story:
Hello,

My name is Giannis Tompros and I am 44 years old. I’ m from Greece. I’ve studied history of European culture at the Open University of Greece.

THE STORY

Two years ago I attended a program under the thematic field “Industrial Archeology’’ at the National and Kapodistrian University of Athens. This program offered me theoretical and practical knowledge on the concept, approach and operation of industrial monuments and brought me into essential contact with Greece's industrial heritage. It also offered me knowledge about the basic practices and concepts, concerning the management of industrial heritage as well as the problem of reusing industrial monuments in modern times.

THE IDEA

Since then, I was thinking of how to set up a company that promotes this unknown tourist aspect of my country. And makes profit, obviously. I definitely wanted to learn even more. So, I read specialized books, visited related web-sites and talked with professionals.

I contacted with the managers of the industrial monuments and took part in guide tours. I even contacted with state actors. I collected information from anywhere I could have access. In this way I was inspired the idea about industrial tourism in Greece. An alternative tourism that has not developed adequately in Greece yet. The cultural heritage is exploited as a resource to attract visitors-tourists and creating tourist flow in an area. An important aspect of this is the industrial heritage. It attracts significant direct and indirect revenues throughout the year successfully and improves the image and reputation of brownfield sites.

Here some pictures of industrial monuments all over Greece.

The Industrial Gas Museum, the first industrial museum in Athens founded in 2013, highlights an industrial heritage monument, the old Gasworks, which provided energy and lighting in Athens for nearly 130 years.

http://events.innovathens.gr/inheritageen/

Flour mill Pre-industrial establishment Limnos,  Panagia

http://pandektis.ekt.gr/pandektis/handle/10442/159236

Tabakaria, the neighborhood of the old tanneries, Chania town, Crete island, GREECE.

The headquarters of the former company Metalia Serifou

THE REASONS WHY…

After I appreciated the information and analyzed all the data, I proceeded in creating the business plan and cost calculation.

Unfortunately the complete absence of personal sources of funding as well as the impossibility of financing from banks or other sources at this time in Greece are the reasons why I ask for your support.

ABOUT COST

Your contributions will help me to cover the initial cost of the business.

This includes:

  • Buying a used coach of 50 seats: I chose to buy it instead for rent it for two reasons: greater flexibility and disengagement from trade unions and other interests.

  • Rents.

  • Office equipment, computerization.

  • Hiring 6 officials: 1 for office, 2 specialized guides, 1 professional driver, 1 accountant, 1 for outdoor works.

  • Web-site construction for information and sales of tourist packages.

  • Promotion via internet, magazines, newspapers.

  • Other expenses such us taxes, insurances, unexpected losses.

MY AIM

I know the difficulties but I will really try to succeed. To succeed in a challenging, competitive but also thriving and lucrative sector such as tourism.

I have the vision, I have the plan, I miss the most important, the financial means.

Thank you for your time. 

The Museum of Industrial Olive-Oil Production of Lesvos is housed in the former Communal Olive Press of Agia Paraskevi, Lesvos. 

http://events.innovathens.gr/inheritageen/
story_txt:
Hello,
My name
is Giannis Tompros and I am 44 years old. I’ m from Greece. I’ve
studied history of European culture at the Open University of Greece.
THE STORY
Two
years ago I attended a program under the thematic field “Industrial Archeology’’
at the
National and Kapodistrian University of
Athens. This program offered me theoretical and practical knowledge on the
concept, approach and operation of industrial monuments and brought me into
essential contact with Greece's industrial heritage. It also offered me knowledge
about the basic practices and concepts, concerning the management of industrial
heritage as well as the problem of reusing industrial monuments in modern
times.
THE IDEA
Since
then, I was thinking of how to set up a company that promotes this unknown
tourist aspect of my country. And makes profit, obviously. I definitely wanted
to learn even more. So, I read specialized books, visited related web-sites and
talked with professionals. I
contacted with the managers of the industrial monuments and took part in guide
tours. I even contacted with state actors. I collected information from
anywhere I could have access. In this way I was inspired the idea about
industrial tourism in Greece. An alternative tourism that has not developed adequately
in Greece yet. The cultural heritage is exploited as a resource to attract
visitors-tourists and creating tourist flow in an area. An important aspect of
this is the industrial heritage. It attracts significant direct and indirect
revenues throughout the year successfully and improves the image and reputation
of brownfield sites.

story:
About this campaign

Please help me expand a local yarn shop into something wonderfully crafty.

I opened Yarncadia in June 2015 after being on JSA for 3 years without a single job interview. Sick of being unemployed, I got a small personal loan and took a risk. So far business has been slow but steady (word to the wise - don't open a LYS in summer!) I believe it is a friendly little shop, happy to help where it can, and I already have a few regular customers.

This campaign is to help the shop reach the next level. I've had lots of people come in for goods I don't stock. There are many crafters around and nowhere local to serve their needs. I'd like Yarncadia to fill that gap.

What I need

I need £5000 to cover the following costs

  • Purchase of an Anchor thread display unit to meet the needs of cross-stitchers and embroiderers.
  • Purchase of a Güitermann sewing thread display for local sewers
  • Initial orders with King Cole and Stylecraft so I can offer more yarn choice to knitters and crocheters
  • Initial order with Craft Company for fat quarters and sewing kits
  • Purchase of crafting books, patterns and magazines
  • Advertising the business
This will open the rear section of the shop to the public while offering greater choice. If I don't reach my goal, then any funding raised will go on the above as far as possible.

Risks and challenges

Running a yarn shop is expensive. I've already used up most of the credit available to me, which is why I'm doing this campaign. My last retail experience was 20 years ago, but I believe I have the passion, the knowledge, and definitely the determination to make Yarncadia work.

The biggest hurdle is making the rent. Now I'm claiming Working Tax Credit, I'm putting some aside each week in order to pay the rent and keep the shop open.

The second hurdle is making sure people know that I'm open and what I stock. I have a website, Facebook and Twitter account, all of which are updated with every new line I get in. I've an enhanced Google listing and am listed in the local business directory. I will use a small amount of the funding to advertise further.

Other ways to help

If you just can't contribute financially, I'd hugely appreciate if you could spread the word by sharing the campaign on Twitter and Facebook - heck, even word of mouth if you're local to Little Lever!

story:
Who 

We are a group of creators residing in Grand Rapids Michigan from different fields and backgrounds. Or as the antagonist in your favorite 80s movie would put it...Nerds. 


Why (Local Reason)

We recently lost the film incentives in our state leaving an industry full of passionate and invested people at a loss. We want to to take this and make it an opportunity to create our own sustainable industry that impacts, entertains and effects people and our economy in a positive way.  We can create our own solution that doesn't rely on the unstable ground of warring political parties. We can reignite our own opportunities. Michigan has changed the world before. Why not do it again? 


Why (National Reason)

On a national level, there are some even bigger problems. Dramatic increases in everything but the value of the average worker. We want to change that.


What

Snow Monster Studios will serve as a perpetual local economy growing machine. It will house Education, Open Offices, Production Facilities, Equipment, Apartments and Access to Healthy Food. This will give creatives a platform to produce their own and original content.
This model could be used by any industry to ethically bring a new field into an area anywhere in the U.S. that lifts its residents instead of pushing them out.


Our particular focus will be in media, generating movies, animation, youtube content, virtual reality, video games etc. Our environment will allow for individuals to grow their talents, collaborate, and produce there own work. There will also be official Snow Monster Studios projects such as profit sharing movies.


How
The building is designed to be self sustained through resident rent and green energy. The fixed rent will be priced low enough so that a resident can work a part time job leaving more time to develop their craft and career. Included with rent is access to open offices, equipment, facilities and a rooftop green house. 
We will be offering free classes to low income and affordable classes for everyone else. Mixing students and young professionals in our open offices will lead to impromptu mentorships, collaborations and more. 


Profit Sharing Movies!

Profit sharing movies is a way for the entire crew to benefit from the success of a project. It takes a whole team to make a movie happen, yet a few at the top benefit tremendously while the rest of the crew is severely underpaid. In our system, everyone that works on a movie will receive a percentage of the profits scaled to the skill required for their position.  They will still receive their normal pay, but this also allows everyone to benefit from the success of their hard work.


The Impact! YAY!


Local Impact

We will be growing a new high paying industry from the ground up along with building a larger specialized talent pool through our training. Businesses plant themselves in cities with larger talent pools. 
One of our internal projects, Profit sharing movies, has the potential to make Michigan industry workers the highest paid in the country. 

National Impact

Once proven successful, this could be modeled by any industry to ethically introduce new fields into local communities all over the country in a way that benefits those communities instead of displacing them. 
We need your help to build it. 

What We Need & What You Get

We've been quoted at  1.2 million to build, an additional 195K for land and need roughly 173K for equipment. It's a lot, so we have set our goal at 250K to get us started, but many have raise more, and we hope to keep raising beyond our goal through flex funding.

Our first priority will be to get the equipment for training and producing content. From there it will be securing land in a walkable location. Then getting the facilities built.


Equipment Needs

15K for Render Servers, 15K for 3 Production Cameras, 20K Film Lenses, 10K for 10 Training Cameras, 8K Training Lenses, 1.5K Production Tripods, 1K Training Tripods, 1.6K 10 Shoulder Mounts, 4K Film Lighting, 1.4K Sliders, 2K Jibs, 48K 16 Production Computers, 30K 15 Training Computers, 4.5K 4k TVs (for testing footage), 10K Needed to build 2 flight simulator prototypes, 1K Screen Printing Press


Land Cost

We want to secure a plot of land in a walkable location. The cost of that land is 195K. 


Facilities Cost

1.2 Million


Some of our Perks!







Risks & Challenges

We understand that this is a new kind of undertaking, but we have a plan. Our system is set up so that half capacity resident rent will cover all the costs of the building. That way beyond the monthly costs, we can have money saved for any future costs we may incur such as repairs. The more we can raise on here, the cheaper we can keep rent. This model also gives us the freedom to work on creative projects and training. 

For the production side of the facilities, we have a collective resume in media that includes, Sony, Maker Studios, Marvel Studios, CBS, Spike TV, MTV, Nickelodeon, Stan Winston, Epitaph Records, Tooth and Nail Records and more along with experience teaching at the college level.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please Share this! Even if you aren't able to contribute, it can help us a ton!

story:
My name is Garrett Ellis and I am part of the Great Social Pitch with Assets Lancaster and the Lancaster County Community Foundation. My goal is to bring a new social enterprise to Lancaster, PA and beyond....


Far Far Away Books is a Mobile Bookstore and Social Enterprise. With a heart for children in low income communities, we sell books on book bikes that all economic backgrounds can afford. Accessibility and affordability are often barriers to reading and Far Far Away hopes to lessen that burden by making quality books both accessible and affordable.

I am really passionate about Far Far Away because I believe in the power of reading and the life changing experiences that books can provide to children. It is the basis for all education and allthough i grew up in a low income community, I have personally benefited from having a lifelong love of reading.

Donating to this cause can change a child's life. Unfortunately, many families in low income communities can not afford to buy and own books for their children. Far Far Away gives them a chance to do so at prices that they can afford.


What We Need & What You Get

 

The goal for our campaign is to raise $1100. This money will be used for start up costs as well as to help purchase our first book bike. We also have some really cool perks for every donation you make.

     
  • For every $25 donated, one child will be given a book!
  • For donations of $50 or above, 3 children will receive a book!
  • For a donation of $100 or above, 10 children will receive a book in your honor!
  • For donations of $500, your business can have their name sponsored on the side of our book bike!

The Impact

Every donation that you give will help us to put more books in the hands of more children who need them. There are so many benefits to an enterprise like this:

  • Literacy rates and reading proficiency scores are more likely to go up if we are able to help more kids read.
  • Making books accessible on book bikes helps us to keep overhead costs low, to be closer to children in their actual neighborhoods and to show kids that reading can not only be fun but a large part of their lives.



Other Ways you can Help

We understand that for some, a financial donation isn't possible. This doesnt mean you still can't help!

  • Feel free to share this page on all of your social networks.
  • Get the word out to your friends, family and co workers about what we are trying to do.

Thank you so much for donating to our cause. Every dollar puts another book in the hands of a child who desperately needs it!

This crowdfunding campaign is part of The Great Social Enterprise Pitch, a friendly competition facilitated by ASSETS and the Lancaster County Community Foundation. The Pitch consists of social enterprise ideas based in Central Pennsylvania. A Social Enterprise is a market-based, income-generating enterprise that aims to solve a social and/or environmental problem through its business activities.  Social enterprises focus on a trip bottom line:  people, planet, and profit.  Upon completion of the Crowdfunding phase of the competition, 5 ideas will be chosen to move on to the Live Pitch, during which the contestants will present their ideas to a panel of judges, with winners receiving a package of cash and pro-bono prizes. In 2014, winners received nearly $40,000 in cash and pro-bono prizes.
Please visit www.lancasterpitch.com for more information.  To access to the crowdfunding sites of all participating social enterprise ideas, click here: https://www.indiegogo.com/partners/SocialEnterprisePitch.

story:
Who Are We?

Positive Teens on the Run! is a running group of determined and goal-focused adolescents ages 13-20. We reside in the heart of the former Venda homeland in Limpopo, South Africa. We are from impoverished and underprivileged families, many of us have grown up as orphans, and we are all HIV positive. We believe we can turn our positive status into a positive inspiration for change and awareness, to help end stigma and discrimination throughout the world.

AIDS is the leading cause of death among adolescents in Africa, and the second leading cause of death among adolescents globally.  Positive Teens on the Run!  is an active and proactive way of modeling behaviors to improve health and lifestyle, and in some cases, save lives.

Positive Teens on the Run!  believes that more young people need to be directly involved in leading the effort by example. We want to be a catalyst for change by disclosing our HIV status publicly, maintaining a healthy lifestyle, setting goals, and proudly engaging in social integration by participating in broad reaching South African running events.We want to change society’s perceptions of HIV with the attitude that we are confident in our desire to be tomorrow’s leaders.  

Each runner keeps a training journal to track his or her practice and progress. Our motto is: Empowering strides to end stigma and discrimination.  As a group, we have chosen to dedicate each 40,008 kilometers, which equals one circling of the globe, to memorialize one young person we know who has died directly or indirectly as a result of stigma and discrimination. This run around the world is dedicated to our dear friend Ronewa, who died in February 2015, a few days after her 17th birthday.

What will we do with the money?

Your generous donations will go towards race entry fees, bus transport costs, basic accommodations, and appropriate running clothing.

What will you get.

We want you to be aware of our gratitude and the impact you have in our lives, therefore, each time before we run we say a blessing of thanks, and carry thoughts of you with us. We believe in directly expressing our gratitude, giving back and paying forward. For each donation, we will provide you with a personal thank you. Larger donations will also receive items such as team photos, t-shirts, official team sponsorship and updates on team and individual progress.

Your impact!

We want to join the mainstream, and run in big race events with other teens and adults from all over South Africa and the world. By helping us achieve this goal you will give us courage to spread  encouragement to others.  Most of us have been HIV+ since birth, and stigma and discrimination is always a shadow that has followed us.  Running with purpose and goals empowers us to realize that our we are strong enough to overcome the hardships we have known, and believe we can turn our positive status into a positive inspiration for change and awareness to help end stigma and discrimination throughout the world.

What else you can do.

Please share this page with your friends and families to help us gather as much support as possible.

Send us words of encouragement. It is difficult to take the risk of disclosing our status, but we feel it is the right thing to do in order to set an example for others. We want to be stronger in the face of stigma and discrimination, and it helps to know you believe in us, and in our efforts to empower change! 

Positive Teens on the Run! 2015 Race Schedule

15 August

Polokwane 5Km Color Run

11 October

Spar Woman's Challenge 5-10km Jo'burg

18 October

Pretoria Jacaranda City Challenge 5 km, 10 km, 22 km, 42 km

01 November

Soweto Marathon 5km, 10km, 22 km, 42 km

05 December

Aspen Port Elisabeth City Marathon 10km, 42 km

“I am HIV+ and I started the treatment when I was young and went to collect my treatment on my own in 2010 and I am healthy and want to see myself as a professional marathon competitor and it does not bother me to take my treatment because I am healthy and strong like a normal teenager.” 15 year-old Positive Teens on the Run! team member.

“When I run, I am proud of myself. I am strong, and I forget all my troubles … when I grow up, I want to be a doctor.” 13 year-old Positive Teens on the Run! team member.

“My dream is to run 42Kms like great African runners … I have choice, I have right, I have a [running] team that is one love.”  15-year old Positive Teens on the Run! team member

“I am 19 years old and a girl who stays at an orphanage with other 63 children. When I grow up I want to be a business woman. I am strong because I am running and it encourages the other children.” Positive Teens on the Run! team member

“I started taking my treatment in 2005 (4 years old) and I was told that the treatment is for HIV when I was 9 years old and I was shocked and there was nothing I could do about it rather than accept my status. I want to have a bright future and my dream job is to be a social worker so that I can help children who are being abused and orphans My treatment and to run makes me feel better.”  14-year old Positive Teens on the Run! team member.

lives. 
Positive Teens on the Run!  believes that more young people need to be directly
involved in leading the effort by example. We want to
be a catalyst for change by disclosing our HIV status publicly, maintaining a
healthy lifestyle, setting goals, and proudly engaging in social integration by
participating in broad reaching South African running events.We want to change
society’s perceptions of HIV with the attitude that
we are confident in our desire to be tomorrow’s leaders.  
Each runner keeps a training journal to track
his or her practice and progress. Our motto is: Empowering strides to end stigma and discrimination.  As a group, we have chosen to dedicate each
40,008 kilometers, which equals one circling of the globe, to memorialize one
young person we know who has died directly or indirectly as a result of
stigma and discrimination. This run around the world is dedicated to our dear
friend Ronewa, who died in February 2015, a few days after her 17th
birthday.
What will we do with the money?


Your generous donations will go towards race entry fees, bus
transport costs, basic accommodations, and appropriate running clothing.
What will you get.
We want you to be aware of our gratitude and the impact you have in our lives, therefore, each time before we run we say a blessing of thanks, and carry thoughts of you with us. We believe in directly expressing our gratitude, giving back and paying forward. For each donation, we will provide you with a personal thank you. Larger donations will also receive items such as team photos, t-shirts, official team sponsorship and updates on team and individual progress.
Your impact!
We want to join the mainstream, and run in big race events with other teens and adults from all over South Africa and the world. By helping us achieve this goal you will give us courage to spread  encouragement to others.  Most of us have been HIV+ since birth, and stigma and discrimination is always a shadow that has followed us.  Running with purpose and goals empowers us to realize that our we are strong enough to overcome the hardships we have known, and believe we can turn our positive status into a positive inspiration for change and awareness to help end stigma and discrimination throughout the world.
What else you can do.
Please
share this page with your friends and families to help us gather as much
support as possible. 
Send
us words of encouragement. It is difficult to take the risk of disclosing our
status, but we feel it is the right thing to do in order to set an example for others. We want to be stronger in the face of stigma
and discrimination, and it helps to know you believe in us, and in our efforts
to empower change! 

Positive Teens on the Run! 2015 Race Schedule
15 AugustPolokwane 5Km Color Run11 October
Spar Woman's Challenge 5-10km Jo'burg
18 October
Pretoria Jacaranda City Challenge 5 km, 10 km, 22 km, 42 km
01 November
Soweto Marathon 5km, 10km, 22 km, 42 km05 DecemberAspen Port Elisabeth City Marathon 10km, 42 km
“I am HIV+ and I started the treatment when
I was young and went to collect my treatment on my own in 2010 and I am healthy
and want to see myself as a professional marathon competitor and it does not
bother me to take my treatment because I am healthy and strong like a normal
teenager.” 15 year-old Positive Teens
on the Run! team member.
“When I run, I am proud of myself. I am
strong, and I forget all my troubles … when I grow up, I want to be a doctor.” 13
year-old Positive Teens on the Run!
team member.
“My dream is to run 42Kms like great African
runners … I have choice, I have right, I have a [running] team that is one
love.”  15-year old Positive Teens on the Run! team member
“I am 19 years old and a girl who stays at an
orphanage with other 63 children. When I grow up I want to be a business woman.
I am strong because I am running and it encourages the other children.” Positive Teens on the Run! team member
“I started taking my treatment in 2005 (4
years old) and I was told that the treatment is for HIV when I was 9 years old
and I was shocked and there was nothing I could do about it rather than accept
my status. I want to have a bright future and my dream job is to be a social
worker so that I can help children who are being abused and orphans My
treatment and to run makes me feel better.”  14-year old Positive Teens on the Run! team member.

story:
Short Summary

After my job was eliminated in January, I began building my own company, Cosmic Cocoa. I created instant hot chocolate recipes (most using powdered goats milk). My goal was to develop products with rich taste and creamy texture when made with water. I succeeded!
In June Cosmic Cocoa officially became an LLC! During the past six months I’ve invested a lot of my own money into the company. The company is now at a crucial point in development. My goal is to have Cosmic Cocoa on the shelves of retail venues in southern Maine in time for the holiday season. That is where you come in!

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise $50,000 within 30 days. This amount will insure we can meet customer demand this year, and provide working capital to grow the company into 2016. We are moving toward a large scale market test beginning in October 2015. We have two retailers, with eight locations between them, lined up and ready. The capital we raise will allow us to finish the administrative things (Insurance, UPC code, legal), get our advertising materials distributed as well as buying the inventory to meet this roll out and through the 2015/2016 season.

We are offering some great perks like the gift sample pack (a great holiday gift for the cocoa lover in your family), a first look at new flavors, and locally made artwork.

Community Impact

Our ingredients are important to us and we have sourced sustainable ingredients while keeping the price competitive.
As we grow we want our employees to be paid a livable wage.
Once profitable, we plan to give 2-5% of pre-tax profits to local charities.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign page with your friends! Every little bit helps get us closer to being on the shelves.

Like our Facebook page or follow us on Twitter!

Check out our website!

Want more information? Email me directly at auroraw@cosmiccocoa.com

story:
July 4th Got Me Thinking...

What is the world record for the tallest beeramid? It's 16 feet. But the truly disturbing fact is that the USA does not hold the record. Its held by a bunch of Aussies. 

Source: http://www.brobible.com/life/article/13159255-which-brobible-reader-can-build-largest-beer-can-pyramid-10-minute/

Now, the US is #1 at everything in the world. Especially in drinking beer. So in light of the recent victories over German and Japan (sound familiar?) lets lock in another against the Aussies. The problem is simple and so is the solution. Build a larger and better beeramid. 

The beeramid will be constructed on July 18th, in Providence, Rhode Island. If you are in the area, we would love for you to participate in being an American. It will be constructed on the top of a parking garage just south of Brown University's campus.


Here are the numbers:

The US standard can is 4.83 inches tall. To beat 16 feet the beeramid will need 40 layers of cans. But why stop there? Just 1 more beer...

With 50 layers, the beeramid will be 20 feet tall and it will be comprised of 2500 beers. Does America have to stop there? Nope. 

The money raised will be equivalent to the number of cans acquired.

Our goal is to build it as tall as we are funded. More $ = more height. The more impressive it is, the more likely the Guinness World Records will accept the submission proposal.

Can we do it?

If you donate just $1 to the cause, your name will be added to a list of backers that strive to make the US the best country in the world to live in. 

If you think America can't do it then I invite you to leave this beautiful, land of freedom and rethink your actions.


Spread the Word

If you can't contribute, that's fine. But that doesn't mean you can't help. Tell your beer loving friends and spread the word.

That's all there is to it. U-S-A


P.S If you got a 6-Pack please drop your email here:

http://eepurl.com/bstMZ1

story:
For a long time, I've had a dream of taking a Supernatural road trip...but with a twist. I want to stop at various locations and perform good deeds for the fandom family. They've given so much to me, and I've seen so many people struggle, that I just have to give back.
The ideal: travel across the country performing good deeds to as many fandom family members as possible. I'd like to hit at least three people. Who will I choose? I want to take nominations--you can nominate yourself, a friend, or someone you've never met. What will I do? You can choose what you want to happen or let me (or should I say, us, since the family has overwhelmed me with their desire to help!) decide. Maybe a financially-strapped friend has always wanted to go to a convention. Maybe a single mother needs a day off. Maybe you know someone who is sick but can't afford medicine. No limits to what we hope to do!
The alternative: if traveling ends up not being financially possible, I want to be able to at least send personalized gifts to everyone who needs it. Sometimes, all a person needs is knowing someone cares. This idea might include some Supernatural merch, a gift certificate to a favorite store, a card from the family...the only qualification is that it must be personal and meaningful to them, something that helps with their specific problem.
Just so you know, any money raised will go right to the project. Any traveling or mailing expenses will be paid by me alone. And I will be doing this, even if no one donates a cent. But the more money raised, the sooner it can happen, and the more people can be helped.

Where Your Money Goes

Our fandom is so giving, but also full of people hurting--the Always Keep Fighting campaign among others has shown this. Supernatural and the family it has created has helped us get through our struggles, but I want to take it a step further.
  • 100% of your donations will go to helping other fans...or maybe even helping you.
  • Possible gifts might include a box of Supernatural merchandise, tickets to a convention, needed groceries, etc. There's no limit to what we might do.
  • Can't wait to make an impact? That's okay--two of our perks include immediate benefits to fans! Plus, we have a guest campaigner: a portion of these proceeds will also go directly to a fellow fan's campaign--check her out at http://www.gofundme.com/heartsmom
  • Want to help but don't have money to spare? You can still donate your talents. Let me know what you can do here: https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/FY89B32

Risks & Challenges

We're just beginning, and so still very small. But no matter what you give, it will go to fans, and no matter what, we will do our best to help. Keep posted on our progress at our Facebook page: www.facebook.com/groups/125978474405271/

story:
How it Works

A dollar of contribution gives you a vote on the board. Our final committee will be responsible for taking all the decisions:
1. Vote for the house of your preference
2. Vote for every single furniture that will be bought
3. Vote for the decorative items.
4. Give your ideas and suggestions on the board.

Photos of nominated houses and items will be put on vote online once our campaign is completed. Contributors will receive their username and password in order to cast their votes.

Weekly Sweepstakes!

By joining this campaign you automatically take part in weekly sweepstakes for unique gadgets and items from the dream home! You only need to contribute once in order to enter all the sweepstakes. A dollar gives you one entry! If you contribute 20$ you obtain 20 entries. Winners will be announced on Facebook and will be contacted by email in order to provide their shipping address.


The Story behind this Campaign

My name is Helen and I am 29 years old. For the last 9 years I wake up and go to bed with the same thought in my head. 

My thought since I was a little, little girl was to have my own little home (my family and I live on rent since always and we have already moved in and out of 4 different houses, making it impossible to consider them a "home"). So I am dreaming of my own home; decorate it as super as it gets with bright COLORS and unique shapes, have FLOWERS all over, candies and Cookies (fresh baked) here and there for the guests; it might sound crazy but with 1$ you can be a part of the implementation of this dream.

I have the fortune and misfortune to live in Greece (probably I don’t need to say more). Luckily I have a good job and I make my living. However with simple calculations I need more than 80 years to make enough money to buy my own home. That’s probably… too long! This is why I am making this campaign.


That's it!

Happy thoughts, happy thoughts, happy thoughts, more happy thoughts and may all your dreams come true!


Second Plan fallback

So, where the money goes if we don't reach our target? Sadly in this case my dream house might have to be a rented house again. Let's hope not...!


Other Ways You Can Contribute

If you don't want to share a dollar you may just share the dream using Indiegogo share tools!

story:
T.H.I.S. (Target Hit Indicator Systems) is a sensing unit that attaches to the back of a steel target which will send a signal to a flash unit after sensing a hit on the target. These systems are designed for the long-range shooter, competition shooter, and the avid hobby shooter. These systems assist the shooter with those shots that are hard to see even with a spotting scope. This device takes the guessing out of whether you hit the target or not by seeing a flash that is visible up to 1 mile. We are currently working on releasing a wireless version that eliminates any and all cables needed in the system. We also have 3D drawings sent to a manufacturing company to build a target stand and targets of various sizes to work with both the wired and wireless systems. We are looking to expand the company from the one product that we currently are offering to many many more. We have several other designs of product we would also like to get on the market but at this time am only financially able to release one at a time. 

This business was just recently accepted into the Vendor Direct Program sponsored by the Friends of National Rifle Association for the state representatives to choose as an item to auction off at the banquets. They were impressed with the wired version that they also accepted the wireless version upon completion. The package deal with them helps but does not fund the design and initial setup and costs to get everything that we would like to offer to the public. This limits everything right now to a select few and not the general population. 

​The system was developed after discussing a few different ideas with a friend and babbling on and on to his wife, Melissa, about the idea. He decided to make a system that was easy to use, easy to see, cost effective, and reliable.  One of the main reasons the system came to light was when he went shooting with some friends and a certain on friend would always claim that he hit the target when none of us heard a smack of the bullet on the steel target or see the steel move from the impact so the flasher was dreamed up designed and put into motion. This certain friend does not like to shoot with us anymore needless to say. 

Please check out the Gallery for extra videos and photos. 

The imagination is endless if you can dream it you can build it.

You can see more and follow us on our Facebook Page  https://www.facebook.com/TargetHitIndicatorSystem                                                   Or on our website http://www.targethitindicatorsystems.com/

As a company we currently donate to the Freedom Hunters Organization which is an organization that takes Active Duty, Veterans, and Families out on different outdoor events such as Pheasant Hunts, Duck Hunts, Fishing trips, Camping Trips, you name it.  Even with this fund helping out our business we will still want to help out the Freedom Hunters. We will continue to donate to the Freedom Hunters even with all the donations we receive. At the end of the campaign we will tally up the total of all the donations and write a nice little check to the local chapter in South Dakota. 

Help us, Help them. 

Adam

story:
About Us

The Clubhouse Brewing Company ltd. Is a service disabled veteran owned and operated limited liability company.  It is our belief that alcohol no longer has to be a destructive force in the veteran community.  Our goal, even more so than making great beer, is to help make our part of the craft beer industry a constructive force among the veteran community.  From the beginning we hope to donate 5% of our income to veterans charities.  The more we get crowd funded, the more we can donate.

  • Veteran welfare focused
    • Clubhouse Brewing will donate 5% of up to all our proceeds to veterans charities
    • Veteran friendly hiring practices
    • Workshops to guide and help veterans to realize their dreams of being small business owners
  • Sustainable Green Practices
    • Clubhouse Brewing strives to be a zero landfill company
    • Spent grains and hops will be donated to local farmers to use as feed
    • An onsite steam generator will be used to almost completely offset the brewery's electricity consumption
  • Locally Sourced
    • Along with giving back to farmers, the brewery will help local businesses by locally sourcing as many ingredients as possible

 

What We Need & What You Get

This is how we will use the funds raised by this campaign.  For every milestone additional beers will be added to our charity portfolio, listed in parenthesis. 

  • $149,895- 15 barrel brew plant (super hopped black IPA, hefeweizen)
  • $21,099- Boiler (chocolate cherry stout)
  • $28,394- 100 kw steam powered generator (honey orange IPA)
  • $45,000- 2 fermentors, 1 brite tank (Bacon Chocolate Red Ale)
  • $30,000- Brewery build out (doppelbock)
  • $45,000- Refrigeration Units (raspberry hefeweizen)
  • $12,000- Kegs and ancilarry supplies (Belgian Quad)
  • $5,000- Licensing and start up costs (Bourban Barrel Red Ale)

What You Get

  • First Run Clubhouse Brewing Company merchandise: Coasters, Pint Glasses, Shirts
  • A chance to help name and create the lable for one of the beers listed above
  • Lifetime membership to the Clubhouse Brewing Cigar Club
  • 1 or 2 year subscription to the Clubhouse Brewing Bomber of the Month Club
  • A chance to be at the grand opening of the company you helped to make a reality

The Impact

Contributing to this campaign helps us help the veteran community across the nation.  Funding this company through small business loans, greatly reduces the amount we can give back to charities until loans are paid back in seven years.  It is our goal to eventually give a portion of all the company's income to charity, contributions will make this happen from the start.  Your contributions will directly effect the amount of good this company can do upon start up.

Risks & Challenges

Although craft beer is not as popular, in Ohio, as it is in the northwest, there are still a few local craft breweries that will be direct competition to Clubhouse Brewing Company.  What sets us apart from them is that Clubhouse Brewing has a cause.  People who enjoy our products are not only enjoying the highest quality craft beer, but also taking part in making the world a better place.

The biggest challenge we are currently facing is that we are a start up.  Landlords and bankers are leery enough about start ups, and almost immediately turn their noses up when they hear that Clubhouse Brewing wants to give away a not insignificant portion of profits to help the less fortunate.  All are eventually willing to help, but at a much higher rate of return, which makes growth more difficult for us as a company.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

IF you want to contribute but can't, no worries here are some other ways to help:

  • Like us on Facebook (@Clubhousebrewingco) and spread the word about our campaign
  • We are always looking for new small veteran charities to donate to.  If you know of one that makes a difference, let us know at clubhousebrewingco@gmail.com

Cheers!!

Workshops to guide and help veterans to realize their dreams of being small business owners


Sustainable Green Practices
Clubhouse Brewing strives to be a zero landfill company
Spent grains and hops will be donated to local farmers to use as feed
An onsite steam generator will be used to almost completely offset the brewery's electricity consumption


Locally SourcedAlong with giving back to farmers, the brewery will help local businesses by locally sourcing as many ingredients as possible


 

What We Need & What You Get
This is how we will use the funds raised by this campaign.  For every milestone additional beers will be added to our charity portfolio, listed in parenthesis. 

$149,895- 15 barrel brew plant (super hopped black IPA, hefeweizen)
$21,099- Boiler (chocolate cherry stout)
$28,394- 100 kw steam powered generator (honey orange IPA)
$45,000- 2 fermentors, 1 brite tank (Bacon Chocolate Red Ale)
$30,000- Brewery build out (doppelbock)
$45,000- Refrigeration Units (raspberry hefeweizen)
$12,000- Kegs and ancilarry supplies (Belgian Quad)
$5,000- Licensing and start up costs (Bourban Barrel Red Ale)

What You Get

First Run Clubhouse Brewing Company merchandise: Coasters, Pint Glasses, Shirts
A chance to help name and create the lable for one of the beers listed above
Lifetime membership to the Clubhouse Brewing Cigar Club
1 or 2 year subscription to the Clubhouse Brewing Bomber of the Month Club
A chance to be at the grand opening of the company you helped to make a reality

The Impact
Contributing to this campaign helps us help the veteran community across the nation.  Funding this company through small business loans, greatly reduces the amount we can give back to charities until loans are paid back in seven years.  It is our goal to eventually give a portion of all the company's income to charity, contributions will make this happen from the start.  Your contributions will directly effect the amount of good this company can do upon start up.
Risks & Challenges
Although craft beer is not as popular, in Ohio, as it is in the northwest, there are still a few local craft breweries that will be direct competition to Clubhouse Brewing Company.  What sets us apart from them is that Clubhouse Brewing has a cause.  People who enjoy our products are not only enjoying the highest quality craft beer, but also taking part in making the world a better place.
The biggest challenge we are currently facing is that we are a start up.  Landlords and bankers are leery enough about start ups, and almost immediately turn their noses up when they hear that Clubhouse Brewing wants to give away a not insignificant portion of profits to help the less fortunate.  All are eventually willing to help, but at a much higher rate of return, which makes growth more difficult for us as a company.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
IF you want to contribute but can't, no worries here are some other ways to help:

Like us on Facebook (@Clubhousebrewingco) and spread the word about our campaign
We are always looking for new small veteran charities to donate to.  If you know of one that makes a difference, let us know at clubhousebrewingco@gmail.com

Cheers!!

story:
El sorteig dels Smartbox es farà el 15 de Juliol de 2017 i anunciarem els guanyadors per a indiegogo , facebook i al e-mail personal de cada guanyador.

Si tens qualsevol dubte ens pots trucar al +34616557087 o enviar-nos un e-mail a info@mokkedo.com

 

Coneix la nostre història i perquè ajudem als botiguers

  

Som dos germans fills de dos botiguers jubilats i per a nosaltres la botiga és molt més que un negoci, és la vida als carrers, alegria quan és Nadal, lloc on hi retrobaràs vells amics i on et rebran amb un somriure i t’atendran personalment.

Amb els anys hem vist com el canvi generacional i l’expansió de les grans cadenes, franquícies i la venda per internet han generat cada cop més pressió al petit comerç provocant que moltes botigues hagin hagut de tancar o buscar nous canals de venda.

A conseqüència d’això i del que va ser la vinculació amb la botiga dels nostres pares vam pensar que teníem que actuar per fer més visible el petit comerç  i els seus valors a través d’una plataforma de venda on-line on s’hi sentin representades el màxim de botigues possible tenint en compte les necessitats reals i la manera de fer de tots els botiguers.

Es per això, que amb la teva participació estarem ajudant no només a la teva botiga sinó també a tot el petit comerç.

 

Quina quantitat necessitem per finançar la primera versió de l'App ?

 

Per fer realitat la primera versió de l'app del petit comerç necessitem per començar 35.000 €, que aniran destinats al seu desenvolupament i a fer les proves necessàries per a que compleixi amb totes les prestacions i a fer les primeres promocions de l'app per captar usuaris.

En cas de no aconseguir arribar al nostre primer objectiu de 35.000 € utilitzarem les aportacions per començar a fer l'app i a buscar més finançament a través de nous crowdfundings dirigits a usuaris, inversors privats i finançament públic, perquè sabem que el petit comerç necessita aquesta app i volem fer-ho realitat,

       
 

Si tens botiga ara tens l'oportunitat de participar-hi

Si ets botiguer/a, ens agradaria comptar amb la teva contribució perquè pensem que és important per tu i per tot el petit comerç. És hora de que les botigues es facin un lloc a internet i puguin estar a l'altura de les grans cadenes i plataformes de venda on-line però sense deixar el que son i guanyant més visibilitat, sent més eficients i compartint els costos de publicitat entre totes les botigues per arribar a més usuaris i fer créixer els teus clients.

Nosaltres ens ocuparem d'invertir el màxim de recursos perquè l'app de mokkedo estigui en les primeres posicions i sigui l' alternativa a totes les altres plataformes de venda on-line.

Per fer-ho possible comptem també amb el suport i l'assessorament de les següents organitzacions:

  • Associació de Comerciants Independents i Empresaris de Catalunya 
  • Enginy Digital S.L.
  • M&Partners
  • Viuho Systems S.L. (Mentoring)
  • Empreses de transport social entre d'altres.
  • Botiguers, amics i família. 

 

El nostre compromís amb tu i els teus clients

Aquesta app està feta i pensada només per potenciar el petit comerç i per a què sigui un èxit necessitarem l'ajuda de tots els botiguers a l'hora d' aconseguir que la base d'usuaris i clients sigui cada dia més gran.

Nosaltres ens comprometem a treballar al màxim per a que l'èxit sigui una realitat per a tots i que els usuaris entenguin els beneficis i les facilitats que els aporta comprar al petit comerç.

 

També ens pots ajudar compartint l'enllaç de la campanya:


https://igg.me/at/mokkedo

Som conscients de que no tothom pot col·laborar de la mateixa manera; per això, si creus en el projecte mokkedo i tens ganes d'ajudar-nos t'animem a que en facis difusió compartint aquest enllaç per e-mail, facebook, instagram, twitter, etc.

story:
Green Tree Project

As a foster mom in Oklahoma City, I am passionate about family. Green Tree Project is a business that will enhance the magic of family celebrations at Christmas by supplying living, potted trees for people to decorate and use as the cornerstone of their holiday traditions. 

In addition to living Christmas tree rental, Green Tree Project will also offer a Grow With Me Tree Subscription. Families can subscribe to a seedling tree and receive that same tree year after year. Our trees grow at a rate of 2 to 3 feet per year, so before long families will have large, mature trees for the same subscription rate. Families will receive postcards and notes from their trees throughout the year in addition to an invitation to our Christmas in July party. 

Green Tree Project is an eco-friendly option for Christmas. Beyond that, as a business that is owned and operated by a local foster family, it is a socially conscious option. We will provide free delivery and pick up for any local foster families who rent or subscribe to a Christmas tree. 

Campaign Goals (and how we plan to thank you!)

We are seeking $10,000 in our Fund the Forest campaign. We will use this funding primarily in three ways:

  1. To secure a brick and mortar location: Right now Green Tree Project is being operated out of our home, but we want to expand and rent trees to as many families, foster families, businesses and churches as possible. 
  2. To increase our potted tree forest: We would like to offer more species of trees in more sizes to our deserving clients. 
  3. Most importantly, to support foster families: We will rent trees to foster families with no delivery or pick up fees. Foster families tend to be pressed for time and energy, and funds raised will go to support these families by taking a major logistical issue for Christmas off their hands. 

There are perks to supporting our Fund the Forest campaign! From sending a personalized note to a foster family to naming a tree to free lighting and delivery on tree rentals, we are ready to spoil our supporters! 

The Impact

This is a dream project for our family. We can't imagine something more meaningful than sharing a joyful, impactful tradition in homes, businesses and churches across the Oklahoma City Metro. We're excited to mail postcards to our clients from their trees year round to increase the sense of wonder and awe for the holidays. Thank you for your support in bringing this dream to life. 

Challenges

There are some challenges in this business, and we are aware that numerous small businesses fail in their first years. However, we believe people will find this service as magical and helpful as we do. We are committed to this business and prepared to take on any challenge. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are ways to support our business apart from contributing! Follow our Facebook page for our upcoming launch and special promotions. The best way to support a local business is to use their products and services! Please also share this campaign to friends and family who might be interested.

story:
Hello and thank you for reading about our campaign to get our Dream business launched. Growing Crazy is a Gardening center for both Indoor and Outdoor growers! My name is Josh, a father of 3 amazing sons with my wife Jenne.  

I spent the last 12 years working in High-End Software Sales and after I was let go at the beginning of 2016, I've been able to finalize the business plan  for Growing Crazy. I'm not only passionate about growing organically with sustainable methods, but teaching others how to as well.  This business will help me achieve that goal and with the funds we have available and the contributions we raise from this campaign, it will go directly to opening our store. We thank you very much for being a part of our next chapter.


What We Need & What You Get

Here is what we are looking for and how you will benefit from helping us.

Breakdown:

Initial Inventory: $21,500

Marketing: Up to $6,000 for Business Sign and another $1,000 for Branded t-shirts and magnets

Advertising: $2,000 for Radio and Online ads

Store Build-Out & Shelving - $4,000 (Some build out costs will be reimbursed via property owners)

Seeking $50K to cover the initial inventory, Store Build-out, Marketing and Branding signage. The remaining funds will be for store items such as Shelving and Counter tops, Technology and any unforeseen expenses that always seem to crop up. 

Here are the perks you will receive with your contribution.

Contribution Perks:

$20 - Growing Crazy Magnet
$50 - Growing Crazy Magnet & Tee Shirt

$100 - Growing Crazy Discount Card 5% x1 year, Tee Shirt & Magnet

$250 - Growing Crazy Discount Card 10% x1 year, Tee Shirt & Magnet

$500 - Growing Crazy Discount Card 15% x 2 years, Tee Shirt & Magnet

$1,000 - Growing Crazy Discount Card 20% x3 years, Tee Shirt & Magnet

$5,000  - Growing Crazy Discount Card 20% x5 years, Tee Shirt, Magnet and up to $100 in Free Merchandise with 1st purchase (Valid in addition to all in store promotions)

$10,000 - Growing Crazy Discount Card 10% x Lifetime Membership, Tee Shirt and Magnet (Valid in addition to all in store promotions)

*All merchandise will be shipped out upon the completion of this campaign. Please allow up to 2 weeks for Shipment of items from that time.

The Impact

This business will help our local community by providing not only the items they'll need to grow a successful garden, but also allowing us to provide all the information for managing a sustainable grow via our consultation and Seminar programs. 

Risks & Challenges

We are also seeking financing through traditional lenders, using our house as collateral for the upfront business loan. The reason we are also doing a crowd sourcing campaign is to assist with additional upfront cost with opening a New Business. 

The challenges we face are acquiring upfront financing to move forward with the plan. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are excited to hear about our endeavor and would like to do your part, but cannot contribute with money, go ahead and Share this campaign with your friends and family via the many Social Media forums out there. (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and LinkedIn)

We want to thank you all soo very much for anything you can do to help us take the next step in living the american dream and owning a business that will help many families.

story:
Short Summary

We are Baruti and Denise Tucker, owners of Humanitree House. We launched Humanitree House in 2014, as a COMPLETELY self funded grass roots effort.  We started with no loans, no savings, no investors and we took a risk to bring healthy cold pressed juices and vegan food to an underserved area that lacks these options. Currently, we are the ONLY cold pressed, organic, vegan juice bar in the area.  In addition, we are the ONLY African centered Art Gallery in the Augusta, Georgia area.  Augusta DOES have the Laney Walker Musuem of Black History; however, we are the only independent Art Gallery that features a diversity of African centered art. 

We decided to launch this campaign to reach out to the global community at large to help us stay open. We are looking for 5,000 or more people with $5 to donate to a worthy effort. Because we launched independently, we depend on day to day operations to even open the next day. This doesn't allow for inventory or needed equipment and repairs to remain fully operational. In addition, it doesn't allow for us to provide jobs to our youth in the area that may need it. Currently, we are at a critical place where we have no reserve and are facing the possibility of closing our doors.  We appreciate you prayers as well!! 

 The kindness of all of you that have ALREADY helped and those that haven't but are willing to help can change this dire situation. Nobody likes having to ask for money; however this is a time where we really need your help. So please...no matter the amount, anything you can contribute, myself, my husband, our family AND the community of Augusta will be truly grateful. 

We are asking for 5,000 people or more with $5  (just $5) to help us reach our goal to remain operational.  Your gift will keep a vital resource open in this community. We are already 30% to our original $20,000 goal with the first campaign. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $20,000.00. It will help us to replace equipment that is vital to our operation. In addition, expand our reach and community programs to reach a broader audience.
  • The perks are amazing from JUICE, to Veggie Burgers, to Store Credit, to ART to HUGS.  Our out of town backers will receive a Humanitree House Tshirt for any donation over $20.
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will use the funds raised to take care of some of the needed resources.

The Impact

 It's vital that our businesses stay in our community. Many of them close due to lack of support.  We have a strong support system, however, we need more resources. As you are aware traditional funding, loans and bank financing is not as easily accessible to small businesses as they may be to retail chains. 

Local businesses give a community its flavor. Cities everywhere have similar chain restaurants, grocery and department stores but that juice bar downtown where you have your morning smoothie is one-of-a-kind. The combined presence local businesses will make a city different from every other place in the world. By supporting our business you ensure that uniqueness is preserved as a part of the global as well as the Augusta community.

THE RISKS: We want to remain open. The only RISK is closing because we can't reach our goal or close enough to the goal.  WE have the customer base to keep us operational. BUT we don't have the resources to keep us healthy as a business. We can't continue to risk our family to keep the doors open. 

THE GREAT RISK we expect is that WE take AUGUSTA by storm, continue a universal space where LOVE, CREATIVITY and HOPE remains!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share this campaign with those you feel can support or get the word out!  
  • Send someone down to Humanitree House in Augusta to purchase a juice or smoothie!

Our remaining goal is $ 15,000. Peace & Blessings !

Thank you for taking your time in reading this and your help is much appreciated.  Much love, peace, and blessing to you all,

By supporting our business you ensure that uniqueness is preserved as a part of the global as well as the Augusta community.THE RISKS: We want to remain open. The only RISK is closing because we can't reach our goal or close enough to the goal.  WE have the customer base to keep us operational. BUT we don't have the resources to keep us healthy as a business. We can't continue to risk our family to keep the doors open. THE GREAT RISK we expect is that WE take AUGUSTA by storm, continue a universal space where LOVE, CREATIVITY and HOPE remains!Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please share this campaign with those you feel can support or get the word out!  
Send someone down to Humanitree House in Augusta to purchase a juice or smoothie!
Our remaining goal is $ 15,000. Peace & Blessings !Thank you for taking your time in reading this and your help is much appreciated.  Much love, peace, and blessing to you all,

story:
We are Kellie Joe and Vanda Chong aka. The Chicks.  We are a wife & wife team. Kellie is a chef & culinary educator.Chef Kellie Joe  Vanda works in the natural food industry and is soon to be a nursing student.  We founded Chicks and Love in 2010. more on Chicks and Love  For years we've offered handcrafted organic flatbread pizzas at the Farmers Market in Walnut Creek, California.  Our menu has something for everybody including gluten sensitive, vegan and traditional flatbread pizzas.  

Three months ago we suddenly came upon an incredible opportunity to grow our business.  We were offered to set up shop in an existing space in San Francisco.  A 104 square foot enclosed coffee cart and an empty outdoor patio.  We had to convert the cart into a pizza kitchen trailer and make the slab of concrete into an inviting patio. What's true is that we didn’t have any money saved for this serendipitous occurrence.

Luckily we are practical "Do it Yourself" type chicks!  We are all about reusing, repurposing, remodeling, and we are pros on Craigslist!  We have decreased our start up costs by thousands of dollars, however we still had to spend over $20,000 and have exhausted our personal credit options.  

Our doors are now open for business yet we're compelled to raise funds to cover our start up costs.   We are asking for your love and support so we can pay off the big banks, and focus on offering a refreshing new restaurant option for the residents, businesses and shoppers in the area.  We also plan to host informative community events such as beekeeping workshops, growing your own mushrooms, and keeping backyard chickens. 

As one can imagine, building a kitchen and opening a restaurant in two months was no easy feat. Luckily, between the two of us, we have quite a resume of skills and experiences to pull something like this off!  With your help, a huge weight will be lifted off our feathers!

Here is a summary of our Start Up costs: 



This is What You Can Get!!!!

We've created so many PERKS to give to back to you for your contributions!  Please see the Perks (right side bar) for more details, and here is just a couple of unique items.

Limited Edition Chicks Tote Bag!

Very Limited supplies of our own Chicks Backyard Farm Honey!

Many Ways to Help The Chicks

  • You can contribute as little as $5 or as much as you want!  Just go to the BOX above the hot pink contribution button.  
  •  SHARE our campaign with your FACEBOOK friends!  (Go to the right side bar to use the share tools.)
  • SHARE our campaign link in an EMAIL or TEXT with specific friends, family or associates that would appreciate what we are doing. (Go to the right side bar for share tools)
  • LIKE our Facebook Page! Chicks and Love Pizza Patio Facebook Page
  • PLEASE let people know that we are OPEN FOR BUSINESS at 1701 Folsom Street.  Monday-Friday 9am-3pm.

story:
OUR WHY:

We love coffee.  We want to build a future for our family here in Fresno.  We would love to bring a community coffee bar here to Fresno, and make it a place where you can gather with friends, come here to get inspired, or just relax in a fun space and drink a really good cup of coffee. 

We relocated here to Fresno from the Orange County, CA area.  After being here for a short time we quickly realized we wanted to set down some roots and make this our home.  But most importantly, Steve and I want to create something amazing here, and to build a legacy for our son Elik.  Since the day we dreamed up our little guy, we’ve always promised one another to give Elik the most amazing future and to build him something that he can one day call his own. Rove Wild is that something.

Here's a little about Steve and I.  Both of our fathers were Marines, stationed on the Tustin Military Base in California.  We were next-door neighbors.  Our moms were friends, our siblings hung out and played together, and we were teenagers when we started dating.  Having moved quite a bit as young kids, and exploring Orange County, Los Angeles, and Tucson, AZ as adults, we bring some great and interesting experiences with us. We both love to travel, seek out new places to eat, and especially like trying new coffee shops.  

Combined, Steve and I bring experience working in the food, corporate, and small business worlds.  Steve has experience working for a sandwich chain as a manager and really enjoyed working in the food industry.  He had an opportunity to work part-time for FedEx 20 years ago to make some extra money, and he never left. He's been a courier with FedEx ever since, and also drives for Uber and Lyft during the weekends.   I have years of experience working in the corporate world as an IT buyer and supply chain coordinator, and after my position was outsourced to India I decided to go back to school and get my AA in Fashion Design.  After graduating from the Art Institute of Tucson I focused on working with and supporting smaller businesses.  This is really where I learned the most valuable lessons and information, and this is what I plan to use to help us bring Rove Wild to life.

Hit the forward button, and here we are celebrating 13 years of marriage, and we have a very rambunctious toddler keeping us oh-so-very entertained.  How grateful are we!  

THE PLAN

Our goal is to build a place where the community can come together, use some free Wi-Fi (because that's a must), meet with friends, or have a business meeting.  Our roaster is Pachamama Coffee Cooperative, they are the only coffee company in the USA that is 100% owned and governed by farmers in Peru, Nicaragua, Guatemala, Mexico, and Ethiopia.  The coffee is absolutely amazing, and we cannot wait to share it with the Fresno community.

Handcrafted is always better.  To really enjoy all the amazing flavor that each coffee bean has to offer, we believe you must take a few extra minutes. We will be serving Pachamama coffee pour over style, brewed cold or hot whatever you prefer, and the coffee offerings will change seasonally.  Of course we will also offer espresso drinks or whatever coffee drink you want to dream up.

For those that are not coffee drinkers we will offer tea and unique in-house sodas.  Our pastries and baked goods will be locally sourced from local chefs and bakers that will also change seasonally. Supporting local is so important to us!

Prior to launching this campaign we did secure a small space in the Mural District. The goal we set will help us cover the new plumbing and requirements to bring the space up to code, as well as helping us with some of the initial start-up costs and licensing and permits.

The funds we receive will go towards the following:

  1. IndieGoGo fee's/Credit Card and PayPal fee's
  2. Business licensing and permits:                                        
  3. Rent for 6months
  4. Furniture/Equipment
  5. Build-Out

THE LOOK

Close your eyes.  Imagine a white space filled with lush green plants, a comfy couch to sink into, an area to set-up your laptop or to hold a much needed group study session.  Because we know coffee, magazines, and newspapers go hand-in-hand we will have a unique selection of indie newspapers and design magazines for you to read while at Rove Wild.  This was a must-have…because we may or may not be magazine addicts too?!?

THE COFFEE

100% organic.  100% hand picked.  100% farmer owned coffee farms.                    Once we found Pachamama, we stopped in our tracks, and knew we had found the company and roaster we wanted to partner with.  We know how hard these farmers work, and they deserve to be paid fairly.  It is very important to us knowing that our coffee farmers are able to have a higher quality of life.  We are so thankful for the Pachmama organization for their hard work in making this a possibility for them, for us, and especially for you.  Follow along with us and meet the farmers behind the coffee.

LOCATION

We feel an amazing vibe happening in the Mural District in Downtown Fresno.  Here we are surrounded by some very creative designers, artists, and small businesses. We feel this location offers us an opportunity to get involved with our community, and to be a part of the revitalization and growth of this area. 

Our location on H Street is 600 square feet, with lots of available parking, and is surrounded by the Granville Homes properties such as Vagabond Lofts, H Street Lofts, Fulton Village, Iron Bird Lofts, Brio Lofts, and the Broadway Lofts...just to name a few. These Granville Homes urban developments account for 600+ units, and we have been told by so many of the Granville tenants how much they want a neighborhood coffee shop to open up.  

THE GOODS

Here are some details on the perks that we are offering in exchange for your donations:

Rove Wild tote bag/market bag

Each tote bag is printed and sewn right here in Fresno.  The IndieGoGo tote will be a limited edition and made especially for you early supporters.  Our plan is to release unique designs throughout the year, so make sure you check back in soon.  

Rove Wild tee

Rock your Rove Wild tee everywhere!  These tee’s are 100% organic cotton.  The designs were created in collaboration with us and a local artist.  

Rove Wild tea towels

You can never have too many tea towels.  We’ve selected a great quality cotton/linen and all towels will be hand-sewn right here in Fresno.  Each towel has a twill strap for hanging or displaying.  So while you are drying your dishes you’ll be reminded that you did a great thing and supported a small business.

Coffee Cards (Secret Instagram Only Perk..stay tuned to Instagram for link)

Your Buy-One-Get-One gift cards are the perfect solution to date night, or maybe taking a friend out on a coffee date.  Who doesn’t love a good coffee date?  For you early bird supporters, this was a way for us to say THANK YOU, and also for us to share the Pay It Forward spirit.  

VIP coffee card

We have designed and printed a unique ROVE WILD VIP card just for you.  Use this to get 100 premium organic coffees and special perks.

We will place orders and pay for all set-up charges for all of our limited edition goods once this campaign has ended.  If there will be any delays in fulfillment we will notify everyone immediately.  

EVENTS

We've had the opportunity to partner with Granville Homes on 2 events, one being their tenant holiday party in December, and for the February ArtHop at The Lede. We received a great response to us opening in this area, and an especially great response to the coffee.  The feedback has really confirmed what we have felt all along, that Fresno is a great supportive community, and that they welcome new businesses like ours in the area.  

Stay tuned for details about our Pop-Up event at the April ArtHop.  Make sure to follow us on Instagram or Facebook to be the first to know. 

Instagram:    @rovewild

Facebook:     www.facebook.com/rovewildcoffee

Website:        www.rovewild.coffee


We completely understand that some of you may not be able to contribute, but we would still appreciate and love it if you could share our campaign with your friends, family, co-workers, and your community.  During our campaign we will be offering some fun ways for you to share our campaign and receive free stuff by tagging us or forwarding our posts on Facebook and Instagram. 

Thank you for your support, we are beyond excited to open up Rove Wild!

story:
Our goal: to raise enough money to take advantage of the Burger King 10 nugget for $1.49 deal, and order 10,000 nuggets at one time. We are the Nugget Nine.


If goal is not reached, we will use the money to buy as many nuggets as possible.
If goal is exceed all excess funds and chicken nuggets will be donated to charity and food banks.
If Burger King discontinues this deal before our campaign is complete, we will locate another source of nuggets.

story:
"Find your passion."
"Follow your heart."
"Do what you love."

Constantly we are told things like this as we make our way from adolescence to adult-hood. This seemingly regret filled advice is given in what seems like so many parents desperate attempt at hoping that their children will not have to fall into the same 9-5, emotionally (and, so many times, financially) unfulfilling grind of "working for the man."

Alas, no matter how many times we hear those same little quips, no matter how many inspirational quotes we read and no matter how hard the tears of their importance and truth fight to break free of the stronghold of our eyes, so many of us put our dreams on hold until we can "afford" it...but sometimes that idea of foundation that we cling to seems to crumble at the same time it is being built. You know the story...you save a little and then your car breaks down; you save a little and then your dog gets a face full of porcupine; you save a little and you save a little and you save a little and then, somehow, you are fifty years old and telling your grand children to follow their dreams.

So here I am, a twenty seven year old mother of an amazing fifteen month old boy; a loving and supportive partner to a loving and supporting man; a girl trying to make a living by doing something she truly loves.

I would love to say that I have known for ever what exactly my dream was (and I guess now that I think of it, I kind of always have, but we will get back to that in a moment) but I didn't. A few years ago, I couldn't tell you what I was passionate about, let alone would I have been able to dream up a way to turn -passion- into what I did for a living. I thought I was stuck in the 9-5 world and that's just the way life worked if you didn't pursue higher education, didn't have money or opted out of joining the Peace Corps.  I have gone from job to job with a smile on my face, though
 not always in my heart, because I knew that it was what I needed to do. Some days I really loved it, being the eternal optimist that I am, I had found my niche in Customer Service. Something about working with people and having that chance to share a moment of each others lives together and to help bring a little bit of my sunny-side of life outlook into their days really made me happy. It still does make me happy, but when those moments are over and I begin to think about the time and effort I put into creating that experience for someone elses dream, I am left feeling a little bit empty inside.

It was when I realized these feelings that I really started to ponder what -exactly- I wanted to do with my life. It was then that those tears of truth began to bubble under the surface, threatening to escape when I encountered people living their dream. It was then that those tears did escape when I met people taking the risk to do what they believed in. It was then that I began to think about passion.

I read once that a good place to start to gain an understanding about what may or may not be your passion is to return to your childhood. It is in those un-jaded years of our youth that we truly loved without the burden of societies ideas of right and wrong. What was it that I loved as a child?Books, baths and most of all, reading books while taking a bath. While it sounds a little silly, there was seriously nothing I loved more than taking a ridiculously long bath (sometimes re-filling the tub two or three times) and escaping into some fantastical landscape (mostly Hogwarts...okay almost ALWAYS Hogwarts) where I didn't have to worry about the realities of life.

So, when I thought about what I love about being a part of the work force today, the life style that I live and my childhood (and forever) love of a way too long bath, Laughing Fox Botanicals was born. I came to the conclusion that I could make a product that not only encourages people to stop bombarding their body with the ridiculous amounts of dangerous chemicals that are put into today's bath and body products, but more importantly encourages them to SLOW DOWN and take a moment to remember to love yourself.

I want to take this moment to thank you. Thank you for taking the time to read my story. Thank you for supporting me, and if you feel moved to make a donation, thank you so much for helping to make my dream a reality and I hope that it will inspire another person to follow their dreams.
