What was it that I loved as a child?Books, baths and most of all, reading books while taking a bath. While it sounds a little silly, there was seriously nothing I loved more than taking a ridiculously long bath (sometimes re-filling the tub two or three times) and escaping into some fantastical landscape (mostly Hogwarts...okay almost ALWAYS Hogwarts) where I didn't have to worry about the realities of life.So, when I thought about what I love about being a part of the work force today, the life style that I live and my childhood (and forever) love of a way too long bath, Laughing Fox Botanicals was born. I came to the conclusion that I could make a product that not only encourages people to stop bombarding their body with the ridiculous amounts of dangerous chemicals that are put into today's bath and body products, but more importantly encourages them to SLOW DOWN and take a moment to remember to love yourself.I want to take this moment to thank you. Thank you for taking the time to read my story. Thank you for supporting me, and if you feel moved to make a donation, thank you so much for helping to make my dream a reality and I hope that it will inspire another person to follow their dreams.

story:
Imagine a Lego like system...

to build any structure, wall or furniture, 

inside or outside ...

no tools, no screws, no glue... 

that's CORKBRICK! 


CORKBRICK is a unique system,  that will surely change households, office spaces and many other spaces worldwide in the next 5 years.


CORKBRICK story started in April 2012 at Lisbon airport coffee shop, on a trip to Casa Blanca... a  conversation between father (serial entrepreneur) and daughter (future architect)  about flexibility in home spaces. We were discussing solutions for open spaces, specifically searching for ideas to create dynamic guest rooms in our attic. We needed something simple, scalable, easy to mount and dismount - and most importantly without the use of tools, glues, or screws ! That was when we first thought of the potential behind a modular construction brick such as the CORKBRICK concept and designed the first sketches.

Ten days later, already back home from Morocco, we resumed our brainstorming and explored the global market to find that nothing fulfilled our imagination's criteria! There was no concept available with easy modularity and flexibility to build structures and furniture at home for people, such as us, who are hopeless at DIY (Do It Yourself) -- This was the origin of CORKBRICK!

Two weeks later, we started developing a solution for our problem, wondering if other people in the world might be looking for the same solution!

Our biggest challenge was in the optimization of the design of the bricks (or as we call them, the brocks!) -- finding the lowest possible number of brock designs necessary to ensure the highest number of modular  solutions and guaranteeing structural stability.

After 16 months of research, testing and trial and error, we finally came up with SEVEN optimized brock designs. Seven brocks to build structures in any possible direction, providing a solution for walls, furniture and any other creative applications at your heart's desire.

We have since patented our invention internationally and developed our own molding technology and production line, optimized to efficiently distribute CORKBRICK from Portugal to Europe and ready for global expansion - USA, Japan, China, Brazil and Australia.

Furthermore, we have entered into three strategic alliances to ensure CORKBRICK is ready for the global marketspace:

  • First, in July 2014, NOVACORTIÇA, a cork industry expert, to secure manufacturing capacity;

  • In January 2015, (Idea)ology group to prepare the expansion to the US market

  • Finally, in December 2015,  INAUTOM, that excels in automaton, to support in the development of the production line, molding processes and quality control;

Today, we are ready to start the production line and drive towards providing CORKBRICK worldwide.

What is CORKBRICK?
Imagine a Lego-like system to build any structure or furniture with no tools, screws or glues-- it's CORKBRICK!


With only 7 different brocks you can build whatever you imagine in any direction. The innovation of the whole system relies on its simplicity, both in terms of usage and production, which makes CORKBRICK a highly attractive and sustainable business.

Its the only solution available in the market that empowers creative minds that cannot face Do It Yourself solutions. Its potential users go beyond the DIY market to reach all those with a passion and enthusiasm to create unique and innovative solutions in their home (and office).


In 20 minutes you can build a wall, a bookcase or a bed... your imagination is the only limit! There is no comparable solution on the market. All with your bare hands, with very light components, it can be handled by any person from 8 to 88 years old!...


Although our initial focus was geared around what we could do for our own attic in our own home, the possible applications and usefulness of CORKBRICK are wide and varied. It serves both household and business environments. Imagine the flexibility it may offer to office spaces— always adaptable to the changes in the company development, in business fairs, to build stands, or even in hotels. The brocks are  fully-reusable, long-lasting, ecological, comfortable, whilst being excellent sound proofing and thermal isolation. It is truly a uniquely sustainable solution tailored to anyone, offering immense possibilities only limited by one's imagination.

The main reason for this campaign is to help finance the building of the production line and the molds. We have sought crowdfunding to maintain the unique advantage of independence and reduction of undesirable costs.

Currently we only have a few sets of brocks. prototypes - but we thought you would like to see what kind of solutions can be built!..



The possibilities, as you can see,  are huge! The usefulness of the CORKBRICK system is obvious; the sustainability of the whole business is easy to demonstrate, too.  Your help participating in this campaign and becoming part of our club, will turn this idea and unique concept into a success, hopefully revolutionizing the interior architecture market in a similar way as Lego did in the toy industry...

If you like this concept as much as we do, please support us and share. We want to start delivering CORKBRICK in October.With your help, it can be possible!

How many times do you have the opportunity to participate in such a global venture?  Join the Club and be part of this innovation!

story:
• Who We Are

Dorr to Eden is a family hobby farm in Dorr, Michigan. We combine the unique practice of naturopathy and psychodynamic counseling using animals. We are offering a place for children to find healing by reconnecting with animals, nature and themselves.

  • Equine assisted therapy uses the natural instincts of the horse, a prey animal, to bring awareness to the client's emotions. The horse has a very heightened sense of human emotions because of their need to be conscious of anything that feels unstable in their environment. Their mirror neurons responds to anxiety, depression, or fear that is present and the client. This will then make space for the client to learn ways to reduce their uncomfortable emotions and watch how the horse also relaxes. 
By following the principals laid out in EAGALA (Equine Assisted Growth and Learning Association), Angela and Tracy can explore non-traditional pathways to healing.

  Angela McElroy BSHS,  Doctor Naturopathy- Angela has worked in Infant mental health as a social worker for 10 years.  Angela observed a need for educating parents in holistic health as well as a increase in nature deficiency so she pursued her certification as a doctor of naturopathy and continued her education in herbal studies.  She recognized that when children become diagnosed at a younger age with ADHD, Anxiety, Depression and chronic anger; they become disconnected with society and themselves due to overuse of technology, and lack of outdoor play. Angela's passion is to reconnect children through truer healing and peace of mind.


Tracy Thompson LPC Child and Family Therapist- believes that childhood can be a time of happiness, joy and excitement. For others it can be a time of disappointment, confusion and pain.  Tracy has been in the mental health field for 10 years and specializes in working with children and families who have discovered that life can be a tough journey. By using animals and nature rather than a traditional office setting children are released to explore healing through non-judgmental playful connection.  Tracy loves to help children learn about how their body is communicating with them through their feelings and helping them to listen and develop tools to help them manage these "big" feelings. 

Why it Matters

  • Offering this space and treatment to kids, who have not had success in the traditional settings, can give parents and children hope that healing is possible.  When children are forced to function in an environment that limits their ability to express themselves they feel the need to protect themselves by shutting down. When they are out in nature and in connection with animals,  they feel comfortable, and free to fully express there true selves.  
  • Using animals in healing has been shown to provide a quicker process towards healing. Dorr to Eden will expand that by joining together two modalities to create a space where healing can begin. 
  • When children are facing disconnection in their relationships, trauma, school problems, health issues or other points of conflict, there is limited capacity for them to navigate their world very well. This place will provide them with tools and support to assist them in being able to take steps towards wholeness. 
  • Being outside taps into the relaxing side of the nervous system, and results can be seen in as little as 5 minutes.   During this outside time anxiety and depression can be relieved and happiness can begin again.
When you support Dorr to Eden you support a holistic mindful model of healing and connection. We believe that we are beings created to move towards wholeness and with the right support and tools people are more likely to have healthy lives. Your support allows you to be part of an innovative way for children and families to gain the resources they need to become happy, healthy and whole!

What We Need & What You Get

The great news is we have the property, animals, education and the passion to make this happen. Good works are taking root.

We are looking for your support to renovate an indoor work space for shelter when weather is bad. As you could see in the clip,  the garage out front is in need of a do- over, by adding this addition it will allow space for the children to participate indoors.  Also privacy fencing is needed around the front  pasture where sessions will be held. This funding will also help with the up front insurance fees for liability for clients and Dorr To Eden.

 Our timing is limited as the official opening date is September 1st 2016,  we would like to  have a website up and running by the end of June and offer  open houses during the month of August.

We are excited to offer these perks that have a connection to out space here on the farm, from the mindful heart connection to the nature connection. 

Beyond giving, we would love for your help to get the word out to friends and family about this service.  This could look like:

Sharing this page to raise out goal

Like and follow us while sharing our updates on our Dorr To Eden Facebook page.

Come check out our open house this fall.

The Impact

Well grounded individuals are a benefit to society as a whole.  Community, schools and parents all benefit when youth are respectful and grounded in nature because they feel physically and mentally whole.  When we encourage youth to love and respect nature and animals it teaches them to love and respect themselves, which will translate to gratitude and love for others. 

More potential out comes would look like...

Lower negative behaviors

Deeper connection to families

Higher sense of personal responsibility

High sense of self awareness and self esteem

Lower medical bills do to improved health both mentaly and physically

A change of heart will change everything.

Risks & Challenges

It is extremely important to us that we have safety and confidentiality at Dorr to Eden. The kind of work that we are going to be doing is very unique and it is essential to our clients safety that the funds first go towards the building structure and privacy fencing. We also recognize the unique challenges of working with Animals. 
We are committed to receiving the necessary training to make sure that we have a team of qualified therapists who are focusing on best practices to give our clients the best care. Angela and Tracy are both going through the training process specified EAGALA, which has laid out specific ways to manage the challenges that may come while working in this modality, as well as ongoing study in our individual fields of practice.

 Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways you can support Dorr to Eden:

Share this link on Facebook

Like the Dorr to Eden Facebook page

Talk to your Friends about Dorr to Eden

story:
The Project:

Our primary purpose is to bring good cheer to our community through outstanding beer produced in Statesville's first brewery. We envision 1789 Brewery & Taphouse as a comfortable gathering spot for all to enjoy delicious, handcrafted beer in a welcoming environment. A cozy beer garden will be the perfect outdoor setting to enjoy our warm southern climate. 

The Beer:

With a focus on quality over quantity, we will use the finest ingredients available to produce an exceptional product. All of our beer is handcrafted with care and held to the highest standards.

Flavorful, refreshing, unfiltered deliciousness created fresh for you to enjoy straight from the source. The beers in our Signature Collection are classic styles, rooted in European tradition, crafted with American flair. The line-up includes, but is not limited to, an American IPA, a Tart Gose or Berliner Wiesse, an English Pale Ale, an Irish Stout, a German Golden Lager, a Czech Dark Lager, a Belgian Wit, and a Hefeweizen.

We plan to have 6 of our Signature Collection beers on tap at all times, but we also love experimenting with new flavors and brewing fun, eccentric beers. A constant rotation of seasonal specialties, barrel-aged projects, collaborations, and experimental batches of our own will be among the 20 different choices featured in the 1789 Taphouse.

It is important for us to host a wide variety of local and international guest taps, so we always have an appealing beverage available for everyone. Hard cider, kombucha, sparkling soda, and cold-pressed coffee will also be on hand for gluten-free and alcohol-free options.

Homebrew Supply:

There is a definite void in the homebrew supply market in our area. Local homebrewers need access to ingredients and equipment without going out of town, ordering online, or worrying that the store is closed when they need a last minute item. We plan to have a small homebrew supply shop connected to the Taphouse to give homebrewers the option to shop locally. 

Community Enrichment:

1789 Brewery & Taphouse will be the first of its kind in historic Statesville. Our goal is to not only build a successful business for ourselves, but to run an organization that will benefit our community as a whole. We will play a fundamental role in the continued revitalization and growth of our city, bringing in new jobs and attracting other businesses to the area. We look forward to sponsoring established community events and creating other civic-minded events of our own. We will also help develop and organize educational courses for those interested in learning more about beer and the brewing process.

We would love to see 1789 become a beer destination and put Statesville on every beer traveler's map. At the crossroads of I-77 & I-40, Statesville is the perfect pit stop for travelers heading to and from the popular beer destinations of Asheville, Raleigh, and Charlotte. Thanks to our beautifully renovated downtown streetscape, a greenway that rivals any large city, and a dog park project underway, Statesville has just been named Tree City USA and is an even lovelier place to work and play. 

Community Tap:

We plan to give back to our community by joining forces with local charities and donating all profits from one specially designated tap, the Community Tap. Every quarter, the winner of our charity raffle will get to choose their favorite local charity as well as have a say in the beer that is served from the Community Tap. Profits from the Community Tap for the next three months will be given to the charity of choice.   

Why 1789?

We chose the name 1789 Brewing Company for its historical significance and unique simplicity. In 1789, the Iredell County settlement known as Fourth Creek Congregation was officially renamed Statesville. 1789 is the year the Province of North Carolina became the 12th state to join the Union. North Carolina University, now known as UNC - Chapel Hill, received its charter in 1789. George Washington's Presidential inauguration was held on April 30, 1789. We could go on, but that would spoil the fun, as we plan to use these historical facts in our beer names! 

Your Contributions:

We are truly committed to this venture, and realize a lot of hard work lies ahead. In order to move forward, we need your help.

By contributing to this campaign, you are making it possible for us to purchase brewing equipment and taphouse furnishings, apply for permits and licensing, and complete necessary building renovations. In addition to our everlasting gratitude, you will have your name emblazoned on our taphouse wall for all eternity. You will be able to walk in to 1789 Brewery & Taphouse with a sense of pride, knowing that you were an essential part of turning this dream into reality.

To thank you for your support, we have put together some awesome perks, as seen on the right and detailed below. You are not limited to one perk, you can choose two or three, whatever feels right. All items listed as perks will be unique to Backers only, not available for purchase to the general public. If our perks are not appealing, you are more than welcome to leave a monetary contribution in any amount.

Perks:

In addition to our never-ending gratefulness, every perk includes your name proudly displayed on our website. 

You may choose multiple perks by making separate transactions.

$5 - Coaster

Keep wet rings off the furniture, or bugs out of your glass, with your very own 1789 Coaster.

$10 - Sticker + Coaster

Slap a sticker on anything that doesn't breathe. You can even use it to keep wet rings off the furniture while your coaster is keeping the bugs out of your beer.

$25 - Automatic Bottle Opener + Sticker + Coaster

Watch out! Your friends will want to pop the caps off all your beer once they get a load of this thing. Bottle cap collectors will love the undamaged caps that pop off perfectly. A sticker and a coaster are also included.

$50 - The Ultimate Perk Pack

Enjoy an awesome array of 1789 merchandise including 2 unique pint glasses, an automatic bottle opener, 2 stickers, and 2 coasters. Our unique, stackable pint glasses are a shapely pair; nucleated, and specifically designed for versatility and sensory enhancement. Your name will be proudly displayed on our website as well as incorporated into a work of art gracing the Backer's Wall of our Taproom.

$50 - Limited Edition T-Shirt

Tell everyone you supported 1789 while wearing our 100% organic, soft-touch, ring-spun cotton T-shirt with a one of a kind design created by a local artist, exclusively for Backers only. Your name will be proudly displayed on our website as well as incorporated into a work of art gracing the Backer's Wall of our Taproom.

$100 - Private Pre-Opening Party (admit one)

1789 Brewery & Taphouse cordially invites you to our Private Pre-Opening Party. Be among the first to experience our handcrafted brews fresh from the source. Enjoy a catered meal, live entertainment, games, prizes, and discounted beverages. A souvenir glass is included. 

$150 - Dedicate a Bar Stool

Become a permanent fixture in the 1789 Taphouse by dedicating a bar stool to yourself or a loved one. Your contribution will help thirsty travelers enjoy a comfy seat at the bar. When they see your name permanently etched on their stool, they'll know you were a major player in helping make this happen. We've kept this perk simple, so you may choose only to dedicate a barstool, or make an additional contribution by adding another perk. 

$150 - Limited Edition Brewer's Shirt 

Get to work! You'll be ready for anything in your short sleeve industrial strength button-up shirt from Dickies. We wear them, and you should too. These shirts are unique to this Indiegogo campaign and will never be available to the general public. Your name will be proudly displayed on our website as well as incorporated into a work of art gracing the Backer's Wall of our Taproom.

$200 - DrinkTanks® Growler  + 25% off Fills for Life 

Receive a 25% discount for life when you fill up your double-walled stainless steel DrinkTanks® Growler with your favorite 1789 beer* to share with family and friends. Take it to the lake, the beach, or anywhere glass is prohibited. Highly effective thermal technology is guaranteed to keep your beer cold for 24 hours! No condensation, no sweating, no metal or plastic flavors. Upgrade your awesome growler to a mini-keg with the fittings we will have on display and available for purchase when you pick up your growler at the Taphouse. This lifetime growler fill option is only available during this campaign. Your name will be proudly displayed on our website as well as incorporated into a unique work of art gracing the Backer's Wall of our Taproom. *Some restrictions apply.

$250 - Dedicate a Table

This is a great perk for a company, an organization, or an entire family. Have your names permanently engraved on a Taphouse or Beer Garden table. Let everyone see how important your contribution was to us as they sit down to enjoy a tasty beverage. We've kept this perk simple, so you may choose only to dedicate a table, or make an additional contribution by adding another perk. 

$500 - Stein Club Lifetime Member

Become a member of the 1789 Stein Club for life, and drink a full liter of beer for the price of a 16oz pour*. You'll be the envy of the Beer Garden as you drink from a beautiful German Stein made of earthenware, which actually helps keep the beer cold longer than glass. Lifetime membership is only available during this Indiegogo campaign. A special plaque for Stein Club members will hang in the Taphouse. *some restrictions apply

$500 - Reserve a 4 Person Table  

You can have your very own reserved 4 person table on whatever night of the week you choose, so that you always have your favorite seat at your favorite place. This is your table - you can embellish it with artistic flair however you wish to let everyone know who sits here. This concept comes from the German Stammtisch, which is a special table reserved for an informal gathering of a group of friends with similar interests who meet on a regular basis to socialize. Includes 2 tickets to the Private Pre-Opening Party. (Limit 5)

$500 - Recipe Creation Event + Brewer's Shirt 

Pick your favorite style of beer, and we'll sit down together as a tasting committee to come up with a new recipe for the 1789 Brewery. We will bring in several commercial examples of the style you choose, and taste each one to help us come up with the perfect recipe for your beer. You can also help us brainstorm ideas for the name of your beer. VIP seating and dinner for you and 5 of your closest friends on the day the beer is released. A Brewer's Shirt is also included with this perk. Includes 1 ticket to the Private Pre-Opening Party.

$500 - Assistant Brewer for a Day + Brewer's Shirt

Get your feet wet inside the Brewery by assisting our Brewmaster with his daily tasks! You'll learn the basics of handcrafting beer from start to finish. VIP seating and dinner for you and 5 of your closest friends on the day the first keg of the beer you helped brew is tapped. A Brewer's Shirt is also included with this perk. Includes 1 ticket to the Private Pre-Opening Party. 

$1000 - Reserve a 10 Person Table 

Have your very own reserved 10 person table one night a week for the rest of your life. You own this table so you can do whatever you like to enhance its greatness. Showcase your artistic talent, or have a family memento placed in the center. You choose the night of the week, and we'll make sure your table is ready. This concept comes from the German Stammtisch, which is a special table reserved for an informal gathering of a group of friends with similar interests who meet on a regular basis to socialize. Includes 4 tickets to the Private Pre-Opening Party. (Limit 5)

$5000 - Dedicate a Fermenter

Become a permanent fixture in the 1789 Brewery by dedicating a fermenter to yourself, a loved one, or your organization. This perk includes either the Recipe Creation Event or Assistant Brewer for a Day, your choice. You'll also have the opportunity to help name the beer you had a hand in creating. When the beer is ready to serve, we will throw a special release party in your beer's honor, with a VIP table for you and 9 of your closest friends. A great perk for individuals, corporations, clubs, and special interest groups alike! Includes 10 tickets to the Private Pre-Opening Party.

Wondering what the heck is a fermenter? A fermenter is a large stainless steel tank where yeast turns wort (water, malt, and hops) into beer through a process called fermentation. Ales typically take 21 days to ferment, while lagers take even longer. Fermenters are the most important components of the brewery. The more fermenters, the better, so we can ferment a good variety of beers at the same time.


Risks & Challenges:

Of course there are risks involved when starting any new business venture. Adequate funding is essential to the success of 1789 Brewing Company. Most of the building renovations will be done ourselves, but we will eventually have to hire contractors. Shipping delays will most likely be an issue. Acquiring the proper licenses will probably involve yards of government red tape. 

While running a brewery sounds like a lot of fun, it is also very labor intensive. Lucky for us, brewing beer is our passion, so the hard work is a genuine labor of love. We realize we will have to jump through many hoops before our doors open to the public, but we shall overcome! And we welcome you along for the ride.

Thank you in advance for your generosity and support. We will keep you updated periodically with our progress. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

We understand if you do not have the monetary means to help. That's OK. There are other ways you can lend a hand in getting this venture off the ground.

1. Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word to your social media circle

2. Talk to your friends and family the old-fashioned way

3. Follow us on Facebook and Twitter

4. Share the craft beer love!
story_txt:
The Project:
Our primary purpose is to bring
good cheer to our community through outstanding beer produced in Statesville's
first brewery. We envision 1789 Brewery & Taphouse as a comfortable gathering
spot for all to enjoy delicious, handcrafted beer in a welcoming environment. A
cozy beer garden will be the perfect outdoor setting to enjoy our warm southern
climate.  

The Beer:
With a focus on quality over
quantity, we will use the finest ingredients available to produce an
exceptional product. All of our beer is handcrafted with care and held to the
highest standards. 
Flavorful, refreshing, unfiltered
deliciousness created fresh for you to enjoy straight from the source. The
beers in our Signature Collection are classic styles, rooted in European
tradition, crafted with American flair. The line-up includes, but is not
limited to, an American IPA, a Tart Gose or Berliner Wiesse, an English Pale Ale, an Irish Stout, a German
Golden Lager, a Czech Dark Lager, a Belgian Wit, and a Hefeweizen. 
We plan to have 6 of our Signature
Collection beers on tap at all times, but we also love experimenting with new
flavors and brewing fun, eccentric beers. A constant rotation of seasonal
specialties, barrel-aged projects, collaborations, and experimental batches of
our own will be among the 20 different choices featured in the 1789 Taphouse.
It is important for us to host a
wide variety of local and international guest taps, so we always have an
appealing beverage available for everyone. Hard cider, kombucha, sparkling soda,
and cold-pressed coffee will also be on hand for gluten-free and alcohol-free
options. 

Homebrew Supply:
There is a
definite void in the homebrew supply market in our area. Local homebrewers need
access to ingredients and equipment without going out of town, ordering online,
or worrying that the store is closed when they need a last minute item. We plan
to have a small homebrew supply shop connected to the Taphouse to give
homebrewers the option to shop locally.  
Community Enrichment:
1789 Brewery & Taphouse will be
the first of its kind in historic Statesville.
Our goal is to not only build a successful business for ourselves, but to run
an organization that will benefit our community as a whole. We will play a
fundamental role in the continued revitalization and growth of our city,
bringing in new jobs and attracting other businesses to the area. We look
forward to sponsoring established community events and creating other
civic-minded events of our own. We will also help develop and organize
educational courses for those interested in learning more about beer and the
brewing process. 
We would love to see 1789 become a
beer destination and put Statesville on every beer traveler's map. At the
crossroads of I-77 & I-40, Statesville is the perfect pit stop for
travelers heading to and from the popular beer destinations of Asheville,
Raleigh, and Charlotte. Thanks to our beautifully renovated downtown
streetscape, a greenway that rivals any large city, and a dog park project
underway, Statesville has just been named Tree City USA and is an even lovelier
place to work and play.  
Community Tap:
We plan to give back to our
community by joining forces with local charities and donating all profits from
one specially designated tap, the Community Tap. Every quarter, the winner of
our charity raffle will get to choose their favorite local charity as well as
have a say in the beer that is served from the Community Tap. Profits from the
Community Tap for the next three months will be given to the charity of
choice.   
Why 1789?
We chose the name 1789 Brewing
Company for its historical significance and unique simplicity. In 1789, the
Iredell County settlement known as Fourth Creek Congregation was officially
renamed Statesville. 1789 is the year the Province of North Carolina became the
12th state to join the Union. North Carolina University, now known as UNC - Chapel
Hill, received its charter in 1789. George Washington's Presidential
inauguration was held on April 30, 1789. We could go on, but that would spoil
the fun, as we plan to use these historical facts in our beer names!  
Your Contributions:
We are truly committed to this
venture, and realize a lot of hard work lies ahead. In order to move forward,
we need your help. 
By contributing to this campaign,
you are making it possible for us to purchase brewing equipment and taphouse
furnishings, apply for permits and licensing, and complete necessary building
renovations. In addition to our everlasting gratitude, you will have your name
emblazoned on our taphouse wall for all eternity. You will be able to walk in
to 1789 Brewery & Taphouse with a sense of pride, knowing that you were an
essential part of turning this dream into reality. 
To thank you for your support, we
have put together some awesome perks, as seen on the right and detailed below.
You are not limited to one perk, you can choose two or three, whatever feels
right. All items listed as perks will be unique to Backers only, not available
for purchase to the general public. If our perks are not appealing, you are
more than welcome to leave a monetary contribution in any amount. 

Perks:
In addition
to our never-ending gratefulness, every perk includes your name proudly
displayed on our website.  
You may
choose multiple perks by making separate transactions. 
$5 - Coaster
Keep wet
rings off the furniture, or bugs out of your glass, with your very own 1789
Coaster. 
$10 - Sticker + Coaster 
Slap a
sticker on anything that doesn't breathe. You can even use it to keep wet rings
off the furniture while your coaster is keeping the bugs out of your beer.
$25 - Automatic Bottle Opener +
Sticker + Coaster
Watch out!
Your friends will want to pop the caps off all your beer once they get a load
of this thing. Bottle cap collectors will love the undamaged caps that pop off
perfectly. A sticker and a coaster are also included. 
$50 - The Ultimate Perk Pack
Enjoy an
awesome array of 1789 merchandise including 2 unique pint glasses, an automatic
bottle opener, 2 stickers, and 2 coasters. Our unique, stackable pint glasses
are a shapely pair; nucleated, and specifically designed for versatility and
sensory enhancement. Your name will be proudly displayed on our website as
well as incorporated into a work of art gracing the Backer's Wall of our
Taproom. 
$50 - Limited Edition T-Shirt
Tell everyone
you supported 1789 while wearing our 100% organic, soft-touch, ring-spun cotton
T-shirt with a one of a kind design created by a local artist, exclusively for
Backers only. Your name will be proudly displayed on our website as well as incorporated into a work of art gracing the Backer's Wall of our Taproom.
$100 - Private Pre-Opening Party (admit one)
1789 Brewery
& Taphouse cordially invites you to our Private Pre-Opening Party. Be among
the first to experience our handcrafted brews fresh from the source. Enjoy a
catered meal, live entertainment, games, prizes, and discounted beverages. A
souvenir glass is included.  
$150 - Dedicate a Bar Stool
Become a
permanent fixture in the 1789 Taphouse by dedicating a bar stool to yourself or
a loved one. Your contribution will help thirsty travelers enjoy a comfy seat
at the bar. When they see your name permanently etched on their stool, they'll
know you were a major player in helping make this happen. We've kept this perk
simple, so you may choose only to dedicate a barstool, or make an additional
contribution by adding another perk.  
$150 - Limited Edition Brewer's Shirt 
Get to work!
You'll be ready for anything in your short sleeve industrial strength button-up
shirt from Dickies. We wear them, and you should too. These shirts are unique
to this Indiegogo campaign and will never be available to the general public. Your name will be proudly displayed on our website as well as incorporated into a work of art gracing the Backer's Wall of our Taproom.$200 - DrinkTanks® Growler  + 25% off Fills for Life Receive a 25% discount for life when you fill up your double-walled stainless steel DrinkTanks® Growler with your favorite 1789 beer* to share with family and friends. Take it to the lake, the beach, or anywhere glass is prohibited. Highly effective thermal technology is guaranteed to keep your beer cold for 24 hours! No condensation, no sweating, no metal or plastic flavors. Upgrade your awesome growler to a mini-keg with the fittings we will have on display and available for purchase when you pick up your growler at the Taphouse. This lifetime growler fill option is only available during this campaign. Your name will be proudly displayed on our website as well as incorporated into a unique work of art gracing the Backer's Wall of our Taproom. *Some restrictions apply.$250 - Dedicate a Table 
This is a
great perk for a company, an organization, or an entire family. Have your names
permanently engraved on a Taphouse or Beer Garden table. Let everyone see how
important your contribution was to us as they sit down to enjoy a tasty
beverage. We've kept this perk simple, so you may choose only to dedicate a
table, or make an additional contribution by adding another perk.  
$500 - Stein
Club Lifetime MemberBecome a
member of the 1789 Stein Club for life, and drink a full liter of beer for the
price of a 16oz pour*. You'll be the envy of the Beer Garden as you drink from
a beautiful German Stein made of earthenware, which actually helps keep the
beer cold longer than glass. Lifetime membership is only available during this
Indiegogo campaign. A special plaque for Stein Club members will hang in the
Taphouse. *some restrictions apply
$500 - Reserve a 4 Person Table  
You can have
your very own reserved 4 person table on whatever night of the week you choose,
so that you always have your favorite seat at your favorite place. This is your
table - you can embellish it with artistic flair however you wish to let
everyone know who sits here. This concept comes from the German Stammtisch,
which is a special table reserved for an informal gathering of a group of
friends with similar interests who meet on a regular basis to socialize. Includes 2 tickets to the Private Pre-Opening Party. (Limit 5)
$500 - Recipe Creation Event +
Brewer's Shirt 
Pick your
favorite style of beer, and we'll sit down together as a tasting committee to
come up with a new recipe for the 1789 Brewery. We will bring in several

with this perk. Includes 1 ticket to the Private Pre-Opening Party. 
$500 - Assistant Brewer for a Day +
Brewer's Shirt

dinner for you and 5 of your closest friends on the day the first keg of the
beer you helped brew is tapped. A Brewer's Shirt is also included with

Reserve a 10 Person Table

You own this table so you can do whatever you like to enhance its greatness.
Showcase your artistic talent, or have a family memento placed in the center.
You choose the night of the week, and we'll make sure your table is ready. This

story:
It was a long, stressful but happy 5 months while we invested over 50 Thousand Dollars cash into the renovation of a Historical Building in Rosenberg, Texas.  We also expended 4 months of rent before we were able to open. All of our equipment was paid cash - We however, never had enough funds to get hot food on our menu. Since opening, we have offered sandwiches, salads and smoothies.  

 

We admitted the mistakes and miscalculations, running over budget for the remodel and remained positive as we both committed everything to fulfilling our dream. And we were strategics on how we were going to overcome our shortcomings when Ronnie two strokes. Ron is better now and we are eager to stay business need financial help.

 

The money raised in this campaign will go to paying rent and catching up on some operating cost. We feel confident if we can get over this slump, that we grow the business and not have to seek help. 

 

Thank you for your support! Preston Naquin 832-373-3561

story:
JERKebago charcoal grill!

Warmest of greetings beautiful souls!!!

We are Joshua and Saiqa, husband & wife, passionate about all things life - especially family, food and culture.

This is precisely what JERKebago is all about!

As unique and diverse as both our backgrounds, we are looking to promote our delicious food and colourful culture, in the beautiful Prince Edward County, through our JERKebago charcoal grill!

We will be serving you fresh, charcoal grilled jerk chicken, BBQ, savoury samosas, exotic drinks, treats and other homemade goodness.

Being able to set up shop in the county, will provide for us an opportunity to share our passion of cooking together as a family! It will also provide an authentic experience of all our cultures food, music and arts, for us all to vibe together - a true JERKebago experience!!
 

What We Need & What You Get

Ok, so basically we're starting from scratch.
Our goal is $20,000, although more is most certainly going to be needed.
Below is a gist of where the funding raised will be allocated.

  • We have bought a well-loved trailer, which we are in the process of gutting thoroughly, with our own hands.
    {Check out our progress pictures above!}
    [$]
  • Once this is cleaned out, we will build from the floor up, an industrial grade prep area, a walk in cooler and a serving window area.
    This is where half the magic happens!
    [$]
  • The other half will happen outside of the trailer, with our 18 square foot, charcoal grill! 
    [$]
  • We also need to take care of our lot, to make sure it is comfy cozy for everyone who stops by for a bite! From porta potties, seating to water stations.
    [$]
  • Some of the tasks above, we will seek professional guidance i.e electric, plumbing, construction, handymen thoughts etc.
    This will ensure we have done everything up to par!
    [$]
  • Once we've completed the tasks above, we are able to move on.
    Which leads us to licenses, permits, insurance - aka a lot of paperwork to take care of, in order to make sure that our indoor & outdoor premises are indeed certified safe, sound and secure.
    [$]
  • Phenomenal!!
    We've got the green light from all clerks, fire marshals, health-board and the likes.
    Next up is preparing to serve you meals.
    From scratch (ingredients) to finish (packaging)
    and all that is inbetween!
    [$]
    ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Please take a look at the many perks we're offering. 
When you contribute, you get something in return.
 


 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spreading the  word and sharing our campaign is greatly appreciated.
It takes a village to raise a child, or in this case, brainchild!!

You can share our journey using the Indiegogo share tools up top.
It's super simple, just the click of a button!

Also, follow us yourselves
Facebook @JERKebago
Instagram @JERKebago
Twitter @JERKebago

And that's all there is to it.
​
An abundance of gratitude for taking the time to read our spiel and be a part of this endeavour with us. We appreciate each and every one of you. 

See you this spring!
Blessings

Fear and complacency will leave you unfulfilled and stuck in a dead situation. It is time to bring life to your goals, visions and dreams!

Don't miss out on what we have to offer!

Coaching Sessions:  LCS will help you to set obtainable goals, gain awareness of your strengths/areas of improvement and receive feedback on daily life skills. Coaching sessions can be done face-to-face or online.

Workshop/Webinar: LCS will work with your company on improving job related skills and company culture.

Publicity: We have 1000s of listeners! Let the world know about you and your brand by advertising on the LCS Radio Show.

Design a show: We will work with you on creating a show of your choice.

story:
Why buy from us?

Yes, it is easy to go help on your own and donate money. Buying merchandise is more about becoming a member of the "team" and showing you want to support spreading this ideology. Wearing this clothing shows you want to back this message and we want this idea to keep spreading! There are many wonderful people out there making a difference; however, strength is in numbers and we want to keep this idea spreading! So get behinds HUMANS today!

What is the HUMANS ideology?

The important thing to note is HUMANS is about tackling things step by step. HUMANS wants to work locally in communities. This means supporting programs helping the poor and volunteering to help the locals. Gradually as the company and message grows  it is about tackling bigger and bigger issues such as hunger and working on getting areas basic living essentials. The ideology continues on to things such as getting areas energy and converting our world to renewable energy sources. 

Its bigger than just helping out the community.

HUMANS is about the future and the state of communities and the state of the world. Political parties and the government are currently at a state of unrest and we need a movement that is truly for the betterment of the people. 

HUMANS is more than just volunteering. 

HUMANS is about solving issues in our communities.

HUMANS is about solving social and cultural issues.  

HUMANS is about getting the world basic living essentials.

HUMANS is about helping fight mental and physical diseases.

HUMANS is about making our existence on Earth safer for the environment.

HUMANS is an ideology that wants to make a difference. 

HUMANS are the source of our own Prosperity

Check us out on social media

facebook.com/helpusmakeanewstory

twitter.com/humanseffort

story:
Para Español oprima aquí

OUR STORY

 

 

My name is Angelica Alvaray, as a professional I have gone from being an Engineer with an MBA at Henley Management College in London to becoming a Social Entrepreneur on a mission to develop a wonderful startup: CITIVIVA.

 

We, as people, are ever less engaged in fundamental affairs which affect our quality of living: life is moving faster than ever in a technology driven world and civic engagement drags along like a snail to the detriment of city life for all. 

 

Thus, CITIVIVA was born: to give civic engagement a fighting chance and an opportunity to catch up with the realities of a digital world.

 

At a very basic level, CITIVIVA is an information and awareness social platform, which puts a stop to the pernicious trend of civic disengagement and neglect. At a more ambitious level, it creates a virtuous dynamic in which whatever good happens in a section of the city becomes visible and enviable for other parts of the city to emulate. Similarly, whatever bad is reported in a neighborhood becomes known to other neighborhoods to avoid. The result is simple but powerful: a digital platform facilitating awareness of city issues, to drive a virtuous cycle of learn, engage and actuate which makes our cities more livable, serviceable and governable. CITIVIVA aspires to be "The Front Page of MIAMI community life".

 

 

Accordingly, CITIVIVA provides an App through which Miami citizens tell what they like and dislike about living in their city. Better yet, the App allows other people to vote up or down your likes or dislikes about living in Miami as well as posting their comments about them.  This simple but important dynamic results in an engaging atmosphere that enhances the sense of community and belonging among Miami citizens.

 

But CITIVIVA is much more than a simple App to praise or complain. Our App is tied to a cloud platform that stores, organizes and displays all of the issues posted by its members. Thus, anybody who cares about Miami can see the topics or issues of interest to its citizens. They can be community organizations, colleges and universities, the chamber of commerce, local media, service companies and local government officials. And they can use the information to propose innovative solutions, which will enhance the quality of life in the city.

 

We have already invested our own funds in developing and piloting our Civic Engagement Platform, so that it can be effectively deployed in medium to large American cities. Our current objective is to prove CITIVIVA viable in Miami as the first American city.

 

For CITIVIVA to be fully deployed in Miami, we need US$ 450.000, a part of which is being funded by us and our Angel Investors. The money will be used as follows:

Apps development and technology costs:    20%

Marketing and launching costs:                   29%

Awareness towards an engagement culture:         14%

Neighborhood and community workshops:   11%

Administrative and general expenses:                  26%

 

For us, the experience gained during our pilot trial at Montevideo provided us with important lessons learned that we intend to use during our deployment in Miami. The most important one is to recruit, early on, existing citizen organizations and institutions and "install" them within the Citizen Social Network, so they can leverage it to better organize and reach their existing constituencies, as well as to grow new ones. Therefore our initial marketing efforts will be totally focused on these targets. The other most important lesson is the use of the mobile apps to enhance user experience. This is already defined and waiting for the funding to commence.

 

As you can see, your contribution is valuable not only for the money you bring, but for the enthusiasm it provides in spreading the message in our communities that now is easier then ever to become engaged in the betterment of our city.

 

CITIVIVA is here for people like you who care about the city we live in.   With your help and participation we can, together, make this happen. After all, our everyday life matters!

 

 

 

 

NUESTRA HISTORIA

 

Mi nombre es Angélica Alvaray. Mi vida profesional me ha llevado de ser ingeniero con un MBA de la escuela de gerencia de negocios del Henley Management College en Londres, a convertirme en una Emprendedora Social dedicada al desarrollo de una iniciativa maravillosa: CITIVIVA.

 

Como personas, estamos cada vez menos envueltos en temas fundamentales que afectan nuestra calidad de vida: nuestra vida se mueve cada vez más rápido en un mundo empujado por la tecnología mientras que la participación ciudadana se mueve a paso de tortuga en detrimento de la calidad de vida de nuestras ciudades.

 

Por esto nace CITIVIVA: para darle a la participación ciudadana un chance de ponerse al día con las realidades de este mundo digital en el que vivimos.

 

A un nivel básico, CITIVIVA es una plataforma social de información y participación ciudadana cuyo objetivo es detener el círculo pernicioso de desidia y abandono cívico. A un nivel más ambicioso, crea una dinámica virtuosa dentro de la cual cualquier cosa buena que suceda en una parte de la ciudad pueda ser visualizable y envidiable para que el resto de la ciudad la emule. Igualmente, cualquier suceso o tendencia negativa en una sección de la ciudad se hace visible al resto de la ciudad para ser combatida o evitada. El resultado es simple pero poderoso: tener disponible al alcance de nuestro dedos una plataforma digital que facilite estar al tanto de los asuntos vitales de la ciudad, auspiciando un círculo virtuoso de informarse, opinar  y actuar que haga nuestra ciudad más vivible, serviciable y gobernable. CITIVIVA aspira a convertirse en "La portada de la vida ciudadana de MIAMI"

 

 

En consecuencia, CITIVIVA provee una App a través de la cual los ciudadanos de Miami pueden publicar lo que les gusta y no les gusta de su ciudad. Mejor aún, nuestra App le permite a otras personas votar en apoyo o en contra de tu opinion al mismo tiempo que les permite opinar sobre ella. Esta dinámica sencilla pero importante, estimula una atmósfera de participación que realza el sentido de comunidad y de pertenencia entre los ciudadanos del área metropolitana de Miami.

 

Pero CITIVIVA es mucho más que una simple App para aplaudir o protestar. Nuestra App está integrada con una plataforma social en la nube que almacena, organiza y presenta todos los asuntos creados por sus miembros. Así, cualquiera a quién le importe Miami, puede ver los tópicos o asuntos que de interés para sus ciudadanos. Esto aplica organizaciones comunitarias, colleges y universidades, cámara de comercio, medios de información, empresas de servicio y oficiales del gobierno local. Todos pueden utilizar la información disponible para proponer o implementar soluciones innovadoras que realzen la calidad de vida de la cuidad.

 

Los fundadores de esta iniciativa han invertido de sus propios fondos en el desarrollo y pruebas de la plataforma de participación ciudadana, de manera que pueda ser utilizada effectivamente en ciudades norteamericanas medianas y grandes. Nuestro objetivo inmediato es probar la viabilidad de CITIVIVA en Miami como su primera instalación en los Estados Unidos.

 

Para "instalar" CITIVIVA en Miami, requerimos de un total de $450,000, parte de los cuales serán provistos por nuestros Inversionistas Ángeles y el resto por ustedes. Los fondos serán empleados de esta manera:

 

Desarrollo y tecnología:                            20%

Mercadeo and lanzamiento:                        29%

Promoción de cultura de participación:        14%

Talleres de educación y promoción:            11%

Gastos administrativos y de ventas:            26%

 

La experiencia que adquirimos durante nuestro piloto en Montevideo nos dejó importantes lecciones que utilizaremos durante nuestra "instalación" en Miami. La más importante es incorporar organizaciones civicas así como instituciones para integrarlas dentro de nuestra Red Social Ciudadana y que puedan utilizarla como su "Sede Digital" para optimizar su alcance al público al cual de dedican, pero tambien a nuevos públicos. De manera que nuestros esfuerzos iniciales de mercadeo estarán centrados en estos "targets". Otra lección importante que aprendimos es diseñar efectivamente nuestras Apps móviles para realzar la experiencia de nuestro usuarios.

 

Como puedes ver, tu contribución (no importa su monto) vale no solo por el aporte financiero que nos provee, sino tambien por la demostración de entusiasmo que representa y nos ayuda a "correr la voz" de que ahora es más fácil que nunca influir poitivamente en la vida de nuestra ciudad.

 

CITIVIVA esta aquí para gente como tu a quien le importa la ciudad en la cual viven. Con tu ayuda y tu participación podemos, juntos, hacer esto posible. Después de todo, nuestra vida diaria importa !
story_txt:
Para Español oprima aquí OUR STORY  My name is Angelica Alvaray, as a professional I have gone from being an Engineer with an MBA at Henley Management College in London to becoming a Social Entrepreneur on a mission to develop a wonderful startup: CITIVIVA. We, as people, are ever less engaged in fundamental affairs which affect our quality of living: life is moving faster than ever in a technology driven world and civic engagement drags along like a snail to the detriment of city life for all.  Thus, CITIVIVA was born: to give civic engagement a fighting chance and an opportunity to catch up with the realities of a digital world. At a very basic level, CITIVIVA is an information and awareness social platform, which puts a stop to the pernicious trend of civic disengagement and neglect. At a more ambitious level, it creates a virtuous dynamic in which whatever good happens in a section of the city becomes visible and enviable for other parts of the city to emulate. Similarly, whatever bad is reported in a neighborhood becomes known to other neighborhoods to avoid. The result is simple but powerful: a digital platform facilitating awareness of city issues, to drive a virtuous cycle of learn, engage and actuate which makes our cities more livable, serviceable and governable. CITIVIVA aspires to be "The Front Page of MIAMI community life".  Accordingly, CITIVIVA provides an App through which Miami citizens tell what they like and dislike about living in their city. Better yet, the App allows other people to vote up or down your likes or dislikes about living in Miami as well as posting their comments about them.  This simple but important dynamic results in an engaging atmosphere that enhances the sense of community and belonging among Miami citizens. But CITIVIVA is much more than a simple App to praise or complain. Our App is tied to a cloud platform that stores, organizes and displays all of the issues posted by its members. Thus, anybody who cares about Miami can see the topics or issues of interest to its citizens. They can be community organizations, colleges and universities, the chamber of commerce, local media, service companies and local government officials. And they can use the information to propose innovative solutions, which will enhance the quality of life in the city. We have already invested our own funds in developing and piloting our Civic Engagement Platform, so that it can be effectively deployed in medium to large American cities. Our current objective is to prove CITIVIVA viable in Miami as the first American city. For CITIVIVA to be fully deployed in Miami, we need US$ 450.000, a part of which is being funded by us and our Angel Investors. The money will be used as follows:Apps development and technology costs:    20%Marketing and launching costs:                   29%Awareness towards an engagement culture:         14%Neighborhood and community workshops:   11%Administrative and general expenses:                  26% For us, the experience gained during our pilot trial at Montevideo provided us with important lessons learned that we intend to use during our deployment in Miami. The most important one is to recruit, early on, existing citizen organizations and institutions and "install" them within the Citizen Social Network, so they can leverage it to better organize and reach their existing constituencies, as well as to grow new ones. Therefore our initial marketing efforts will be totally focused on these targets. The other most important lesson is the use of the mobile apps to enhance user experience. This is already defined and waiting for the funding to commence. As you can see, your contribution is valuable not only for the money you bring, but for the enthusiasm it provides in spreading the message in our communities that now is easier then ever to become engaged in the betterment of our city. CITIVIVA is here for people like you who care about the city we live in.   With your help and participation we can, together, make this happen. After all, our everyday life matters!   

 
 
NUESTRA HISTORIA

story:
Brewster Club?

Brewster Club is dedicated to quench beer lovers' thirst for discovery by sharing with them the hidden gems of microbreweries. Every month, we ship our members a box of 4 liters of the best and most unique craft beers we found.

 

Four microbrewery will be featured in every box, sharing with our Brewsters one, two or three of their best creations. Members' taste buds must be ready for a party because we ensure that every box contains a variety of tastes and beer types. And as for what differentiates Brewsters from any other craft beer drinkers, it is the knowledge and experience they get as they open their box.

And to make sure our members' beer gets to them in the best condition (and not in the midst of shattered glass), we only ship canned beers. ​

OUR AMAZING PERKS

Hoodies, t-shirts,trucker hats and glassware, we got everything you need to drink your Brewster beer proudly! 

 

And now, we need you to share our passion for craft beer and hop on board to allow us to stock on those amazing brews, pack them and get them to your door!

 

HOW WE DO IT

 

We travel across America to find the best microbreweries and craft beers and learn about their stories. We share our all-American road trip and favorite brews with beer lovers by catering monthly boxes filled with our most amazing finds.

 
Brewster Club's promise is to feature only high quality products, coming from limited distribution microbreweries. It is our standard, and it will never change.
 
 

Risks & Challenges

We've already gone a good way in this adventure. Our founders left their jobs, took on the road and identified some of america's best brews. We met the brewers, got them on board and learned about their amazing stories, passion and commitment.

We also raised the money to rent and set our warehouse and shop, which we are required to have to get our licence. 

Now, and most important, we got the license!

And now, we need you to share our passion for craft beers and hop on board so we can stock on those amazing brews, pack them and get them to your door!

 

It’s all about the people, people!

We select the beers we ship to our members based on their uniqueness, their character or their recipe. But above the beers there’s the people who brew them. Every sip is the reflect of their hard labor and passion. Through the beers we choose, we want Brewsters to discover their amazing stories. 

That is what the Brewster Club is really about. It is about stories, people, discoveries and laughter. Joining the Club is becoming part of a community knit around a shared passion for the art of beer, a true enjoyment of the product and a desire to discover the hidden gems this great country has to share.

 
 

CAN'T GET OUR BEER?

You can still support us by purchasing our awesome merchandise. Because yes, we can ship our glasses, hoodies and t-shirts everywhere! (even outside of the US)

Still thirsty to try our beers? If you ever get near Plattsburgh, NY, we'll be happy to sell you a box (or 2) at our Brewster Shop! (Opening December 2016)

 

OUR PROJECT TIMELINE

 

OUR MISSION AND IT'S IMPACT ON YOUR LOCAL BREWERIES

Brewster Club will only feature products from independent, distribution-limited brewers. Those microbreweries all need to be located within the United States' territory. That's where we focus our search and discovery efforts.

Brewster Club was created to help our beloved members discover America's finest brews. We operate to help our members discover America's finest brews. But even with the greatest will in the world we couldn't do much without the support of the craftsmen themselves. As such, we are committed to helping our partner brewers blossom and bring you the best of beers.

However, the competition is fierce on the beer market, and microbreweries do need support to get out there. By helping Brewsters all over the country discover your local brewers even from a distance, we help these passionate microbreweries make a dollar they can put towards propelling their craft, creating new recipes and staying in business to keep serving those brews you love.

So, what’s not to like?!

 

OUR TEAM

Alex Laporte
Co-founder & CEO

 Coming from a family of entrepreneurs, there was no doubt for him on the path to take when the Brewster Club idea came to Julien and him. His experience in finance and accounting acquired throughout his years as a CFO, financial analyst and auditor helps him make sure Brewster Club remains financially viable and has the funds required to get that beer from the brewery to your door.

Julien Pouliot
Co-founder & COO

Ecommerce is nothing new to Julien, neither is entrepreneurship. Indeed, he used to run a web development agency. His curiosity and drive were well served, but Julien needed a project that would bring out his passion every day. Trips, discoveries, beers, how can’t he be fully committed to the task?

 

CAN'T BECOME A MEMBER BUT STILL WANT TO HELP?

We know everyone is not yet ready to hop on our all american beer tour. Maybe it is hard for you to get beer delivered to your door (I mean, we can also ship to your office!), or maybe you don't drink beer at all but still respect and support the craft of our brewers.

If so, we would still be very grateful if you can share our campaign to your friends. A simple share of this campaign to your Facebook wall can go a great way for us!

 

FAQ

Is an Adult Signature Required?

Since you are receiving alcohol, our shipments require an adult signature at delivery, so we usually suggest shipping to a work address or to the home of a relative or friend who is home during the day since the vast majority of shipments will deliver M-F, 8-5 (during working hours).

When will my beer arrive each month?

The purchase will be charged to your credit card within the first week of the month, and the shipment will arrive within 6-10 business days thereafter. For all the Indiegogo backers, you will receive your fist package during the first or second week of January 2017. 

Can I select specific beers or beer styles that I want to receive?

Although you cannot choose specific beers or styles that you would like to receive in the monthly package, you will be able to repurchase all of the products that we featured in the previous months as a ''mix & match''.

story:
*Montrealers have a look at shipping details (below) to avoid fees if you wish to pick up your perk*

Pamela decided to take Blueberryjams to Indiegogo for three reasons including the ever mysterious element of timing.

1. Blueberryjams is ready to grow! To do so requires purchasing materials, equipment,  and to spend resources on branding. Crowdfunding allows for this purchasing power as well as a great way to build awareness for and officially launch Blueberryjams.

2. Why 7000$? In the last year, things have been rocky health wise and friends were kind enough to lend a hand. By turning to IndieGoGo to fundraise and setting the goal at this amount, this allows Pamela to grow the business and use her labour costs to pay back her friends. Setting it at $7000 allows for the growth of Blueberryjams, repaying buds, AND keeping prices affordable.

3. Growing and launching Blueberryjams is also a way to equip Pamela with something solid to turn to in rougher health times and in between work contracts. Instead of simply raising funds to pay back her helping buds, growing Blueberryjams helps Pamela build the tools to weather stormy times.

Your contributions and support will help make the following things possible:

 

Originally from Saguenay Lac St-Jean, where people are referred to colloquially as 'blueberries', Pamela Fillion, head squirrel at Blueberryjams, moved to bustling Montreal over a decade ago to pursue her education. Pamela is a disabled queer-femme artist, activist, crafter, keen fermenter, community organizer, and sometimes scholar. She talks quite a bit, finds her own jokes funny, is an avid reader, and enjoys copious amounts of tea. She is roomies with a chatty Siamese cat named Pikachu.

The crux of her work experience revolves around project, program, and organizational development and best practices with an emphasis on skillsharing, education, creativity, and empowerment. At work and beyond, Pamela has a geeky love for archiving and resource building. The kitchen and working with and around food is what Pamela considers her hearth. Blueberryjams is the result of a lively concoction of all of her interests and skills. 

You can check out her Linkedin page here.

Blueberryjams is a small business or praxis (as Pamela likes to call it). Blueberryjams is a platform where her varied projects find a home and where they interact and intersect. From her arts & culture writing to her crafts and her workshops to radical home economics*, Blueberryjams is a space where Pamela's interests and skills sprout freely and bloom often. 

*Term borrowed from the folks over at rootsimple.org

Putting into practice these principles and values while running a small business is why I like to think about Blueberryjams as a praxis or embodying and putting into practice these values throughout operations.

Some of the ways these are put into practice includes making sure that prices are accessible and working to dispel some of the greenwashing and attitudes that make these natural health and body products inaccessible.

Another way is through a collaborative and not competitive way of operating working together with other makers to co-promote and share best practices. In fact, some perks will include samples from other crafters' work.

Empowerment is put into action by emphasizing skill sharing, community involvement, and making sure all herbal products have booklets explaining the different elements & properties. This one also starts at home and has been a guiding principle for developing my own skills and the different kinds of projects I undertake and then share with others.

Sustainability is a running thread amongst the products and choices made with Blueberryjams. Blueberryjams will be branded using a customized stamp using recycled & upcycled cardboard. Paper and glass are favoured over plastic, which is used minimally. Packaging is put together with an effort to diminish waste and in the vein that everything has multiple uses (thus increasing the purchasing power of those buying products). 

Workshop Perks: Blueberryjams will be hosting seasonal workshop series starting January 2017. This means 4 series per year with each series offering 4 to 5 workshops.

Zine Perks: There are currently three Blueberryjams zines in print: Choose Your Own Adventure: Intro to Radical Home Economics, For the Love of Sauerkraut, and Beyond the Holidaze: Re-Using Your Xmas Tree. With this campaign, Pamela will publish three new zines including inFESTations: Radical Home Ec Tips for Dealing with Unwanted Guests, For Bodies with Ovaries, and Radical Home Ec 102. 

One of the first projects housed under the moniker Blueberryjams was Pamela's arts & culture journalism and writing. Over the last 10 years, Pamela has published over 200 articles, many times a staff writer and content producer, and been involved in several media collectives.

This arts writing is in and of itself a form of community engagement as well as a site where Pamela shares what she learns from conversations with artists about their craft. With a focus on indie bands, social justice, community initiatives, genre film, and local film festivals, Pamela's writing remains a central element of the Blueberryjams project.

At the time of this campaign, with the difficulties faced in the last year forcing energies to be focused on health and trying to making ends meet, Pamela is looking for support/patrons so that she can once again put her energies into writing and, if she dares to dream, refine and elevate this part of her craft to its stage (which she has been planning and dreaming of for a little while now). 

Arts & Culture Writing Perk:  You can directly sponsor an article for 40$. In doing so, you will be thanked at the bottom of the article as well as on the updated Blueberryjams website.

Blueberryjams offers a constantly expanding selection of hand made knits. Hats, cowls, scarves, mitts, headbands, blankets!

Knitting Perks: For the knitting perks, Pamela will have a selection of knits available but can also make customized knits (colours, size, etc) based on Blueberryjams patterns. Don't be shy to get in touch for more information. As well, knits (and other perks available) will be featured throughout the campaign on the Facebook page.

Sewing Perks: There is one sewn perk available in the Indiegogo perks - The Magic Bag. There will be more available once Blueberryjams gets that sewing machine. <3

One of the fastest growing aspects of Blueberryjams is its Herbalism & Natural Body Products offerings with Pamela diving ever increasingly into this aspect of radical home economics. After several years of learning about, growing, harvesting, and preparing herbs, it seems time to share some of this knowledge with others.

Many of the herbs and plants used in the herbalism perks come from Pamela's personal harvesting and foraging. Other herbs and plants come from sources that Pamela has researched, trusts, and whom have high quality product. As Blueberryjams grows, the emphasis on sourcing herbs & plants locally, carefully, and through community relationships remains a  priority. 

Herbal Tea Perks: There will be over 16 different herbal tea/infusion mixes available to choose from. Descriptions of these mixes will be included in a campaign update and on our Facebook page.

 

Herbal Blend Perks: There are currently 12 herbal blend recipes available from Blueberryjams. Each blend will be featured throughout the campaign but feel free to ask if you have any questions about a specific one. (Although these blends can be used as infusions, they are crafted to be burned and used for incense and as alternatives to tobacco).

 

Herbal Bath Bombs: Herbal bath bombs are made with flower and herbs as well as natural plant. There will be 6 scents to choose from. These will be featured throughout the campaign in updates and the Blueberryjams FB page. 

Multi-Purpose Body Lotion Perks: Part of the aim of this campaign is to allow Blueberryjams to add more body lotion options. 6 options will be developed and these can also be personalized.

Herbal Trousseau Perks: For the trousseau perks, people can choose to customize from the available selections and/or have their trousseau (chest) personalized. These trousseau's are a great way to equip oneself with a natural healing kit.

A note on "customized" and "personalized" perks: Customized means you can pick from the the selection offered and customize your perk pack (i.e. Herbal Blend Pack - 2 Sensory Blends + 1 Brew O'Clock + 1 Sweet Tulsi). Personalized  means having a chat with Pamela about some of the things you are looking for i.e. Herbal Tea blend for sinus infections or a Tincture for immunity.

"Branding": this slice refers to paying our lovely logo designer, buying a customized rubber stamps, and customizing a small website.

"Materials": this section refers to the cost of bulk items like body butters, carrier oils, tincture materials, herbs, mason jars, printing costs, etc.

"Repaying Helpers": this section represents labour costs which will be using to repay friends who helped Pamela this past year.

"Sewing Machine": this slice refers to the costs of buying a new sewing machine with a warranty along with some thread. Although not many sewn products are featured in the perks, Blueberryjams is looking to expand this section! Currently, Blueberryjams offers fabric hanky sets for a very affordable rate. Upcycling fabrics has so much potential!

"Fees": this slice of the pie represents the fees taken by Indiegogo as well as taxes.

"Small Equipment": this sections refers to small kitchen equipment such as a spice grinder, a vegetable slicer (mandoline), paper slicer,etc.

As is the standard on Indiegogog, Shipping Fees are NOT included in the perk prices nor part of the $7000 goal.

For those of you from Montreal who want to come pick up your perks from me, please select the country of Oman as your location which I have set to shipping fees of $0. Why Oman? Oman was one of the key players in helping my thesis supervisor from a really bad situation this summer. You can read about that here if you'd like. 

Crowdfunding comes with its own kinds of risks but resourcefulness and making the most of what you have is at the heart of the Blueberryjams project. 

"What if the goal isn't reached?": With this campaign, the funding is flexible which means that even if the 7K goal is not met, the money will still be billed and Blueberryjams will be sending you your perks. Most perks should remain unaffected. In the event that not meeting the campaign goal will affect a perk, contributors will be informed in advance and adjustments will be made.

Perk Guarantee: We want you to be happy with your Blueberryjams perk - if you are not satisfied with your perk, let Blueberryjams know and we will work something out. Don't hesitate to contact Pamela.

If you have any questions, don't hesitate getting in touch with Pamela through the Blueberryjams FB page or at fillion.pamela@gmail.com.

  • Let your friends know you contributed to the campaign!
  • Please Like our FB Page: facebook.com/blueberryjamsmtl
  • Encourage folks to consider getting their holiday gifts through this campaign!

THANK YOUS: Thanks to Adam Waito (for the lovely logo!), Caroline Pelletier (for the tune!), Charlotte Burns, Jamie King, Anthony Hansen, Mom, Steve Rainville, Nic Rainville, Dane Duplessis, Lilly Nicole, Gersande La Flèche, Sara Maranda Gauvin (for giving me my first Blueberryjams market experience), Patricia Boushel, Annie Chen, Shaina Agbayani, Natasha Flath, Shayne Gryn, Brendan Jeffrey, Pikachu and all you amazing buds who encouraged and supported me to share my work.

Herbalism Disclaimer: None of the products or information shared through Blueberryjams are meant to replace medical advice. All information is meant for educational purposes.
story_txt:
*Montrealers have a look at shipping details (below) to avoid fees if you wish to pick up your perk*


Pamela decided to take Blueberryjams to Indiegogo for three reasons including the ever mysterious element of timing.
1. Blueberryjams is ready to grow! To do so requires purchasing materials, equipment,  and to spend resources on branding. Crowdfunding allows for this purchasing power as well as a great way to build awareness for and officially launch Blueberryjams.
2. Why 7000$? In the last year, things have been rocky health wise and friends were kind enough to lend a hand. By turning to IndieGoGo to fundraise and setting the goal at this amount, this allows Pamela to grow the business and use her labour costs to pay back her friends. Setting it at $7000 allows for the growth of Blueberryjams, repaying buds, AND keeping prices affordable.
3. Growing and launching Blueberryjams is also a way to equip Pamela with something solid to turn to in rougher health times and in between work contracts. Instead of simply raising funds to pay back her helping buds, growing Blueberryjams helps Pamela build the tools to weather stormy times.
Your contributions and support will help make the following things possible:

 


Originally from Saguenay Lac St-Jean, where people are referred to colloquially as 'blueberries', Pamela Fillion, head squirrel at Blueberryjams, moved to bustling Montreal over a decade ago to pursue her education. Pamela is a disabled queer-femme artist, activist, crafter, keen fermenter, community organizer, and sometimes scholar. She talks quite a bit, finds her own jokes funny, is an avid reader, and enjoys copious amounts of tea. She is roomies with a chatty Siamese cat named Pikachu.
The crux of her work experience revolves around project, program, and organizational development and best practices with an emphasis on skillsharing, education, creativity, and empowerment. At work and beyond, Pamela has a geeky love for archiving and resource building. The kitchen and working with and around food is what Pamela considers her hearth. Blueberryjams is the result of a lively concoction of all of her interests and skills. 
You can check out her Linkedin page here.

Blueberryjams is a small business or praxis (as Pamela likes to call it). Blueberryjams is a platform where her varied projects find a home and where they interact and intersect. From her arts & culture writing to her crafts and her workshops to radical home economics*, Blueberryjams is a space where Pamela's interests and skills sprout freely and bloom often. 
*Term borrowed from the folks over at rootsimple.org
