story:
Short Summary

When we set out on this journey, we had no idea what was in store for us. We had no idea about what would come from the countless hours spent on conceptualizing such a visionary and noble project. 

You may be wondering, "What are we trying to do?" This is very simple to answer: We are trying to launch a semi-truck into space. After the truck leaves the atmosphere, we intend to have it eject from the rocket, then fall to earth, with our team inside, driving it until we jump out and parachute to safety. The truck will then crash into the ocean. All of this is currently scheduled for early 2018

The Team

Our team consists of some of the best and brightest individuals on the face of the planets. Our core members include: Davis Thomas, Joseph Erwin, Cole Mazza, Reed Bryant, and Carter Methvin. Not only did these brave souls conceptualize this project, but with exception to Davis Thomas, they will be the fearless astronauts travelling where no one has dared to go before. Additionally, our ground controllers are Austin Warnock and Davis Thomas. Last, but certainly not least, is the man that is making all of this happen: Roady Hollingsworth. If not for the common sense and wisdom of this individual, our project would be nothing more than a bunch of unfocused morons, dreaming about unreasonable space-travel.

What We Need & What You Get

According to our meticulous calculations, we are in need of $14,470,337.34 to complete this project. Now, you may be wondering, "Why do you think you can do this so inexpensively?" If we're being honest, we cannot be certain that this will be enough money, but we are pretty sure. To those of you who are skeptical, here is a comprehensive spreadsheet, detailing the expenses.

In return for donating your money to this project you will receive all sorts of gifts and remunerations. We realize that there are so many different projects that you could fund, and we want to make your decision to fund this one worth it. To learn more about all of the neat goodies that you will receive as a result of donating to this project, check out the "Perks" section of this campaign.

If we don't reach our fundraising goal, we plan to tackle a slightly smaller project which would be proportionately less awesome, but still basically the awesomest thing to ever happen.

The Impact

This project will achieve something never before imagined, inspiring the next generation of dreamers to dream bigger and bolder than ever in the history of mankind.

Risks & Challenges

As is the case with any project of this scale, it's all or nothing. Frankly, if our goal is not met, there can be assurance that all of the rewards will be distributed, as many directly require this project to be completed in its entirety. By donating, you are helping this dream become a reality, but are in no way certifying that it will. As such, do not expect any remuneration for donations directly involving the complete construction of the rocket truck.

Other Ways You Can Help

Follow us on Twitter at @SemiTruckLaunch, and spread the word about this campaign.

story: Trying to raise funds for inventory to keep a long running Noblesville store open. I just purchased the store in an attempt to save it as well as live my dream of owning my own bookstore, but didn't receive money owed to me from my previous job due to it's owner going broke. This bookstore can make it, I just need to get the shelves stocked.

This bookstore can make it, I just need to get the shelves stocked.

story:
Much Dogs, Such wow!

After a successful first attempt at 2015's Burning Seed, Dagwood Estate is back bigger and better gifting mini Dagwood Dogs to the beautiful people of the paddock. 

What's a Dagwood Dog I hear you ask? A delicious deep fried mini hot dog, smothered in a thick batter, deep fried & dunked in you preferred saucey goodness.

We are looking to gift 1000 of these over 2 days. If we receive more funding that number goes up!

What We Need & What You Get

THE DOGS

Approx  30 kilos of mini hotdogs  $240

Flour and batter supplies 40 

Cooking oil $40

1000 bamboo sticks  $80

SUBTOTAL $400

THE COOKER

Gas bottle with gas $50

Gas cook top $50

SUBTOTAL $100

SIGNAGE & LIGHTS $80

3x3 Marquee $170

GRAND TOTAL $750

What you Get?

Delicious Dagwood Dogs served on Friday and Saturday afternoon to prepare you for all your paddock adventures......

story:
WHO ARE WE?

Ursula Undress, Roula Roulette, and Talloolah Love are teachers from The Atlanta School of Burlesque brought together by their love of sparkle, community, art and body positivity!

 

 

Ursula Undress
Ursula has over 20 years of experience in musical theater, along with a BFA in Graphic Design. She also has 10+years experience in live music venue management, and 3 years of event production management & design under her belt. She is the founder and President of Metropolitan Studios, Inc.

 

Roula Roulette
Roula has decades of theatrical experience in both stage and production management, an MA in Communication Arts and extensive sales experience. Her love of theatre, arts and all things body positive have made her an integral part of both the Atlanta School of Burlesque and Metropolitan Studios, Inc., where she is the VP.

 

Talloolah Love
Talloolah has been one of the figureheads in Atlanta Burlesque for over a decade, she has performed all over the world, and is an exquisite instructor, marketer, and social media maven.  She runs a podcast for Burlesque Atlanta, has been a producer for 9 years,  and is the matron of The Burlesque Atlanta society, a free community workshop program that has been going strong for 8 years. Currently, she is enrolled in YTT training to become a certified yoga instructor, and will be graduating at the end of this year! She has been teaching with the Atlanta School of Burlesque since its inception, and is the Operations Manager for Metropolitan Studios, Inc. 

 

OUR VISION

We have seen a great need in the community and the Greater Atlanta Area for something new - a space that speaks to the artistic and social community.  This will be more than a dance school, it will also serve as a creative space for a variety of classes, workshops, and intimate events. Really, the sky's the limit as far as possibilities! We are here to announce that we are opening Metropolitan Studios - An Arts & Movement Cooperative!

 

THE SPACE

We have signed a lease on a gorgeous new space in East Atlanta Village/Atlanta, Georgia that will not only house the school, but be a sparkling new event/ meeting space, and theatrical production studio for the performing arts!

 

THE NEED

As producers, these women know that Atlanta is suffering when it comes to acquiring adequate venues to house shows, rehearsals, meeting spaces and stage productions. They have decided to stop beating their heads against the wall and open an all-in-one place for the community! If you help us, you will be contributing to the advancement in not only the burlesque artistic vein, but you will be supporting other local artists, producers, and people who want to have a place to congregate, collaborate, and entertain. It is our intention to use this space for private rehearsals, workshops, individual rentals, photo shoots, community brunches, bachelorette parties, game nights, baby showers and all around creative space!

STRETCH GOALS

$20,000 - BREAKEVEN. This is where we’ll break even for the upfront costs! This will cover the expenses for studio mirrors, for a fully functioning sound/lighting system, wifi, office equipment, and for us to get our craft and construction space up and running. For that we will need sewing machines, cutting tables, standard supplies like fabric, scissors, etc.  We will also need yoga mats and props for our yoga classes, as well as lobby and office furniture. 

$25,000 - SPARKLE-TASTIC!  Our desire is to make this space accessible to everyone in the community. Should we hit this goal, we will use the money to help us become handicap accessible by adding a ramp in the front and enlarging doorways to our bathrooms. We have this projected as a goal for the future, but wouldn't it be better if we could offer it now?

$30,000 - BLING BLING BLING! ZOMG!  If we could hit this goal now, we could upgrade the kitchen!  We would love to offer a space for others to utilize a kitchen for their events.  Our concepts include things like Burlesque Brunch, or ayurvedic cooking classes, or healthy living through diet and dance, just to name a few!  

OUR PERKS

Want to know what you’ll be getting for your donation? Check out the Perks menu! Be on the lookout for some secret perks that we release throughout our campaign!

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

We know that we still have some unforeseen challenges ahead. But we know that our artistic community is worth the risk! We also understand there are already so many great and established dance studios. So it is our promise to work tirelessly to provide an excellent, unique experience for the Atlanta area artistic community that promotes a culture of continuous collaboration and support. We are confident that the community will help us overcome these challenges so that we can share our space, talent and art with everyone!

 

THANK YOU!

We could not do this without you! So thank you for all you do to support the fringe artists and the vision we have for this space! Make sure you're keeping up to date on social media!

Metropolitan Studios Facebook - www.facebook.com/MetropolitanStudios
Atlanta School of Burlesque Facebook - www.facebook.com/atlantaburlesqueschool
story_txt: WHO ARE WE?Ursula Undress, Roula Roulette, and Talloolah Love are teachers from The Atlanta School of Burlesque brought together by their love of sparkle, community, art and body positivity!  Ursula UndressUrsula has over 20 years of experience in musical theater, along with a BFA in Graphic Design. She also has 10+years experience in live music venue management, and 3 years of event production management & design under her belt. She is the founder and President of Metropolitan Studios, Inc. Roula RouletteRoula has decades of theatrical experience in both stage and production management, an MA in Communication Arts and extensive sales experience. Her love of theatre, arts and all things body positive have made her an integral part of both the Atlanta School of Burlesque and Metropolitan Studios, Inc., where she is the VP. Talloolah LoveTalloolah has been one of the figureheads in Atlanta Burlesque for over a decade, she has performed all over the world, and is an exquisite instructor, marketer, and social media maven.  She runs a podcast for Burlesque Atlanta, has been a producer for 9 years,  and is the matron of The Burlesque Atlanta society, a free community workshop program that has been going strong for 8 years. Currently, she is enrolled in YTT training to become a certified yoga instructor, and will be graduating at the end of this year! She has been teaching with the Atlanta School of Burlesque since its inception, and is the Operations Manager for Metropolitan Studios, Inc.  OUR VISIONWe have seen a great need in the community and the Greater Atlanta Area for something new - a space that speaks to the artistic and social community.  This will be more than a dance school, it will also serve as a creative space for a variety of classes, workshops, and intimate events. Really, the sky's the limit as far as possibilities! We are here to announce that we are opening Metropolitan Studios - An Arts & Movement Cooperative! THE SPACEWe have signed a lease on a gorgeous new space in East Atlanta Village/Atlanta, Georgia that will not only house the school, but be a sparkling new event/ meeting space, and theatrical production studio for the performing arts! THE NEEDAs producers, these women know that Atlanta is suffering when it comes to acquiring adequate venues to house shows, rehearsals, meeting spaces and stage productions. They have decided to stop beating their heads against the wall and open an all-in-one place for the community! If you help us, you will be contributing to the advancement in not only the burlesque artistic vein, but you will be supporting other local artists, producers, and people who want to have a place to congregate, collaborate, and entertain. It is our intention to use this space for private rehearsals, workshops, individual rentals, photo shoots, community brunches, bachelorette parties, game nights, baby showers and all around creative space!STRETCH GOALS$20,000 - BREAKEVEN. This is where we’ll break even for the upfront costs! This will cover the expenses for studio mirrors, for a fully functioning sound/lighting system, wifi, office equipment, and for us to get our craft and construction space up and running. For that we will need sewing machines, cutting tables, standard supplies like fabric, scissors, etc.  We will also need yoga mats and props for our yoga classes, as well as lobby and office furniture. $25,000 - SPARKLE-TASTIC!  Our desire is to make this space accessible to everyone in the community. Should we hit this goal, we will use the money to help us become handicap accessible by adding a ramp in the front and enlarging doorways to our bathrooms. We have this projected as a goal for the future, but wouldn't it be better if we could offer it now?$30,000 - BLING BLING BLING! ZOMG!  If we could hit this goal now, we could upgrade the kitchen!  We would love to offer a space for others to utilize a kitchen for their events.  Our concepts include things like Burlesque Brunch, or ayurvedic cooking classes, or healthy living through diet and dance, just to name a few!  OUR PERKSWant to know what you’ll be getting for your donation? Check out the Perks menu! Be on the lookout for some secret perks that we release throughout our campaign!RISKS AND CHALLENGESWe know that we still have some unforeseen challenges ahead. But we know that our artistic community is worth the risk! We also understand there are already so many great and established dance studios. So it is our promise to work tirelessly to provide an excellent, unique experience for the Atlanta area artistic community that promotes a culture of continuous collaboration and support. We are confident that the community will help us overcome these challenges so that we can share our space, talent and art with everyone! THANK YOU!We could not do this without you! So thank you for all you do to support the fringe artists and the vision we have for this space! Make sure you're keeping up to date on social media!Metropolitan Studios Facebook - www.facebook.com/MetropolitanStudiosAtlanta School of Burlesque Facebook - www.facebook.com/atlantaburlesqueschool

story:
English Text, read below.

 

Vilka är vi?

Helena, den Nordiska Valkyrjan, Tetris mästare i organisering lvl 1000 med en passion för holistisk hälsa och nutrition.

Tariq, en Karibisk pirat och kulinär savant, vars perfektion ligger i utsökta och perfekt balanserade smakupplevelser.

Tillsammans startade vi The Soup Company Sweden!

Som titeln beskriver så vill vi samla ihop finans till att få The Soup Company på vägen. Vår avsikt är att få ekologiska och närproducerade alternativ, hälsosamt tillagad “snabbmat” in till städerna, till din dagliga pendling, arbetsplatser, under festivaler och events, serverat året runt från vår FoodTruck, Citroën HY van.

--Fronten

--Bak

Ditt sponsorskap betyder allt för oss, med din hjälp kan vi sjösätta vår verksamhet och påbörja en resa av entreprenörskap. Med era generösa donationer har vi ett startkapital som grund, där vi kan komplimentera resterande finansiering med ett mindre banklån, eller, i bästa av fallen till och med inte blanda in banken alls!

“Låt maten bli din medicin, och medicin vara din mat” -Hippokrates

 

I detalj

Vi vill att ni ska vara del av vår genisis. Detta är vad Era sponsringar kommer att gå till:

  • Vår kökslokal behöver rustas upp, lagas och utrustas. Lokalen är gammal och utdaterad, ny el är en nödvändighet, kakel behöver bytas, kylar, frysar, spis och arbetsytor måste in. Att ha lokalen klar ger oss även möjlighet att lite längre fram hjälpa andra nya företagare, i behov av ett livsmedelsgodkänt kök, att starta upp sin verksamhet.
  • Köpa in stjärnan i företaget, en 60tals Citroën HY van, utrustad med fräsch inredning och ny motor för att klara av alla väder året runt.
  • Inhandla biologiskt nedbrytbara soppskålar, skedar, servetter och andra serviceartiklar till våra kunder.
  • Sist men absolut inte minst; gynna våra lokala bönder och producenter.

Vi vill uppnå 10.000€ i finansiering för att ändra bolagsform och att visa bankerna hur seriösa vi är med vår vision.

Som tack för Er hjälp har vi tagit fram en rad attraktiva gåvopaket som du kan ha glädje av under lång tid. Om du vill så kan du även välja att vara med på lanseringspartyt i januari, då får du även uppleva vad vi kan erbjuda med vår catering verksamhet, utöver de mustiga sopporna vi serverar dagligen, och ha en riktigt rolig kväll med oss i vår färdiga kökslokal!

 

Den sociala påverkan

Vilken skillnad gör vi i världen med din hjälp? Och vad bidrar ditt sponsorskap med i det längre loppet?

Otaliga gånger i såväl daglig pendling som på resande fot, har vi fått fia oss i att de mer hälsosamma alternativen helt enkelt inte finns att få tag på. Det erbjuds hamburgare, kaffe, kakor och bakelser, mackor i låga rader och kalla sallader. Med era grymma hjälp kan vi dra vårt strå till stacken och erbjuda pendlare och resenärer god mat som får dig att må bra, i kroppen och i själen!

  • Vi kommer att gynna våra lokala bönder och producenter, vilket i sin tur stärker den totala ekonomin i det lokala område vi verkar.
  • Vårt syfte är att kunna erbjuda alla vårt goda alternativ till snabbmat; socker och tillsatsfritt, ekologiskt och omfattande allergivänligt.

Nästa mål är att med samma koncept finnas i flera städer landet igenom, och servera våra värmande och närande soppor med råvaror så lokalt producerat som möjligt.

 

Risker och utmaningar

Genom att utmana den vedertagna uppfattningen om vad “snabbmat” är, och ändå lyckats skapa stort intresse i finansiella institutioner, så har vi lyckats övervinna en smärre prövning.

Det konventionella sättet att tillaga både ekologisk och hälsosam proviant involverar tyvärr allt som oftast även kemikalier, tillsatser och utfyllnader för konsistens och att förlänga livslängden på varan. Vi gör tvärt om. Livslängden på vår mat är kort och kommer alltid att vara det, likväl som de hälsosamma egenskaperna inte kommer att riskeras för en viss konsistens. Vi är dock väldigt vana att tänka i andra banor och har blivit påhittiga i att hitta väl fungerande substitut.

Stigmat om att “hälsosam mat” är synonymt med “nötter och sallad” är en annan utmaning vi möter med vårt koncept. Men vi hoppas kunna, med hjälp av våra värmande och mustiga soppor, bredda synen på vad sundhet innebär och visa att det inte bara är sallader som är nyttiga. Med de alternativen vi erbjuder i vår FoodTruck tillgodoser vi Vegansk, Vegetarisk och Allätande kosthållning. Vi är transparenta med våra recept och delar gärna med oss så att ni kan laga samma mat hemma, eller utveckla dem efter egen smak.

Vi erbjuder även våra tjänster mot den öppna samt privata sektorn, till arbetsplatser och evenemang.

Vårt nätverk växer konstant och sträcker sig från nära familj och vänner till bolag och verksamhets kamrater. Med det stora stöd vi har så vet vi att vi kan ta oss an utmaningarna och tackla dem på ett konstruktivt och målmedvetet sätt.

Även om vi inte skulle nå vårt utsatta mål idag, så kommer vi trots det dra visionen i land. Vi tror stenhårt på att vi i Sverige behöver varma, fräscha och hälsosamma alternativ till den dammiga gamla snabbmaten vi får när vi är på språng.

 

Fler sätt du kan hjälpa oss

Oavsett om du har möjlighet att bidraga finansiellt eller ej, så har vi stort behov att sprida ordet vidare. Bara i lilla Linköping bor det 160.000 invånare, om ALLA bidrar med endast 5 svenska kronor, så behöver vi inte längre ta ett banklån! Så hjälp oss att sprida vår kampanj till alla du känner; vänner, familj, kolleger och bekanta:

  • Klicka på ”dela” knappen (share) och välj vilken sociala plattform ni vill dela på. Skriv gärna en kommentar innan delningen så det blir lite mer personligt på ditt flöde.

Om du har läst såhär långt, ett stort TACK! Tid är värdefullt och du har just spenderat en del av det på vår kampanj, det uppskattar vi så otroligt mycket!

Vad är din reaktion på denna kampanj? Vad kan vi göra bättre, saknas det någonting? Vi är nyfikna på vad just du tycker, så skriv till oss på något av de plattformer vi använder oss av, indiegogo, facebook, twitter, instagram eller snapchat.

Join the Soup Revolution!

 

ENGLISH

Remember those home-made soups your grandma would make?. The heart warming feeling they would give you on cold days.

Well that's exactly what we aim to bring to everyone.

By supporting our campaign you can bring a soup van to your nearest city/town which would:-

~Support locally sourced ingredients.

~Sell nourishing, healthy and natural food.

~Make you part of the expanding trend of quality food on the go.

~Be a key influencer in helping a business grow and expand.

 

Who are we?

Helena the nordic viking valkyrie and tetris master level 1000 organiser with a passion for holistic health and nutricion.

Tariq is a Carribbean pirate savant of culinary deliciousness and a consumate flavour perfeccionist.

Together we created The Soup Company Sweden!.

We want to raise funds as our title says " To get the Soup Company on the go". Our main aim is to bring ecological locally sourced food to city centres. We want to provide a heathy fast food alternative throughout the seasons. Bringing our produce to you at festivals, Events, workplaces and travel centres.

You sponsorship means the world to us, it means that we can to launch our business and start our journey of entreprenuership, with your donations we can approach banks by providing a small start capital and in turn getting them to fufill our finace goal.  Doing this we can bring food from local farms to your city centres with chemical free, nutritional food options.

"let food be thy medicine and medicine be thy food" -- Hypocrates

Breaking it Down

We want you to be part of our Genesis, so here's what you sponsorship will go to.

We want to raise 10,000 Euro capital to be able to change our company registration to a limited company and to approach banks with a reasonable capital for them to see how serious we are about making this happen. Your sponsorship helps us :-

  • Outfit our kitchen local with the essentials to be able to provide our service whilst having the possibility to help others in the future by being able to rent space in our kitchen for them to start their own catering interests or cooking courses
  • Acquire a vintage 1960's Citroen HY van and have it outfitted to be able to serve in all weathers.
  • Acquire biodegradeable soup containers and service items for our customers.
  • Help local farmers bring their produce to city centres

In return for you generosity we are offering an awesome line of perks to show our magnitude for what you will help us accomplish. These range from our caligrafied hand written letter to an invite to our launch party where you'll get to sample our best dishes of not only soup but also items that we could provide for private catering functions and check out the facilities that you helped make possible.

--Front

--Interior

--Service side

 

The Impact

So what differences are we aiming to make with your help? and what does your help contribute towards?.

  • Countless times we have found ourselves wanting a healthier option whilst we are doing our daily commutes. Only to be faced with the options of burgers, coffee and cake or the cold salad bar in the super markets with its long queues and "fresh options".  With your help we want to bring something to the market which gives us that good feeling only healthy nutrious food can give, without the queues or the sugar lapses that traditional fast food provides or as they are commonly known "food comas".
  • We will be bringing food produced by local farmers to your city centres, Helping support the local economies. Which in turn gives back to us, the people who are part of that economy.
  • Our aim is to gives everyone access to an ecological food option that is allergy , additive and sugar free. Our goal for the future is to provide this by having many kiosks serving from your towns and citys by making a brand that will be synonymous with the points stated above and generating a standard for healthy food options to be provided in your local areas.

Risks & Challenges

We have already faced many of our challenges by firstly engageing and opening peoples perceptions to what fast food should be. That combined with presenting these ideals to financial institutes in a way which peaks their interests are many of the hurdles we are trying to overcome.

By showing the benifits of food made from ecological ingredients and cooked in a chemical free way we promote the healthy "fast food" option that our main competitors try to create for public consumption, and although they come close with their "green" options the mass production levels that they have implemented mean that innevitably the food undergoes some form of additive process to prolong its shelf life. We in turn don't do that, we take whats seasonal, local and fresh and use it as quickly as possible so it can be brought forward for consumption without the neccesity of prolonging the produces life with chemical means.

The stigma is that healthy food means just "greens and nuts" or it being solely vegitable, fruit and legume based is another factor we've faced but by providing hearty options and giving people the choices of either vegan, vegitarian or omnivorous we cater to everyone all the while showing that healthy food is more than just salad and greens. Its is a variety that creates the right balance.

Also our transparency in sharing our recipes and ingredient sources gives people the option to try them at home and even better them to their own particular tastes.

Of course there are other risks of, if we don't achieve the desired sales and such business running related risks but by both of us doing business courses and providing our services not just for the public but also towards private sector like events and workplaces. We have and are always building on an extensive network of people from family and friends to alumni of our business associates we believe we are suffiently equiped to face these challenges and approach them with our basis of always keeping to our main aims we will overcome them.

Even if we don't reach our entire goal  for funding we will still make this project happen by approaching banks with the most detailled presentation we can make and taking the loans that are necessary to make it happen, such is our devotion to bringing an alternative and healthy food option to people that we are determied to make it work no matter what, so don't be put off if it seems we are not reaching our main goal we will still strive to bring this project forward although it will only take a little more time.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can finacially contribute and we understand that, but you can be of great help to us by getting the word out to your family, friends and work colleagues about this project and help us generate interest in it:

  • Just by clicking on the share button you help us immencely by sharing our dream with your peers, You can find all the quick tools to do this here on the indiegogo website and also through our media pages on Facebook, Twitter and instagram. Any help we receive is so so appreciated only through people helping people can we make each others dreams come true.

If you've read this far thank you so much , You are awesome for giving us some of your time. We look forward to hearing any feedback you can give us on this campaign and will endevour to respond to any enquiries as quickly as possible. Thanks for being part of The Soup Revolution.

"The most revolutionary thing one can do is to always proclaim loudly what is happening"

Rosa Luxenburg

 

Perks

5 EURO, Our personalised thank you
A personalised, Hand written thank you from us and a campaign badge to show our appreciation of you supporting the soup revolution.

10 EURO, Spread the deliciousness
Claiming this perk will give you a personalised calligraphy letter, our campaign badge and a bonus coupon for buying 2 soups you get to invite another person for 1 free. Not only is it our grattitude for the finacial help but with this perk you also spread the deliciousness to your friends.
Coupons will be sent to you via email which you can print out and claim whenever you want.

25 EURO, Member of the Revolution
In this perk you'll get our personalised hand scripted thank you letter, our support the soup revolution campaign badge and a 6 month basic membership that gives you 10% off EVERY purchase plus a free invite a friend coupon. Members get up to date news about what new soup is on offer that fortnight, a link to the GPS positioning so you'll always know where we are at and as mentioned above that sexy discount on everything.

50 EURO, A Souper Hero
This perk gives you our handwritten special thanks, a support the soup revolution campaign badge and 12 months gold membership aswell as 2 free friend coupons to invite your friends to enjoy the deliciousness.
The gold membership gives you 12% discount on everything, the gps link, our soup of the fortnight news letter and a monthly seasonal recipe to cook at home.

70 EURO, The Kamprad Principle
Taking an idea from the man who brought you IKEA, with this awesome limited perk you get our special handwritten thank you, our soup revolution campaign badge, a 6 month standard membership entiteling you to 10% discount on everything and our "Souper Star Cookbook". Giving you 20 of our best kept secrets to try at home. DIY never tasted so good.

100 EURO, Soup Is Life
Apart from our wholehearted gratitude from our hand written letter and our campaign badge , You get 1 soup a month, for free, for LIFE. Plus you get a 12 month gold membership giving you 12% discount on everything, our monthly recipe, the GPS "find us" link and our news letter on what will be highlighting the fortnightly soup.

250 EURO, VIP in our Launch Party
In this awesome perk we are offering you a chance to come to our launch party with a plus one and enjoy in our catering and see our facilities and truck. You'll get to see our awesome kitchen and processes along with being able to sample some of best dishes that are only available for catered events.
You get this plus a caligrafied gratitude letter our soup revolution campaign badge and the Gold membership giving you an awesome 12% discount on all produce for 12 months, plus all of its extras.

500 EURO, And it shall be named.......
In this perk you get our handwritten gratitude letter with soup revolution campaign badge. Our Super secret Recipe book, The month gold membership package giving you 12% discount on all purchases for 12 months, the fortnightly soup menu and our monthly seasonal extra recipes.
You also get a recipe named after to show our gratitude in helping make The Soup Company come to life.

1000 EURO, Your Name In Lights
This is an awesome perk for private persons and small and large businesess where we will have your company logo/Name printed on the side of our truck as an ultimate thank you for being so generous with your sponsorship. Your name/logo will be proffesionally printed for all to see at the places we come to attend and whilst we drive around for a whole year, and we have plans to drive all over Sweden so you brand will get plenty of visual attention.
Plus our campaign package.

Även om vi inte skulle nå vårt utsatta mål idag, så kommer vi trots det dra visionen i land. Vi tror stenhårt på att vi i Sverige behöver varma, fräscha och hälsosamma alternativ till den dammiga gamla snabbmaten vi får när vi är på språng.
 
Fler sätt du kan hjälpa oss
Oavsett om du har möjlighet att bidraga finansiellt eller ej, så har vi stort behov att sprida ordet vidare. Bara i lilla Linköping bor det 160.000 invånare, om ALLA bidrar med endast 5 svenska kronor, så behöver vi inte längre ta ett banklån! Så hjälp oss att sprida vår kampanj till alla du känner; vänner, familj, kolleger och bekanta:
Klicka på ”dela” knappen (share) och välj vilken sociala plattform ni vill dela på. Skriv gärna en kommentar innan delningen så det blir lite mer personligt på ditt flöde.
Om du har läst såhär långt, ett stort TACK! Tid är värdefullt och du har just spenderat en del av det på vår kampanj, det uppskattar vi så otroligt mycket!
Vad är din reaktion på denna kampanj? Vad kan vi göra bättre, saknas det någonting? Vi är nyfikna på vad just du tycker, så skriv till oss på något av de plattformer vi använder oss av, indiegogo, facebook, twitter, instagram eller snapchat.
Join the Soup Revolution!
 
ENGLISH
Remember those home-made soups your grandma would make?. The heart warming feeling they would give you on cold days.
Well that's exactly what we aim to bring to everyone.
By supporting our campaign you can bring a soup van to your nearest city/town which would:-
~Support locally sourced ingredients.
~Sell nourishing, healthy and natural food.
~Make you part of the expanding trend of quality food on the go.
~Be a key influencer in helping a business grow and expand.
 
Who are we?
Helena the nordic viking valkyrie and tetris master level 1000 organiser with a passion for holistic health and nutricion.
Tariq is a Carribbean pirate savant of culinary deliciousness and a consumate flavour perfeccionist.
Together we created The Soup Company Sweden!.
We want to raise funds as our title says " To get the Soup Company on the go". Our main aim is to bring ecological locally sourced food to city centres. We want to provide a heathy fast food alternative throughout the seasons. Bringing our produce to you at festivals, Events, workplaces and travel centres.
You sponsorship means the world to us, it means that we can to launch our business and start our journey of entreprenuership, with your donations we can approach banks by providing a small start capital and in turn getting them to fufill our finace goal.  Doing this we can bring food from local farms to your city centres with chemical free, nutritional food options.
"let food be thy medicine and medicine be thy food" -- Hypocrates

Breaking it Down
We want you to be part of our Genesis, so here's what you sponsorship will go to.
We want to raise 10,000 Euro capital to be able to change our company registration to a limited company and to approach banks with a reasonable capital for them to see how serious we are about making this happen. Your sponsorship helps us :-

Outfit our kitchen local with the essentials to be able to provide our service whilst having the possibility to help others in the future by being able to rent space in our kitchen for them to start their own catering interests or cooking courses
Acquire a vintage 1960's Citroen HY van and have it outfitted to be able to serve in all weathers.
Acquire biodegradeable soup containers and service items for our customers.
Help local farmers bring their produce to city centres

In return for you generosity we are offering an awesome line of perks to show our magnitude for what you will help us accomplish. These range from our caligrafied hand written letter to an invite to our launch party where you'll get to sample our best dishes of not only soup but also items that we could provide for private catering functions and check out the facilities that you helped make possible.
--Front
--Interior
--Service side
 

The Impact
So what differences are we aiming to make with your help? and what does your help contribute towards?.

Countless times we have found ourselves wanting a healthier option whilst we are doing our daily commutes. Only to be faced with the options of burgers, coffee and cake or the cold salad bar in the super markets with its long queues and "fresh options".  With your help we want to bring something to the market which gives us that good feeling only healthy nutrious food can give, without the queues or the sugar lapses that traditional fast food provides or as they are commonly known "food comas".
We will be bringing food produced by local farmers to your city centres, Helping support the local economies. Which in turn gives back to us, the people who are part of that economy.
Our aim is to gives everyone access to an ecological food option that is allergy , additive and sugar free. Our goal for the future is to provide this by having many kiosks serving from your towns and citys by making a brand that will be synonymous with the points stated above and generating a standard for healthy food options to be provided in your local areas.


Risks & Challenges
We have already faced many of our challenges by firstly engageing and opening peoples perceptions to what fast food should be. That combined with presenting these ideals to financial institutes in a way which peaks their interests are many of the hurdles we are trying to overcome.
By showing the benifits of food made from ecological ingredients and cooked in a chemical free way we promote the healthy "fast food" option that our main competitors try to create for public consumption, and although they come close with their "green" options the mass production levels that they have implemented mean that innevitably the food undergoes some form of additive process to prolong its shelf life. We in turn don't do that, we take whats seasonal, local and fresh and use it as quickly as possible so it can be brought forward for consumption without the neccesity of prolonging the produces life with chemical means.
The stigma is that healthy food means just "greens and nuts" or it being solely vegitable, fruit and legume based is another factor we've faced but by providing hearty options and giving people the choices of either vegan, vegitarian or omnivorous we cater to everyone all the while showing that healthy food is more than just salad and greens. Its is a variety that creates the right balance.
Also our transparency in sharing our recipes and ingredient sources gives people the option to try them at home and even better them to their own particular tastes.
Of course there are other risks of, if we don't achieve the desired sales and such business running related risks but by both of us doing business courses and providing our services not just for the public but also towards private sector like events and workplaces. We have and are always building on an extensive network of people from family and friends to alumni of our business associates we believe we are suffiently equiped to face these challenges and approach them with our basis of always keeping to our main aims we will overcome them.
Even if we don't reach our entire goal  for funding we will still make this project happen by approaching banks with the most detailled presentation we can make and taking the loans that are necessary to make it happen, such is our devotion to bringing an alternative and healthy food option to people that we are determied to make it work no matter what, so don't be put off if it seems we are not reaching our main goal we will still strive to bring this project forward although it will only take a little more time.

Other Ways You Can Help
Not everyone can finacially contribute and we understand that, but you can be of great help to us by getting the word out to your family, friends and work colleagues about this project and help us generate interest in it:
Just by clicking on the share button you help us immencely by sharing our dream with your peers, You can find all the quick tools to do this here on the indiegogo website and also through our media pages on Facebook, Twitter and instagram. Any help we receive is so so appreciated only through people helping people can we make each others dreams come true.
If you've read this far thank you so much , You are awesome for giving us some of your time. We look forward to hearing any feedback you can give us on this campaign and will endevour to respond to any enquiries as quickly as possible. Thanks for being part of The Soup Revolution.
"The most revolutionary thing one can do is to always proclaim loudly what is happening"
Rosa Luxenburg
 
Perks
5 EURO, Our personalised thank youA personalised, Hand written thank you from us and a campaign badge to show our appreciation of you supporting the soup revolution.
10 EURO, Spread the deliciousnessClaiming this perk will give you a personalised calligraphy letter, our campaign badge and a bonus coupon for buying 2 soups you get to invite another person for 1 free. Not only is it our grattitude for the finacial help but with this perk you also spread the deliciousness to your friends.Coupons will be sent to you via email which you can print out and claim whenever you want.
25 EURO, Member of the RevolutionIn this perk you'll get our personalised hand scripted thank you letter, our support the soup revolution campaign badge and a 6 month basic membership that gives you 10% off EVERY purchase plus a free invite a friend coupon. Members get up to date news about what new soup is on offer that fortnight, a link to the GPS positioning so you'll always know where we are at and as mentioned above that sexy discount on everything.
50 EURO, A Souper HeroThis perk gives you our handwritten special thanks, a support the soup revolution campaign badge and 12 months gold membership aswell as 2 free friend coupons to invite your friends to enjoy the deliciousness.The gold membership gives you 12% discount on everything, the gps link, our soup of the fortnight news letter and a monthly seasonal recipe to cook at home.
70 EURO, The Kamprad PrincipleTaking an idea from the man who brought you IKEA, with this awesome limited perk you get our special handwritten thank you, our soup revolution campaign badge, a 6 month standard membership entiteling you to 10% discount on everything and our "Souper Star Cookbook". Giving you 20 of our best kept secrets to try at home. DIY never tasted so good.
100 EURO, Soup Is LifeApart from our wholehearted gratitude from our hand written letter and our campaign badge , You get 1 soup a month, for free, for LIFE. Plus you get a 12 month gold membership giving you 12% discount on everything, our monthly recipe, the GPS "find us" link and our news letter on what will be highlighting the fortnightly soup.
250 EURO, VIP in our Launch PartyIn this awesome perk we are offering you a chance to come to our launch party with a plus one and enjoy in our catering and see our facilities and truck. You'll get to see our awesome kitchen and processes along with being able to sample some of best dishes that are only available for catered events.You get this plus a caligrafied gratitude letter our soup revolution campaign badge and the Gold membership giving you an awesome 12% discount on all produce for 12 months, plus all of its extras.
500 EURO, And it shall be named.......In this perk you get our handwritten gratitude letter with soup revolution campaign badge. Our Super secret Recipe book, The month gold membership package giving you 12% discount on all purchases for 12 months, the fortnightly soup menu and our monthly seasonal extra recipes.You also get a recipe named after to show our gratitude in helping make The Soup Company come to life.
1000 EURO, Your Name In LightsThis is an awesome perk for private persons and small and large businesess where we will have your company logo/Name printed on the side of our truck as an ultimate thank you for being so generous with your sponsorship. Your name/logo will be proffesionally printed for all to see at the places we come to attend and whilst we drive around for a whole year, and we have plans to drive all over Sweden so you brand will get plenty of visual attention.Plus our campaign package.

story:
Skills Village is based in Frere Road, in Bez Valley Johannesburg in a network of old and very old buildings and we’re set and ready to let the Youth Create, and we want them to Create  Enterprises that create Jobs – for themselves. We want them to have a sustainable income, work together and employ more youth to create sustainable lives for themselves and their communities. 

Just minutes from Johannesburg Inner City - Skills Village has  collaborative and cooperative style training and work rooms, workshops and studios –  supervisors, coaches  and mentors all available to transfer skills and support our youth to develop enterprises so that they can be not just self-supporting, but primary proprietors within their communities. 

We have training programmes  and resources to equip the youth with the knowledge, skills and abilities needed to enable them to plan, prepare and produce festivals, events, parades, exhibitions and socio-economic activities. 
 
Skills Village 2030 is a place for youth to go, to be, to learn, to earn.   We're challenging the new generation of adults to be the ones to create sustainable events for sustainable livelihoods aligned to the Sustainable Development Goals.  Using the emerit International Event Management Standards to  enable youth to plan, prepare and produce safe, compliant events  in local communities.

The Sustainable Development Goals are a set of goals to end poverty, protect the planet, and ensure prosperity for all as part of a new sustainable development agenda. Each goal has specific targets to be achieved over the next 15 years.   For the goals to be reached, everyone needs to do their part: governments, the private sector, civil society and people like you. (http://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/sustai...)

Skills Village 2030 is the set to share the  learning through social media and a market place that  brings buyers & sellers together through a Dynamic Linkage System  inspired by The Experience Economy  Work is Theatre & Every Business a Stage

We'd love you to support the movement.  

For more details read on...

Youth unemployment is a big challenge worldwide.  At Skills Village 2030 we're on a mission to #LetYouthCreateJobs.   To use festivals, events, exhibitions, tourism experiences, parades and socio-economic development activities  to create sustainable  events for sustainable livelihoods aligned to the Sustainable Development goals

To establish  Skills Village 2030 as a home for Innovative, Creative, Entrepreneurial  (ICE)  youth.     The 12 old buildings becomes the 'set' to  document and share the learning through social media and an unscripted self-contained documentary inspired by  the Pine & Gilmore "Experience Economy  Work is Theatre & Every Business a Stage".     

We're challenging Innovative, Creative, Entrepreneurial  (ICE)  youth to submit proposals for an event that can create jobs in their local community.    From these proposals 200 individuals showing leadership skills and a passion for events and the Sustainable Development Goals  will be selected to participate in a five day 'pressure' challenge where five  groups of 40  will each produce five different events in a 'safe environment' over the  five days.  The vision is that these five day sessions would be repeated with different community groups who would then be acquiring the knowledge, skills and abilities to implement  Community Market Days and Township Tourism Experiences in their local communities.

The five day challenge will identify  inspirational leaders  and youth  to take the  2017 Sustainable Development Goal aligned Festival and Event Calendar and create and manage the Project Implementation Plan.  By  capacitating and supporting youth to  design and deliver festivals, events,  tourism experiences, exhibitions, and parades that create jobs and attract tourists to their communities, we're looking  to create circular economies in local communities that maximise the multiplier effect, minimise leakage and make a difference in the lives empowered in the process. 

A scalable & replicable model for job creation  #LetYouthCreateJobs

When the conversation is about sustainability, no demographic should be more front and center than the youth who will inherit the world we shape now.   The future of the global economy relies on putting young people in productive jobs   (United Nations Secretary-General’s Envoy on Youth  https://www.un.org/ecosoc/en/events/2016/youth-...)

We'd love your support and any contribution you can make will make a difference.   The funds raised not only contribute towards the big picture - but the perks offered also contribute towards supporting small  enterprises.    Pictures of the perks are in the gallery.  The model is scalable and replicable and we would love to get it out so other communities can use it to create sustainable events for sustainable livelihoods.   

Some folk like detail - and others don't - so below are the ACT's 1 - 10 which details the process   for those who are interested read on.     

ACT 1: Youth  are invited to submit a short story about themselves and a brief proposal for a Sustainable Development Goal event that will create jobs, maximize the multiplier effect, minimise leakage and make a difference in the lives of  local communities. The event could be a  Community Market Day,  a Township Tourism Experience, a Parade, a Festival, an Exhibition - any event.   When the youth participate in the training event at the Village - they will  be part of the five day challenge, each day, on the different events, the group will take roles that will show the jobs that can be created based on the EMBOK - Event Management Body of Knowledge  using the five domains - Administration, Design, Marketing, Operations & Risk (www.juliasilvers.com).  

ADMINISTRATION: Human Resources, Financial, Info Systems, Procurement,Stakeholder, Systems, Project Management

DESIGN: Content, Entertainment, Environment (decor), Food & Beverage, Production Design, Programs, Themes

MARKETING: Marketing Plan Management, Materials, Merchandising, Promotions, Public Relations, Sales, Sponsorship

OPERATIONS: Attendee Management, Communications, Infrastructure (Parking, Cleaning, Sanitation, Waste) Logistics, Participant Management  (Protocol) Site Management, Technical.

RISK: Compliance, Decisions, Emergency, Health & Safety, Insurance, Legal, Security.

Act 2:  200  Youth are  selected to participate in a 5 day Event Coordination Challenge at Skills Village where industry professionals will be assessing and short-listing potential candidates to make up a youth/millennial  team to coordinate the festival and event calendar.    This challenge introduces the emerit EMICS - Event Management International Competency Standard (www.emerit.ca) - which enables all participants to be able to return to their communities with the tools to start the process of  planning, preparing and producing safe, compliant events in their local communities. 

ACT 3 :   200 Youth participate in the five day training challenge 

Five teams of 40  participate in an inter-active five day challenge  at Skills Village.  Candidates will be challenged to design and deliver five events over five days.  Five days of pressure tests!  Shared through the social media unscripted self-contained documentary.

  1. Community Market Day
  2. Township Tourism Experience
  3. Sustainable Development Goal Banquet
  4. Exhibition 
  5. Sustainable Development Goal Parade to showcase careers of the future
  •  Industry experts,mentors and skilled members of the Village team  will be working with the participants to transfer skills, whilst  observing and identifying  potential leaders with special interest and passion for the  different Sustainable Development Goals.

ACT 4:  60 Potential  youth leaders  are invited to participate in the implementation of the  Festival, Event , Tourism Experience, Parade,  Exhibition, Activities Plan . These  youth would ideally be supported with stipends to be part of a six month programme to implement the plan .  Supporting cooperative enterprises are formed to create structures to unlock revenue sources  in the event value chain.

These events  and activities aligned to the Sustainable Development Goals  create:

  • Work Integrated Learning for youth entering the World of Work
  • Opportunities on the  Young Intern Programme  for valuable workplace experience.   
  • Powered by dynamic Innovative, Creative, Entrepreneurial  (ICE) youth with a vision of turning spaces in local communities into event places  and sharing the experience through the Experience Economy documentary 
  • Mentored, Coached and support by event and event value chain  industry experts 
  • Reported through the Event Organiser GRI - Global Reporting Initiative.
  • Event Organisers are encouraged to use the IFEA - International Festivals & Events Association "Pinnacle Awards" to ensure that each category for awards is being addressed on their events. 

ACT 5 : The programme of Sustainable Development Goals events designed to support the  #UN2017 as the International Year of  Sustainable Tourism for Development is planned- inviting local, national and international youth and tourists to share the Township Revitalisation Experience.  Local communities collect data against the IFEA World Festivals & Event City Awards.

ACT 6 :  Primary  Cooperatives  are formed   to support the youth to become suppliers in the event value chain.   Using the categories aligned to the EMBOK functional areas which inspires individuals to specialise in their areas of interest .    These primary cooperatives then have mentors/ supervisors to guide  physically as well as on-line and social media in their areas of specialisation.

ACT 7 :   A The Secondary Cooperative  is formed to support the Primary  Coops and is responsible for :

  •  Bulk buying  on behalf of its member co-operatives;
  • Providing marketing of products and to handle such products on behalf of member co-operatives.  
  • Providing support services for the member co-operatives;  
  • To actively work towards improving the quantity and quality of co-operative patronage in member co-operatives;
  • To assist member co-operatives to interact with each other in problem solving and resource utilisation;
  • To enhance management and organisational capacities of its member co-operatives managing the resources for the Secondary Cooperative.   

ACT 8: A Tertiary Cooperative could be formed with the existing Secondary Coops in the Village.

  • To advocate and engage organs of the state, the private sector and stakeholders on behalf of its members with regard to matters the members have an interest in.
  • To represent the interests of the members within the sector and region they function within.   
  • To provide assistance for education and training to members;
  •  To establish an audit fund to assist member co-operatives to have their co-operatives audited.  

Individuals in the primary coops are encouraged to  use the experience and resources of the Village but to look forward to forming  their own coops or enterprises as they evolve into sustainable enterprises.    The Pine & Gilmore Dynamic Linkage System  for mass-customization seamlessly matches customers needs with cooperative suppliers to create  a sustainable model for Skills Village as a  resourced socially inclusive place  to go, to be, to learn, to earn.  

ACT 9 :  The Calendar of Socio-Economic and Environmental Events aligned to the Sustainable Development Goals Events  kicks off the programme, starting with the 64 Days of Non-Violence on the 30 January.  The ICE Youth , unemployed youth entering into the World of Work and Young Interns are supported to deliver great experiences.

ACT 10: The UMNOTHO Poverty Eradication Festival to be held between the 14 - 17th October to report on the events of the year and to recognising :  International Day for Natural Disaster Reduction (14 October) World Rural Women's Day & Global Handwashing Day  (15 October) World Food Day (16 October) and International Day for the Eradication of Poverty (17 October) 

What We Need  

We'd love whatever you can contribute:  Financial, other resources, opportunities, physical and virtual mentorship, visiting experts  and support.  A full report of all expenditures and interventions will be available on the new Skills Village 2030 website

Our mission is to support a one year programme to be financially viable by Year 2.  

We'd love to do a full programme, but whatever support we get will be meaningfully invested in creating jobs.

    ENTERPRISE DEVELOPMENT INVESTMENT would assist us to 

    1.   Call for Innovative, Creative, Entrepreneurial youth to participate in the 5 day challenge to identify young Leaders for the ICE  Headquarters for youth.    200 x  Innovative, Creative, Entrepreneurs participate in a 5 day pressure challenge @ $500,00 per challenger = $100,000

    2.  Identify and select 60 x selected ICE Leaders who would earn a  6 month stipend programme @ $400,00/month  = $2400 x 60 = $144,000 

    3. Support  Socio-Economic Development  activities - Heroes for Change, Roots & Shoots Club, Chess, Internet access,  and other activities aligned to the Sustainable Development Goals.  These activities create Work Integrated Learning for  unemployed  youth and local community children are the beneficiaries  $28,000

    4. Produce a Pilot Social Media Production - unscripted self-contained documentary inspired by The Experience Economy  Work is Theatre & Every Business a Stage (Pine&Gilmore)   : $28,000

    • It would be great to have 'visiting' industry professionals and youth from other countries supporting the interventions - so let us know if you are coming to South Africa. 
    • At the Global Entrepreneurs Week in Johannesburg in November 2016 they talked about "flipping the classroom" - we need mentors, and experts to be there, working with youth - not lecturing but doing.  Global Entrepreneurs Week to be celebrated at the Village during the 13 - 17 November 2017
    • Youth would have access to technology, resources, mentorship, opportunities.   Spending time  in the Firehouse, the Prophouse, the Studio, the  Theatre, the ICE Box, The Rooftop   - spaces to go, to be, to learn to earn - creating networks, creating sustainable events.  

    What you get

    Thank you for any contribution which goes to the big picture - but also important is the perks include  art and craft element assisting crafters to earn as suppliers and mentors in the Village.   Every element creates jobs somewhere in the event value chain.   The perks can be customised so just drop us a note if you're looking for anything special or bulk. 

     

    The Impact

    We're looking to transfer over 35 years of  eventing know-how into a collective vehicle for sustainable social, environmental and economic development solutions .  To inspire event professionals to turn their eventing expertise into catalytic value to strategically grow the economic benefits of the industry and grow extended industries exponentially.  

    We believe that it's time for baby boomers, exiting the industry in the near future,  to cut the umbilical cord - to be there when needed - not to be there to tell youth how to do it but to be there if they need coaching, mentorship. resources.   Youth can create jobs through events if we support them.  

    We are privileged to be part of and serve on the IFEA - International Festivals & Events Association World Board - and just being part of the global picture and the support from IFEA on our journey to get us stable has been huge.  

    We were privileged to have Jean Mc Faddin from New York - an IFEA Hall of Fame legend - share her insight into parades, like the Macy's Parade - she was an absolute inspiration for the young entrepreneurs who are now rearing to go on  our planned Career Carnival Sustainable Development Goal parade   

    The quest for a Professional Certification for Event Management  has been supported by many event professionals - from the amazing EMBOK - Event Management Body of Knowledge team Julia Rutherford Silvers (www.juliasilvers.com)  Philip Mondor, Joe Goldblatt, William O'Toole (www.epms.net) Glenn Bowdin, Matthew Gonsalez, the late Dr. Kathy Nelson, and Janet Landey.   To the awesome Human Resources Canadian Tourism visionaries - Philip Mondor and the team that pioneered the Event Standards and the International Event Qualification Framework (www.emerit.ca)  So, we all have access to  a progression of standard for the professional delivery of safe, secure, social,economic and environmentally responsible events. Sustainable Events for Sustainable Livelihoods.

    Through the Gauteng TSHEPO 500 000 programme  we've been honoured  to work with an amazing group of  Youth, including the  Raphushana Kagiso Peace Festival team in the Western Corridor of Gauteng - who together have delivered some awesome events and looking forward to the future to replicate the Peace Festivals throughout the Province.

    These ICE Youth are a great example of caring, sharing young generation leadership and we are excited to support the youth to make the difference we all want to see.  The real issue is that there are 100,000's of youth in local communities who are unemployed and need workplace experience - so this is our opportunity to #LetYouthCreateJobs.   Events create jobs and can contribute greatly towards increased  tourism through events. 

    The Gauteng Economic Development Tourism Department supported the three day event coordinator challenge as seen on the video and that event was proof of the role that events can play in creating  socially inclusive places and the magic that can happen when youth have access to resources. 

    Thanks to Chemetrix and Mary's Community Centre  the Socio-Economic Development Programme was a great success for the local community children who were beneficiaries - from guest readers in  Jax's Local Story Exchange, to research in the  Bitco Internet Development Centre, the performances they planned and produced for Mandela Day for their parents, and youth learning to play and teach the Marimba's in the West Rand and at the Skills Village in Joburg. 

    Risks & Challenges

    So what is the greatest risk...  whatever we raise will produce great results - if we raise less  - then numbers and events will be smaller -  but whatever is invested, we can make work - it will take the programme to the next level.  If we raise more, more events and more local communities participating.    Scalable down or up.   But basically that is it.   The model is in place that no matter what small investment we get, we can make something happen - the buildings are there - the exiting baby boomers are there to assist in skills transfer and mentorship..    If we get great funding it would be catalytic and would make a great handover to the next generation and could go to scale. 

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Whatever way you can help to support the vision would be great.

    You could share the campaign - you could share your talents and do skills transfer - physically or virtually.   You could support our enterprise development by investing in customizing any of the perks that you know will create a job for some of the amazing artists and crafters that we have been privileged to work with.  We've put pictures of some of the pieces on the Gallery including some special original art - your investment can impact many lives in the event value chain. 

    You could share our campaign with the Indiegogo share tools!

    Thank you for reading this! #LetYouthCreateJobs
