For more details read on...
Youth unemployment is a big challenge worldwide.  At Skills Village 2030 we're on a mission to #LetYouthCreateJobs.   To use festivals, events, exhibitions, tourism experiences, parades and socio-economic development activities  to create sustainable  events for sustainable livelihoods aligned to the Sustainable Development goals 
To establish  Skills Village 2030 as a home for Innovative, Creative, Entrepreneurial  (ICE)  youth.     The 12 old buildings becomes the 'set' to  document and share the learning through social media and an unscripted self-contained documentary inspired by  the Pine & Gilmore "Experience Economy  Work is Theatre & Every Business a Stage".     
We're challenging Innovative, Creative, Entrepreneurial  (ICE)  youth to submit proposals for an event that can create jobs in their local community.    From these proposals 200 individuals showing leadership skills and a passion for events and the Sustainable Development Goals  will be selected to participate in a five day 'pressure' challenge where five  groups of 40  will each produce five different events in a 'safe environment' over the  five days.  The vision is that these five day sessions would be repeated with different community groups who would then be acquiring the knowledge, skills and abilities to implement  Community Market Days and Township Tourism Experiences in their local communities.
The five day challenge will identify  inspirational leaders  and youth  to take the  2017 Sustainable Development Goal aligned Festival and Event Calendar and create and manage the Project Implementation Plan.  By  capacitating and supporting youth to  design and deliver festivals, events,  tourism experiences, exhibitions, and parades that create jobs and attract tourists to their communities, we're looking  to create circular economies in local communities that maximise the multiplier effect, minimise leakage and make a difference in the lives empowered in the process. 
A scalable & replicable model for job creation  #LetYouthCreateJobs
When the conversation is about sustainability, no demographic should be more front and center than the youth who will inherit the world we shape now.   The future of the global economy relies on putting young people in productive jobs   (United Nations Secretary-General’s Envoy on Youth  https://www.un.org/ecosoc/en/events/2016/youth-...)
We'd love your support and any contribution you can make will make a difference.   The funds raised not only contribute towards the big picture - but the perks offered also contribute towards supporting small  enterprises.    Pictures of the perks are in the gallery.  The model is scalable and replicable and we would love to get it out so other communities can use it to create sustainable events for sustainable livelihoods.   
Some folk like detail - and others don't - so below are the ACT's 1 - 10 which details the process   for those who are interested read on.     
ACT 1: Youth  are invited to submit a short story about themselves and a brief proposal for a Sustainable Development Goal event that will create jobs, maximize the multiplier effect, minimise leakage and make a difference in the lives of  local communities. The event could be a  Community Market Day,  a Township Tourism Experience, a Parade, a Festival, an Exhibition - any event.   When the youth participate in the training event at the Village - they will  be part of the five day challenge, each day, on the different events, the group will take roles that will show the jobs that can be created based on the EMBOK - Event Management Body of Knowledge  using the five domains - Administration, Design, Marketing, Operations & Risk (www.juliasilvers.com).  
ADMINISTRATION: Human Resources, Financial, Info Systems, Procurement,Stakeholder, Systems, Project Management
DESIGN: Content, Entertainment, Environment (decor), Food & Beverage, Production Design, Programs, Themes
MARKETING: Marketing Plan Management, Materials, Merchandising, Promotions, Public Relations, Sales, Sponsorship
OPERATIONS: Attendee Management, Communications, Infrastructure (Parking, Cleaning, Sanitation, Waste) Logistics, Participant Management  (Protocol) Site Management, Technical.
RISK: Compliance, Decisions, Emergency, Health & Safety, Insurance, Legal, Security.
Act 2:  200  Youth are  selected to participate in a 5 day Event Coordination Challenge at Skills Village where industry professionals will be assessing and short-listing potential candidates to make up a youth/millennial  team to coordinate the festival and event calendar.    This challenge introduces the emerit EMICS - Event Management International Competency Standard (www.emerit.ca) - which enables all participants to be able to return to their communities with the tools to start the process of  planning, preparing and producing safe, compliant events in their local communities. 
ACT 3 :   200 Youth participate in the five day training challenge 
Five teams of 40  participate in an inter-active five day challenge  at Skills Village.  Candidates will be challenged to design and deliver five events over five days.  Five days of pressure tests!  Shared through the social media unscripted self-contained documentary.

Community Market Day
Township Tourism Experience
Sustainable Development Goal Banquet
Exhibition 
Sustainable Development Goal Parade to showcase careers of the future

 Industry experts,mentors and skilled members of the Village team  will be working with the participants to transfer skills, whilst  observing and identifying  potential leaders with special interest and passion for the  different Sustainable Development Goals.
ACT 4:  60 Potential  youth leaders  are invited to participate in the implementation of the  Festival, Event , Tourism Experience, Parade,  Exhibition, Activities Plan . These  youth would ideally be supported with stipends to be part of a six month programme to implement the plan .  Supporting cooperative enterprises are formed to create structures to unlock revenue sources  in the event value chain.
These events  and activities aligned to the Sustainable Development Goals  create:

Work Integrated Learning for youth entering the World of Work

Opportunities on the  Young Intern Programme  for valuable workplace experience.   
Powered by dynamic Innovative, Creative, Entrepreneurial  (ICE) youth with a vision of turning spaces in local communities into event places  and sharing the experience through the Experience Economy documentary 
Mentored, Coached and support by event and event value chain  industry experts 

Reported through the Event Organiser GRI - Global Reporting Initiative. 

Event Organisers are encouraged to use the IFEA - International Festivals & Events Association "Pinnacle Awards" to ensure that each category for awards is being addressed on their events. 

ACT 5 : The programme of Sustainable Development Goals events designed to support the  #UN2017 as the International Year of  Sustainable Tourism for Development is planned- inviting local, national and international youth and tourists to share the Township Revitalisation Experience.  Local communities collect data against the IFEA World Festivals & Event City Awards.
ACT 6 :  Primary  Cooperatives  are formed   to support the youth to become suppliers in the event value chain.   Using the categories aligned to the EMBOK functional areas which inspires individuals to specialise in their areas of interest .    These primary cooperatives then have mentors/ supervisors to guide  physically as well as on-line and social media in their areas of specialisation.
ACT 7 :   A The Secondary Cooperative  is formed to support the Primary  Coops and is responsible for :

 Bulk buying  on behalf of its member co-operatives;
Providing marketing of products and to handle such products on behalf of member co-operatives.  
Providing support services for the member co-operatives;  
To actively work towards improving the quantity and quality of co-operative patronage in member co-operatives;
To assist member co-operatives to interact with each other in problem solving and resource utilisation;
To enhance management and organisational capacities of its member co-operatives managing the resources for the Secondary Cooperative.   

ACT 8: A Tertiary Cooperative could be formed with the existing Secondary Coops in the Village.

To advocate and engage organs of the state, the private sector and stakeholders on behalf of its members with regard to matters the members have an interest in.
To represent the interests of the members within the sector and region they function within.   
To provide assistance for education and training to members;
 To establish an audit fund to assist member co-operatives to have their co-operatives audited.  

Individuals in the primary coops are encouraged to  use the experience and resources of the Village but to look forward to forming  their own coops or enterprises as they evolve into sustainable enterprises.    The Pine & Gilmore Dynamic Linkage System  for mass-customization seamlessly matches customers needs with cooperative suppliers to create  a sustainable model for Skills Village as a  resourced socially inclusive place  to go, to be, to learn, to earn.  
ACT 9 :  The Calendar of Socio-Economic and Environmental Events aligned to the Sustainable Development Goals Events  kicks off the programme, starting with the 64 Days of Non-Violence on the 30 January.  The ICE Youth , unemployed youth entering into the World of Work and Young Interns are supported to deliver great experiences.
ACT 10: The UMNOTHO Poverty Eradication Festival to be held between the 14 - 17th October to report on the events of the year and to recognising :  International Day for Natural Disaster Reduction (14 October) World Rural Women's Day & Global Handwashing Day  (15 October) World Food Day (16 October) and International Day for the Eradication of Poverty (17 October) 

What We Need  
We'd love whatever you can contribute:  Financial, other resources, opportunities, physical and virtual mentorship, visiting experts  and support.  A full report of all expenditures and interventions will be available on the new Skills Village 2030 website
Our mission is to support a one year programme to be financially viable by Year 2.  
We'd love to do a full programme, but whatever support we get will be meaningfully invested in creating jobs.

ENTERPRISE DEVELOPMENT INVESTMENT would assist us to 
1.   Call for Innovative, Creative, Entrepreneurial youth to participate in the 5 day challenge to identify young Leaders for the ICE  Headquarters for youth.    200 x  Innovative, Creative, Entrepreneurs participate in a 5 day pressure challenge @ $500,00 per challenger = $100,000
2.  Identify and select 60 x selected ICE Leaders who would earn a  6 month stipend programme @ $400,00/month  = $2400 x 60 = $144,000 
3. Support  Socio-Economic Development  activities - Heroes for Change, Roots & Shoots Club, Chess, Internet access,  and other activities aligned to the Sustainable Development Goals.  These activities create Work Integrated Learning for  unemployed  youth and local community children are the beneficiaries  $28,000
4. Produce a Pilot Social Media Production - unscripted self-contained documentary inspired by The Experience Economy  Work is Theatre & Every Business a Stage (Pine&Gilmore)   : $28,000

It would be great to have 'visiting' industry professionals and youth from other countries supporting the interventions - so let us know if you are coming to South Africa. 
At the Global Entrepreneurs Week in Johannesburg in November 2016 they talked about "flipping the classroom" - we need mentors, and experts to be there, working with youth - not lecturing but doing.  Global Entrepreneurs Week to be celebrated at the Village during the 13 - 17 November 2017
Youth would have access to technology, resources, mentorship, opportunities.   Spending time  in the Firehouse, the Prophouse, the Studio, the  Theatre, the ICE Box, The Rooftop   - spaces to go, to be, to learn to earn - creating networks, creating sustainable events.  


What you get
Thank you for any contribution which goes to the big picture - but also important is the perks include  art and craft element assisting crafters to earn as suppliers and mentors in the Village.   Every element creates jobs somewhere in the event value chain.   The perks can be customised so just drop us a note if you're looking for anything special or bulk. 
 
The Impact
We're looking to transfer over 35 years of  eventing know-how into a collective vehicle for sustainable social, environmental and economic development solutions .  To inspire event professionals to turn their eventing expertise into catalytic value to strategically grow the economic benefits of the industry and grow extended industries exponentially.  
We believe that it's time for baby boomers, exiting the industry in the near future,  to cut the umbilical cord - to be there when needed - not to be there to tell youth how to do it but to be there if they need coaching, mentorship. resources.   Youth can create jobs through events if we support them.  
We are privileged to be part of and serve on the IFEA - International Festivals & Events Association World Board - and just being part of the global picture and the support from IFEA on our journey to get us stable has been huge.  
We were privileged to have Jean Mc Faddin from New York - an IFEA Hall of Fame legend - share her insight into parades, like the Macy's Parade - she was an absolute inspiration for the young entrepreneurs who are now rearing to go on  our planned Career Carnival Sustainable Development Goal parade   
The quest for a Professional Certification for Event Management  has been supported by many event professionals - from the amazing EMBOK - Event Management Body of Knowledge team Julia Rutherford Silvers (www.juliasilvers.com)  Philip Mondor, Joe Goldblatt, William O'Toole (www.epms.net) Glenn Bowdin, Matthew Gonsalez, the late Dr. Kathy Nelson, and Janet Landey.   To the awesome Human Resources Canadian Tourism visionaries - Philip Mondor and the team that pioneered the Event Standards and the International Event Qualification Framework (www.emerit.ca)  So, we all have access to  a progression of standard for the professional delivery of safe, secure, social,economic and environmentally responsible events. Sustainable Events for Sustainable Livelihoods.
Through the Gauteng TSHEPO 500 000 programme  we've been honoured  to work with an amazing group of  Youth, including the  Raphushana Kagiso Peace Festival team in the Western Corridor of Gauteng - who together have delivered some awesome events and looking forward to the future to replicate the Peace Festivals throughout the Province.
These ICE Youth are a great example of caring, sharing young generation leadership and we are excited to support the youth to make the difference we all want to see.  The real issue is that there are 100,000's of youth in local communities who are unemployed and need workplace experience - so this is our opportunity to #LetYouthCreateJobs.   Events create jobs and can contribute greatly towards increased  tourism through events. 
The Gauteng Economic Development Tourism Department supported the three day event coordinator challenge as seen on the video and that event was proof of the role that events can play in creating  socially inclusive places and the magic that can happen when youth have access to resources. 
Thanks to Chemetrix and Mary's Community Centre  the Socio-Economic Development Programme was a great success for the local community children who were beneficiaries - from guest readers in  Jax's Local Story Exchange, to research in the  Bitco Internet Development Centre, the performances they planned and produced for Mandela Day for their parents, and youth learning to play and teach the Marimba's in the West Rand and at the Skills Village in Joburg. 

Risks & Challenges
So what is the greatest risk...  whatever we raise will produce great results - if we raise less  - then numbers and events will be smaller -  but whatever is invested, we can make work - it will take the programme to the next level.  If we raise more, more events and more local communities participating.    Scalable down or up.   But basically that is it.   The model is in place that no matter what small investment we get, we can make something happen - the buildings are there - the exiting baby boomers are there to assist in skills transfer and mentorship..    If we get great funding it would be catalytic and would make a great handover to the next generation and could go to scale. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Whatever way you can help to support the vision would be great.
You could share the campaign - you could share your talents and do skills transfer - physically or virtually.   You could support our enterprise development by investing in customizing any of the perks that you know will create a job for some of the amazing artists and crafters that we have been privileged to work with.  We've put pictures of some of the pieces on the Gallery including some special original art - your investment can impact many lives in the event value chain. 
You could share our campaign with the Indiegogo share tools!Thank you for reading this! #LetYouthCreateJobs

story:
A New Groove for Craft Beer

Meet Jonathan:

 

Jonathan Duke is originally from Carrollton, Georgia, and has lived and worked in Spartanburg County since 2004. A proud father of one, Jonathan has experience at many levels in the restaurant/bar operations world, from washing dishes to managing an independent sports bar in Georgia. 

Since moving to South Carolina, Jonathan has been an IT specialist with a local school district and taught the nationally recognized high school drumline there. Now his percussive prowess is turning towards starting a New Groove for you to march to. His interest in the culinary arts, service, and the mixing of science with art is what attracted Jonathan to homebrewing some years ago.

 

Meet Josh:

Josh Dodson, a blue collar businessman from Steelville, Missouri, has been a member of the Boiling Springs community since 2009. His 3 daughters attend Boiling Springs schools and his entrepreneurial wife April runs their multiple businesses from their office center in the west side of the community.  

Josh’s passion for brewing started like many other home brewers, with the gift of a homebrew kit from his wife.  This hobby brought Josh to the Spartanburg Brew Club where he and Jonathan met and became friends.

Through this friendship the duo have decided to share their passion for craft beer with you, and with this we bring you New Groove Artisan Brewery.

The Project

Our goal is to provide the Boiling Springs area of Spartanburg with a community gathering place. A spot that you can be proud of and know that you can meet your friends and hang out.  A place that produces exceptional local, fresh beer that will please both recent craft beer converts and experienced beer enthusiasts alike. A bright yet cozy place where everyone feels comfortable and relaxed.

Boiling Springs is a rapidly growing and thriving area that is thirsty for a high quality and flavorful craft beer bar and brewery. Jonathan and Josh are currently constructing the brewery in the 4100 sq ft space at 4078 Hwy 9.  The brewery portion of the planning is taking shape and brewing vessels are paid for and scheduled for delivery.  

Photo: Former "Tornados" future site of New Groove Artisan Brewery

Where we need your help is with the taproom space.  We are planning to construct a comfortable and trendy social area that you, your family, and your friends can use to enjoy our hand crafted beers, craft sodas, and guest tap ciders and wine.

This will include tables and chairs for the main area and bar stools for the 22’ bar.  There will be televisions, a comfy lounge for maximum relaxation, a stage for musicians to perform, games to entertain the whole family, and excellent spaces for gatherings of friends or meetings.

 

We are building a carefully selected size system, designed to allow frequent brewing. This is our plan to ensure a wide variety, but also the highest level in freshness. Our goal is that every time you come in there is something new to try. After all, if the same beer is on every time, how fresh could it be?

We will be serving our beer draft only for the first phase of our plan, but we will offer to go beer sales with a fantastic vessel called the "Crowler." A Crowler (Can+Growler) is a 32oz can that is filled and sealed right at the bar. The aluminum Crowler offers benefits over traditional glass growlers, in that the beer is better protected against light and oxygen, two of the main spoilers of fresh beer. It is also recyclable, and doesn't pose the shatter danger of glass - making it ideal for taking up to the street and sharing beer at the lake or pool. When you're done simply toss it in with your other metal for recycling, and purchase a new one on your next visit. No cleaning required, which leads to fresher, better tasting beer! We will still be happy to fill your glass growlers as well, of course. 

The beer is our focus, but the community is our goal. With your support, you can take part in bringing a New Groove to everyone.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to remodel and build out our taproom, making our vision a reality.  Your contribution will go towards developing the existing space into a comfortable and enjoyable craft beer setting.  

Our contributor reward merchandise will be exclusive to those that help fund this campaign.  

The Groove Club is our special annual program limited to less than 100 of our closest supporters. Any support level that features membership in this club will grant you exclusive annual perks, such as:

  • A Groove Club Sticker
  • A Groove Club Shirt
  • A Groove Club Glass to take home
  • Recognition on our wall in a place of honor
  • Groove Club Card - Card with 12 month punch out. Each month the bearer gets a single 32oz Crowler of your choice. This membership card will also grant the member a 5% discount for regular New Groove swag.
  • An exclusive invitation to our soft opening party, where you will have the opportunity to be among the first customers to purchase our beer, tour the brewery, and enjoy food and entertainment!

The Groove Club merchandise will carry a club logo to show your elite support status, and provide access to exclusive events.  With it, you will be the envy of the craft beer community.

Your contributor status will be a virtual badge you can wear forever.  You will eternally be a member of our New Groove Family.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not all folks have the ability to help monetarily and that's okay!

There are other ways that you can contribute to the startup of the New Groove Artisan Brewing Company:

Make some noise, and share this page by word of mouth!

Share our Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram pages with your friends! The more people we can get following us, the greater chance for success we will have.  Indiegogo has share tools to help you!

Visit us once we open! We will be happy to share a drink with you, or simply shake your hand for taking the time to check out all of our hard work!

 

 

The Groove Club Terms and conditions:

The Groove Club memberships are valid for 1 year from the 1st day of the month following the brewery opening date. You will get a Groove Club Card with 12 month punch out, valid for a single 32oz Crowler for off-premise consumption per month. Your Groove Club membership gets you 5% off of general merchandise.  Annual membership renewals are subject to changes in terms and conditions as well as new perks and member programs.

story:
Who we are

The team behind Bootleg Brew Co. consists of Matt Tilley and Morgan Turner. We met while working together at Newfound Sushi. We've both been working in the restaurant industry across Canada for years and have seen that more and more that people like to know where their food and drink come from. Using the skills we've gained from years behind the line, we've developed beers to compliment food, and seasonal beers to show off the best that Newfoundland has to offer. We're planning to open a 3 bbl microbrewery in Corner Brook, Newfoundland, so that we can produce enough to share our beer all across the island.

Why we're here

We've been working hard over the last few months to source the best equipment and ingredients possible, as well as an existing building that fits our specific needs. We are just looking for that last push to make sure that we are good to get going. Any funds that we receive will go towards our Brewha 3 bbl system and any renovations that we need to meet all of the regulations necessary to produce beer in Newfoundland.

Our aim

While Newfoundland beer is very nostalgic for us, we both grew up drinking Blackhorse (after we turned 19 of course), we've noticed the huge growth of craft beer in the other provinces we've lived in over the last few years. While it's great drinking a beer that's been carefully crafted with love and attention, the community surrounding it is just as important. Working with local chefs, artists and other brewers, we plan to help create a community across Newfoundland to show off the talented people that call this province home.

 

The Rewards

 

First Pint On Us

 

Swag Pack

 

Be A Brewer For A Day

 

Drink Free For Life

story:
The Skinny

As Levi seeks to launch a book-bar in Downtown Harrisonburg, he has been pointed to Paz & Associate's online training resources and training retreat as the best launching pad by many other booksellers around Virginia and across the U.S. To make the store a reality, it is his hope to build the foundations using Paz & Associate's resources to get things off on the right foot. To get there and pay for the resources, he's in need of some financial support.

 

Who is Levi?

At age 25, married to the beautiful Amy, and a sweet baby Phoebe almost here Levi Fuller is an ambitious young man who very much likes to buy and read books. Levi spends much of his time and money reading and buying books, which led him to the thought that kicked off the downtown bookstore idea: "If I could buy books and be surrounded by them for the rest of forever, why would I not?"

Levi is passionate about stories and people. The bookstore is his passion for seeing those two things flourish in Downtown Harrisonburg for the good of Harrisonburg.

 

What We Need & What You Get

To have access to the online trainings and attend the weekend retreat, Levi is need of $2,000. This will take care of the training costs ($1,395) as well as travel expenses (food, lodging, gas) to get to the weekend retreat in Nashville, TN.

When you give, we give you:

  1. My family's love (which is a some pretty sweet love)
  2. A personal thank you note
  3. A hand-drawn pen-and-ink illustration of Court Square in Downtown Harrisonburg when you give at least $15 or $25

 

The Impact

Through Paz & Associates, Levi will learn:

  • Tangible competitive advantages booksellers are using now
  • Design strategies that will make the store memorable
  • How (and where) to buy books and shape inventory selection
  • How to merchandise books, cards, toys and a variety of items
  • What bookstore computer systems should do
  • Buying and inventory management strategies to help create a fabulous inventory and generate profits
  • Ways to drive traffic to the store
  • Strategies to develop customer loyalty
  • Ways to use technology to organize operations and create efficiencies

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't give financially, give Levi the gift of spreading the word. Share this with your friends online or pass the word along to check this campaign out and get Levi the training he needs.
story_txt:

As Levi seeks to launch a book-bar in Downtown Harrisonburg, he has been pointed to Paz & Associate's online training resources and training retreat as the best launching pad by many other booksellers around Virginia and across the U.S. To make the store a reality, it is his hope to build the foundations using Paz & Associate's resources to get things off on the right foot. To get there and pay for the resources, he's in need of some financial support.

My family's love (which is a some pretty sweet love)

What bookstore computer systems should do

Strategies to develop customer loyalty
Ways to use technology to organize operations and create efficiencies

Even if you can't give financially, give Levi the gift of spreading the word. Share this with your friends online or pass the word along to check this campaign out and get Levi the training he needs.

story:
Why Support Evelyn's?

About two years ago, I had some girlfriend's out to Buffalo to shop downtown for a day and then hang out at my house.  Little did I know, this little excursion would set in motion the concept for Evelyn's Wine Bar.  It was a simple question posed by a girlfriend around lunch time -- "ok, now where can we get some wine and something to eat?"  My answer was that we didn't really have a place like that downtown, we could just go to my house after we were done.  I had wine there.  Her followup comment... "you should open a wine bar down here."

I knew it was something I'd love to do and I knew Buffalo needed it.  Such a beautiful historic downtown should have a nice bistro/wine bar.  There are always shoppers around.  It is the perfect location --  old brick buildings and sidewalks, a gorgeous lake setting, a movie theatre, cute little boutiques.  Seemed strange it didn't have a wine bar.  It is the perfect place for one.

About a year later, I met the Chamber of Commerce president and asked her why Buffalo didn't have a wine bar?  Is the city tough on ordinances? Is it hard to get a license?  To my surprise her answer was "no, just no one has done it." In fact she was sure the city would support something like that and knew the retailers would. And they have.

So, now I'm at the construction stage.  The plans have been approved, the licenses applied for, the building about to start.  I've secured an SBA loan, have applied for leases for the kitchen equipment, and put some personal savings to good use to get us to this point.  But there is just a bit more funding needed and I would be so grateful for your support.  

It's The Little Things That Matter

The big stuff has been accounted for and we've got the money to transform the building into a wine bar.  But, it's the little things that matter.  Your contribution will help fund the furnishings: 

  • Tables and chairs
  • Bar and bar stools
  • Fixtures (i.e. lights, bathroom fixtures)
  • Dinnerware, glasses, utensils, kitchen items
  • Signage

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you can't contribute financially.  There are other ways to support Evelyn's!

  • Share the campaign with friends, especially if they are from Buffalo and would be excited to support a local business and see a new wine bar open downtown.
  • Visit us after we open and have a glass of wine, a cold ice tea, or one of our yummy small plate menu items.
  • Spread the word.  Tell friends and family downtown Buffalo is growing.  Evelyn's Wine Bar will open in mid-summer at 18 Central Avenue.

Thank you so much for your support!

 

Kristi Paul

story:
Short Summary

I make and sell comic related posters online. I am passionate about comics because of the storylines that give these characters incredible depth. I studied Graphic Design in college and took what I learned to start making these posters in my free time. My goal is to raise enough money to sell my posters at conventions and more online. This campaign will help me:

    •    Promote the FBposters brand

    •    Advance my business to the next level

    •    Expand interpersonal skills

    •    Acquire imperative business connections

What I Need & What You Get

What I need:

    •    Supplies for FBposters (Ink, inventory, shipping, etc.)

    •     Website maintenance: $500/ 2 years

    •     Adobe Creative Cloud Suite (holds my design programs): 

        $31.79/ month

    •     LLC registration: $49

Comic-Con costs:

    •     Table: $99

    •     Table Covering: $29

    •     Extra Vendor Wristband: $40

    •     Chairs (Not allowed to bring your own): $9

    •     8.5x11 poster: (approx. $5/poster)

    •     11x17 poster: (approx. $8/poster)

    •     13x19 poster: (approx. $12/poster)

(Prices include ink and paper costs)

What you get:

There are great perks available through this campaign:

    •     Small $1 perk

    •     Exclusive designs for this campaign

    •     PDF Downloads

    •     Posters at a discount

The Impact

The impact from the campaign will result in:

    •    Valuable business experience.

    •    Positive sales increase (in person and online)

    •    More opportunities for marketing online (ex. ads)

    •    Consistent upkeep for both www.fbposters.com (regular site) and    www.etsy.com/shop/FBposters (Etsy shop)

    •     Becoming an LLC: $49

    •    Even if the goal is not met, proceeds will go to FBposters for more printing supplies, shipping supplies, and website maintenance.

Risks & Challenges

With campaigns there are risks:

    •    Not turning a profit.

    •    Inability to cover entrance costs at Comic Con

    •    Whether or not the goal is met, this is a valuable learning experience and I can take this opportunity to get my name out to a larger crowd. This will be accomplished by advertising on social media and marketing on my own time.

    •    In addition, this is valuable for making business connections with vendors and customers.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, that’s not a problem!

    •    If you can take a second and share my campaign with your friends through the Indiegogo share tools, it would be helpful and appreciated!

story:
The People’s Bank of Govanhill

is a local currency project in Govanhill, Glasgow initiated by artist Ailie Rutherford

The aim is to create a new form of currency in Govanhill, through a series of currency experiments, workshops and discussion events talking about money; looking at what’s wrong with our current economic situation and what we can do to change it.

The People’s Bank of Govanhill is an action research project, testing out different forms of local currency in order to find out what works best for the community and engaging local people in discussion.

The exchange booth allows you to exchange Govanhill notes for sterling on a pay-what-you-can-afford basis. Each time the booth operates the notes can be used as vouchers exchangeable for local goods and services.

The suggested exchange rate is

1 Govanhill note : 100th of your weekly income.

The first set of Govanhill notes was designed by Ailie Rutherford during her residency at the Govanhill Baths in 2015

There are now around 200 of these notes in circulation.

What The People’s Bank of Govanhill needs now

We really need your help to keep this project going, to print some new notes for The People’s Bank of Govanhill and to allow us to carry on this programme of events and ultimately to develop a local currency in Govanhill. The project has no core funding so is entirely reliant on donations and small grants to keep going.

A second set of notes is being designed by Govanhill based artist Marvin Gaye Chetwynd but we need your support to print them.

If we reach our target we will also then have enough money to commission one more local artist to design the third set of notes.

The new notes will be launched at Govanhill Baths in April, with a series of currency exchange events to follow.

And What You Get

All the notes are hand screen printed and then signed, dated and editioned.

Everyone who donates will receive a printed Govanhill note. We ask that you consider our pay-what-you-can-afford exchange rate and donate what you can afford to help us realise this next stage of the project.

Once we reach our target, donations of over £25 will receive a complete set of three limited edition banknotes; signed and editioned by all three artists.

In order to receive your printed notes, please give your details when donating. You can then either collect your notes from the exchange booth at the launch of the new currency in April, or if you live outside Glasgow please send a stamped self-addressed envelope to:

The People's Bank of Govanhill c/o Ailie Rutherford, Studio 4 Glasgow Independent Studios, Trongate 103, Glasgow G1 5HD

You can choose whether to keep these notes as souvenirs or to use them and participate in local exchange projects.

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute financially, but you can certainly help us by spreading the word and sharing information about our campaign.

story:
VERSION EN FRANCAIS ICI


Hello, we are Florence and Thibault !

As kids we used to eat super delicious Ballekes (Belgian meatballs) at our grandparent's house and as we grew up we kept good memories of this taste. In 2012, we wanted to follow our passion for food and share our grandmother's traditional recipes. We started a bistro ('t Bolleke) in Brussels serving traditional Belgian cuisine with Ballekes as a speciality. Our customers loved it !

Video of 't Bolleke shooted by TV-Brussel in 2014.

Thibault's Grandmother

BALLEKES, A NEW PROJECT 

We all live fast urban lives with less time or no will to cook sp we stop at fast-food restaurants with average quality products. Obviously, there is a real need for better quality food options at democratic prices and cool atmosphere. BALLEKES is an answer to this need.

OUR VISION

  • Create a place where you can enjoy good food at affordable prices
  • Making sure you enjoy a great Belgian Experience 
  • Serve you the best Belgian meatballs, fries and Beers

THE CONCEPT 
BALLEKES is a fast-casual restaurant with minimum service like a fast-food but with high quality food. You order at the counter and have the possibility to customize your choice. The interior design is also very important : good materials and cosy atmosphere.

Inspiration (ONLY) for the counter and the cosy atmoshere
MENU 
The menu selection above the counter is very simple: 
  1.  Select your taste: Pork/Beef, Chicken or Bio Veggie 
  2.  Select your style : Belgian sauces, Baguette or Salad 
  3.  Select your sides and extras


We are committed to use local and organic food as much as we can and of course we guarantee 100% taste explosion.



LOCATION 

Chaussée de Charleroi, 174 - 1060 Brussels (OPEN 7/7)

Located at the intersection of many trendy neighbourhoods : Chatelain, Avenue Louise, St-Gilles and Uccle; it's the perfect location to meet up with your friends for a quick bite !

WE NEED YOUR HELP ! 

The place was abandoned for more than 3 years and we had to rebuild everything from scratch.

We have done all the main structural renovations (water, gaz, electricity, walls, ceiling, air conditioning, toilets) and we bought all the professional equipments for the kitchen. But we still need an additional 25.000€ for :
  • The carpentry : custom-made counters, benches, tables and furniture (similar to inspiration above) so that you can easily order, sit back, relax and enjoy your Ballekes with a fresh Belgian beer.
  • The lights: so that you can see the meatballs you eat and Instagram your food to your friends.
  • The floor: renovate the wooden floor which is broken in many places so that you can enjoy the place for many years to come. 

SUSTAINABILITY AND SOCIAL JUSTICE

If we can raise the money, we will work with Klimop for the Carpentry. It's a workshop inside the "Atelier Groot Eiland",a non-profit organisation that has the mission to reintegrate long-term unemployed people from disadvantaged neighborhoods of Brussels. In addition to that, they use recycled wood.

"By supporting our crowdfunding you help saving the planet and support poverty reduction at the same time. So cool isn't it?"
PERKS 

Support BALLEKES and get plenty of rewards  that match the value of your contribution. Our perks include: 

  • Your name in our thank you video in front of Manneken Piss
  • Goodies: t-shirts, caps, glasses, bottle opener 
  • Your name on the wall of Baller fame inside our shop to be thanked forever 
  • Limted Edition Crowdfunder Card that gives you 10% off FOR LIFE
  • Your name engraved in a table so that it will be yours forever 
  • Party for all your friends, family and colleagues 
  • Meatballs for life

Pay attention that shipping cost are applicable if you want us to ship your perks instead of getting it in the shop.

Even if you cannot contribute financially to the project now, you can still support us by making a lot of noise and sharing it with your friends :)

Thank you for joining the Belgian Meatball Revolution.

You are awesome !

Florence & Thibault

#BALLEKES 

#Jointhebelgianmeatballrevolution

If you need pictures to support an article, you can dowload all the pictures here: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/b6ffw2xk810c8d7/AADDS7z93-gGcubcsqe-dcxja?dl=0

FAQ

Where can I contact the founders ? - You can drop an email to social@ballekes.be if you have any question

What is the official date of the opening? - It will all depend of the work we still have to do but we estimate it broadly around beginning of March.

Can I participate if I am outside Belgium? - Sure, we will ship all the perks to your address anywhere in the world.

What does the "meal" perk include? - It include one classic meatball with sauce (+side)  OR one baguette (+ side) OR one salad with one meatball + one FREE drink.

What do I get with the VIP invitation for the opening day? - You will be exclusively the first of your friend to taste the meatballs and you will get a FREE drink with your order.

Can I sponsor as a Company? - Sure, there is no restriction. We can even engrave your company name on our tables, benches and the wall of fame.

VERSION FR

Merci pour votre support. Si vous avez encore des questions, vous pouvez nous joindre sur social@ballekes.be ou sur les réseaux sociaux.

A très bientôt!

Florence & Thibault

What do I get with the VIP invitation for the opening day? - You will be exclusively the first of your friend to taste the meatballs and you will get a FREE drink with your order.

Can I sponsor as a Company? - Sure, there is no restriction. We can even engrave your company name on our tables, benches and the wall of fame.


VERSION FR





Merci pour votre support. Si vous avez encore des questions, vous pouvez nous joindre sur social@ballekes.be ou sur les réseaux sociaux.
A très bientôt!
Florence & Thibault

story:
Concept Summary

The Boomerang Shield concepts has been crafted for the purpose of saving lives in today’s world, by revolutionizing traditional law enforcement capabilities to a new, sophisticated and secure level and completely eliminate any fear or doubts traditional law enforcers are faced with.

In today’s day and age, a growing number of countries, nations, ideologies and gangs are involved in war, terror and civilized disruption. Traditionally , the solution has been served by adding manpower, force, weapons and resources which rarely achieve a real solution other than disrupting daily activity for millions of innocent people.

The results are poor; innocent people die every day, and in cases where law enforcement are lucky to timely intervene and the subject attacker is confronted and killed, the result is endless public disarrays over police brutality.

The Boomerang Shield is designed to confront and eliminate today's dangers and has the capabilities to immediately neutralize imminent threats with no loss of life. This will tremendously help law enforcement, local governments, border control and security personnel to maintain ultimate control of their constituent’s security at the highest level at all known trouble spots, at all times.

How does it work??


The patent pending highly intelligent software will work seamlessly in conjunction with the cutting edge futuristic hardware with advanced military precision to:

  • Automatically detect and deter violence in everyday life. i.e. in Bus Stations, Train Platforms or even on street corners.
  • Immediately detect an exposed weapon of any sort.
  • Trigger an alarm when detecting a concealed weapon, using advanced technology.
  • Immediately evaluate the danger level prior to striking, and in the events of ambiguous happenings trigger a live feed to a looped monitoring authority, for direction.
  • Assist the operator at the off-site monitoring authority, to approve the system to eliminate the danger by firing a highly accurate Taser cartridge directly on the attacker, with a single click.
  • Capture and submit recordings of the event, which shall be automatically generated at the sign of any threat, to law enforcement to assist in prosecution.

·  Map high sensitive areas and tweak the system to automatically discharge and eliminate attackers at first sign of danger.

·  Work in conjunction with The National Threat Monitor, where an upgraded threat level will automatically operate the system on a higher sensitivity basis.

In the automatic triggering mode, the system will be tuned to differentiate between civilians and law enforcement personnel and would not act as a disturbance to every day law enforcement activity. It will only utilize positive assistance. Law enforcement personnel will have the option to remotely disarm the units in a variety of easy to use methods, each of which can be programmed to best suit the local requirements.

The Difference between Life and Death

In its current form, law enforcement first need to be notified when a threat surfaces; then, be present or waste time rushing to the scene in order to determine if and how to respond or act; multiply that by hundreds of daily threats, and that task becomes logistically impossible.

With The Boomerang Shield, law enforcement suddenly have a helping upper hand, their presence extends to instantly reach where the shield is, they see what the shield sees on the second and can either manually operate the shield to neutralize threats, or, direct the shield to automatically do so.

In the event of a terrorist attack, or even worse, a simultaneous terror attack where law enforcement does not know where and what to first respond to, and can definitely not handle all at once; The Boomerang Shield will already be there, ready prepped and on target to act on a milliseconds notice to neutralize the threat and save lives!

Where will The Boomerang Shield be installed?

The Boomerang Shield will come in many variations to service:

  • Private Residences
  • Gated communities
  • Banks and Department Stores
  • Mobile Security Personnel
  • Government Agencies
  • Borders and Checkpoints
  • Transit
  • Neutralization of would be suicide jumpers

What We Need, to Deliver!

To turn this amazing concept into a fully functioning working and serving being we would need all the help we can get from you in order to:

  • Successfully complete the research and development of the vital components, processors and software that will integrate, run and power the system.
  • Establish a team of world leading programmers with a focus on military defense.
  • Set-Up the necessary facilities and environments to fully test all versions of prototypes in secure locations.
  • Source manufacturers for the most viable, durable, materials, components, and protection.

The Impact

Saving lives on a daily basis is a big deal, but, saving lives on a daily basis while enhancing the lives of millions is an even bigger deal. Once The Boomerang Shield will launch successfully, saving numerous lives on a daily basis will be "No Major Deal!" people in today's world would able to enjoy the freedom and security once again whilst Law Enforcement agencies will be able to operate up to the highest standards, and be protected, knowing where and when they need to go to, and that they will always have a friendly Boomerang Shield to do the heavy lifting and watch their backs!

Challenges & Risks

With an idea and a vision as large as The Boomerang Shield, there will no doubt be some bumps in the form of challenges, i.e.

·  The timing of receiving the public's and governments backing for projects like this.

  • To secure our unique software, component sketches and intimate details about the project against compromise of any sort.
  • Working with the ever evolving threat and terror types which would all need to be timely programmed and adjusted into the carvings of The Boomerang Shield

By combining a team of world leading programmers, military engineers and advisers we will be eliminating most of the risk associated with the project and get The Boomerang Shield ready to save lives within the shortest time frame.

Other Ways You Can Help

We need your help to make this a success and save lives…… no matter how you can provide it!

  • By contributing; Thank You!
  • By Sharing this project
  • Or, By making any form of publicity to help us bring this amazing revolution to reality, Fast..!

Thank You for taking the time to read, help and contribute to our project!

story:
Vestability: Life vests that save lives, empower women and reduce waste 

Vestability is a non-profit organisation, created by a team of university students who have a common goal to reduce the death rate amongst fisherman, empower women and reduce waste in Sainte Luce, Madagascar.

Sainte Luce is a rural fishing village, with 450 fishermen and their families. Fishing is the main form of employment and the largest source of income. However fishing is extremely risky: boats are made to a poor standard, produced from local hollowed tree trunk, and there is no access to safety equipment. The boats are prone to capsize due to the rough conditions of the Indian Ocean, and fishermen lack any ability to swim. As a result, fishermen face a daily risk of death from drowning.


Throughout Madagascar, households typically rely solely on male income. Cultural expectations, domestic responsibilities and lack of employment opportunities restrict women from earning. In Sainte Luce, the majority of families are living in extreme poverty. Women are traditionally forced to rely on their husbands’ or fathers’ minimal income. Due to the dangers of fishing, women are often left widowed.  As such, both single and widowed women are left particularly vulnerable to poverty.


In line with the 2015 UN Global Goals, Vestability aims to work towards alleviating extreme poverty, fighting inequality and reducing climate change. Vestability aims to reduce the risk of fishing, whilst offering a source of income for vulnerable women in Sainte Luce. To do this, we will establish a co-operative of 3 local women. The members will work together to produce life vests made from local waste materials: plastic bottles and rice sacks. The members will then be able to sell the life vests to local fishermen, catering for the severe demand for adequate safety equipment.

What we need

We are hoping to raise £10,000 to kick-start our project. We will use this money to:

·  Produce and test life vest prototypes

·  Provide training for our co-operative members

·  Provide information sessions to fishermen on the importance of life vests

·  Send a member of our team to Madagascar to establish and monitor our project

Your impact

By helping Vestability, you will be helping transform the lives of families in the Sainte Luce community. By introducing life vests, we can not only substantially decrease the risks of drowning for fishermen, but also introduce a reliable source of income for women. In addition, our co-operative members will learn valuable skills in product creation, business and sales, and use of recycled materials. Moreover, the use of recycled materials will prevent environmental degradation and the dumping of plastics in to the sea. In the long term, we hope to boost the economy of Sainte Luce, alleviating poverty and improving lives. 

Other ways you can help

·  Join the Global Goals 2015 movement and help make them famous!

·  Follow us on Facebook and Twitter to stay up to date with our progress.

story:
What we are about

Montana Fresh Shrimp Company is working to grow and sell fresh marine shrimp to a local market. Our intent is to offer, in a sustainable way of growing, one of the highest-protein sea foods that is local, fresh, GMO-free and heavy-metal free, using organic growing methods. We are changing the food supply one ingredient at a time. We believe in the local farmers market slogan "Know your local farmer"  

We have a crew of over 12 people working tirelessly on construction, marketing, accounting, social media and website as well as an aquaculture science consultant team and a microbiologist. 

We have been working diligently on our facility.  Building walls, painting, sealing the floors with a slip-proof water resistant epoxy have turned our facility into a healthy place for the shrimp to grow in a good environment and create a safe place for our shrimp wranglers to work.  

The first two sets of beta tanks are built and lined with a special marine liner.  The beta tanks hold about 8300 gallons of water, per four tank set.  Phase two will include installing fiberglass tanks more than twice that size at about 18000 gallons.

How are we different from other shrimp farming operations? We are working to grow shrimp that have a higher nutrition content than the average shrimp. This is due to our unique method of feeding which includes two types of algae one being spirulina. The algaes make the shrimp higher in omega 3's and keep the water clean. Our method of feeding them also increases their protein content as well as adds astaxanthin. Astaxanthin is a powerful antioxidant that aids in fighting cancer, macular degeneration, fighting dementia, enhanced athletic performance, and fights the aging process.  

We will also have the ability to remove the iodine normally found in shrimp, which will be beneficial for those with some seafood sensitivities and allergies.

We will be donating part of our shrimp harvest to local food banks, and other organizations who help low income and homeless citizens.  We will also be donating a portion of our sales to local organizations to help them in their efforts to help people who need it.

What We Need & What You Get

We are already well underway but, we need help with some key items to get the first babies in the tanks. 

  • oxygenation bubblers 
  • high quality feed for the shrimp
  • heaters to keep the shrimp warm during our long Montana winters
  • plumbing
Your contribution will help create a much needed clean food source for the country.  90% of the shrimp we eat come from foreign countries, some having been treated with antibiotics and fed with questionable feed sources. We are working hard to change that and reclaim a healthy, high protein food source for generations to come. We have a dedicated team working tirelessly to get us up and running with our first set of tanks growing shrimp.  We are starting from scratch and need the help of the crowd to succeed in providing a clean food source. 
We have some amazing perks for this first phase of our farm. Our team thought hard about what would be the best things to offer our generous contributors. Our first harvest is not until May 2016 so we had to get creative. We hope you love them as much as we do. On top of these perks we are investing in a camera for a live feed of the shrimp farming process that everyone will be able to access 24/7!
$5:
  • Shout out!  We will mention your name on the website donor list as well as a shout out on our Facebook and Twitter.
$10:
  •  A copy of our ebook written in house which includes recipes, shrimp"toids" , sustainable farming facts and more, and a shout out
OR
  • A high quality bumper sticker and a shout out.
$25:
  • Full color Shrimp Can Koozie, sticker, and a shout out.
$50:
  • Montana Fresh Shrimp reusable bag, sticker and a shout out
$125:
  • Montana Fresh Shrimp Organic cotton T-shirt, sticker, and a shout out.
$250:
  • Reward package: A Montana Fresh Shrimp Organic t-shirt, bag, Koozie, a sticker and a shout out.
$500:
  • Donate $500 and you get 5 pounds of shrimp from our very first harvest in May 2016, plus an apron, sticker, the recipe ebook and a shout out.
$1000:
  • 20 pounds of shrimp from our first harvest for your to host your very own shrimp boil! Harvest in May 2016 Montana Fresh Shrimp apron, sticker, the recipe ebook, and shout out.
$5000:
  • Adopt a tank! For a generous $5000 donation you get to name a shrimp tank anything you want.  Tanks will all have a brass plaque with the chosen name on it.  You will also get the 20 pounds of shrimp for the shrimp boil, an apron or t-shirt, sticker, ebook, and a shout out.

The Impact

Generous contributions from our local community have helped us get to the current stage of construction.  We are reaching out even further for our next phases of our farm:

  • Not only are we providing a healthy and clean food source to the local community. We are donating 1% of our overall monthly profits to a local charity. We will also be donating shrimp to local charities that feed low income families and local homeless populations.  
  • Our system allows us to grow more shrimp per square foot than other systems commonly used.  If we are successful in our start up we hope to change the way shrimp is farmed to provide a higher quality food to more people.  
  • We are using sustainable and organic farming practices on our shrimp farm using a feed that provides them with probiotics and organic feed. Doing this is healthy for the overall global aquaculture ecosystem.
  • Several local contributors have generously donated to get this farm project launched.  We have been hard at work using their generous donations to maintain the facility, build tanks and hire professional scientific consultants including an aquaponic engineer and a microbiologist.
Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk in shrimp farming is the risk of disease in the population.  EMS(Early Mortality Syndrome) is one of many known diseases in in the shrimp farming industry in China, Thailand, Vietnam and Malaysia. 

Due to our method of farming we have ultimate control over the ecosystem in our tanks which will be tested periodically.  This greatly reduces EMS.

Our processing room is a few short yards away from our tanks. Once the shrimp are harvested they will be packaged immediately in a BPA-free food-grade package and sent out to you our customers, for consumption.

Lastly there is the concern of the use of antibiotics in shrimp farming.  Due to our feeding system and constant monitoring there is no need for the use of antibiotics to fight disease. The shrimp's digestive tract and environment will be strong and healthy enabling them to resist disease on their own.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute financially but want to help us get the word out? We can still use your help with a few things:

  • Word of mouth is a huge help!  Just sharing our story and our crowdfunding will make a difference.  Tell your friends on social media, twitter, facebook, or over email.  Use the share tools on the far left to shout out our message on the web! We can use all the help we can get to get up and running at 100%.
  • We would love the help of a branding company to get our brand, logo and image set in stone.  We understand that this is a huge part of the success of a company but we need help getting our image perfected.  If you can help us with this aspect of the business would love to hear from you!

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our campaign!  Follow us on our adventure by checking back here, on our website or social media pages.

 We would love the help of a branding company to get our brand, logo and image set in stone.  We understand that this is a huge part of the success of a company but we need help getting our image perfected.  If you can help us with this aspect of the business would love to hear from you!   Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our campaign!  Follow us on our adventure by checking back here, on our website or social media pages.

story:
About Muskogee Directory

My name is Kelvin (Ray) Brown.  I am a native of Muskogee County. Due to military service (US Army and Army Reserves), I left the area.  I spent 25 years in the the Washington, DC area.  In Jan of 2009 I returned to Muskogee, Oklahoma.  With-in a few months of my return I became entrenched with-in the business community, along with my camera. Becoming know as the Picture Man. 
Since that time, I have taken nearly 40,000 pictures of people in Muskogee and Muskogee County.  30,000 plus, of which are publicly available on Facebook, at Facebook.com/MuskogeeDirectory
Although, photographing public events is not my primary income generator, I love doing it.  I love seeing the smiles on peoples faces when they become the star.  I love seeing comments from loved ones and jokes from their friends.  I love it that people far away, can still enjoy family pictures.



Why this campaign?
I want to keep taking your pictures.  However, I will need community support to do that, at over above the previous level.

Christmas Parade 2015, in Downtown Muskogee, otherwise known as 'the day the camera died'.
If you were there or on your way, you will remember that it started raining just as the parade started.   I had already started taking pictures, ahead of the actual start of the parade.  But, within minutes of the parade actually starting, the rain really started coming down.  The camera and I both got drenched. The camera had gotten wet before, but this time was just too much, and it died.
I have a backup camera, but it is not even close to the Canon T3i that was just lost to rain. And this is Oklahoma, so, as has happen several times in the last few years, any camera that I use is sure to get rained on, at some point. So, I need a better camera.

Here is the album that I just had to capture in the rain, that just happened to ruin the camera.

Muskogee Christmas Parade 2015

Research: 

After consulting with a couple local photographers and doing some online searches, the recommended camera replacement is the Canon 70D.  The main reason is because of two keywords.  Weather resistant. 
The problem is that it is not an inexpensive camera, especially when you add the lenses and accessory kit. As, I mentioned earlier, public event pictures makes me feel good but that alone, does not justify or cover the cost of a quality camera.  Thus the reason for this campaign.  Muskogee Directory, needs your help. 
Many people have said how much they enjoy seeing the pictures online, as well as, in the Muskogee Phoenix newspaper.  So, I must ask, that of those who enjoy it would you be willing to help get a new camera, by donating as little as $5. 

How much is needed

Camera:

Canon 70D body only: $999 
Canon 70D plus lens and accessory kit: $1,199

Additional items:
2 Harddrives to store and backup several thousand pictures.
5TB HD: $139 each
Extra batteries and Battery Grip $100

Warranty:
 4  year protection plan $68.00


I could get by, with the body only and a used lens, but of course the accessory package would cut down on the over all cost of buying those items separately, later. 


What needs to be raised?

Allowing for price changes, on the low end, $1,100 is needed.  
To cover the cost of the camera, accessories and warranties, the total comes to $1,700.  
But, $1,700 does not look so big if small amounts came from 200 different people. 


What do you get for helping. 

In exchange for your support, downloads or prints will be made available to you. The choices (perks) are explained  on the sidebar and hopefully this will make it worthwhile for you.  You can see, some of the thousands of pictures available on the Muskogee Directory Facebook page.   Sizes ranging from 4x6 to 8x10 mailed to your home.  And in many cases poster size prints are available for pictures taken in the last 2 years.

Or, you can come to my office and we can have fun creating new pictures for you, using greenscreen technology, to digitally replace the backgrounds. 



What about businesses?

Prints are available for you as well.  There are pictures from hundreds of events, such as grand opening, event sponsors, parades, etc.   
Higher donations will eligible for in store pictures, promotional videos, or maybe you want a basic mobile app for your business. 
If you don't need it, maybe you want to sponsor a local non-profit or maybe a family photo shoot for those that may be less fortunate. 


And if I want to help further?

if you want to help us even more, please consider any of the following:

  • spread the word - share this campaign with your friends on your social networks or on email, and ask them to give us a hand
  • you can also, contribute offline as well, money order, cash, checks


Thanks for your time and contribution!

Sincerly, 

Kelvin Brown

story:
Short Summary

YUMMi is the online food ordering platform with a difference!

For Restaurants: YUMMi is the only food ordering platform that gives back 100% of the profits from each order direct to the restaurant partner. What's more, YUMMi also have no monthly fee's, no hidden costs, and take 0% commissions from each order that is placed.

With the YUMMi integrated payment cart customers can pay with Cash, Card, PayPal, and many Mobile Payment's such as Apple Pay.  With the YUMMi Delivery Network we have you covered. Simply receive your order, confirm via your app, and the YUMMi driver will arrive to collect and deliver for you. With the YUMMi Reservations feature your customers can now book and reserve a table at your restaurant on the live booking system. With YUMMi you are in complete control of your business, and are free to use any other services you like. YUMMi will go the extra mile to ensure a constant stream of orders, and pay you 100% of your profits, whilst you explore any additional services you require.

For Customers: With the YUMMi GPS Systems customers can now order their favourite foods from virtually anywhere they like. Fancy a picknick delivered to the park? How about donuts to the cinema? Anything is possible with YUMMi.

With the YUMMi unique ordering system you can order take out direct from your Facebook profile, the YUMMi website or our Unique app. Plus you can like and share your experiences online. 

Rather eat in than eat out? Nothing is an issue with YUMMi. With our unique Table Booking Platform you can book a table at your favourite restaurants with the click of a button!

Sick of waiting for your order to arrive? YUMMi has your back! With our 'Kitchen to Door' feature you can track your order via GPS from the point it leaves the restaurant to arriving at your front door! The YUMMi Delivery Network are ready and waiting for your orders!

Cant decide what you fancy? Use the 'Inspire Me' feature...



What We Need & What You Get

What are we going to spend the money on? The simple answer: YOU!

YUMMi is already taking the restaurant industry by storm in the south, with a new exciting partnership with one of the largest sales companies throughout the UK. January 2016 will see 90 new restaurants join the YUMMi Revolution, with exponential growth throughout the rest of the year. But we don't do things by halves, and we will be investing the funds raised from this campaign back into the software and systems which allow us to stay one step ahead of the game.

£80,000 will be invested into new systems which will integrate all our current features, such as the ordering placing and receiving process, the table booking platform and the GPS delivery tracking feature into one single application. This will allow for a much more user friendly product, keeping all the amazing YUMMi features that our customers love all in one simple application.

£60,000 will be invested in 2 brand new sales campaigns, allowing YUMMi to have brand presence in a city near you. These funds will allow us to follow our proven success model, in which each new restaurant has a dedicated account manager to handle all enquires, and each customer has a team of designers, transport managers, accountants and advisers working behind the scenes to ensure each and every order placed is fulfilled to the highest standard.

£20,000 will be invested in our digital marketing campaigns which allow maximum order potential for each and every YUMMi restaurant partner. Our daily discount emails offer all our subscribing customers deals from their favourite restaurants direct to their inbox every single day. Plus with our growing social media presence, we are able to offer out stop prizes, competitions and exclusive offers and discounts.

What if we fall short? No problem. YUMMi will still launch these exciting new features, it will just take us a little while longer. BUT as we don't want to fall short, we have some amazing offers for all of those who believe in our brand...

Invest £20 and receive £5 credit to use on any takeaway of your choice through the YUMMi App.

Invest £40 and receive £10 credit to use on any takeaway of your choice through the YUMMi App.

Invest £100 and receive our amazing YUMMi Mondays Giveaway! Every Monday for a whole month you will receive your food for free. This equates to £200 worth of food and drink split over 4 consecutive weeks.

Invest £500 and we will pay for you and a guest a 3 course meal at one of our London restaurant partners. For a full list please contact us.

Invest £1,000 and receive free takeaway every Monday for the whole of 2016! Contact us for more information.

YUMMi Headquarters | Leeds | West Yorkshire...



The Impact

YUMMi takes conventional food ordering and delivery to a whole new level.

Giving restaurants and takeaways access to an online ordering platform with tens of thousands of potential customers without taking a penny from the orders placed.

Providing restaurants with a table booking service which rivals all main competitors completely free of charge.

Having a dedicated delivery network allowing restaurant partners more time to concentrate on received orders as opposed to additional staffing.

Allowing customers to order from virtually anywhere they like, and letting them track their orders in real time using the GPS feature.

Offering all types of cuisines from Chicken Tikka to Chicken Pies!

Charging a fixed fee of just £2 per delivery on anything ordered through YUMMi.

These are the just a few of the main features which allow YUMMi to stand out from the crowd.

YUMMi has been months in preparation, had tens of thousands of pounds invested in the current systems and processes which hold everything together, and has a dedicated team running in the background to ensure everything runs as smooth as it should do. And now it's ready!

YUMMi has had an amazing start to the new year, with a new sales campaign launched in Central London, a large head office acquired in Leeds, West Yorkshire, and a delivery network ready and waiting for each order to be placed.

2016 is an exciting time for YUMMi, with over 7,000 restaurant partners planned to join this amazing new concept, generating over £8 Million for the company and more than £20 Million in order values. This will see some exciting changes for YUMMi, including an express app which will allow you to order and receive food within 15 minutes, brand awareness throughout the whole of the UK, and so much more.

We have launched this Indiegogo campaign in order to help us build a solid back end system to ensure that our stream of new restaurant partners and customers receive the best possible service.

YUMMi Reservations: Book a table online and receive an instant confirmation...


Risks & Challenges

Although YUMMi is the only food ordering platform which pays back 100% of the commissions direct to the restaurant, it is certainly not the only food ordering platform on the market.

Some of our biggest selling features are also our biggest risks, as we face competition from rivals in food ordering, food delivery and table booking systems.

But here at YUMMi we take this on the chin. Although we do have a dedicated R&D team, we know that as long as we build our services with both restaurant and customer in mind, provide first class service, and most importantly do everything we do to the best of our ability, YUMMi will always prevail.

We have a strong focus on our success model, which focuses on individual teams who work closely with one another to provide the best service possible to all our restaurants and customers. This team have and do work endlessly to ensure our current systems are always in tip top order, and our creative team are always on the lookout for new and exciting ways we can take the business to a whole new level - hence why you're reading this campaign!

The YUMMi Delivery Network - Just £2 per delivery...


Other Ways You Can Help

Cant afford to invest? No problem at all. If you have gotten this far then you must believe in our company in the way we do!

We would be extremely grateful if you could use the below share options and help us spread the word.

We would like to use this space to personally thank you for looking through our campaign and we look forward to launching in an area near you very soon.

Regards

YUMMi

story:
Short Summary

Magohub is a web platform (app coming soon) where students can buy and sell used stuff, find housing around university, connect with relevant services, and share their own experiences with other students - making the moving in experience into a new country or city smoother, faster and safer. MagoHub is participating in the Duke Startup Challenge at Duke University.

Problem:

Our research indicates that the most challenging issues that individuals face when transitioning to a new city are:

  1. Housing-related decisions (Where do most students live? Where do students from my country live? What areas of the city are safe? What areas of the city are expensive?)
  2. Finding furniture (Where can I get a good deal? Where can I find high quality used items? Do I have to buy everything new? Can I lease furniture instead of buying it? What options will I have to sell this furniture when I leave?)
  3. Transportation (Do I need to buy a car? Where would I go if so? Is it safe to bike? What public transport options are available? Can I carpool?)
  4. And most important, building a community (How can I find friends who speak my language? What school should my children attend? Where are people practicing my religion? My favorite sport? How do I make professional connections?)

Our Solution:

A web and mobile app that connects new students to their communities. Magohub helps students find better housing, buy and sell used stuff, and interact with others in the area. We do the aggregating work for you, saving you time, effort, and of course money!

How:

MagoHub has a category for each need such as housing, furniture, local events and community forums, etc. 

Each individual, whether a buyer or seller, has a profile with rating system. This makes the experience richer and safer, unlike craiglist. We believe in making the moving in process as simple as possible. MagoHub is integrating payment gateways and courier service to make payment and delivery of items possible with just one click.

MagoHub also connects its users to the best options available in the service market such as: banking accounts, cell-phone plans, insurance, storage units, and other main services needed during the settling-in process. Along with that MagoHub will also host an event and free food calendar.

We at MagoHub want you to enjoy your new city. So let us handle all the hard work for you.

Where will the funds go?

We will use the funds to the improve and develop our web and mobile app, and to conduct marketing and promotion campaign.

Meet our team:

Felipe Magofke is a graduate of Duke University’s Sanford School of Public Policy, where he received a Master of International Development Policy degree with a concentration in development management and a certificate in Latin America studies. His development passion focuses on innovation and entrepreneurship policy design. In summer 2014, Felipe completed an internship at the World Bank in the Enabling Business Unit. Felipe also holds an MBA from the Catholic University of Chile that included a semester at the Kenan Flagler School of Business at UNC. In 2004, Felipe, along with two friends, cofounded ProJoven, a startup that offers services for international students who move to Chile for exchange or full time undergraduates programs.

Maria Trinidad Ugarte is a Duke graduate student in the Master of Arts in Liberal Studies. She is a journalist and language teacher. Her previous position in Chile was for a startup that developed interactive toys for children. After living almost 3 years in the US as a spouse and mother, she is very active with the international community of spouses and gained a deep understanding of the target audience.

Sanskar Shrivastava, is a recent Duke graduate with a degree of Master of Engineering Management. Prior to Duke he has over two years of experience working as Systems Engineer with IBM. Realizing the potential of information technology he jumped into forming his own technology based journalistic startup, The World Reporter to solve some of the common problems in journalism. His startup has received many international awards and recognitions.

Please, use the Indiegogo share tools and follow us in Twitter, FB, YouTube!
