graduate with a degree of Master of Engineering Management. Prior to Duke he has over
two years of experience working as Systems Engineer with IBM.
Realizing the potential of information technology he jumped into forming his
own technology based journalistic startup, The World Reporter to solve some of
the common problems in journalism. His startup has received many
international awards and recognitions.
Please,
use the Indiegogo share tools and follow us in Twitter, FB, YouTube!

story:
Short Summary

With the start of a new year upon us, many people are opting to make healthier changes. As we know, changing the way we eat or exercise can have a profound effect on health and well being. However, we often overlook the environment that we’re working out in and this can make a big difference. 

Infrared Heat 

coming to Sol Studios Fairfax!

 Provides a therapeutic, deep penetrating, detoxifying form of heat which expels toxins, heavy metals and pollutants from the body, providing significant benefits.

FAR infrared heat promotes a stronger immune system, better cardiovascular health, and speeds up the healing process in soft tissue injuries such as tears, pulls, and sprains. As a beauty treatment, the penetrating heat of far infrared heat therapy works wonders by reducing the appearance of crow’s feet, fine lines, and wrinkles. In addition to helping heal scars, wounds, and cuts, it also smoothes skin’s texture, lessens coarseness, and reduces pore size.

FAR infrared heat therapy is a natural way to aid aches and pains from arthritis, fibromyalgia and other health-related disorders. Providing relief to people suffering from chronic injury, illness or fatigue, far infrared heat is often the first step in helping them get their life back.

Optimal Health Benefits Immediatly

• Burns hundreds of calories in 20-30 minutes
• Reduces stress and fatigue
• Strengthens the cardiovascular system
• Heals injuries faster and more efficiently
• Relieves pain and migraine headaches
• Eases joint pain and stiffness
• Relaxes muscles and increases flexibility
• Deep cleanses skin naturally
• Removes toxins and mineral waste
• Improves the immune system


Here are 5 health benefits of practicing yoga in an environment that’s heated with Infrared  

  1. Increased Flexibility – Because Infrared heat is directly warming the muscles, it opens them up allowing for a greater range of flexibility. A study at Auburn University compared how far athletes were able to stretch in a training room to how far they were able to stretch in an infrared sauna. Researchers concluded participants were able to stretch as much as three times their normal amount in the infrared environment. This will allow yoga students to open up, melt deep into the poses and gain confidence in their practice.
  2. Increased Circulation – Infrared heat has been shown to stimulate blood flow by opening up the body’s capillaries. This has an incredible affect on the body and offers a variety of benefits. It can help lower blood pressure, oxygenate the organs and rid the body of toxins (read more below).
  3. Detoxification – Simply put, infrared heat will make you sweat, which is a good thing because it is your body’s natural way of flushing toxins. As your body absorbs infrared heat, water molecules begin to vibrate, which causes them to wring out impurities from the cells and expel them into the blood. These impurities will then be released from your body as you sweat, creating a deep, detoxifying cleanse on the cellular level.
  4. Weight Loss – The human body has an impressive temperature regulation system. It wants to stay at a consistent temperature and its willing to work very hard to ensure that happens. As the body heats up, its natural cooling systems kick in, which take energy and burn calories.  Infrared heat also increases metabolism between the blood and tissue, which also burns calories.
  5. Pain Relief – Infrared heat directly penetrates tissue, muscles and joints, allowing them to heal and regenerate. This is accomplished through a combination of the aforementioned increased circulation, oxygenation and detoxification. Infrared radiation incredibly useful for pain relief for both minor injuries and chronic ailments. It’s no surprise then that infrared heat is often the preferred method of  many physical therapists, saunas and yoga studios around the world.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $8,000 to get this dream off the ground. The money will go towards installing the new INFRARED heating system.  We have the skills, the drive and the heart to make this dream a reality. Now with your help we will have the rest of the capital. 
The Impact

Invest in your health NOW and you'll receive limited-time discounts on class packages. For just $40, you will receive two weeks of unlimited yoga and a 

Feel good about setting a local, family-owned business up for success.

Are you interested in being a part of a thriving community of wellness-minded individuals? Do you want to experience first hand the proven physical and mental benefits of a regular yoga practice? Or do you believe in our mission to offer yoga for free to young athletes? If yes, PLEASE ACT NOW in support of Sol Studios


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone who wants to help is able to give money, but there are other ways you can help us get this project out. Please spread the word to your friends. Simply use the Indiegogo share tools. Or if you have a service or product to donate as a Perk please let us know.The more people who hear about our project the faster it will be completed. Our goal is to have the system installed by the end of February 2016.

story:
Hello my name is Angela McMillian

I'm a mother of three, very caring and professionally diligent. I’m a firm believer in “A family that prays together stays together” and that’s why I want to offer my services to your loved ones. I have decades of experience in certified home care, pro-social family unification and community integrated rehabilitation. As a seasoned professional in the healthcare field, I take great pride in providing the utmost caring, reliable and courteous service to my clients, in addition to being the overall point of contact for operations, personnel, and management. My professional experience includes 20 plus years in Healthcare, Associate Degree of Science from UMA and successful completion of requirements for Certified Medical Administrative Assistant with the NHA. 

As a passionate and responsible caretaker of my mother for over 15 years, I fully understand the creative adversity it takes to overcome the hardships of caring for a parent or loved one. And, as I recall being a novice, I quickly learned when my mom was diagnosed with "Alzheimers," that not only did her healthcare needs changed but her standard of living needed more than just my spare room. She was different and so were her needs, abilities and interests. From that moment on, I vowed and committed to providing my mother with the highest, quality of care I could provide and what I didn’t know I researched, learned and expeditiously implemented; therefore she could enjoy her last moments with her family, friends and community.

As the number of older individuals in society grows, the needs for private assistance is becoming much more important and a community integrated sociological approach is the new standard of care. At this time, I’m seeking start-up and working capital in order to continue to meet the needs of our friends. We would like to expand our services from a mobile service to a residential program. We’ve  identified a location of interest and am requesting an initial investment of $50.000 for the purchase of property.

We’ve taken great interest in the property and fully intend to rehab the space. Currently the property offers a wide main road with plenty of nature and a secure pavement for outings. Fortunately, the property is vacant therefore with your Angel Investment we can commission a rehab team to completely renovate the 25000, square ft. building and re-facade the space to the loving, caring, innovative social environment we envision for our friends. In addition to your service investment for our friends we will be doing our commercial due diligence to our community by offering new job skills, training and employment satisfaction to the community.

Services:

  • We offer a group environment for the elderly, referred to as our friends.
  • We pride ourselves on providing our friends with the opportunity to get involved and contribute to their well-being by continuing to live prosocial healthy productive lives.
  • Our staff and programs are tailored to fit the needs of our friends, to accommodate their individual lives. We also make every effort to accommodate the lives of other family members in the households Generations Hand in Hand friends resides.

I Angela McMillian, Founder and Director of Generations Hand in Hand, fully intend to wholeheartedly offer my conducive services, commitment and support of the evolution of care for our friends. I ask you to reach out to me if you need further information regarding GHIH and I welcome your support to help us reach our goal. 

     (email:hhtransportation@netzero.net)


You can also notify people of your Verified status by directing them to the following link:https://www.paypal.com/us/verified/pal=angelamcmillian%40gmail%2ecom


Disclaimer: A quarterly progress report will be provided to every Angel Investor regarding project status. In the event the total resources have not been reached THE FUNDS WILL BE USE FOR OTHER PROGRAMS AND FACILITIES FOR OUR FRIENDS. 

THERE IS A STRONG BUSINESS POTENTIAL IN THE ADULT CARE MARKET. THE NEED FOR PRIVATE ASSISTANCE IS BECOMING MUCH MORE IMPORTANT AS THIS PART OF OUR POPULATION GROW. IN FACT, SOCIETY NOW SEES THAT PRODUCTIVITY AND EMPLOYMENT RELY ON AN EXPANDING, SKILL WORKFORCE. THE WEALTH OF EXPERIENCE RESIDING IN THE OLDER POPULATION CANNOT BE IGNORED. EVEN OLDER INDIVIDUAL WITH SOME HEALTH LIMITATION, CAN STILL BE RESPECTABLE CITIZEN.

LET EVERYONE WHO SEE THIS CAMPAIGN, UNDERSTAND THAT IF YOU CAN'T MAKE A CONTRIBUTION. THAT THIS COULD HAVE A MAJOR IMPACT ON YOUR AGED FAMILY MEMBER EXPERIENCING HEALTH CHANGES AS WELL AS CONCERNED RELATIVES. INDIEGOGO SHARE TOOLS. IS THE RIGHT WAY TO GO AS FAR AS REACHING RESOURCE SPECIALIST AND CHOOSING THE RIGHT CAMPAIGN.

story:
Help us to foster sustainable local food start-ups in Bulgaria

LocalFood.bg is a network of small local food producers in Bulgaria, which supports their access to the market and promotes policies to regulate home-made food production. Our team is a pioneer in organizing farmers markets in our country, but our experience and feedback shows that the local food producers has serious difficulties to start legal business.

The biggest obstacle to them is not to much financial resources as a scant information on the steps to register and exactly what requirements are sufficient to meet for run regulated business.

Largely the gray market of local food in Bulgaria is a consequence of insufficient or misled information for the smallest producers. It is a significant problem that the institutional experts are not familiar with the specifics and opportunities for the local food producers and instead support them, they soon stumble them.

Bulgarian institutional sites are lacking of easy to understand and implement guidelines for small entrepreneurs.The situation rather prompts them to seek assistance from consultants, which complicates the process and increases the cost of their start.

We want to solve these problems and support the launch of local food start-ups by creating resource site www.localfood.bg,rich in:

- opensource easy guides,
- opensource e-trainings,
- videos,
- webinars,
- education, courses and events calendar.

We plan to offer producers subscription for additional legal, marketing and advertising support and also will encourage producers associations by building community network. The site will be helpful for consumers too, because it will promote local food finder, producers individual pages and calendar of events. Further we plan to run a national training sessions campaign for local producers in 10 Bulgarian cities.

LocalFood.bg will be widely promoted in Facebook, YouTube and Google and we plan to provide a budget for such campaign by Google AdGrants.

With your help, the smallest informal producers from Bulgaria will have a valuable and easy to implement resource site, dedicated to their proper registration, practice, teachings and community building.

As a result of our project we expect that hundreds of innovative small food businesses will be ran.

What we need and what you get

Basically, we need your help to pay for a easy to use, professional platform. We want a helpful website. A really, really helpful website.

We want to develop an open source system to be used by other communities and NGOs around the world.

Now LocalFood.bg is a free beta version.

The perks will include a set of 4 Bulgarian rural food recipes. And if you donate $1,000 or more, your name will go on our first webpage!

The Impact

We believe in this dream of ours, because our experience with the pilot farmers' market in Bulgaria has been great. In the last two months we formed a new expert team of lawyers, educators, specialists in food control, marketing, PR and visualization. We made the first open source guide to run a farmers'market, which we published in the beta version site. It was met with great interest and now hundreds of people in Bulgaria expect more valuable resources.

For us, LocalFood.bg is not just an information site. It is about sustaining life and a chance of being enacted new policies for small local food entrepreneurship in our country. With your help we can do this! Together we can promote the best practices and can foster hundreds of small local food businesses.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to contribute financially, there are many ways you can join us.
  • If you are a website builder, let us know! 
  • Spread the word to friends, family and anyone you think may be interested.
  • If there is a way in which our community can be of benefit to you, don’t hesitate to reach out and ask.
* * *
Discover some of our local producers
(video: AVOCADO)

story:
We are Tangier body piercing and art boutique, our goal is to create a warm, happy and safe environment for piercing here in Ukiah. We also feature and sell local artists work in our shop.
We opened recently in downtown Ukiah, but were forced to close due to circumstances beyond our control. As you can imagine, this not only has left us heartbroken, but we also have to start over in terms of funding our business. 
We are trying to make it work with what we do have, however, we need help from our community to realize our dream once again.
Not only do we offer piercing, we have a local henna artist and a local tooth gem artist whose services will be available in our shop. We are also very focused on featuring and selling local artists work, from sculpture to jewelry and everything in between! We are also hoping to host craft nights, clothing swaps, and fun get togethers some days out of the month. We really want to have this space become a healing and safe place to come, relax, and create (or just hang out). 

All funding will go towards our business, from supplies to space. To bring you all the very best that we can!
We thank you for your time, and any donations are very much appreciated.

story:
Summary

We have a dream of seeing entrepreneurs confidently and proudly using their profession to make a lasting impact on the world.  We believe that you can do this in a way that strengthens the business at the same time.  There are many great examples of this already happening, but we believe it can happen on a much bigger scale resulting in transformational results around the world.  We have, no doubt, an ambitious, long-term plan to get there which includes a creating a transformational business, forming a network of likeminded business people, and a establishing foundation to give entrepreneurs starting small and medium transformational businesses the boost that they need to get on their way.

So that’s super overwhelming and big picture-y!  So why don’t we start small?

In order for our big vision to happen, we first need to build a prototype business that displays the transformational potential of businesses that have a deeper purpose than just financial profitability.  With both of us being passionate coffee drinkers and specialty coffee baristas, we just knew that it would be natural make this prototype business a specialty coffee company.  

Along our journey we discovered the name Narrative Coffee Company.  We were so drawn to this name because we have seen time and time again the potential of when two or more narratives connect.  It happens so often that a brief introduction or connection that we originally don't think of meaning much, turns into something much deeper, long-lasting, and life-altering.  And it all starts when your path or your story connects with someone else’s.  "Stories connecting" could mean two people meeting for the first time.  It could also mean someone encountering God for the first time in a tangible way that results in them having a deeper purpose for living.  That is what drives us, and we want to use our coffee shop to create the perfect environment for the connection of stories to take place.  

But why not do this alone?  Well the simple answer is, we are far more effective when we work together collaboratively! This is where you come in!

What We Need & What You Get

We believe that we are far stronger when we work together!  Over the past two years, we along with our business developer, consultants, and a team of amazing volunteers, have been putting in the hard work of building the business: tasting coffees, networking with other artisans of all types, developing our business model, and experimenting with different concepts.  We are now ready to open our first coffee bar in September 2016, and now all we need is your help to make this happen.  

We are raising a total of $29,500 USD.  These funds will cover the cost for Narrative’s first coffee bar, machines, brewing equipment, initial stock, reserve operating funds, etc.  Basically everything we need to get the first coffee bar launched and running.

As a heartfelt thank you from us, we would like to give you a token of our gratitude for partnering with us to make Narrative a reality.  Each partnership level comes with a corresponding gift straight from Narrative’s line of lifestyle products.

The Impact

By contributing to Narrative, you join us in making an impact on multiple spectrums of society. 

First, you impact the lives of other entrepreneurs.  Through Narrative's coffee bar and the Narrative Network, entrepreneurs can more tangibly understand that they don't have to leave their profession in order to have a profound impact on the world.  Their calling in the business world is honorable and has a powerful transformational impact.

Second, you impact  local communities.  As entrepreneurs realize the transformational potential of their businesses and act on that potential, communities are made stronger and more beautiful.  

Third, you impact international communities.  As entrepreneurs become effective beacons in their local community, we challenge them to take it a step further by using their business to transform communities in other cultures.  Often, these are communities that are experiencing difficult living conditions and need someone to have a transformational presence among them.  

Risks & Challenges

With any business there are huge risks.  We have been working hard over the past 2 years to minimize the risk of failure.  We have done this by conducting thorough research, listening to the needs and desires of those in our community, and through learning from our friends who already own coffee shops.  

In addition to the business risks, there are also risks that come with empowering and equipping other entrepreneurs to transform communities.  Many of our strategies have yet to be tested, although they were created out of intentional and thorough research we conducted.  Narrative’s culture is such that we aim to fail fast and small, learn from those failures, and then adapt our strategy to become more effective.  

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to contributing, you can help also Narrative by being an ambassador for our cause in your social circles.  Promote this campaign among your friends and share updates about Narrative as we journey forward. 

Your prayers are also extremely crucial.  We cannot accomplish our dreams and goals without God working powerfully in and through Narrative. 

Frequently Asked Questions


Is the coffee shop in the crowdfunding video a Narrative coffee shop?
No.  The coffee shop in the video is actually EDSA Beverage Design Studio, where we were trained as baristas and interned for the past year.  They were so kind as to allow us to use their shop as one of the settings for our video. 

Are contributions tax-deductible?
Unfortunately not.  Crowdfunding is viewed as the giving of a personal gift from an individual or individuals in order to fund a project.  Because the coffee shop is technically a for-profit company, contributions to the start-up funds we need are not tax-deductible. 

How will you use funds you receive beyond your $29,500 goal?  
Additional funds received through this crowdfunding campaign will be used in two ways.  First, they will be used to open additional Narrative coffee bars.  This allows us to have a transformational presence in additional communities.  Second, the funds will be used as seed money for the Narrative Foundation, which we will be establishing in 2017 to help other transformational business start-ups. 
Where will the coffee bar be located?
We are currently in the process of finalizing a location for our first coffee bar in the Makati Central Business District.  This is the major hub for business in Metro Manila.  We are targeting to open the bar inside of an existing co-working space, which provide a steady customer base, ample seating, and networks for Narrative. 

What will your menu look like?
Our menu will include slow brew coffee options using single origin beans, espresso based beverages, a selection of signature beverages unique to Narrative, loose-leaf tea offerings, and grab-and-go food options such as artisan pastries, sandwiches, greek yogurt, and fresh fruit.

What is specialty coffee?
Specialty coffee is coffee that is grown, harvested, processed, and served with great attention to detail.  On a quality scale of 1 to 100, specialty coffee beans must have a grade of 80+.  Almost all specialty coffee is Arabica, but there are some great specialty Robusta beans in the market.  

Because specialty coffee is of much higher quality than commodity coffee, farmers get paid much more for their crops.  This helps to increase the quality living for coffee farmers.  Specialty coffee companies take great care in ensuring that communities where coffee is grown are benefited and not harmed by the coffee industry. 

How many staff will you have?
Currently we have one full time staff, David.  He is our business developer and will be a regular barista at Narrative once we open.  In addition to David, we are planning to hire one additional staff member as a barista, shortly after opening. 
In addition to having paid staff at Narrative, we also welcome interns and volunteers who want to learn how to barista.  

What is the Narrative Network all about?
The Narrative Network is comprised of entrepreneurs from around Manila who are passionate about making a deeper impact through their profession.  Currently, we meet monthly at an event called "Curated Talks" where we dialogue on a number of relevant topics, encourage one another, and collaborate together.
story_txt:
Summary 
We have a dream of seeing entrepreneurs confidently and proudly using their profession to make a lasting impact on the world.  We believe that you can do this in a way that strengthens the business at the same time.  There are many great examples of this already happening, but we believe it can happen on a much bigger scale resulting in transformational results around the world.  We have, no doubt, an ambitious, long-term plan to get there which includes a creating a transformational business, forming a network of likeminded business people, and a establishing foundation to give entrepreneurs starting small and medium transformational businesses the boost that they need to get on their way.
So that’s super overwhelming and big picture-y!  So why don’t we start small?


In order for our big vision to happen, we first need to build a prototype business that displays the transformational potential of businesses that have a deeper purpose than just financial profitability.  With both of us being passionate coffee drinkers and specialty coffee baristas, we just knew that it would be natural make this prototype business a specialty coffee company.  
Along our journey we discovered the name Narrative Coffee Company.  We were so drawn to this name because we have seen time and time again the potential of when two or more narratives connect.  It happens so often that a brief introduction or connection that we originally don't think of meaning much, turns into something much deeper, long-lasting, and life-altering.  And it all starts when your path or your story connects with someone else’s.  "Stories connecting" could mean two people meeting for the first time.  It could also mean someone encountering God for the first time in a tangible way that results in them having a deeper purpose for living.  That is what drives us, and we want to use our coffee shop to create the perfect environment for the connection of stories to take place.  
But why not do this alone?  Well the simple answer is, we are far more effective when we work together collaboratively! This is where you come in!
   What We Need & What You Get 
We believe that we are far stronger when we work together!  Over the past two years, we along with our business developer, consultants, and a team of amazing volunteers, have been putting in the hard work of building the business: tasting coffees, networking with other artisans of all types, developing our business model, and experimenting with different concepts.  We are now ready to open our first coffee bar in September 2016, and now all we need is your help to make this happen.  


We are raising a total of $29,500 USD.  These funds will cover the cost for Narrative’s first coffee bar, machines, brewing equipment, initial stock, reserve operating funds, etc.  Basically everything we need to get the first coffee bar launched and running.
As a heartfelt thank you from us, we would like to give you a token of our gratitude for partnering with us to make Narrative a reality.  Each partnership level comes with a corresponding gift straight from Narrative’s line of lifestyle products.   The Impact By contributing to Narrative, you join us in making an impact on multiple spectrums of society. First, you impact the lives of other entrepreneurs.  Through Narrative's coffee bar and the Narrative Network, entrepreneurs can more tangibly understand that they don't have to leave their profession in order to have a profound impact on the world.  Their calling in the business world is honorable and has a powerful transformational impact.Second, you impact  local communities.  As entrepreneurs realize the transformational potential of their businesses and act on that potential, communities are made stronger and more beautiful.  Third, you impact international communities.  As entrepreneurs become effective beacons in their local community, we challenge them to take it a step further by using their business to transform communities in other cultures.  Often, these are communities that are experiencing difficult living conditions and need someone to have a transformational presence among them.  
    Risks & Challenges  
With any business there are huge risks.  We have been working hard over the past 2 years to minimize the risk of failure.  We have done this by conducting thorough research, listening to the needs and desires of those in our community, and through learning from our friends who already own coffee shops.  
In addition to the business risks, there are also risks that come with empowering and equipping other entrepreneurs to transform communities.  Many of our strategies have yet to be tested, although they were created out of intentional and thorough research we conducted.  Narrative’s culture is such that we aim to fail fast and small, learn from those failures, and then adapt our strategy to become more effective.     Other Ways You Can Help In addition to contributing, you can help also Narrative by being an ambassador for our cause in your social circles.  Promote this campaign among your friends and share updates about Narrative as we journey forward. Your prayers are also extremely crucial.  We cannot accomplish our dreams and goals without God working powerfully in and through Narrative. 




Frequently Asked Questions

story:
OpenWebGIS is an open source Geographic information system (GIS). OpenWebGIS was founded in 2014. Over this period of time, thousands of users have taken the advantages of this system functions. The site and the blog have tens of thousands of views. All this time the developers team has done everything at their own expense, providing a completely free and open access to the system and its source code. Many new functions were added and App for Android OS was created.
Thanks to everyone who supported morally OpenWebGIS all this time.
Now OpenWebGIS needs funds for a qualitative leap in its development!
This system has been and will always be free and open, but the time has come when your support is needed in the form of financial assistance, in order that the system would continue to exist, evolve and help you in your work and life with new useful features. By means of funding you give thanks for the work on the creation of the existing functions and help in the creation of new ones. Share our plans and be part of the process! Be involved with other users who believe in us and share our vision!



The new actively developing GIS called OpenWebGIS supports and implements the ideology of open source software. According to its developers opinion, the ideology advantages of open source are in the following:
  • Developing and using open source software - is one of the ways to the true freedom of creativity and mutual assistance in the modern human society.
  • Open source software allows to the wide range of people to use advanced information technology in their work, daily activities and scientific research, free and absolutely legal, without severe restrictions of proprietary software.
  • Open source software provides greater freedom in developing new technologies and improving existing ones.
  • Open source software can be installed without any restrictions, used, modified, distributed in all scientific, educational institutions, offices, personal computers, in all government and commercial organizations and institutions, according to the General Public License GNU (GPL), BSD and others. 
Taking into account all this, we believe that in scientific research it is often more effective to use open source software. We suppose that it is easier to build and complete open source software for the needs of the scientific organizations and individual researchers, rather than to wait for the owners of proprietary software to offer necessary additional applications. This agrees well with an open scientific process of software development and problem solving, where the speed is important in implementing solutions and the ability to fix something instantly.
Currently OpenWebGIS  is still an insufficiently developed and powerful system, and it still requires some improvement, but however now, in our opinion, it gives to its users fast and efficient decisions in some challenges faced by them in the field of GIS technology.

Now the OpenWebGIS users can:

Create, export and add layers in many common geospatial formats (gml, kml, geoJSON, gpx, shapefile, tiff, arcgrid, csv, osm), make vector layers with points, lines, polygons, add WMS layers, use WPS, style their own data, share as embedded maps, share as web pages, customize Interface, use analysis functions, create 2D, 2.5D and 3D maps. In Android App you can use sensors, WiFi statistic in you mobile device and refer this data to geographic coordinates. The OpenWebGIS blog and a  full list of articles about OpenWebGIS provide a lot of information about possibilities and specific features of OpenWebGIS.




OpenWebGIS is gaining recognition and trust of highly skilled professionals in the field of Geographic information system. OpenWebGIS is written about and referred to. 

In the media:

  • Web Mapping, Part 2 (http://www.xyht.com)
  • Web mapping (Part 1, The Basics) (http://www.xyht.com)
  • About OpenWebGIS and 3D maps at Cesiumjs.org (http://cesiumjs.org)
  • SIG Online Open Source! 3D! (In Spanish) http://mundocartogeo.blogspot.mx
  • Heatmap, JavaScript, Openlayers and canvas (http://www.digital-geography.com)
  • Heatmap and Interpolation: it is easy in OpenWebGIS (http://www.digital-geography.com)
  • The information tools (data base and GIS) to help paleontologists in their scientific researches (http://www.digital-geography.com)
  • Integration of OpenWebGIS with “OSM Buildings” JavaScript library (http://blog.osmbuildings.org)
  • Un nuevo paradigma visual para la interpretación de datos en la investigación urbana (In Spanish) (http://www2.ual.es/RedURBS/BlogURBS)
Some links to OpenWebGIS, where it is mentioned among other famous GIS:
  • https://mixdyr.wordpress.com
  • http://www.edukator.pl
  • http://gisgeo.org/catalogue/soft.html

Global Goal:

The development of an open source Geographic information system(GIS) called OpenWebGIS, which will be closer in its opportunities to desktop universal GIS systems and have some additional features that distinguish OpenWebGIS from many desktop and other online web GIS (for example, the module of the time series forecast or satellites tracking - it is available in the menu item "Calculations->Time and matrix analysis" and “GeoDataBase->Satellites Tracking” respectively). The system should be focused on scientific analysis of spatial (and preferably not only spatial) data. Also the system must be designed to have simple, understandable and used by many people functions, as well including some entertaining functions to attract a wide range of users (for example, the game on modeling of animals populations. It is given now in a rather simple form, this game is available in the menu item “About”)
Here are some tasks which will be solved with your help for the goal achievement:
  • Redesigning the interface. There will be some variants from which the user can choose (but you need to bear in mind that you have already had the opportunity to adjust the interface - further information is given in this video:
    An important part of the work will be the increasing of mobile usability (for users of mobile devices.
  • Producing source code refactoring. It is planned to be done with the help of other professional programmers or obtaining their advice.
  • Now the system is guaranteed to work in Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome. It is planned to optimize it for other browsers.
  • Organizing the sampling and mapping data from huge amount of open geo databases, for example as The Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF). You as users can offer databases for mapping data.
  • Extending offline (local) mode functionality (for example, use OpenStreetMap, Google maps or other base maps in offline for web and app, use more analytic, calculation functions in offline mode).
  • Creating App for iOS.
  • Translating the interface into other languages with the help of professional translators, and may be also as described in this article. Now, there is English, French and Russian online interface. Android App has only English interface. The next step will be to update the French translation of the interface and the translation into Spanish, and then into many other languages.
  • OpenWebGIS is in a need for new, more powerful hosting. It is necessary to register its own domain name.
  • There will be more written educational articles about the creation of similar systems and their parts.
This list of tasks can be enhanced according to your suggestions for expanding existing and adding new features or functions to OpenWebGIS.

What You Get

At your disposal the multifunctional system and its source code working online/offline on the majority of desktop operation systems (via the browser), as well as on Android for many mobile devices and iOS for Apple hardware

story:
About Our Company

I have always been a bit of an entrepreneur and go getter, running a successful construction and sheet metal business for a long period of my life. But at the age of 38 I came down with a genetic eye disease called Leber optic neuropathy that ended with me becoming blind. For a long period of time I was sad and depressed and struggled to keep my business alive until finally I had to give it up.

Initially when I got diagnosed the doctor’s had given me two years before I would go blind, instead I had gone blind in only two months. Instantly I went from making upwards of $1200 a day to only $1200 a month on Social Security. The state or more specifically BESB (Bureau of Education System for the Blind) wanted me to go to work for somebody else in a ‘vocational rehab’ program. But I just couldn’t see myself working for somebody else after being independent for so long. I thought long and hard about what kind of business I could handle being blind.

It wasn’t long before it hit me as I had been making beef jerky on and off for friends and family for over 30 years. A recipe that I had learned from my grandmother and had been thoroughly tried and tested. Once I knew what I was going to sell I had to come up with a name and I wanted it to play off my disability. I thought about it for a long time before Blind Jerk Beef Jerky was born. Everyone I have ever given samples to have all loved my meat, it’s the best jerk around!

 

The Campaign

With this Indiegogo campaign I hope to fund the startup costs of opening Blind Jerk Beef Jerky LLC. . BESB will cover our initial inventory and equipment costs, but in turn require that we provide a matching $5000 combination of liquid and in-kind contributions. The costs associated with opening a business are many and your donations will go directly to offset these expenses and help us meet the requirements from BESB. Those include; licensing, filing and application fees, marketing costs, promotional material (posters/cards/etc...), associated permits, and any other misc. costs that might occur. Your help no matter how small will see that this great product can be enjoyed by all. With your contributions and the people I have by myside there’s no doubt Blind Jerk Beef Jerky will take off! Even if you can’t contribute be sure to share our campaign and get the word out!
 

Our Featured Perk

Donate 100$ or more to help our campaign and you receive a hearty 3 oz sample of BOTH our sweet and spicy and infused jerky, a business card to share with friends, and a T-shirt!

story:
My Story and Business

My name is Mike Arnold and I'm the founder of Wheel Skinz Graphics. Wheel Skinz are easy to apply wheel accents designed to provide an affordable alternative to giving your wheels and car a new appearance. Today, the only methods used to achieve this look is to have your wheels painted, dipped, or sprayed with some type of coating, all of which are permanent, time consuming, and most of all, expensive.

What I'm Looking For

I'm hoping to raise $800 to get the business up and running. Funds raised will be applied to:

  • Initial production costs associated with the first line of graphics
  • Resources necessary to get to several markets and fairs to educate patrons about the product
  • The ability to travel to trade shows and automotive showcases, where I can best reach my target consumers.
  • Extending the product into new markets and in different online mediums

If the campaign is successful, it would truly mean the world to me. You can rest assured that your donation will go directly into making my business, my dream, and my life a great success.

My Personal Investment

I have truly devoted all of my time, energy, and resources into making this business a success. I believe in the product fully, and know that with the right backing it can really take off. That being said, starting a business by yourself brings with it a host of risks and I'm putting my financial well being on the line. This makes it no longer a business; rather, it's now my life.

Wheel Skinz are easy to apply wheel accents designed to provide an affordable alternative to giving your wheels and car a new appearance. The ability to travel to trade shows and automotive showcases, where I can best reach my target consumers.
Extending the product into new markets and in different online mediums

If the campaign is successful, it would truly mean the world to me. You can rest assured that your donation will go directly into making my business, my dream, and my life a great success.
My Personal Investment
I have truly devoted all of my time, energy, and resources into making this business a success. I believe in the product fully, and know that with the right backing it can really take off. That being said, starting a business by yourself brings with it a host of risks and I'm putting my financial well being on the line. This makes it no longer a business; rather, it's now my life.

story:
Everyone should know an Herbalist....

I've always said this, and I still believe it today.  

In the beginning, knowledge about herbs and remedies was only found in books, or learned from a teacher.  

Today, information about natural medicines is everywhere, but someone who really understands plants, and how to use them, is far more difficult to find.

I have spent the better part of 3 decades, learning my particular craft.  And while I have not offered my expertise in a retail environment before now... I find that I love it.  I have the opportunity to help so many more people than I ever believed possible.  Every day brings new people for me to share my knowledge with.

Hand crafted Herbal Tinctures

We Need A New Home & Space to Grow...

I began the tiny little shop in the Underground of Old Seattle two years ago - with zero experience in retail, no understanding of sales, and only a vague inkling of business management. 

In those two years, my tiny little shop has become a fixture in Pioneer Square, and my products are sold in several other locations.  I create products for a birthing center, pet stores and a local mercantile.  I ship my teas and balms and tinctures all over the world from our - now quite cramped - apothecary.

I took on apprentices to keep up with demand (now there is an apprentice waiting list!) and every one of us contribute in own way to healing the world one person at a time.

And then, in the midst of the blossoming of my dream - gentrification struck, and our building was sold; our lease terminated.  Time to move?  One month! We have to be completely moved by the 31st of May.

We know our community needs us...

There is only one place in our corner of the city where someone can come and speak to an herbalist - in person.  Just one place where everything is made by hand, created to order if need be.  

One place where you know that from field to farm to apothecary, everything is real, everything was grown with care, harvested with care, made by hand.  That's us.

So many clients rely on us and the products we craft. For us, giving up was never an option.

Determination is key...

Right now, our biggest obstacle is finding the best location to rebuild our shop. Pioneer Square - as much as we love it here - has no small storefronts for lease.  So we have chosen to focus on the nearby International District.  Full of funky little spaces, and diverse cultures...

We think we will fit right into the neighborhood - and hope to be welcomed.

Of course, the other obstacle is having the capital to create a space worthy of our dream.  Not just rebuilding our apothecary, but (with room to grow) we can offer classes, books and spices, resources and information and esoterica for the pagan or spiritual community!  Lots of tea to sip and space to read... a true sanctuary in the city, filled with nothing but good things.

Everyone matters...

Please accept our thanks, in advance if you can contribute to this campaign... however we have never been all that focused on money - so even if you cannot contribute with your dollars, we would sincerely appreciate anyone who can spread the word, share this with their circle, or simply send us your good wishes.  

And do come by the new shop, please, so we can thank you in person and offer a cup of tea to warm you.

Please check back for updates...

We look forward to finding our new location, and will be sure to update this campaign with that information (and photos!) as soon as it is cemented.

story:
-The Future of Honey is Here-

If you're here that means you probably love honey, same as we do. However putting honey in your drinks could get very messy, or even annoying sometimes. That's why most people use other sweeteners for their drinks, rather than honey.

Our goal is to make honey more convinient for the everyday use, that's the main reason we invented Globee.


What is Globee?

Globee is the world's first dried artisan honey sphere, created to sweeten your drinks, and also make life a little easier.


Our Mission

Did you ever get sticky, and everything messy around you after using honey to sweeten your drinks? We know how frustrating this can be, that's why our team reimagined the honey sweetener experience.

We are raising 10,000 $ to bring Globee to life. We think it's an awesome, innovative product, and we stand behind it 100%! 

Your support will allow us to initiate tooling, and manufacturing, so we can make Globee available to you!

This unique design was inspired by nature, we have spent several months to create the finest holding case for our honey spheres and we got it... It looks just like a honeycomb structure!

Worker bees seal their comb cells for protecting honey with wax, to prevent absorption of moisture from the air.

We are using the same principle, but with different materials.

In order to ensure the quality of the nineteen honey globes, we cover their capsules with a golden alu foil. That way to protect them from harmful external effects like; light, sunray, air, and humidity.

Why use Globee?

  • No more stickiness
  • Quick to use
  • Rich honey taste
  • Healthier than other sweeteners
  • Each capsule is also easy to separate


It's ideal for every home kitchen, or if you're on the go, just grab a few capsules and take them with you!


Globee Perfectly Fits Into Your Capsule Holder!







We would like to expand our honey selections for you, if we reach our goal!




-Nutrition Data-

*One box of Globee contains nineteen honey spheres, which has total 1216 Calories.

story:
The Magazine

MÜV Magazine began as a way to create, collect, curate and share inspirational stories and experiences, but as we grow we’re hoping to tackle something bigger: We’re hoping to help centralize the discussion of parkour culture as it pertains to more than just movement, and expand the professional opportunities available.

Our discipline is a rapidly emerging and evolving subculture, in much the way skateboarding and rock climbing were in decades past: Gyms and parks are sprouting up all over the world, practitioners are creating their own fashion brands, and major events are held and funded by recognized sponsors every year. And as the sport enters the mainstream consciousness it becomes increasingly clear that an important transformation is underway.

Our subculture is still amorphous, and primordial, and in a constant state of being defined and redefined. What really is Parkour culture? In many ways we simply don’t know yet, and that’s because it’s still being invented! It’s an exciting time, but it’s also a tenuous one in which our sport runs the risk of being co-opted by outside forces.

At MÜV Magazine we believe it’s important that Parkour culture always belong to the practitioners. That the great project of defining our movement, our culture and our philosophy always belongs to us! And by creating a center for that discourse MÜV Magazine is hoping to help democratize the discussion as it moves forward. To help our movement and culture always reflect the true spirit of the practitioners and athletes who are our readers and contributors alike.

And creating opportunities to become a contributor is an important part of our plan. Until recently, MÜV Magazine has been a one-man operation run by Andrew Obenreder, but after hundreds of lonely hours, MÜV Magazine is finally expanding! And building a dedicated staff is just one step in our goal to create additional careers paths within parkour.

We want to expand professional opportunities, fund projects voted on by the community, create a space for the discussion of parkour culture, and most importantly, we want to make sure your voice is always a part of helping define what parkour truly is.

But in order to achieve all of these goals we need your help! While future revenue streams will allow us to continue growing and providing a good portion of our content for free, we need initial funding to get the process underway! MÜV Magazine began as a side-project on a shoestring budget, but has turned into something much more than that. Please join us in moving forward. Help us to create the first parkour culture platform run by the community, for the community. Please donate what you can, become a subscriber, share with who you know and follow us on social media to join the movement!

It all begins somewhere, and we believe it’s here.


What We Need

We are looking to raise a minimum of $50,000. We've projected that between the original magazine platform and our other in-development platforms, we will need to invest roughly $150,000. We know it isn't a small amount but we know that with the help of the community we can get there.

So we're asking for a dollar. If everyone within the community, everyone who watches parkour videos, and everyone who supports or enjoys our movement gave a single  dollar (an amount that most of us throw away or take for granted), we could go above and beyond these numbers to create something beautiful together.


Donate Or Subscribe?

If you donate, you will also receive a subscription for your donation level. However, this time around, your subscription will be at least 50% off and you'll also receive the perk for your level and those below.


$25 Donation: Müver (Regularly $60/year)

Premium content (monthly), digital book, member card (partner discounts), STEREOMÜV and MÜVD access.

$150 Donation: Müvers + (Regularly $300/year)

Includes all Müver level perks, discounts on premium content.

$300 Donation: Müvers Collective ($600/year)

Includes all Müver level perks, free and discounted premium content, help in direct creation of a project, producer credit in productions and invitations to special events and screenings.

$500+ Donation: Müvers Society

Includes all level perks, free premium content, invitations and free entrance to all special events and screenings, special gift and other benefits dependent on donation level .


Interested in donating directly? Help save us some money by using our self-hosted donation page: http://muvmag.com/donations/startup/


Our Current State


During our biggest period of development, we hit a plateau and this campaign sprung into existence. Although our team of 9 is currently putting in full-time hours into the project, it simply isn't enough to get it where we want it to be. We're all currently working full or part-time jobs that consume the additional time and resources we have that are needed to continue pushing the project forward to the state that the parkour community deserves and needs.

Outside from this, platform development has come to a crawl. While we had enough knowledge to get the platform to where it is, we're not inherently developers and need some outside help.

We're also currently on cloud shared hosting, which has been great to start but  resource-wise is no longer suitable for the platform. But upgrading to something dedicated, powerful, and scale-able costs a lot more money than we have at the moment and time is running out as our current hosting is up on June 18, 2016.


Projects in the Works


Making A Movement Facility is a collective guide on starting and managing movement facilities with input, advice and tips from some of the largest and most developed gyms within the parkour community including APEX, Parkour Visions and more!

Dylan Baker: The Descent is an in depth exploration of Colorado athlete Dylan Baker, his past, present and future, as we follow him through the process of tackling his most ambitious descent to date.


The Art of Cheap Travel is a collective guide written by Andrew Obenreder featuring stories, advice and tips from other experienced travelers on how to travel the world cheaply while getting the most out of your experience.

Nick & Max Get Tattoos shows that a bond between friends is more than skin deep. Training video featuring Max Henry and Nick Ortiz.

Nomad Hacks: Hobo Swag Bag is a guide for making the best sweatpants bag for when you've gotten nothing left to carry things in but your pants.


Welcome to Steel City: Parkour Culture City Guide to Pittsburgh is the most comprehensive parkour city guide of Pittsburgh featuring the biggest and best training locations, where to eat, buy gear, who to stay with, how to get around and more! The next best thing to crashing on my floor. More cities coming soon!

Korey Sarvas: Taken is the tragic story first hand account of the loss of our friend Korey Sarvas as told by Julian Vasquez.

SUBSTANCE: Piracetam follows Andrew Obenreder as he experiments with a nootropic or smart drug, Piracetam, which has become popular among traceurs for video gaming, for it's cognitive effects while training.

Humans of Parkour: Spontaneous Youth is a mini video portrait documentary  following a creative group of friends who have taken their experiences within parkour and translated the benefits into another passion, inspiring the world around to create change through creative media.

WFPF Vegas: A Conversation | Jacob Cormier's expose on the WFPF Vegas Competition is a personal journey to discover what’s at the heart of our discipline. Full coverage of the event paired with conversations from athletes all over the world delve deep into the matter of whether competition will change the soul of our sport.


The KO Shoe review will include a thorough review of all three new KO models: Drop, Pres, and Gen3. These three will be put through the most thorough, one-week destroy test any parkour shoe has endured.


Born Explorer: Abandoned is the first episode of Nomadik Projekt's Born Explorer series. The vlog style film follows Andrew Obenreder and friends through a journey of self discovery and adventure within places that have been long forgotten.

Platform Development


What started simply as an online magazine is quickly developing into the first and most comprehensive parkour culture platform covering all aspects of our movement: the movement, art, music, philosophy, fashion, news, the people, the stories and all the other things that make our community unique and ours.

Platform development currently consists of finalizing magazine website design, developing the MÜV News, Stereomüv, MÜVD, THEWORLDMÜVS platforms; as well as translating the entirety of our platform (websites, articles, videos) into Spanish, German, Italian and French (with more languages to come in the future).

MÜV News is an international news channel dedicated to parkour culture. 


Stereomüv is a streaming music service for while on the move. The service features the largest curated parkour soundtrack collection, music to train to, artists within the parkour community, and the ability to create your own playlist.


Stereomüv homepage preview.


Stereomüv custom playlist.


MÜVD is a dedicated parkour culture media channel, housing all the best shows, videos, and films within the community.

MÜVD homepage preview.


MÜV Magazine channel.


MÜVD video player preview.


THEWORLDMÜVS is a social-creation platform that operates on the sharing of ideas and the support of the community to bring inspiring projects to life. Created with the intention to keeping our movement and growth in the hands of the community.

The Future & Impact


You are helping creating a centralized place of discussion for parkour culture, the creation and curation of inspiring stories, and the development of something that truly represents who we are and what we do. What started as a simple side-project grew into something of unbelievable magnitude. Something much bigger than myself, than the people involved or the community. Something that started for fun has become something that I now see will help guide parkour into the future.


The Money


Other Ways You Can Help


Not everyone can contribute and we understand, but that doesn't mean you can't help.

  •  Share on social media, ask your grandma, yell from your rooftop, tell your local communities, post it on the forums (do these still exist?), or ask your friendly telemarketer when he calls. The more people that see this, the more money we potentially can raise.
  • Become a contributor and send us content or tell us what you want to see! http://muvmag.com/submit/
  • Become a free member at http://muvmag.com/subscribe/
  • Follow us on social media.
  • Does your team, organization or business have something to offer to the parkour community (product, service, etc)? Give our subscribers discounts and or other benefits and gain access to our subscriber base as a sales channel. Become a MÜV Magazine partner today at http://muvmag.com/contact/
  • Have a skill to offer? Become a volunteer at http://muvmag.com/contact/


Interested in donating directly? Help save us some money by using our self-hosted donation page: http://muvmag.com/donations/startup/

story:
Short Summary

11-year-old Mr.Cory, with the help of his mom Lisa, has been running a successful cookie business since he was 5 years old. Mr. Cory's Cookies offers a large variety of cookies made with all-natural, mostly organic, high-quality ingredients (not wacky ingredients with names that are impossible to pronounce).

Cory and his mom sell cookies in food and farmers markets in New Jersey and New York City, and he sells out at every event. Cory has corporate clients and retail clients as well. Now he wants to sell his cookies and cookie dough online so that cookie lovers across the country can enjoy his cookies too!


The Impact

A Personal Note from Mr. Cory, CEO:

Dear Cookie Clients and People of the World:

I founded my cookie business when I was 5 years old so that I could buy my mom a car. I was sick of taking the bus to go anywhere, especially in the cold and the rain. Plus, she really deserves it.

We sold our cookies in local farmers markets in New Jersey and New York City, and everybody loved them. Then, in September 2014 my story broke on the Ellen Degenes Show, and it was SOOO cool! I was the happiest kid on earth, and my dreams were coming true. Ellen, Ford and Shutterfly gave me a CAR!

I was also selected to be on Masterchef Junior in the beginning of 2015, and that was GREAT! I learned SO MUCH from Chef Ramsey, Chef Bastianich, and Chef Elliot, and all the other kids on the show. After that, my cookie business went through the roof. I had more orders than haris on my head (that's a lot of orders)! I was so excited for the future of Mr. Cory's Cookies!


But then we ran in to some problems. Growing the business and getting cookie dough available for sale online was a lot harder than we ever anticipated. I like to read about successful businesses, and I read from Mr. Howard Schultz, CEO of Starbucks, that bad stuff happens even in the biggest businesses sometimes.

So we are not ready to give up!

We have had some incredible experiences with the media, which has helped a lot of people across the country learn about our cookies. Everyone wants to try them! We just need the funding so we can make our cookie dough and send it out to you all.

I know there are so many people who love Mr. Cory’s Cookies, and you have already helped take my dream this far. I want to thank everyone who keeps sending us emails and writing to us! You are the best! Thank you for believing in me, my mommy and my Cookie Team.

Cory Nieves

CEO, Mr. Cory's Cookie



What We Need & What You Get

Our goal now is to make our cookies and cookie dough available to everyone across the U.S. so that you can have Mr. Cory's Cookies and be a part of his story and the love he shares around the world! YOUR help will allow us to do the following:

  • Rent and customize a commercial kitchen with appliances and all the ingredients to fulfill your orders, starting with these campaign pledges!
  • Create proper packaging and nutrition labeling 
  • Update our website and branding Improve our online store to make it easier for you to order your cookie and dough 
  • Maintain our van for delivering cookies all over New York and New Jersey 
  • Establish our shipping operation to make sure your cookies and cookie dough arrives safely 
  • Promote cookies at farmer's markets & trade shows 
  • Keep up with demand and continue to grow our business~
The online cookie dough is just the start, and we want you to be a part of our success for a lot more years to come!




Risks & Challenges

As a young company, we understand that the road to success can be filled with potholes.

Fortunately, we try to surround ourselves with experienced business owners who have traveled the same roads before us, and tap into their wisdom. When and if issues/delays do arise, we think it’s best to confront them head on - as most customers don't like surprises. Being proactive will ensure outstanding customer service - something Mr. Cory really prides himself on.

We have already spent a lot of time trying to launch our cookie dough product. It was more complicated to do than we thought, and more expensive too. So we have learned a lot about how to do it right. That is why we decided to ask you to help us start with the resources we need to make it happen this time around.

Always believe that the impossible can become possible. Never lose sight of your dream!


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please share our story and this link with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat and wherever you spend your time! Look for the little buttons here on the campaign!
  • Share some encouragement, share your own cookie stories with us, or your own business advice! We love to learn from the people all around us!

Thank you thank you thank you!

Look for the little buttons here on the campaign! Share some encouragement, share your own cookie stories with us, or your own business advice! We love to learn from the people all around us!   Thank you thank you thank you!

story:
Bonjour !

Merci d'être venu faire un tour sur la page du ‘’projet’’ Indiegogo de La Bette à Cath, lancée et administrée par la fondatrice Catherine Fortin-Dubé.

Certains d'entre vous en avez entendu parler, certains s'en doutent et pour d'autres ... SURPRISE!!!

Un de mes rêves devient réalité après plusieurs années de préparation mentale, de formation dans le domaine, de réflexion et de planification... J'ouvrirai finalement mon commerce alimentaire – La Bette à Cath – cet été! Dès la fin juin, les habitants et visiteurs de Notre-Dame-du-Portage pourront profiter d'un Café / Bar à Jus&Smoothies / Fast-food santé en plein cœur du Village. C'est donc un projet qui alliera saine alimentation et ambiance décontractée dans un décor champêtre à seulement quelques pas du fleuve. Tous les mets du comptoir-rapide seront en formule ''prêt-à-manger'' ou ''à emporter'', avec un nombre limité de places assises à l'intérieur ainsi que quelques-unes sur le terrain arrière et la terrasse : faisant face au fleuve et au coucher de soleil dans les montagnes ! Cette offre alimentaire (et cette expérience) unique à Notre-Dame-du-Portage sera évidemment la bienvenue tant par les locaux que par les touristes.

Sur cette page, vous pouvez faire une contribution pour aider le projet, en échange d'une ''contre-partie'' : un/des chèques-cadeaux de la valeur de votre choix. Cette campagne de socio-financement a deux buts spécifiques:

1. Compléter le financement de mon inventaire de départ afin que je puisse vous offrir tous les produits au menu dès la première journée d’ouverture. En effet, les institutions financières ne finançant pas l'inventaire de denrées alimentaires, il me manque un petit peu de liquidité pour bien démarrer.

2. M'aider à bâtir mon ''carnet de commande'' afin de pouvoir confirmer à mes autres investisseurs que la clientèle est belle et bien intéressée et que la population de Notre-Dame-du-Portage (de Rivière-du-Loup et des environs) est plus que prête pour ce type de comptoir alimentaire. Vos achats m'aideront donc en plus à obtenir le reste du financement dont j'ai besoin afin d’avoir la liquidité nécessaires aux achats d'ouverture..!

C’est d’ailleurs une des raisons pour laquelle j’ai choisi de lancer une campagne de socio-financement et de fonctionner par vente de chèques-cadeaux plutôt que par donation/prêts/crédits. J'ai effectivement besoin de liquidité pour acheter mon inventaire alimentaire d'ouverture et fournir quelques garanties à mes fournisseurs et autres, mais je tiens absolument à ce que vous obteniez votre ''retour sur investissement''. En achetant un/des chèques-cadeaux, c'est seulement comme si vous pré-payiez vos futures commandes :) et vous pourrez choisir ce qui VOUS conviendra sur le menu lors de vos visites. La balance des chèques-cadeaux sera remboursable - si vous venez acheter un item au comptoir : c'est-à-dire que si vous n'utilisez pas votre coupon, il ne vous sera pas remboursé. Par contre, si vous achetez pour 6.00$ avec un chèque-cadeau, vous recevrez 4.00$ en monnaie. N'hésitez pas à en acheter pour votre famille et amis. Mon but premier est bien sûr de vous attirer à venir voir, à goûter mes produits et à tomber en amour avec La Bette à Cath!
-------------------------------
Pour ceux qui ne me connaissent pas, j'ai grandi à Notre-Dame-du-Portage et Rivière-du-Loup avant de quitter la ville quelques années pour Québec et Montréal. J'ai étudié en Techniques de diététiques (DEC Cégep Limoilou) ainsi qu'en Sciences de l'alimentation (BAC Université McGill). Alors que j'ai travaillé comme aide-cuisinière et serveuse pendant mes études, j'ai par la suite acquis de l'expérience professionnelle précieuse en gestion de service alimentaire, en nutrition communautaire, en hygiène/salubrité et gestion de la qualité, en recherche & développement de produits alimentaires ainsi qu'en gestion de projet pour une multinationale.
-------------------------------
Je suis extrêmement confiante et motivée et je me sens prête pour mener ce beau projet de front, armée de mes plus précieux collaborateurs, VOUS! J'ai d'ailleurs l'intention de profiter de cette première saison d'activités pour bien écouter et noter vos remarques/commentaires/conseils afin de m'adapter à la demande, et faire évoluer notre commerce dans le meilleur intérêt de sa clientèle.

*Si vous ne pouvez/voulez pas contribuer, vous pouvez quand même m'aider en répandant la bonne nouvelle de l'ouverture imminente et en partageant notre campagne aux gens de votre entourage qui pourraient être intéressés.

** Pour être avisé de l’ouverture, connaître l’horaire, voir le menu lorsqu’il sera rendu disponible et suivre les développements du projet, je vous invite à joindre notre page Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/LaBetteNDDP

Merci pour votre temps et pour votre confiance ... et au plaisir de vous voir cet été!!

Catherine

story:
Theatre on Horseback...

A ragtag group of pirates searches for buried treasure on horseback.  Elves ride unicorns on a Quest to bring magic back to the land.  This isn't your Netflix queue.  This is what you're doing this weekend.

Themed, costumed trail rides bring fantasy to life, allowing regular folks to indulge in their dreams.  The entire experience, from safety lecture to trail ride, is conducted in costume and in character by our performers.  Participants are encouraged to wear their own costumes.

Unicorn & Centaur is a group of Savannah area riders, trainers, tour guides, actors, puppeteers, teachers, and storytellers.  We are passionate about riding, good horsemanship, and all things fantasy and fiction. 

Saddle Up!

To bring fantasy trail rides to the Lowcountry, Unicorn & Centaur needs more costumes and more horses.  Total startup costs in our initial campaign are $5000.

Trail horses:  We are currently seeking two trail horses.  We are open to rescues and owner surrenders, but the horses must be sound with a rider at a walk and trot.  $1000 for each horse, $100 each for trailer fees.

Tack:  Saddles and bridles.  We have quite a stash of tack, but horses almost always need a new saddle, and little extras like girths and bits will be required, depending on what horses we acquire.  $1200 for trail saddles, $300 for trail bridles, and $300 for bits, girths, saddle pads, and stirrups.

Costumes for horses:  Artax, our unicorn, already has his own costumes.  But the new guys will need fancy duds.  Materials for unicorn and pirate costumes for two horses are $300.

Costumes for humans:  Costume pieces will be provided for participants who don't bring their own.  Helmets with costume helmet covers will be worn by all riders while mounted.  Costume boot covers, plus pieces such as sashes, belts, gauntlets, necklaces, and wigs will be provided.  Helmets are $200, costume pieces are $500.

Donations enable you to enjoy perks such as 50% discounts on trail rides and photography sessions, gift certificates for fantasy trail rides, and even special extras like a video thank you from our puppet fairy godmother, or a gift certificate for a private carriage tour of downtown Savannah.

If our campaign goal is not entirely reached, funds raised will first go to acquiring two great trail horses.  Our herd of horses will be the foundation of all that we do.  Partial funding will not deter us from reaching our goal of fantasy trail rides, however, it just might take us longer to get there.

Wait.  Unicorns?

We seek not to compete with the local equestrian community, but to enhance and complement it.  If you are a beginner, we are a safe place for you to learn about horses and riding.  If you are a seasoned rider, we offer you a break from trotting endless circles in the arena.  And we have unicorns.

The alpha mare of Unicorn & Centaur's herd is Michelle Padgett, who has spent the last 18 years entertaining Savannah's people.  Her BFA in theatre helped her write plays for local theatre groups such as the Drama Bums, build and write shows for the Puppet People, and perform in the occasional Murder Mystery with the Odd Lot. 

Michelle has been riding since 1974, and since 2003 has devoted her time to caring for and training Savannah's horses, from Norwood Stables in Sandfly to Historic Savannah Carriage tours downtown, where she works as a tour guide.

Unicorn & Centaur is the culmination of all her life's work.

Real Talk

What if you threw a party and no one came?  Of course our biggest fear is that there will simply be no interest in this area for our kind of nerdy fun.  The good news is that, even if trail rides aren't booked, the horses will be fed and worked and cared for.  The horses in our herd, their physical and mental well-being, are our topmost priority, and their care is guaranteed regardless of sales or interest in this project.

Other Ways to Help

If you can't donate money to our campaign, but you got all excited when you saw pictures of a unicorn and you still want to contribute, don't despair!  Here's what else you can do to help us make this happen:

  • If you are in the Savannah area and have horses or tack to donate, contact us at unicornandcentaur@gmail.com.  We can travel about an hour to examine/pick up.
  • We are also accepting donations of fabric, trim, and notions.  If you're in our area, we can come pick it up, email unicornandcentaur@gmail.com.  If you are out of area, send pics of your donation, and if it's on our list, we'll reimburse you for shipping charges.
  • Share this page to anyone you think would be interested in our project: equestrians, horse lovers, cosplayers, pirates, princesses, and adventurous souls. 

Thank you for helping us make our dreams a reality.
