story:
Please help us reach our goal to raise $30,250 to transform our beloved local pizzeria, NY Pizza Patrol, based in Draper, Utah, into a successful franchise of the award winning NYPD Pizzeria, which was ranked as one of the top 55 fastest growing franchises in Franchise Times Magazine.

We also invite you to eat with us, film with us and join us on our epic journey as we document our transition on film via America's Next Big Franchise (ANBF), a brand new docu-series that will showcase NY Pizza Patrol's story in their first season.

Turning a local restaurant into a top notch franchise is a formidable task, even for a seasoned franchiser.  Doing it on a tight deadline of just 8 weeks and a limited budget of $30,250 turns a formidable task into an almost impossible one.  But luckily for us, we will be guided by the expert team from ANBF, which will be featuring our transition in their exciting first season.

ANBF will start filming in the fall of 2016, and we have a ton of work to do before then to ensure we meet our franchisee’s exacting standards- updating the décor, installing upgraded equipment, hiring and training more team members, tweaking menu items and keeping customers happy.

Donors will have opportunities to be a part of our journey- by joining us when we film episodes, previewing our new menu items and  watching the episodes. This exciting new docu-series will be distributed in 2017 via an OTT network such as Netflix, Hulu, Amazon or Atlys.

When you stop by NY Pizza Patrol, you will experience amazing food (made fresh daily) and top notch customer service.  But we’re not just known for our food, we're known for our heart.  That's because we treat our employees like family and participate in several training programs that offer jobs to the “unemployable”- people with disabilities, recovered addicts and others that may be shut out of the regular workforce.  Many of them wind up becoming star employees that end up inspiring others.  We also encourage all of our employees to cross-train and learn valuable business and leadership skills.


What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $30,250 to transform the NY Pizza Patrol into a successful franchise. Donors will be part of the NYPD Pizzeria family, and have opportunities to be invited to filming opportunities, menu tasting events, transition updates, and more.  When you contribute at higher levels, and you'll also be invited to our exclusive grand opening party and be featured on our founder’s wall. 

The Impact

So when you help fund our franchise dream, you also fund the American Dream as you enable us to support local farmers; serve the best tasting food in a friendly environment enjoyed by friends, families, dates and everybody; provide even more well-paying jobs with opportunities for advancement and offer top performing employees an opportunity to own a piece of the business.  The effects of your funding gets multiplied in the community, making it  win-win for everybody!

About Bill Herndon

Bill is a passionate entrepreneur with over 20 years of experience in business development.  In 2013 Bill was presented with the opportunity to become a partner in NY Pizza Patrol.  He has spent the last 2,5 years in Utah, as the Managing Member and General Manager for NY Pizza Patrol.  During that time the business saw an increase in profits and operation  efficiency.  Over the 2.5 years the business has generated over 1.2 million in revenue,  by turning the pizzeria into a franchise the potential success rate jumps to over 90% and revenue growth up to over a million annually.  Mr. Herndon was able to improve the business mostly by focusing on streamlining operations, improving custom service and overall food quality.  He understands every aspect of the business operation and will continue to evolve the business into a successful franchise.   Mr. Herndon has created a unique employee bonus structure where the best performing employees have an opportunity to grow with the business.

'About NYPD Pizzeria

NYPD Pizza has been developing the art of the pizza business since 1996. Our love for pizza started back in New York City in the 1970’s, where founder and CEO of NYPD Pizza, Paul Russo grew up in a prideful Italian neighborhood. He was always surrounded by people who appreciated the experience and flavorful taste of an authentic New York slice. Call it pride, but we wouldn’t serve it any other way. Since we started franchising, we have developed a straightforward system which allows our franchisees to go through training and utilize the elements we created to operate their own business. 

Our commitment and focus has always been to develop our stores to be a turn-key operation for our franchisees and that is exactly what we have created. From our brand strategy manuals, to our POS software system and restaurant policies; all were designed so that the franchisee would never have to reinvent the wheel. Support, training, national distribution alliances, marketing strategies, and guiding principles are all part of the NYPD Pizza franchise package. There have been modifications to menu items along the way as we grow and thrive, we here at NYPD Pizza constantly develop and research what is best for the franchise system as a whole without compromising our core quality product.

From the first year of stepping onto the pizzeria scene in 1996, we have been awarded scores of awards including Best Pizza in Orlando as well as other cities around the United States more than 30 times. NYPD Pizza has been ranked one of the Top 55 fastest growing franchises in Franchise Times Magazine and listed as a Top 200 Pizzeria in PMQ Magazine. With our many years of experience and dedication, we have looking to expanded the NYPD Pizza Team and brand in select regions of the United States. NYPD Pizza is in the pizza business to give the people what they want, and that’s a Authentic New York slice of pizza! We are devoted to superior customer service and will only use the highest quality ingredients available to produce our menu items. 

The NYPD Pizzeria Mission:

“To protect and serve only the best authentic New York style pizza in a family friendly neighborhood atmosphere while committing to provide exceptional service to our customers, franchisees and squad members.” 

- Paul Russo, Founder & CEO


Risks & Challenges-

With any new business there are definite risk.  However the success rate of a franchise restaurant is much higher than an independently owned restaurant.  Another plus is the fact that NY Pizza Patrol has been in existence in Draper, UT since 2010.  We feel confident that the business will continue to grow.  When challenges do occur we will have the support of the franchiser to help guide us through any unexpected challenges. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please fund our dream and make it a reality!  If you want to help, but don't have the cash, then please spread the word about our campaign to your friends and family, on social media, and come to our Grand Opening and visit us when we are filming.

story:
Introduction & Story

Hello :) My name is Cameo and I am the co-owner and founder of Foxy Fruit Acai Bowls & Smoothies. I run this women owned startup alongside my mother and co-owner, Julie. What we do is serve high-quality smoothies and smoothie bowls out of a pop-up tent in Phoenix, and it is our mission to provide healing food and edible art. Our goal is to be a positive force in the community by serving beautiful bowls to beautiful souls!

I have been a passionate, healthy living advocate for over 4 years. I was completely self-taught until I attended the Southwest Institute of Healing Arts in Tempe, AZ, and became a certified Holistic Nutrition Specialist. I first started experimenting with smoothies at the very beginning of this life-long healthy living journey, and I simply began by eating more consciously and plant-based. Years later, my love for eating healthy and creating the most perfectly delicious smoothies and smoothie bowls has grown into an artistic hobby of mine that I very much enjoy sharing with others. Creating beautiful smoothie bowls and experimenting with recipes has become my favorite creative outlet. I have several years of knowledge and experience as a vegan chef, with a primary focus on raw vegan food. I am dedicated to sharing my knowledge, love for healing food, and Foxy Fruit's delicious edible art creations with everyone.

At Foxy Fruit Bowls & Smoothies, all of our ingredients are nutritious, organic, vegan, gluten-free, and local when possible, because I believe those are the qualities that make food REAL --- food that has the ability to transform lives and heal bodies. Every recipe is intentionally created using nutrient-dense superfoods that provide your body the opportunity to achieve optimum health. Each bowl is a unique, mindfully decorated piece of art, topped with organic fresh fruit, gluten-free granola, coconut flakes, and more.

Foxy Fruit, as a whole, truly emanates love and passion. We feel that people are becoming more conscious of the food they eat by making more natural, healthy choices. Foxy Fruit addresses this growing need for clean, nutritious, and trustworthy food options. Best of all, our smoothie bowls aren't just food, they are an experience. From the colors, to the taste, we turn our food into edible art, providing an incredible presentation, leaving you satisfied from start to finish. We also serve our product in compostable packaging, our recipes are completely plant-based, are free of artificial juices and sweeteners, and we always have many options to choose from, including ever-changing seasonal recipes by incorporating produce grown by local farms in the Phoenix area.

People all over the world love the concept of smoothies and bowls due to their taste, health benefits, convenience, and natural beauty. The team at Foxy Fruit has a passion to provide this healing food to our community. We are driven to cultivate inspiring and beautiful vibes that you can feel and taste.

 

Our Campaign

This campaign is important to us because it will not only take our business and passion to the next level, but it will give us a permanent platform to be able to serve our edible art with the community on a daily basis. I have been told many, many times that customers wish they could come get a treat from us whenever they would like. We very much enjoy serving at occasional local events, however, it would be a dream come true to be able to have a successful brick and mortar in the heart of downtown Phoenix where customers could have easy access to our unique, healthy food option whenever they wish!

The magnitude of this project is huge. This is the biggest and most amazing goal I have ever worked towards achieving. We are extremely grateful for this opportunity and will do whatever it takes to make it happen! The shop we are opening is a small 160 square foot renovated shipping container. It's in the most ideal location in downtown, right off 1st St near Roosevelt Row as well as Arizona State University's downtown campus. Our storefront will be in collaboration with several other locally owned food businesses and stores that will reside in the same complex.

The opening of this shop could have the potential to benefit every single person who lives in or visits Phoenix, and will only add to the artistic, creative, and fun feel that the downtown culture already has. The craze about our deliciously beautiful food is only growing more and more as days go by, so naturally, the demand for our product is growing with it! This location will be the best thing to ever happen to this daughter and mother team, and will be a truly wonderful addition to this great city.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal here is to receive support on the funding needed for operating expenses once we open our doors.

We were blessed enough to secure funding for our equipment costs, however, we need to make sure that we are able to pay our rent, bills, employees, taxes, etc in the first few months (the hardest months) of opening our doors. The goal we have set here is the bare minimum needed to make sure our expenses are paid for for the first month of operations, in addition to my own personal savings.

***Even if we reach our goal, extra donations will be used towards ongoing working capital as well - so please do not hesitate to help if/when this campaign goal is reached!***

We have several awesome perks in store for backers. When you contribute to this campaign, you not only help make this goal a reality, but you also become a collaborator with the Foxy Fruit team. This IS NOT possible without your support, so we want to make sure you know just how grateful we are for your generosity by giving back in the best way we can!

 

The Impact

Your contribution is so very valuable. Opening up a location is not cheap and not easy. We are humbly reaching out for your help so that we can better serve YOU! 

We have had crazy success over the past year. From our very first event at the Full Moon Festival in April 2016, we have had the blessing of gaining a major fan base right off the bat. Over the past year, that fan base continues to grow. Our product definitely speaks for itself!

 

Risks & Challenges

Opening up a location does pose risks. The honest truth is that the worst thing that could happen is that we don't make enough money and we have to close our doors. 

What qualifies me to overcome these hurdles is my dedication, passion, and willingness to work as hard as I need to be successful. Once I set my mind to something, I make it happen - no excuses. I am a creative problem solver and a go-getter. My mother is also very resourceful and extremely hardworking. We make an unstoppable dream team!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to donate monetarily, but would still like to contribute, please share this campaign through an email blast, and on social media sites such as Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter! Share with anyone who you know that would be interested in collaborating with a small business with a big, bright, and beautiful future. :)

Thank you SO much!!!

Love,
The Foxy Fruit team


(Scroll down for more perks!) --->

story:
Who are we?

Dr Mark has been a chiropractor in Raleigh North Carolina for 35 years. He has a wide background from working as a EMT, Physician Assistant, and working in the ER all before settling down in Raleigh and becoming a Chiropractor. Dr Mark had a vision to make a difference in the wellness of people. When Dr Mark met Judi she was able to help him find a way to make that difference. She had worked as a massage therapist, and had worked with many chiropractors, but with her background in business, she knew she would be able to help create the vision that Dr Mark had wanted. Having gone to Cornell University for Hospitality Managements, Judi felt that hospitality needed to be extended to the working class that might not have experienced 5 star amenities.  It made her think what is hospitality really all about. It's about having an enjoyable memorable experience and its convenience.

What We Need & What You Get

We figured a way to help the working class and keep the cost down was to get a bus. This way we would keep the cost of overhead down and be able to extend good health to the working class that might not been able to afford chiropractic care in the past.  However, it is very expensive to outfit a mobile clinic. We have been fortunate enough to purchase our bus, but still need to raise additional funds to get the bus completely serviced, and built out correctly.  We were also able to come up with some great perks, as a reward for your support.

The Impact

The great thing about our bus is that it could travel all over the triangle and help the working class who couldn't afford to go to the chiropractor because they don't have insurance, it would cost them a days pay, or/and they couldn't leave work for an appointment.

We are also working on becoming a B corporation and help the opioid abuse community with every hundred cracks we give we will give an hour back to the opioid abuse community.

Risks & Challenges

Fortunately with eliminating the cost of overhead and being stuck at one general location, we really have eliminated the risk and challenges that some might face. Plus we are really able to extend the savings.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Also don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much in advance for your support!

story:
That Book Store's Store(y)

‘Shop Local’ has become the mantra for successful communities. Although books can be bought online, we know that personal recommendations, not projected by an algorithm, provide more value to the consumer. We understand the frustration of the local community in finding a place where book clubs and those in literature communities can meet. As book lovers and life-long readers, we can anticipate what shoppers hope to find in a local independent bookstore.

Southern Hartford county is a place with only one big box store locally. There is no book store this side of the Connecticut river within an 8 mile radius. That's sad! People of southern Hartford county are smart and know that "reading is fundamental". They also know how important small businesses are for a state like Connecticut.

That Book Store LLC will be a locally, veteran owned and operated bookstore in Southern Hartford County. That Book Store LLC will be owned and managed by book lovers who have their finger on the pulse of the book industry. We will bring our unique experience in the book industry to owning and managing a place for book enthusiasts to come and get personalized recommendations from book lovers.

I am Karen Opper, a recent transplant from Florida. I love where we live in Connecticut, in one of the oldest towns in the state, Wethersfield.  It's beautiful here and full of history and culture. We enjoy all 4 seasons and live so close to both Boston and New York. There is one thing our community is missing though, and that is an independent bookstore.

About the brains behind That Book Store LLC:

I have been a book lover my whole life. I blog reviews and book related mind vomit over at KissinBlueKaren. I have been blogging since 2010, and blogging books since 2014.

With me in this venture, is my daughter Belle. Belle is a recent high school graduate of Wethersfield High School. She spent one semester in college in Florida before heading home to help me pursue this dream.

Officially here's our story...

Karen Opper was an Army Combat Medic and served six years as a Sergeant and Squad leader in the 319th Medical Detachment. Karen holds an associate degree from Saint Petersburg College. Karen also graduated with honors and earned an award for Academic Excellence from Southeastern College. Karen is a graduate of the Leadership Distinction Program. Karen has run a successful website, primarily reviewing books and discussing book trends, for the past four years along with being employed full-time for the Veteran’s Administration’s VA Hospital as a nurse.

Isabelle Opper is a recent graduate of Wethersfield High School. She has volunteered in her school’s libraries for over five years. She was the President of Wethersfield High School’s literature magazine and one of the founding members of Gay Straight Alliance. Isabelle has planned and organized numerous events and is experienced networking within the local community.

With your help, we will bring That Book Store LLC to a place centrally located for the towns of Rocky Hill, Wethersfield, Newington, and Southern Hartford, CT. This part of Connecticut needs an independent bookstore and we want to bring it to them.

 

What have we done so far?

I'm so glad you asked! We have been really busy getting things set up to make That Book Store LLC a reality. Here's what we have done so far...

Legal:

  • Filed That Book Store as an LLC with the state of Connecticut
  • Paid for a sales and tax permit with the state of Connecticut (effective 6/1/2018)
  • Obtained a federal tax ID to pay payroll and federal taxes
  • Purchased the domain for That Book Store
  • Purchased an SSL for the store website which includes McAfee security for purchases.
  • Purchased and set up a website for the store thatbookstore.com
  • Studying the resources provided by the Small Business Association.

Community:

  • Started an email campaign for people to subscribe to for details about progress and events.
  • Went on a local book store “tour” to see exactly what competition look like.
  • Set up email campaigns on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and That Book Store’s website.
  • Spoken with local independent bookstore owners about marketing and things to watch out for in commercial leasing.

Financial:

  • Joined American Booksellers Association (ABA is a national not-for-profit trade organization that works to help independently owned bookstores grow and succeed)
  • Utilized all the free educational offerings on ABA’s website along with bookseller-to bookseller forums to learn more about successful bookselling.
  • Obtained a SCORE mentor, John Molish, who has over 30 years in the bookselling and publishing business.
  • Partnered with Libro.fm to offer customers audio books that support That Book Store LLC.
  • Picked a point of sale system (SquareUP) that is affordable and functional.
  • Set up accounts with a wholesale book distributors Ingram Content and Baker & Taylor.
  • Opened a business bank account.
  • Written up a solid business plan.

What We Need, Exactly

We did the math, and we need about $100,600 to get That Book Store LLC going.

  • Books and non-book merchandise: $35,000 Yea, that's a scary number but we are actually being conservative with that number. We do plan on partnering up with some local companies to carry bookish merchandise along with books new and used.
  • Point of Sale System: $1,100 Once again, we are being conservative and going with a low cost option that provides the support we need to keep track of inventory and accept payments.
  • Furniture/Fixtures and Store Improvements: $40,000 This is an approximate dollar amount and we are going to do everything we can to keep under budget for this. No store is ready to go right away. It will need paint and flooring. Books need shelves and we also need decorations, and lighting to create the perfect atmosphere for the store.

Obviously, we are not asking for the full amount of these costs. I will be contributing no less than $20,000 of my own money and asking a bank for a loan for the remaining balance. Your contribution means we will owe less of a business loan and be able to invest more to make That Book Store LLC the best it can be.

 

The Impact

Hartford County houses approximately 895,000 residents. making it the second-most populous county in Connecticut. An independent bookstore is just what this area needs.

Although the Connecticut market appears to be growing smaller, we believe it will be a wake-up call for Connecticut residents to invest in local businesses and shop local. All the research we have done with Booksellers nationwide has shown that local independent book stores are here to stay and can thrive if they have ties and are invested in their local communities. We live here and shop here and we want to give southern Hartford the opportunity to have their own independent bookstore.

Press

We were featured in an article in American Bookseller's Association Bookselling this Week. Click the graphic to go straight to the article.

We were recently featured in an article in the Hartford Courant. Click the image to go straight to the article.

Shelf-Awareness posted an article about us. Click the graphic to see it.

 

Kari from Kari Reads and Writes wrote up a post about That Book Store.

Daniela Ark from Nocturnal Devices wrote about us in one of her posts.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share this campaign on social media
  • Leave a comment on this page (more comments mean better ratings for this campaign and that equals more exposure)
  • Follow us via email, Facebook, Twitter, and/or Instagram
story_txt:
That Book Store's Store(y)
‘Shop Local’ has become the mantra for successful communities. Although books can be bought online, we know that personal recommendations, not projected by an algorithm, provide more value to the consumer. We understand the frustration of the local community in finding a place where book clubs and those in literature communities can meet. As book lovers and life-long readers, we can anticipate what shoppers hope to find in a local independent bookstore.
Southern Hartford county is a place with only one big box store locally. There is no book store this side of the Connecticut river within an 8 mile radius. That's sad! People of southern Hartford county are smart and know that "reading is fundamental". They also know how important small businesses are for a state like Connecticut.
That Book Store LLC will be a locally, veteran owned and operated bookstore in Southern Hartford County. That Book Store LLC will be owned and managed by book lovers who have their finger on the pulse of the book industry. We will bring our unique experience in the book industry to owning and managing a place for book enthusiasts to come and get personalized recommendations from book lovers.
I am Karen Opper, a recent transplant from Florida. I love where we live in Connecticut, in one of the oldest towns in the state, Wethersfield.  It's beautiful here and full of history and culture. We enjoy all 4 seasons and live so close to both Boston and New York. There is one thing our community is missing though, and that is an independent bookstore.
About the brains behind That Book Store LLC:
I have been a book lover my whole life. I blog reviews and book related mind vomit over at KissinBlueKaren. I have been blogging since 2010, and blogging books since 2014.
With me in this venture, is my daughter Belle. Belle is a recent high school graduate of Wethersfield High School. She spent one semester in college in Florida before heading home to help me pursue this dream.
Officially here's our story...
Karen Opper was an Army Combat Medic and served six years as a Sergeant and Squad leader in the 319th Medical Detachment. Karen holds an associate degree from Saint Petersburg College. Karen also graduated with honors and earned an award for Academic Excellence from Southeastern College. Karen is a graduate of the Leadership Distinction Program. Karen has run a successful website, primarily reviewing books and discussing book trends, for the past four years along with being employed full-time for the Veteran’s Administration’s VA Hospital as a nurse.
Isabelle Opper is a recent graduate of Wethersfield High School. She has volunteered in her school’s libraries for over five years. She was the President of Wethersfield High School’s literature magazine and one of the founding members of Gay Straight Alliance. Isabelle has planned and organized numerous events and is experienced networking within the local community.

story:
Queer Nightlife in Río Piedras

+ House of De Show

The first edition of De Show was in June of 2016, and we've held it every single month since, offering up a new theme each time. (A few faves: Queer Power, Kings of the '90s, our first-ever Ball, Monster Mash for Halloween.) We've gotta brag a little here, but mostly because anyone who's never been to De Show may not truly get it: This party is incredible. It consistently draws a big crowd. (Hiiii, fans and friends, THANK YOU. We love you. So much.)

>> You can check out our Facebook page here. <<

The LGBTQIA community of San Juan, and Río Piedras near the University of Puerto Rico campus especially, has fully embraced De Show, and we are so thankful for that. Our group of performers – drag kings, drag queens, fluid queens, anti-drag artists – work hard to make every edition more incredible than the last. Some of them have even been featured in Puerto Rican publications like Índice and El Nuevo Dia.

In the beginning, Warhola Pop was our host (she's since moved to NYC) and the group was about five or six performers, tops—and now we're organizing shows that feature 12 to 15 individual performers. The group keeps growing. And the crowd keeps growing, too.

Our mission has always been to provide an inclusive, safe(r) space for the queer community—from the University to the rest of Río and San Juan and the island!—so they can connect and feel empowered. It's more important now than ever to stand strong as hell, and our fierce performers encourage everyone to find their strength and hold it tight. With that mission in mind, we've kept the show in Río Piedras, save for the Tropidarkx collab in January at El Local in Santurce. When we started out, we were the only queer party in the area, and we felt like it was important that De Show continued to fill that void.

Now, there are even more queer parties in the area; they're increasingly more frequent, and all of them are amazing! That only serves to prove the point here, though. We're grateful for the businesses who have opened their doors to any and all queer parties. But the LGBTQIA community still needs its own spot in Río Piedras—a permanent place to showcase queer art, music and culture, a place that's queer-run, a place that's more than a spot for drinks and a show, but is also a thriving hub for the queer community.

The Plan for Loverbar

Loverbar will be the community hub the queer community deserves. It's not just about House of De Show; our doors will be open to all queer performers and organizers. And we'll work to bring acts from beyond Puerto Rico too, from drag stars to bands or experimental artists to anyone else we know our crowd wants to see.

We've already got a spot picked out for Loverbar. It's in Río, close to everything. ;) The decor is going to be incredible—we don't wanna spoil the surprise, so let's just say it's gonna be really campy and fun. We plan to be extra thrifty in that department, though. What's really gonna set us back financially is all the permits required to open, plus the cost of renting the space while they're processed. The stage and bar need to be constructed too, though for that we're using mostly recycled materials, and we've got plans lined up with a handyperson from our community who 100% supports our cause.

We've got some funding set aside, but in working out our full business plan (yes, we did that!), we've realized we're gonna need some help.

We appreciate any and all support we can get. That's why we're offering really awesome rewards—many of them provided by members of our community—in exchange. There are totes, buttons, makeup lessons, photoshoots, vintage jewelry and more!

Who is She?

I'm Jhoni, by the way. I'm the "Mama" of House of De Show; I work to organize the party each month. It's a collaborative process in which everyone helps, though. Loverbar will function the same way. Yes, I'm technically the one opening the club -- but the whole team is an integral part of the effort, and they're the driving force behind it. We hope to have the entire community involved, really. We're determined that Loverbar be queer-powered both in its events as well as the folks who keep it running, from management to bar staff to door security.

In case you're wondering: Yes, I know what I'm doing. I have experience in opening and running a bar/venue. I am a co-founder of Club 77, located in Río Piedras just around the corner from where we'll open. We opened in 2014 after about a year of planning, building, permit processing, etc. As an owner at the Club, I managed on a daily/nightly basis, handled inventory (a shared responsibility), and I booked and organized all kinds of local and national acts, including tons of drag shows (which eventually led me to the idea of De Show).

Last September, however, I decided to turn over my share of ownership so that I could focus on writing full-time (I'm also a freelance journalist). I kept De Show going because it needed to exist. I knew when I left, though, that eventually, when the timing was right, I'd open another place, and that the focus would most definitely be queer culture.

In the same way that Club 77 continues to fulfill its mission to help grow the independent music scene of San Juan, Loverbar will be a conduit for growing and supporting queer arts, culture and community.

The time for Loverbar is now. Our business plan is solid, the crowd is there, the space is waiting. We are READY!

The queer community of Río Piedras truly needs this. I hope you'll join us in making it happen.

Note: You may have noticed the location of our campaign is set to Atlanta, Georgia. That's where I'm from originally, and it's where my sister lives. Indiegogo doesn't work with non-U.S. banks. (I use Oriental here in PR.) Thankfully, Indiegogo customer service has informed us that a team member with a U.S. bank can—so she'll be the one receiving the funds and sending them over to us. :)

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand that not everyone can afford to contribute financially. That's OK. You can still support us by sharing the campaign video and page, telling a friend about our effort or just coming out to the next edition of De Show! (We'll have buttons and totes for sale at the shows soon, and we're organizing some fundraising events in the coming months, too!)

Your support, in whatever form it takes, means EVERYTHING to us.

story:
Short Summary

Lean Strategy Masters is an on-line training curriculum designed to help business managers who are responsible for developing company strategy "master" successful formation of business strategies.

Why care? Did you know that a recent study of corporate failures showed that 80% of the companies’ lost value was due to poor strategy? That results in corporate downsizing, depressed salaries, and no bonuses. Even if the strategy error is not corporation-threatening, it can force employees to be held responsible for business results that aren’t possible. And the problem is, only 7% of companies are any good at strategy formation, according to this study by PriceWaterhouseCoopers.

Lean Strategy Masters is designed to help remedy the situation. People who enroll in this training program learn how to implement a novel approach for developing company strategy called the Lean Strategic Decision Model (LSDM). Where is the proof that LSDM can help you? Here is a testimonial from one company.

Lean Strategy Masters is affordable for everyone and any sized company.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to produce Lean Strategy Masters we need $15,000.

The Lean Strategy Masters Program will contain nearly 20 separate instruction modules divided among three sections:

We have a wide range of Perks from $15 all the way to $15,000, and a wide range of products from copies of my books, t-shirts, and flash drives all the way up to a  custom LSDM  consult to help your company resolve a strategic challenge.

The most important Perk is the Founding Member. For $395, Founding Members are enrolled into the Lean Strategy Masters training program. Founding members also get access to our monthly webinar where they have the opportunity to ask questions, review new cases or see new training material. And, they’ll receive a free ticket to a full-day Fall, 2017 workshop in Chicago. The Perk cost is 10% of this $4,000 value.

Why Crowdfunding

On-line training programs are becoming increasingly popular. During our research on successful ones, we discovered the following recommendation: "Don’t invest in developing an on-line training program unless you know that people really have a need for it."

This makes crowdfunding the perfect way to test our concept in the market before we spend the money to develop it. We believe that the time is right for our training program, and we’re hoping this crowdfunding campaign will validate our belief. And since we are offering a really low cost to Founding Members (i.e., people who are willing to fund Lean Strategy Masters before it has been developed) it’s a win-win situation.

The Impact

In our video you learned about Marie being confronted with a strategic challenge and not knowing how to address it. This is a true story, though the name has been changed. From my own observations in business and research conducted to write my books I’ve learned that Marie’s experience is not unique.

When we humans encounter a challenge that we don’t know how to address we find it hard to start. We stress out. But once we see a way to move forward, most of us set off to tackle the problem. It is not knowing how, that stops us. The Lean Strategy Masters program is all about providing a cost-effective mechanism to help business people learn how to approach strategic issues.

A Short Training Module Example

Take a look at this video, which is an example of the kind of education module the Lean Strategy Masters will provide. It is a short 5 minute module that represents the real-world businesses cases that will be contained in the Advanced Perspectives section. Most of the other training modules will use the same format and last about 45 minutes.

 

Risks & Challenges

The training module content is already developed. So no risk there.

Our biggest risk is developing an engaging set of training modules. We’re pretty sure that you’re not really interested in standard college lectures using PowerPoint slides. To help make sure we deliver on this goal, we’ll be enlisting some of our Founding Members to serve as a beta team. We’ll develop the first course or two and preview the course with our beta testers. Then we’ll assemble their feedback and implement their recommendations.

The other risk is funding. If we can’t reach a minimum number of Founding Members, then we’ll need to evaluate whether the need we see really exists. If we reach a minimum number of Founding Members, we’ll self-fund the remaining costs and deliver the Lean Strategy Masters program.

Other Ways You Can Help

Now we know that not everyone works in a company position where strategic decision-making training is relevant. But you probably know someone who does.

If you can’t contribute you can still help by getting the word out to people you know who may benefit. Lean Strategy Masters would be great training for small company owners and managers, for entrepreneurs and start-ups, and for companies with revenue between $10M - $100M that may not have a strategy department.

Help us by telling your network about this campaign.

Biography

Steve Garchow is the President at Foresight Business Consulting, a Chicago-based strategy and marketing firm. Steve is obsessed with making a difference in the way companies form strategic decisions. He believes any company can significantly improve performance by implementing a defined strategic decision process, including his own proprietary process, the Lean Strategic Decision Model.

Steve started as a market researcher, eventually building his career by assuming greater marketing and general management responsibility. As VP, Global Marketing for a Fortune 300 company. Steve became intimately involved in strategy formation. Then, as the leader of a multidisciplinary task force established to select the next generation portfolio for one of the company’s half a billion dollar franchises, Steve recognized the need to develop a new decision approach. He developed a process to overcome the team’s problems of incomplete issue framing, inadequate decision criteria identification, endless data collection and detrimental group dynamics. Using this structured approach, his team successfully forged the new franchise. After stints as a senior manager of two start-ups, Steve launched his consulting company.

Steve is the author of two books, the most recent achieving international best seller status. Titled “Stratification: How strategic decision processes will create sustainable competitive advantage,” the book explains the barriers to strategic decision-making and techniques that mitigate them. He also contributed a chapter to another book, "Elite Entrepreneurs", where he discusses the importance of improving business strategy.

Since developing LSDM, he has presented the model in seminars, successfully implemented LSDM for clients and counts many companies as experienced LSDM advocates. Steve has discussed his strategy views on numerous radio and television broadcasts.

Steve earned his B.S. in medical technology from Michigan State University and has a M.H.A. in hospital management from the Ohio State University.

And since we are offering a really low cost to Founding Members (i.e., people who are willing to fund Lean Strategy Masters before it has been developed) it’s a win-win situation.
The Impact
In our video you learned about Marie being confronted with a strategic challenge and not knowing how to address it. This is a true story, though the name has been changed. From my own observations in business and research conducted to write my books I’ve learned that Marie’s experience is not unique.
When we humans encounter a challenge that we don’t know how to address we find it hard to start. We stress out. But once we see a way to move forward, most of us set off to tackle the problem. It is not knowing how, that stops us. The Lean Strategy Masters program is all about providing a cost-effective mechanism to help business people learn how to approach strategic issues.
A Short Training Module Example
Take a look at this video, which is an example of the kind of education module the Lean Strategy Masters will provide. It is a short 5 minute module that represents the real-world businesses cases that will be contained in the Advanced Perspectives section. Most of the other training modules will use the same format and last about 45 minutes.
 Risks & Challenges
The training module content is already developed. So no risk there.
Our biggest risk is developing an engaging set of training modules. We’re pretty sure that you’re not really interested in standard college lectures using PowerPoint slides. To help make sure we deliver on this goal, we’ll be enlisting some of our Founding Members to serve as a beta team. We’ll develop the first course or two and preview the course with our beta testers. Then we’ll assemble their feedback and implement their recommendations.
The other risk is funding. If we can’t reach a minimum number of Founding Members, then we’ll need to evaluate whether the need we see really exists. If we reach a minimum number of Founding Members, we’ll self-fund the remaining costs and deliver the Lean Strategy Masters program.
Other Ways You Can Help
Now we know that not everyone works in a company position where strategic decision-making training is relevant. But you probably know someone who does.
If you can’t contribute you can still help by getting the word out to people you know who may benefit. Lean Strategy Masters would be great training for small company owners and managers, for entrepreneurs and start-ups, and for companies with revenue between $10M - $100M that may not have a strategy department.
Help us by telling your network about this campaign.
Biography
Steve Garchow is the President at Foresight Business Consulting, a Chicago-based strategy and marketing firm. Steve is obsessed with making a difference in the way companies form strategic decisions. He believes any company can significantly improve performance by implementing a defined strategic decision process, including his own proprietary process, the Lean Strategic Decision Model.

Steve started as a market researcher, eventually building his career by assuming greater marketing and general management responsibility. As VP, Global Marketing for a Fortune 300 company. Steve became intimately involved in strategy formation. Then, as the leader of a multidisciplinary task force established to select the next generation portfolio for one of the company’s half a billion dollar franchises, Steve recognized the need to develop a new decision approach. He developed a process to overcome the team’s problems of incomplete issue framing, inadequate decision criteria identification, endless data collection and detrimental group dynamics. Using this structured approach, his team successfully forged the new franchise. After stints as a senior manager of two start-ups, Steve launched his consulting company.
Steve is the author of two books, the most recent achieving international best seller status. Titled “Stratification: How strategic decision processes will create sustainable competitive advantage,” the book explains the barriers to strategic decision-making and techniques that mitigate them. He also contributed a chapter to another book, "Elite Entrepreneurs", where he discusses the importance of improving business strategy.
Since developing LSDM, he has presented the model in seminars, successfully implemented LSDM for clients and counts many companies as experienced LSDM advocates. Steve has discussed his strategy views on numerous radio and television broadcasts.

Steve earned his B.S. in medical technology from Michigan State University and has a M.H.A. in hospital management from the Ohio State University.

story:
We are CheeseSmith

  • We are Molly and Brendan Curnyn and if you know us, you know we are passionate about our food. We have recently taken the plunge in starting our own Food truck business. We cannot wait to serve you some amazing food that we know you will love! Who doesn't love a good ol' grilled cheese? But how about a grilled cheese with cheddar cheese, roasted jalapenos, cilantro and chive cream cheese, jalapeno jam, and bacon? That's just a sample of what we will offer! It doesn't stop there! How about some charred street corn salad, truffle french fries, smoky tomato and red pepper soup, some fresh gazpacho in the hot summer months, and you can't forget about our homemade cheesecake with strawberry basil syrup!

 

What We Need

  • We need your help for the last push to get this truck up and rolling!
  • We need $5,000 for the remaining equipment, county fees, and startup costs, and most importantly a generator! We have purchased our food trailer and we're picking it up this week! Check out the pics!  
  • Check out the fun perks to the right! If you aren't interested in any offered perks, you can still donate by clicking " back it" underneath our goal number, you can contribute any number, every dollar adds up!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that's ok there are other ways you can help!

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
  • Share our indiegogo page, you never know when you'll run into a die hard grilled cheese fan who wants to show support.

How about some charred street corn salad, truffle french fries, smoky tomato and red pepper soup, some fresh gazpacho in the hot summer months, and you can't forget about our homemade cheesecake with strawberry basil syrup!

We need $5,000 for the remaining equipment, county fees, and startup costs, and most importantly a generator! We have purchased our food trailer and we're picking it up this week! Check out the pics!  
Check out the fun perks to the right! If you aren't interested in any offered perks, you can still donate by clicking " back it" underneath our goal number, you can contribute any number, every dollar adds up!

Share our indiegogo page, you never know when you'll run into a die hard grilled cheese fan who wants to show support.

story:
What’s SEVA Space?

SEVA Space isn’t your ordinary yoga studio. But it serves some extraordinary, ordinary people. The folks who come here aren’t trend-chasers or Instagram influencers. They’re farmers. Teachers. Healthcare practitioners. Veterinarians. Students. Parents. Grandparents. Great-grandparents. (Possibly great-great-grandparents, too.) 

SEVA Space is for everyone. We specialize in true, small-town, Winters, CA hospitality — roll out your mat as a first-timer and you’ll be hard-pressed to avoid making new friends. Our shoe cubbies are home to everything from sparkly flip flops to mud-caked cowboy boots. Attend one of our parties, and you might be coerced into trying someone’s homemade carrot cake or petting a baby lamb from the neighboring pasture. 

But it takes a village to raise a village up. “Seva” is a Sanskrit word meaning “selfless service” or work performed without any thought of reward or repayment. It’s the guiding principle that directs everything we do. We’re asking for help in continuing this mission and expanding on what we’re already built.

What are you doing that's so great?

SEVA Space is an environment for everyone to feel better physically, mentally, and emotionally. We’re not only committed to the yoga practice, but the people who practice the practice.

SEVA Space is inclusive
Everybody (and every body) is welcome here. All classes are beginner-friendly. Our instructors focus on safety and wellness over athletic achievement. We offer yoga and pilates, but also restorative classes, senior yoga, and meditation. Here, it’s not about the physical image or even the physical pose — it’s about looking inside, building strength, and trusting the teacher within.

SEVA Space is financially accessible
It’s 2019 in California. Yoga can be expensive. We do our best to make it affordable. We offer a sliding scale payment structure to accommodate a variety of financial situations, as well as discounts for public servants, students, the elderly, and folks enrolled in WIC and CalFresh. No one is ever turned away.

SEVA Space is community-driven
We put people first. And we hang out outside of class, too — you can find us out at our favorite local haunts or snacking in the studio after hours (yes, you can eat on the floor). We’ve hosted everything from live music concerts, to fundraisers, to pop-up boutiques, to Refuge Recovery meetings, to nutrition workshops. And we’re always open to new ideas.

And you need help, you say?

Yep. In our first year or so, we’ve taught yoga to hundreds of students. We’ve boosted people’s courage and confidence (and the occasional bicep or two). Now, we’re asking for help so we can keep doing this work, expand our services, and kickstart our outreach:

  • Cover operating expenses (to take care of the space and our instructors)
  • Add more classes in different time slots (to make it easier to get to class)
  • Offer more specialty classes (like yoga for kids or prenatal classes)
  • Host more retreats (to help people forge lasting connections in beautiful places)
  • Put on more events (like concerts, wellness & lifestyle workshops, community support groups)
  • Host guest speakers and guest teachers (a little variety never hurt)
  • Expand our online presence (by developing instructional videos and other content)

By contributing here, you’re not only supporting us, but the entire community we support. And we thank you.

What other kinds of help do you need?

There are so many other ways to help — you know the drill:

  • Share this campaign with your people on social media or via email (click the icons above)
  • Peruse our website and get in touch (sevaspacewinters.com)
  • Follow us on social media (we’re on Facebook and Instagram)
  • Leave us a Yelp review

But even more than all that: show up. Come to the space. Check out our schedule and try a new class. Bring a friend. Buy a gift certificate for your friend. (Doesn’t have to be the same friend.) Join us. Talk to us. And spread the word. 

Who's Kim?

Kim Stanford (BSHS, AHP, E-RYT 200) is the owner of SEVA Space. Kim holds a Bachelor's of Science in Human Services from University of Phoenix and a certification as an Ayurvedic Health Practitioner from the California College of Ayurveda in Nevada City, CA. In the last decade, she’s taught thousands of yoga, meditation, and mindfulness classes to thousands of people. She’s taught in hot studios, cool studios, public parks, continuation schools, and transitional housing facilities. She’s taught children and the elderly and folks with disabilities. And in 2018, she opened SEVA Space to serve the community she calls home.

story:
Short Summary

I am a baker and a farmer. It's time to show my daughter that it is possible to create a living with your own two hands. Foundation to roof, seed to loaf. Bucks and Hunterdon counties lack a wood-fired bakery to provide the community with fresh bread made from locally farmed grains. I want to change that. After two years of small scale baking, building a customer base and restaurant orders, it's time to build a bakehouse and an oven. My neighbor and I are teaming up to put the bakery on his farm. He'll grow the grain, it'll be milled right down the road at a historic stone mill we already work with and sold across the street from the farm at a local farm market where my wife works. Because the majority of my ingredients are sourced locally, even the salt, supporting this campaign is directly supporting small local family farms and a local family owned mill as well as area restaurants. This is a direct injection of capital and good local food into the region.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $12,000. This is all materials cost for the oven and bakehouse. My wife and I are putting everything we've got into this. Buying loaves up front helps offset this cost. If you used to live in the area and have family here, gift them loaves. Gift friends loaves. Traveling musician? Gift yourself loaves, road food is terrible. I'll deliver wherever, whenever. Live far away? Think of it this way: buying bread is a good excuse to get together for a visit, to bring old friends together, to introduce families. If you'll be on the east coast at any point I'll find a way to deliver your bread to you.

For larger donations I will cook you dinner in the oven and deliver it to your door. All the ingredients used in the dinner will be seasonally fresh and sourced from local family farms.

I will build the oven and the bakehouse myself with the help of friends skilled in the necessary trades---production carpentry, masonry and commercial electricity. Any money raised beyond the materials cost will go toward purchasing seed, wheat and rye, for the coming growing season to supply the bakery. It will also go to upgrading existing equipment needed to run a wood-fired bakery: chainsaws, a wood splitter, a commercial mixer, commercial scales, bannetons, speed racks, sheet pans, hotel pans, flour, salt, a water heater, lighting.

The Impact

The impact first is for the community. A bakery like this, with locally sourced and milled grains, acts as a way to support multiple family businesses at once. It is a direct contribution to the sustainability of agriculture, milling and farm markets here. The impact for myself and my family is incalculable. It is self-employment, self-sufficiency. It allows me to show to my daughter, by example, what it means to do for yourself, to make and build and create a life with your own hands.

Risks & Challenges

The market has been tested and a customer base built. A retail market is already secured, beyond bread subscriptions. Restaurant orders are already secured, one is just waiting on my building a bigger oven so I can bake all the table bread. The mill connection has already been made. My neighbor, who will grow the grain, has been farming grains for 60 years. Because there is not another bakery like this in the area, the demand is here and ready. The labor has been assembled and is ready to work. The real risk and challenge is in my ability to sustain the work in the long run, but when, like my family is, you're putting your life savings on the line there is no room for failure or quitting.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't financially support please spread the word, maybe your friends or family would like good bread or a nice wood-fired dinner. Feel free to gift bread to friends or family.

story:
Willamette Valley flax in bloom 2018; photo by John Morgan

 

Our Story

Flax will capture your imagination. It is beautiful from seed to suit. It is the oldest plant fiber in continuous use by humans. It absorbs moisture better, dries more quickly, and is one of the strongest natural plant fibers in current usage. You have seen the shiny brown seeds as a food, but you will be enchanted by the rest of the plant. Starting with the graceful long stems waving in the field to the ephemeral blue flowers that carpet the ground only hours after blooming. After harvesting the golden-green stalks are laid out to field rett and age. Then flax is baled and stored. When it is ready, further processing - breaking, scutching, and hackling - produces burnished silver hanks that are spun and woven into linen fabric which can be sewn into a classic summer suit. As if it is still alive, linen clothing drapes and flows on your body similarly to how it blows and waves in the field.

 

Linen in the Normandie region of France; this is our goal for the Pacific Northwest

 

From the time of the early settlers until the 1960’s fiber flax was a dominant crop in Oregon. During this period Oregon developed the only flax industry in the United States. At its peak 18,000 acres of fiber flax were produced and 14 processing plants were in operation in the Willamette Valley. Fibrevolution is ready to devote time and capital to bringing a flax fiber economy back to the Pacific Northwest. After thoroughly researching the successes and setbacks of the Willamette Valley's historic fiber industry, we believe in the economic and environmental viability of linen.

We are Shannon Welsh and Angela Wartes-Kahl, co-founders of Fibrevolution. We have the skills and experience to bring linen to market. We want organic, sustainably grown and harvested linen fibers. We want to build an economy that values people, work, plants and the land at every step of the process. Over the last three years we have teamed up with farmers, textile professionals, manufacturers, seed breeders and university researchers in our community who are inspired to participate in the revitalization of flax and linen in the Pacific Northwest. We need your help to purchase the specialized harvesting equipment needed to get the flax out of the ground and ready for processing.

 

August 2018 Oregon community fiber flax harvest; photo by John Morgan

 

The Community Impact

Natural fibers were integral to our past and now are a hope for the future. Aside from being beautiful, flax is a remarkable crop. It is poised to be a niche regional crop excellent for small-scale farms in Oregon as part of their existing crop rotations. It can be over wintered and dry farmed thereby filling a need for marketable winter crops and saving water. In addition, flax is planted at a high seed density which naturally suppresses weeds. Since flax is harvested by pulling stems directly out of the ground, after harvesting the field is clean and ready for planting.  The processing of flax into linen and many other industrial products is also clean with virtually no waste products. All parts of the plant have multiple uses. It can be made into home furnishings, apparel, building materials, paper, blended with cotton, wool, hemp and synthetics, and used as laminate for surfboard, canoes, bike frames, mopeds and automobile interiors. Its strength lends it to numerous industrial uses. 

Oregon farmers are always looking for new crops to add to their rotations, climatic changes require us to consider water needs for future farming, the marketplace is clamoring for regional sources for multi-use raw materials to shorten supply chains and reduce pollution. Organic flax farming in Oregon will be part of a growing international movement to employ regenerative, carbon sequestering farming practices, to onshore small-scale processing and manufacturing of high quality consumer goods, and to create circular economies that take to heart the reciprocity between the health and well-being of the land and the people who work it.

 

What We Need

Harvesting linen requires specialized equipment not manufactured in North America. We need to import small-scale flax harvesting machinery from Europe to move our project forward. We need machinery that can be easily transported from farm to farm in order to grow more flax and maintain our relationships with small scale farming sites. Our vision is to establish a flax growing cooperative like those we visited in France. In the French flax cooperative, each farmer tends their own field, but they share the costs of machinery and processing infrastructure. This fundraising campaign will result in Fibrevolution buying our own equipment and repairing a mid-1990’s flax puller currently on display at the Yamhill County Historical Society. Having two pullers will allow us to add more farm sites and still meet the sensitive harvesting time frame for flax.

 

 Flax puller at Yamhill County Historical Society photo by John Morgan

 

  • Single Row Puller - $12,500: A ‘puller’ machine pulls flax fiber/linen from the ground rather than cutting it. Pulling increases the quantity and quality of the yield.
  • Single Row Turner - $17,000: Once the flax is pulled and laid out in neat rows it will rett for one month on each side. A turner flips the retting flax.
  • Baler – $9,000: After two months of retting, a baler, towed behind our tractor will pick up the flax and produce a large round bale of retted fiber. All the seed heads on one side and all the roots on the other. Retted and baled flax is now ready for further processing into usable fiber. 
  • Restoring Flax Puller- $5000: We have an opportunity to restore a flax puller used in seed trials in the 1990’s and now on display at the Yamhill County Historical Society. The Society has generously offered to house the machine in the off-season if we get it back in working order.

 

What You Get

Aside from our heartfelt thanks and gratitude, we will send you a token for your contributions.

  • Donations of $10 -Thank you and acknowledgement on our Fibrevolution website
  • Donations of $30 - Personal thank you on a postcard with an image of Oregon Flax
  • Donations of $100 - Set of Oregon flax notecards
  • Donations of $500 - Poster sized image of Oregon flax taken by professional photographer John Morgan
  • Donations of $1000 - Flax craft workshop with Shannon and Angela
  • Donations of $5000 - Tour of the current farms and Oregon’s flax past, plus lunch with Shannon and Angela.
  • Donations of $10,000 - We will name our puller, turner, or baler after you or a person of your choice

 

   Other Ways to Help

  • Buy organic fiber clothing and home furnishings
  • Tell us about a small-scale farmer in Oregon or Washington looking to add flax to their crop rotation
  • Tell everyone about this fundraising campaign

All parts of the plant have multiple uses. It can be made into home furnishings, apparel, building materials, paper, blended with cotton, wool, hemp and synthetics, and used as laminate for surfboard, canoes, bike frames, mopeds and automobile interiors. Its strength lends it to numerous industrial uses. Oregon farmers are always looking for new crops to add to their rotations, climatic changes require us to consider water needs for future farming, the marketplace is clamoring for regional sources for multi-use raw materials to shorten supply chains and reduce pollution. Organic flax farming in Oregon will be part of a growing international movement to employ regenerative, carbon sequestering farming practices, to onshore small-scale processing and manufacturing of high quality consumer goods, and to create circular economies that take to heart the reciprocity between the health and well-being of the land and the people who work it. What We Need Harvesting linen requires specialized equipment not manufactured in North America. We need to import small-scale flax harvesting machinery from Europe to move our project forward. We need machinery that can be easily transported from farm to farm in order to grow more flax and maintain our relationships with small scale farming sites. Our vision is to establish a flax growing cooperative like those we visited in France. In the French flax cooperative, each farmer tends their own field, but they share the costs of machinery and processing infrastructure. This fundraising campaign will result in Fibrevolution buying our own equipment and repairing a mid-1990’s flax puller currently on display at the Yamhill County Historical Society. Having two pullers will allow us to add more farm sites and still meet the sensitive harvesting time frame for flax.  Flax puller at Yamhill County Historical Society photo by John Morgan 

Single Row Puller - $12,500: A ‘puller’ machine pulls flax fiber/linen from the ground rather than cutting it. Pulling increases the quantity and quality of the yield.

Single Row Turner - $17,000: Once the flax is pulled and laid out in neat rows it will rett for one month on each side. A turner flips the retting flax.

Baler – $9,000: After two months of retting, a baler, towed behind our tractor will pick up the flax and produce a large round bale of retted fiber. All the seed heads on one side and all the roots on the other. Retted and baled flax is now ready for further processing into usable fiber. 

Restoring Flax Puller- $5000: We have an opportunity to restore a flax puller used in seed trials in the 1990’s and now on display at the Yamhill County Historical Society. The Society has generously offered to house the machine in the off-season if we get it back in working order.
 What You GetAside from our heartfelt thanks and gratitude, we will send you a token for your contributions.
Donations of $10 -Thank you and acknowledgement on our Fibrevolution website
Donations of $30 - Personal thank you on a postcard with an image of Oregon Flax
Donations of $100 - Set of Oregon flax notecards
Donations of $500 - Poster sized image of Oregon flax taken by professional photographer John Morgan
Donations of $1000 - Flax craft workshop with Shannon and Angela
Donations of $5000 - Tour of the current farms and Oregon’s flax past, plus lunch with Shannon and Angela.
Donations of $10,000 - We will name our puller, turner, or baler after you or a person of your choice
    Other Ways to Help

Buy organic fiber clothing and home furnishings
Tell us about a small-scale farmer in Oregon or Washington looking to add flax to their crop rotation
Tell everyone about this fundraising campaign

story:
Hello, I am Steve the creator and the hard worker behind Barrie411
With my media and technology background I am happy to bring you the news, traffic and weather on a daily basic for Barrie, Orilla and Simoce County
This campaign is important to me because with your help we can maintain the great services you enjoy as well as improve it too. 
    I require funding to help with the daily expenses I absorb such as but not limited to computer maintenance, internet fees, radio maintenance, cell phone fees and daily living expenses.
      
    Barrie411 provides real time information of news, traffic and weather for Barrie, Orilla and Simcoe County . The traffic reports have  have saved you time, you have taken a different route, It prepared you for extreme weather, got you through power outages, It has kept you in the know with trending topics and so much more!

    Thank for your being a fan and your support is greatly appreciated.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please e-mail barrie411media@gmail.com

story:
SHORT VERSION:
In order to support myself as well as my aging parents, I need to expand my mineral and crystals business by buying top quality material from mines and informal diggings deep in the African bush and deserts. I will need to buy a suitable vehicle to get there as well as bring back large quantities of minerals, crystals and gemstones in order to be viable. Not only will this help me support my family but it will also inject some much needed income into very the rural and isolated communities that dig the rocks, stones and crystals out of the ground

LONG VERSION:
The situation:
I have been making a modest living from supplying rocks, minerals and crystals for over 20 years exept for a period of about 4 years where, due to the world financial crisis in the late 2000's, I had to temporarily sell my soul and sanity by getting a job in the corporate world in order to make ends meet. I HATED every moment of it!

As the world financial situation improved, I managed to fire my boss and resume my passion of playing with rocks and stones for a living and I have specialised in Spirit/Cactus Quartz crystals for the last year or so. I get the crystals direct from the diggings in Mpumalanga - South Africa (about 2,5 hours away from my home) and then spend up to 2 weeks or more putting them through an intensive cleaning process before selling them on either through my website (http://www.absolutequartzcrystals.com) or via Ebay (my Ebay store is at http://stores.ebay.com/jimmytherockmonster).

Although these are very popular crystals, they aren't very valuable and so I have to sell a LOT of crystals to meet the monthly bills.

All was good for a long while but about 2 years ago circumstances dictated that I needed to financially start supporting my elderly parents, and there have been many months where sales haven't been good enough to support us all, forcing me to rack up ever increasing levels of debt - to the point where I am forced to seriously consider whoring myself out the in the corporate 9-5 world again just to keep food on the table and keep up with my mom's medical bills. The situation is getting very desperate :-(

In order to increase my business and keep my soul intact, I need to start getting a wider variety of more valuable stones and crystals from exotic, far away and hard-to-get-to places such as Erongo, Brandberg, Okaruso, the Kalahari manganese fields and many more.

Sure, I could try buying from a wholesaler middleman - but not only would this increase the prices substantially, it would also lower the quality on the material I could supply because the best pieces always sell first and who knows how many other people would have had time to pick through the batches before I get my turn.

I need to be able get to the diggings and negotiate directly with the local diggers to get the best prices and quality.

What I need:
I will need a decent second hand vehicle that not only can handle the so called "roads" through the African bush, it will also need to be tough enough to carry at least several hundred kilograms back home from the middle of nowhere and I will also need sufficient seed capital to purchase a decent quantity of high quality, sought after gems, minerals and crystals in order to be viable. It simply won't be worth it to make such a long journey through the bush for just a few handfuls of stones at a time (and no - I don't and won't deal in diamonds. It's a dirty and unethical business!).

Here's where you come in: I have done the sums and in order to carry on here's what I will need.

$2000 - To start. This will take care of a lot of the bills and allow me the breathing room necessary to avoid the dreaded job in a suit.
$10 000 - Halfway. This will buy me a reliable second-hand off-road vehicle and at least allow me to get to the far flung mines.
$20 000 - Bingo! Let's go buy lots of rocks :-)

What's in it for you?
As with all Indiegogo campaigns, the primary reward is in helping out a fellow human being in a time of need. In this case you will not only be helping me, but you will also be helping my parents and also help a lot of desperately poor, rural people earn an honest living when I go buy the beautiful rocks they work so hard to dig up.

In addition to knowing that you are making a difference in so many lives by making a donation, no matter how small, I am also offering discount vouchers on all purchases from my websites at  http://www.absolutequartzcrystals.com and http://www.amazonite.com

For larger donations I will offer discount prices on wholesale minerals, gems and crystals direct from the mine sources and even offer you first pick of everything on a special secret web page that I will set up so that you can select they very best pieces before I make anything available to the public.

For larger donations still (and I'm only putting this out there in case somebody is crazy enough and generous enough) not only will I give you first pick of everything and give you discounted wholesale prices in perpetuity - I will also create a professional e-commerce enabled website for you, to your specifications, so that you can have your own profitable rock, mineral and crystal business.

Thanks for reading, every dollar will help and even if you are unable to make a donation, please help this old rockhound out by hitting one of the share button at the top of the page and sharing my campaign with your friends and family via Facebook and/or Twitter.

Thank you in advance, from the bottom of my heart.

Jimmy Crabb and family

P.S. If you have any questions or even if you just want to verify my authenticity, I can be contacted by phone on +2782 458-7003 or via Skype at jimmy.crabb or email me at kingjim@mweb.co.za

P.P.S. Even if you don't have a dollar to share, please please click one of the share options next to the "Back it" button.

story:
Think of Travel tools...

  • Planning - Tripit
  • Pack - Packing Pro
  • Sleep - AirBnB
  • Fly - Hipmunk / Skyscanner
  • Food - Yelp
  • Navigation - Google maps

How about a tool for visualization?

Youtube? Maybe, but it's not ideal. Here's why:

  • You'll get plenty of videos unrelated to travel in the search results. 

  • You keep getting distracted by other types of popular videos Youtube wants you to see.
  • It takes a long time to trawl through a legion of LONG videos to figure out which ones are really worth your time!

  • Most importantly, you won't get any suggestions on attractions, places, food and activities for the destination you are researching
The world definitely needs a more specialized travel visualization tool!

Introducing Playligo...

Playligo is an awesome tool that helps you visualize your trip, helping you get a REAL SENSE of any place! Here's what you'll get:

  • Suggestions on popular attractions & activities to search for each destination.


  • Get video playlists of any destinations automatically created for you!
  • Each video in your playlist is an average of only 1.5 min, saving you precious research time! 
  • You may also edit or personalize your video playlist based on your travel itinerary.

  • Get your travel mates to participate in polls.
  • Playligo is a FREE web service!
Visualize your travel itinerary with Playligo.com now!

Watch, Vote & Donate!

Vote for Bail or Vietnam?
(Experience Playligo's awesome-ness now!)

DONATE to support --> See the "PERKS" section on this page!


Hire up to 500 interns with the money raised! 

  • Hired interns will also help make Playligo more intelligent by researching and tagging the name of attractions, places, things to do, shopping and food to each destination. As more information is collected and stored, Playligo will be able to more relevant searches for a destination based on users' preference. This is on top of information gathered from highly reputable travel sites that will be integrated with Playligo soon.

  • Playligo also wants newly hires interns to build an international community of "travel visualizers" who are keen on creating travel video playlists for the top 10,000 destinations worldwide. The curated content will be of the highest quality possible, benefiting the worldwide community of travellers.

Can you give us an idea of the internship job scope?

  • Daily Commitment of 60 - 120 mins
  • Start and build Playligo's online community of "travel visualizers".
  • You'll suggest improvements to make Playligo a better visualization tool!
  • Create destination video playlists using Playligo, focusing on interesting top must-see or unusual places to visit, food to try, places to stay, things to do and buy.
  • Create & participate in interesting polls to encourage interaction and engagement
  • Share curated content on a host of social media channels using online tools (we'll show you how to use the tools)
  • Check out Playligo's Instagram page (all the photos with quotes added are done by our interns!)
  • Check out Playligo's Facebook page (most of the content such as external articles and Playligo playlists are create by our interns!)

Is this an online based job?

Yes, our internship programme is part time and online based. Interns may work from anywhere as long as they have good internet connection. 

Does Playligo provide training for the interns?

Absolutely! Playligo will create online tutorials and online documents to help interns with their daily tasks.

How is it possible for Playligo to manage so many interns effectively?

  • As the bulk of their job requires our interns to login to Playligo’s service to create content on the site, we have proprietary IT tools to help with the reporting and management of each Intern’s performance. 

  • We will set SMART goals for each intern and review performance based on targets and KPIs.

Why should you sign up for Playligo's internship programme? 

  • Through our internship, you will have an awesome understanding about the whole world, best travel destinations, exotic cultures.

  • External trainers will make the internship programme more rewarding for our interns with an all rounded education. Lifelong learning is encouraged.

  • Interns will get hands on experience and guidance in social media management and content creation

  • Upon completing the internship programme, interns will receive a certificate highlighting their performance plus the skills and knowledge they acquired. Interns who made special contributions such as blog posting and producing viral content will be commended and recommended by Playligo for full time employment.


What are the requirements to join as Playligo as an intern?

  • Passionate about joining an internet startup that aspires to change the way people research travel.
  • A team player. Great attitude, accommodating and willing to learn.
  • Avid traveller (ideally but not necessary)
  • Savvy in social media usage
  • Not camera shy. Articulate, with pleasant and vibrant personality!
  • Speaks english and writes reasonably well
  • Possess or have access to a desktop or laptop & owns a smart phone
  • Have access to good internet connection
  • You'll need a Paypal account for us to send you a monthly allowance.
  • No age limit. All are welcomed to apply!


How do I apply for Playligo's internship

  • Go to http://playligo.com and sign up for an account
  • Create at least 3 Playligo video playlists and 1 poll.
  • Send your latest resume along with your Playligo's playlist and poll links to team (at) playligo.com


Don't forget to... 
Watch, Vote & Donate!

Vote for Bail or Vietnam?

(Experience Playligo's awesome-ness now!)

DONATE to support --> See the "PERKS" section on this page!
