story:
Tekstą LIETUVIŠKAI RASITE ČIA: https://sites.google.com/site/vivudulces/

I learned very early that asking for help is possible and necessary.
No matter whether your body is ordinary or not, there are things that you cannot overcome alone. (Nick Vujicic)

“To change everything in your life and start from nothing is not madness. Madness is living a life you don’t want to live and pretending to be happy.”

       Two and a half years ago, on Christmas day, we were sitting in our living room under extra blankets, sneezing and coughing from yet another cold. It was heavily snowing outside, and we were miserably watching a live TV report from a country somewhere in South America, where people were celebrating Christmas on the beach, soaking up the sun, dressed in shorts and T-shirts only.

       We were always admiring countries full of sun, happy smiles and beautiful nature. Countries, where you do not need to hide from the cold and rain behind a thick wall of your house.

       "It's now or never", we said to each other that night. It is enough of being sick and feeling sorry for ourselves.


“If he waits for the ideal moment, he will never set off;
he requires a touch of madness to take the next step.” (Paulo Coelho, Warrior of the Light)

       

       The following day we went online and bought our family a one-way plane ticket Lithuania - Nicaragua.

       Many wonderful, talented and clever people do not find their place in this world and do not try to fulfil their dreams for one simple, basic reason - fear. Fear that they may not succeed, and an even bigger fear that no one will help them through their hardest time. We had some fears too, because we did not know any single person in Nicaragua when we bought the plane tickets.

       The last 2 years that we have spent living in Managua have been full of hopes, discoveries and losses, some pleasant and some very unpleasant surprises, disappointments, optimistic and pessimistic moments. We made some good new friends over here and were betrayed by a few old ones back home…

       We only had enough money to build a small enterprise. We chose the sweets industry as everybody, the young, the old and us, ourselves, love them. We taught us how to make ‘dragée’ sweets; how to bake and glaze cookies and we even started making colored popcorn. It all went very well and people are buying our products because they really like them. However, as you might know, poorer countries have their own ‘rules’ and it is very hard for us and our high quality products to compete with a lot of other poor quality and really cheap imported products.


“There are seldom, if ever, any hopeless situations, but there are many people who lose hope in the face of some situations.” (Zig Ziglar)

       Therefore, we have been constantly looking for an ideal solution for combining high quality and an acceptable price for most. And, of course, we found it. We have recently found out, that our current production equipment has a much bigger potential than we thought before. We just bought a new machine and concentrated all of our energy on producing sweet corn sticks. It is a very promising and healthy product, which is already very popular in Lithuania and has already impressed the first buyers in Nicaragua.

       There are various types of plants in Nicaragua, which have many health benefits. Plants such as moringa, chia, stevia and similar... We are building a socially responsible business, which is why we have spent a lot of precious time on developing the recipes for tasty sweets and snacks with ingredients from these plants.

       We believe that we have reached a phase, when we need to start thinking of making our business bigger. Unfortunately, the profit is only enough to survive through the day and our production volumes are quite low as the building we are renting for our factory is not big enough. We are also scared to invest a lot in the premises that we do not own ourselves as we have already learnt our lesson before, when we made a big investment and had to move from the place soon after.

However, there is a solution – mobile confectionary!

       If we could succeed to raise the money, we would buy a used cargo container or a big older bus and install the production facilities and  we would buy a packing machine. It would be a wonderful and efficient mobile factory, which would allow us to go anywhere at any time and start production immediately.

       Our company has been established not so long ago and we still cannot get a loan from the bank. This is why we are asking you for your help.

       Most people, who decided to pursue their dreams, have been in a similar situation with similar difficulties, too. You have probably been in a comparable situation at some point of your life yourself, so you should know how important or even vital it is to get someone’s help when you are on your way to the Unknown…

       We appeal to you, who believe in good and know that the seed you plant in a far-away garden will start growing in your own backyard someday.

Please help us by donating, lending or investing money in the shares of our company.

       If you have any questions or something to offer, do not hesitate to contact us on vivudulces@gmail.com – we will be delighted to talk to you.

       And. It's important ! We would be grateful if you could also share our story with your friends - perhaps they will feel inspired by our example to follow their own goals and dreams, or might want to help our family reach ours. Your every single dollar is like a sip of water in a hot desert, which gives us big hope.

Thank you for your kindness and consideration and God bless you all!


Vitalis, Indrė, Vilius, Urtė
story_txt: Tekstą LIETUVIŠKAI RASITE ČIA: https://sites.google.com/site/vivudulces/I learned very early that asking for help is possible and necessary.No matter whether your body is ordinary or not, there are things that you cannot overcome alone. (Nick Vujicic)“To change everything in your life and start from nothing is not madness. Madness is living a life you don’t want to live and pretending to be happy.”       Two and a half years ago, on Christmas day, we were sitting in our living room under extra blankets, sneezing and coughing from yet another cold. It was heavily snowing outside, and we were miserably watching a live TV report from a country somewhere in South America, where people were celebrating Christmas on the beach, soaking up the sun, dressed in shorts and T-shirts only.       We were always admiring countries full of sun, happy smiles and beautiful nature. Countries, where you do not need to hide from the cold and rain behind a thick wall of your house.       "It's now or never", we said to each other that night. It is enough of being sick and feeling sorry for ourselves.“If he waits for the ideal moment, he will never set off;he requires a touch of madness to take the next step.” (Paulo Coelho, Warrior of the Light)              The following day we went online and bought our family a one-way plane ticket Lithuania - Nicaragua.       Many wonderful, talented and clever people do not find their place in this world and do not try to fulfil their dreams for one simple, basic reason - fear. Fear that they may not succeed, and an even bigger fear that no one will help them through their hardest time. We had some fears too, because we did not know any single person in Nicaragua when we bought the plane tickets.       The last 2 years that we have spent living in Managua have been full of hopes, discoveries and losses, some pleasant and some very unpleasant surprises, disappointments, optimistic and pessimistic moments. We made some good new friends over here and were betrayed by a few old ones back home…       We only had enough money to build a small enterprise. We chose the sweets industry as everybody, the young, the old and us, ourselves, love them. We taught us how to make ‘dragée’ sweets; how to bake and glaze cookies and we even started making colored popcorn. It all went very well and people are buying our products because they really like them. However, as you might know, poorer countries have their own ‘rules’ and it is very hard for us and our high quality products to compete with a lot of other poor quality and really cheap imported products.“There are seldom, if ever, any hopeless situations, but there are many people who lose hope in the face of some situations.” (Zig Ziglar)       Therefore, we have been constantly looking for an ideal solution for combining high quality and an acceptable price for most. And, of course, we found it. We have recently found out, that our current production equipment has a much bigger potential than we thought before. We just bought a new machine and concentrated all of our energy on producing sweet corn sticks. It is a very promising and healthy product, which is already very popular in Lithuania and has already impressed the first buyers in Nicaragua.       There are various types of plants in Nicaragua, which have many health benefits. Plants such as moringa, chia, stevia and similar... We are building a socially responsible business, which is why we have spent a lot of precious time on developing the recipes for tasty sweets and snacks with ingredients from these plants.       We believe that we have reached a phase, when we need to start thinking of making our business bigger. Unfortunately, the profit is only enough to survive through the day and our production volumes are quite low as the building we are renting for our factory is not big enough. We are also scared to invest a lot in the premises that we do not own ourselves as we have already learnt our lesson before, when we made a big investment and had to move from the place soon after.However, there is a solution – mobile confectionary!       If we could succeed to raise the money, we would buy a used cargo container or a big older bus and install the production facilities and  we would buy a packing machine. It would be a wonderful and efficient mobile factory, which would allow us to go anywhere at any time and start production immediately.       Our company has been established not so long ago and we still cannot get a loan from the bank. This is why we are asking you for your help.       Most people, who decided to pursue their dreams, have been in a similar situation with similar difficulties, too. You have probably been in a comparable situation at some point of your life yourself, so you should know how important or even vital it is to get someone’s help when you are on your way to the Unknown…       We appeal to you, who believe in good and know that the seed you plant in a far-away garden will start growing in your own backyard someday.Please help us by donating, lending or investing money in the shares of our company.       If you have any questions or something to offer, do not hesitate to contact us on vivudulces@gmail.com – we will be delighted to talk to you.       And. It's important ! We would be grateful if you could also share our story with your friends - perhaps they will feel inspired by our example to follow their own goals and dreams, or might want to help our family reach ours. Your every single dollar is like a sip of water in a hot desert, which gives us big hope.Thank you for your kindness and consideration and God bless you all!Vitalis, Indrė, Vilius, Urtė

story:
Hiya folks!

 I'm World Famous Dave Ensign theme park adventurer, designer, animator, and extreme Walt Disney fan. This year marks my 30th year in the Theme Attraction/Entertainment industry which means it's my turn to build something great. "Westward HO!e in One" is the place. It's going to be a return to quality and value where you'll get more than you pay for and more then you expect. It will be built by creative people using your contributions. 


WE NEED YOU

You wouldn't be reading this if you weren't a fan of Amusement Parks, Mini Golf, Mine Train rides, or tourist attractions and that makes YOU the kind of person we need. Imagine yourself being part of a cool little park! Imagine how fun it will be to watch it come to life knowing your contribution was the fuel we needed to get it going. Imagine visiting "Westward HO!e in One" knowing you are a part of it. 

Where will your money go? There's a mountain of things that need to be taken care of before we shovel the first scoop of dirt. We need more concepts and planning, we need to research a location for it, we need to retain the contractors who will build it, and we need to tackle a huge amount of legal business. 

This is our chance

This will be a park built and run by creative people and will be funded by people who love to have fun! I don't know if that's EVER happened before. Not since 1966 anyway and you'll be in on the ground floor of it. Your contribution will make this little seed grow into something amazing and we'll all take pride in watching others enjoy it. 

Folks, I never fail. Never. I accomplish the projects I'm interested. Of course this is the biggest one yet but I have absolutely NO fear. I've been working on this concept for over a year completely on my own time and money and I'm 100% certain it's going to happen. I can't do it alone of course because, like Walt said, "It takes people to make the dream a reality". Get on board, folks.


Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD. It's as simple as that:) 

Westward HO!e in One

World Famous Dave Ensign on Facebook

story:
Mess in a bottle

Hey guys! My name is Kalilah and I am a designer that resides in Baltimore, Maryland by ways of Brooklyn, NY and by ways ways of Jamaica, WI. My parents and I migrated to America, when I was at the tender age of 4. I discovered my interest in art and architecture through my godly mom, Aunty Shirley and my 3rd grade teacher, Ms. Cummings. As I evolved and Ms. Warrick and Ms. Lewis (both teachers I love), nurtured my artistic skills, I went off to graduate from Penn State University with a Bachelors of Art and a Masters in Architecture, 2010. Since then I have worked for major architecture and design companies such as Under Armour and CSD to name a few. 

I've always had a love for architecture and design and that has now translated into fashion! In 2015 I launched my tshirt brand, Mess in a bottle. I am an outspoken individual and I frequently spoke my mind. I began to be expressive on my tshirts and PEOPLE LOVED IT; hence, the birth of MESS IN A BOTTLE. Wear your MESSage.

I am launching this campaign to grow outside my design room; my ideas are bigger than 150sq.ft. and I NEED YOUR HELP! I do EVERY aspect of my business myself. I print the shirts, put labels on each bottle, put a personalized message in each package, ship, market, etc etc, the list goes on. I AM ONE HUMAN (I think), with 2 hands. I stay up endless nights chasing this dream that I know will be successful. As we expand, I need more start up capital to meet my demand. That's where YOU come in.

HELP!

Your donation will help us solve world hunger (joking, but I wish). It will allow me as a very small woman owned, black business to grow without taking out additional loans (THANKS SALLIE MAE, I SEE YOU GIRL), and having to choose with giving up stake in my company from potential investors this early in the game.

WHAT DO I NEED?

I need approximately 10k, but I am trying to raise at least half (5k) to get the wheels on this train going.

1. I need a bottle manufacturer. I am currently buying my bottles retail and IT IS KILLING my business.

2. I need printing power. I need to pay someone to print my shirts and print my labels and messages on my bottle.

3. I need marketing power. I need to put some money into real marketing to get the world to know how kick ass this company truly is.

4. I need more space. I am already exceeding the space I currently have and I need a place to house all my inventory.

5. I need a larger inventory, currently I buy 100 shirts and 75 bottles and I sell out in less than a week. I NEED a larger inventory.

6. I need web design and coding help.

7. I need legal services with copyright laws and privacy acts etc.

See, I told you, I NEED YOUR HELP!

I have started another small business liliNash and I enjoyed designing furniture and repurposing items to give it new life, but that company takes a LOT of resources and time. I dove into this tshirt business to help grow and build my baby furniture company, but I quickly discovered the demand and love people had for my tees. 

I am an extremely hard worker and I push through any obstacles I am faced with. Your donation will help me to catapult my business to the next level. 

So thats it folks, thats my Shark Tank pitch. Please share, donate, tell Oprah, Mark Cuban and Bethenny Frankel I am ready to speak with them at their earliest convenience. 

PLEASE SHARE, PLEASE DONATE, believe in me as much as I believe in myself!

Thanks.

Mess in a Bottle owner, creator and designer KALILAH C. WRIGHT

story:
Our Story

We want to have more store events, donut parties and make more punny products! But we didn’t have enough space… until now!

Hello! I’m Queenie Best and this is the story of queenie’s cards! The company started off as a side hobby with an online store in 2008 (queeniescards.com), and it continued to blossom into my full-time passion in 2014. In 2017, I opened up my first brick and mortar shop but now in 2019, my growing team and expanding products need more room! After 10 months of searching, I finally found my forever shop! Still located at Danforth/Coxwell, just blocks away from my current store, a glorious 1200 square feet space became available and I just signed the lease! It’s quadruple the space which means quadruple the costs.

Here is where we need your help!

We have had incredible support from our customers and fans since the beginning, and we continue to rely on this support - current and new - so we can keep growing. In our new space, we will have a studio area for us to design and work on new projects, a bigger storage for inventory and supplies, and the majority of the main floor will be our retail gift shop where we can display more products for you! We are offering exclusive items in our perks to help us fund this new chapter of queenie’s cards. 

Our new location will be at 1808 Danforth Ave in Toronto, just steps away from Coxwell station. We are committed to this place for 5 years so we want to make sure we are doing everything we can to stay for even longer!

Our Goal

Our goal of $15,000 will go towards the following:

  • Improving accessibility by providing a ramp for the entrance
  • Upgrading security (additional surveillance cameras, locks, gates)
  • Rent (the new lease is almost triple what we currently pay)
  • Purchasing new equipment and furniture (such as fixtures, lighting, shelving, displays, tables, chairs, computers, point of sales hardware for merchandise and inventory)
  • Installing a new storefront sign
  • Migrating our entire website and online store to a new host so we can list more products for our customers worldwide
  • General improvements such as painting, patching up holes in the walls, cleaning, etc.
  • Payroll for staffing (many of you have expressed interest in joining our team, so the bigger we grow the more people we need!)
  • Inventory of our own line of products (we want to create more amazing products for you!) as well as licensed items (if you’d like us to carry more branded goods from Pusheen, Sanrio, tokidoki, and more, we need the means to do so!)
  • The fun monthly costs such as legal fees, hydro, heat, taxes, maintenance, insurance... it never ends!

All of the funds raised will go directly into the new space. It would be absolutely amazing if we have your support, so in return we have created exclusive perks for you!

Campaign Perks

We made exclusive perks just for this campaign! If we reach our goal we can continue to carry the new items online and in the shop! 

(Please see PICK UP and SHIPPING details at the end of the perks descriptions!)

$5 Digital Download
Personalized punny THANK YOU cartoon from Queenie Best

$5 Sticker
"I TOTES SHOP LOCAL" Vinyl Sticker, exclusive for this campaign! Proudly put this on your laptop, water bottle, notebooks, anywhere!

(PVC-free, premium adhesive film with a glossy weather resistant laminate for a 2-4 year outdoor life)

$10 Postcard Set
"I TOTES SHOP LOCAL" Postcards, set of 5, exclusive for this campaign! You can send these to your favourite local shops and thank them for their contribution to the neighbourhood! And maybe keep one for yourself ;)

(Printed in Toronto on 130lbs premium cardstock, 4" x 6")

$15 Art Print
​"I TOTES SHOP LOCAL" Print, exclusive for this campaign! Frame this in your office, your business or gift it to your favourite local shop :)

(Printed in Toronto on 130lbs premium cardstock, 11” x 8.5”)

$20 Card Set
5 surprise greeting cards from our collection! If there are specific cards you prefer, please contact us by email (info@queeniescards.com) or message us through Indiegogo and let us know! (queeniescards.com/product-category/greeting-cards)

$25 Enamel Pin
"I TOTES SHOP LOCAL" Enamel Pin, exclusive for this campaign! Wear this proudly when you’re shopping in your neighbourhood :)

(1.25″ soft enamel fill with a pink rubber backing)

$35 Tote Bag
"I TOTES SHOP LOCAL" Tote Bag, exclusive for this campaign! Carry this proudly when you’re shopping in your neighbourhood :)

(Made of 12 oz 100% Natural Cotton Canvas, processed AZO-free with no hazardous chemicals, 18” W x 15.5” H x 4” D)

$45 Happiest Shopping Local T-Shirt
"HAPPIEST SHOPPING LOCAL" T-Shirt, exclusive for this campaign! Our first collaboration with The Happiest Collection in Calgary :) Wear this proudly when you’re shopping in your neighbourhood :)

A. Men's Cotton + Polyester Jersey Black Mix Tee with contrasting black arm and neck ribbing (Size Small - 2XL) 
B. Kids Bamboo + Organic Cotton T-Shirt (Sizes 2T, 4T, 6, Youth Small - 7 to 8 years old)
C. Women's Cotton + Polyester Black Scoop Neck/Scoop Bottom Tee (Size XS - 2XL)

(100% Canadian Made - Remember to let us know your fit and size!)

$75 Paper Lovers Pack
- Postcard Set (see above)
- Card Set (see above)
- 3 "I TOTES SHOP LOCAL" Stickers (see above)
- 3 Bookmarks 
- 3 Notebooks 
If there are specific bookmarks or notebooks you prefer, please contact us by email (info@queeniescards.com) or message us through Indiegogo and let us know! 

$85 Let's Avocuddle Pack
- “Let’s Avocuddle” Enamel Pin
- “Let’s Avocuddle” Iron-On Patch
- “Let’s Avocuddle” Sticker
- “Let’s Avocuddle” Card
- “Let’s Avocuddle” Plush Keychain
- “Let’s Avocuddle” Plush Set

$95 Punny Food Pack
- 2 Food Notecard Sets 
- 2 "Yummimals” Mystery Plush
- “Freddy the Fridge” Plush
If there are specific notecards or Yummimals you prefer, please contact us by email (info@queeniescards.com) or message us through Indiegogo and let us know! 

$120 I Totes Shop Local Pack
- "I TOTES SHOP LOCAL" Enamel Pin  (see above)
- "I TOTES SHOP LOCAL" Postcard Set  (see above)
- "I TOTES SHOP LOCAL" Sticker  (see above)
- "I TOTES SHOP LOCAL" T-Shirt  (see above)
- "I TOTES SHOP LOCAL" Tote Bag  (see above)

● PICK UP OPTION: Indiegogo doesn't allow a pick up option, so if you'd like to pick up your perk(s) at our new storefront at 1808 Danforth Ave, please donate the exact dollar amount for the perk(s) you want as a contribution (Desktop: click BACK IT at the top of the page / Mobile: scroll to the end for "Make a contribution") and send us an email or message here on Indiegogo indicating which perk(s) you have chosen!
● SHIPPING: All shipped perks will be sent via Canada Post by December 2019.
● PERK CHOICES: If you have specific product requests in the perks (such as cards, bookmarks, notecards, notebooks), please contact us by email (info@queeniescards.com) or message us through Indiegogo and let us know!

The Impact

We wouldn't be where we are today without our loyal fans and customers. As a small business, it isn't always easy because we are regular targets to break-ins, shoplifting, scams and copyright infringement. Every dollar helps and does not go unnoticed. All of you have shown so much love for us throughout the years, we intend on returning the favour in every way that we can. We want to continue giving back by supporting our fellow local businesses, artists, designers, customers, our new backers, and to continue working with our friends in the neighbourhood and in the industry. We are always open for collaboration opportunities, and with more resources and more room to express our creativity, the possibilities would be endless! I have a young daughter and as cheesy as this sounds, I want her to see that it’s entirely possible to turn a simple pipe dream into reality with the help of friends, family and people you meet through the love of your creations. I want to keep growing my company to positively influence the power of shopping local and what it can do to revitalize neighbourhoods. Bringing communities together - be it through school fairs, local charities or shopping at each others’ businesses - is what we strive for at queenie’s cards. When we expand into this bigger space, there will be more opportunities to fulfill more dreams.

Other Ways You Can Help

Every bit of support helps! Please get involved!

  • Word of mouth is more effective than you think! We would be so grateful if you can tell your friends, share our campaign where possible (scroll back up to the top of the page and click on the social media icons!)
  • Shop with us! All of our retail, wholesale and online sales go back towards all areas of the business (including product development, payroll, legal fees, hydro, heat, rent, just to name a few)
  • Shop at our stockists! There is a wide range of retailers that carry our products, if you purchase our goods from their stores, that helps them reorder more from us! (queeniescards.com/retailers)


From our small yet mighty team, we are so thankful for your time and for giving us the opportunity for a brand new start!

Highest virtual high fives from Queenie, Grace, Sophia and Kim at queenie's cards (and love from Bowser, who was 2 months old when I created my first punny cartoon!)


WEBSITE: https://queeniescards.com
INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/queeniescards
FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/queeniescards
TWITTER: https://twitter.com/queeniescards

A. Men's Cotton + Polyester Jersey Black Mix Tee with contrasting black arm and neck ribbing (Size Small - 2XL) B. Kids Bamboo + Organic Cotton T-Shirt (Sizes 2T, 4T, 6, Youth Small - 7 to 8 years old)C. Women's Cotton + Polyester Black Scoop Neck/Scoop Bottom Tee (Size XS - 2XL)
(100% Canadian Made - Remember to let us know your fit and size!)
$75 Paper Lovers Pack- Postcard Set (see above)- Card Set (see above)- 3 "I TOTES SHOP LOCAL" Stickers (see above)- 3 Bookmarks - 3 Notebooks If there are specific bookmarks or notebooks you prefer, please contact us by email (info@queeniescards.com) or message us through Indiegogo and let us know! 
$85 Let's Avocuddle Pack- “Let’s Avocuddle” Enamel Pin- “Let’s Avocuddle” Iron-On Patch- “Let’s Avocuddle” Sticker- “Let’s Avocuddle” Card- “Let’s Avocuddle” Plush Keychain- “Let’s Avocuddle” Plush Set
$95 Punny Food Pack- 2 Food Notecard Sets - 2 "Yummimals” Mystery Plush- “Freddy the Fridge” PlushIf there are specific notecards or Yummimals you prefer, please contact us by email (info@queeniescards.com) or message us through Indiegogo and let us know! 
$120 I Totes Shop Local Pack- "I TOTES SHOP LOCAL" Enamel Pin  (see above)- "I TOTES SHOP LOCAL" Postcard Set  (see above)- "I TOTES SHOP LOCAL" Sticker  (see above)- "I TOTES SHOP LOCAL" T-Shirt  (see above)- "I TOTES SHOP LOCAL" Tote Bag  (see above)
● PICK UP OPTION: Indiegogo doesn't allow a pick up option, so if you'd like to pick up your perk(s) at our new storefront at 1808 Danforth Ave, please donate the exact dollar amount for the perk(s) you want as a contribution (Desktop: click BACK IT at the top of the page / Mobile: scroll to the end for "Make a contribution") and send us an email or message here on Indiegogo indicating which perk(s) you have chosen! ● SHIPPING: All shipped perks will be sent via Canada Post by December 2019.● PERK CHOICES: If you have specific product requests in the perks (such as cards, bookmarks, notecards, notebooks), please contact us by email (info@queeniescards.com) or message us through Indiegogo and let us know!

The Impact
We wouldn't be where we are today without our loyal fans and customers. As a small business, it isn't always easy because we are regular targets to break-ins, shoplifting, scams and copyright infringement. Every dollar helps and does not go unnoticed. All of you have shown so much love for us throughout the years, we intend on returning the favour in every way that we can. We want to continue giving back by supporting our fellow local businesses, artists, designers, customers, our new backers, and to continue working with our friends in the neighbourhood and in the industry. We are always open for collaboration opportunities, and with more resources and more room to express our creativity, the possibilities would be endless! I have a young daughter and as cheesy as this sounds, I want her to see that it’s entirely possible to turn a simple pipe dream into reality with the help of friends, family and people you meet through the love of your creations. I want to keep growing my company to positively influence the power of shopping local and what it can do to revitalize neighbourhoods. Bringing communities together - be it through school fairs, local charities or shopping at each others’ businesses - is what we strive for at queenie’s cards. When we expand into this bigger space, there will be more opportunities to fulfill more dreams.

Other Ways You Can Help
Every bit of support helps! Please get involved!

Word of mouth is more effective than you think! We would be so grateful if you can tell your friends, share our campaign where possible (scroll back up to the top of the page and click on the social media icons!)
Shop with us! All of our retail, wholesale and online sales go back towards all areas of the business (including product development, payroll, legal fees, hydro, heat, rent, just to name a few)
Shop at our stockists! There is a wide range of retailers that carry our products, if you purchase our goods from their stores, that helps them reorder more from us! (queeniescards.com/retailers)

From our small yet mighty team, we are so thankful for your time and for giving us the opportunity for a brand new start!Highest virtual high fives from Queenie, Grace, Sophia and Kim at queenie's cards (and love from Bowser, who was 2 months old when I created my first punny cartoon!)

story:
Hi! We Are Keystone Bicycle Co.

We are a worker-owned full service bicycle shop that will be opening in Philadelphia in Spring 2020. Our goal is to bring together a community of cyclists interested in riding, wrenching, and learning about cycling. Focused on quality services, practical bicycle builds, and educational opportunities, we plan to be a hub for the cycling community. 

We will be a bike shop where you can:

  • Get your bike fixed
  • Buy a new bike
  • Plan a custom build
  • Take a mechanic class
  • Connect with other cyclists
  • Plan your next bike tour​
  • And much more!

What Makes Keystone Bicycle Co. Unique?

KBC is owned and democratically managed by us, its workers. We each bring different skills and each of us are involved at every level of the shop's operation, from fixing your flat tire to managing our budget. All of us are invested in the business at every level. We have over 30 years of combined experience working in bike shops, and even more than that riding and touring. We believe a bike shop should be a welcoming place for all, no matter your cycling experience. We are excited to offer mechanic classes on a sliding scale and host events for the w/t/enby folx as a part of our commitment to having an accessible shop.

Why We Need Your Help

We have an incredible opportunity to build a bike shop from the ground up and have a lot of exciting plans for our space at 1800 N American Street. We start buildout this January and your support with funding will go towards transforming our new shop! Our goal of $10,000 will be used to help furnish and outfit our shop with workbenches, storage areas, and retail fixtures. We also need to round out our tool sets and buy some initial inventory. There are many challenges in the bike industry, but we believe that our focus on community and building a space where people can learn will allow us to thrive in Philly.

What's In It For You

You get to support an awesome new worker-owned bicycle shop in Philadelphia! We will also be offering some cool swag, labor services on the house, and a chance to learn about fixing your bike. We have brand new patches, stickers, and limited edition T-shirts coming our way just for you! 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the news about us opening up
  • Follow keystone.bike on Instagram
  • Like Keystone Bicycle Co. on Facebook
  • Come ride with us!

 

Questions? Want to say hi? Send us an email at keystonebicycleco@gmail.com!

story:
American rapper/revolutionary/poet, Tupac Amaru Shakur, wrote an autobiographical poem titled, “The Rose that Grew from Concrete” and it reads: 

 

“Did you hear about the rose that grew from a crack in concrete? Proving nature’s laws wrong it learned to walk without having feet. Funny it seems by keeping its dreams, it learned to breathe fresh air. Long live the rose that grew from a crack in concrete when no one else even cared.”

The concrete, a seemingly harsh environment; cold, hard and rough, nurtured the rose to see full bloom. Despite the conditions, the rose grew beautifully by believing it could.

The rose is Tupac, the rose is Lancaster City, the rose could be you but in this narrative, the rose is most definitely the co-owners of A Concrete Rose Bookbar, Evita Colon and Solise White.

CREATIVE ENTREPRENEURS

Hi! We’re Evita Colon and Solise White, Co-Owners of A Concrete Rose Bookbar! We are Afro-Latina performing artists with life missions to empower our community. Born and raised in Lancaster, PA, Evita is a creative entrepreneur, consultant, international poet among other multi-hyphenate creative skills and a mom. Solise is a native of Bronx ,NY, creative entrepreneur, choreographer, director and producer. As CEO and CCO of a creative arts agency, Speak to My Soul, we learned there is a lack of spaces for artists of color to feel free to be themselves as they meet and create. Most importantly, there lacked spaces that gave our artists the opportunity to showcase their work. We decided to create a solution and build that space. With Lancaster, PA's strides toward diversity and inclusion and booming art scene, we felt this space is the missing piece needed to include the African American community, our community, into the narrative. Representation Matters! What better way to learn about our culture than reading books by black authors? It was a no brainer to create a space like A Concrete Rose Bookbar! We learned black culture, books, performing arts and wine weren’t just something that we found interesting; it was a shared interest of many of our friends and supporters. As excitement grew of this space, we were motivated to make this happen. Thus, further making A Concrete Rose Bookbar another chapter of our story and hopefully, with your help, it will also be a part of yours!

BOOKSTORE | WINE BAR | VENUE

A Concrete Rose Bookbar merges the business concepts of a bookstore, wine bar and live entertainment venue under one roof. The bookstore will feature books and art created by authors and artists of the African diaspora providing the community with the opportunity to learn about our culture through the immersion of our literature and art. As performing artists, we aim to provide the community with a place to freely express themselves and showcase their work on a regular basis. The inclusion of wine intersects a sophisticated experience with a casual experience giving our space a unpretentious vibe. And GUESS WHAT?

 

WE WILL BE MAKING OUR OWN WINE!

YES, YOU READ THAT CORRECTLY! WE ARE MAKING OUR OWN WINE!

 

 

DOING THE WORK

 

So far, we've invested our time and personal income to developing and training ourselves in this industry

  • We've read and studied books and countless articles on wine making, wine pairings, business operations and bookselling.
  • We've studied the PLCB laws to have an understanding of the licenses and permits we will need for operation in Pennsylvania.
  • We've attended Economic and Business conferences to understand the economic impact of our business in our community.
  • Evita has taken an ASSETS idea incubator course to learn how to develop our idea into a feasible and sustainable business.
  • Obtained SCORE business mentors for guidance creating a strong business plan and sustainable business model ( we try to meet at least once/twice a month)
  • Began taking classes to learn how to make wine and brew craft beer (it was a cool add-on class)
  • We've acquired mentorship from current bookstore owners and business owners with similar business models (ie. black bookstores, wine & beer boutique, restaurant)
  • Attended community events and met with community organizations/leaders about our intentions gaining the support of the community.
  • Traveled to businesses similar to ours to speak with the owners/employees about running a successful business while having a positive impact on the community.  (Traveled to Washington DC, Philadelphia and NYC)
  • Met with a real estate agent, toured various properties around the city and selected a property that best fits our vision.
  • Completed a LOI (Letter of Interest) for the property
  • Had a contractor view and estimate property build out
  • Created a visionary sketch of our location and met with a designer to create a formal CAD design
  • Hosted a SUCCESSFUL sample event in the community promoting our themes of literature, culture and expression.
  • Created a calendar with monthly events scheduled for the bookbar
  • Created an AMAZING TEAM to help us see this vision through!
  • Toured wine facilities and (our favorite part) participated in wine tastings.
  • Created a website
  • Filed and obtained our EIN
  • Created a logo for our business

  • Created and continue to build our social media following (Facebook, Instagram and Twitter)

 

We will need $250,000 to open our doors

 

Whew! We know it seems like a lot but things really have way of adding up. We cut a lot of costs by doing the work ourselves but some things we just can't get around.

START UP COSTS

  • Build out for a 2,600 sq ft property  = $180,000 (Includes construction costs+materials to meet coding requirements. Also includes equipment.)
  • Opening inventory = $30,000 (wine, craft beer, books, ancillary items)
  • Marketing = $5,000 (advertisement, website management, stationary) 
  • Furniture/Fixtures=$20,000 (Includes the bar, staging and couches/tables/chairs)
  • Permits/Licensing= $15,000

Indiegogo acquires 8% of funds raised + 30 cents per contribution (includes platform and credit card fees)

Reaching our goal will help us reach our target opening date in the Summer of 2020.

 

PERKS

We have AMAZING personalized PERKS made especially for this campaign! Be the first to rock your A Concrete Rose Bookbar swag or donate to have a lasting impression in our bookbar. Either way, you will be contributing to history! Wait that's not right, HERSTORY! ---------------------------->

 

IMPACT: A SOLUTION

A Concrete Rose Bookbar  is a business that reflects the history and culture of the African Diaspora that will make it’s residents feel welcomed and embraced. In addition to selling amazing wine and food pairings, the space will also provide its patrons with events that will connect and empower people from all walks of life. With content for all ages and backgrounds, we are also confident we can lessen crime and retention in our youth with purposeful programming and partnerships with community organizations and academic institutions.

With 6+ years of professional experience in the performance arts industry and as event consultants, we have an understanding of what it takes to engage the community and keep our customers interested.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand everyone isn't able to contribute monetary donations; however, we appreciate everyone spreading the word about our campaign and initiative!

Share on social media using our HASHTAG:

#LANCLITAROSE

story:
Who we are

If you ask me what MADE. is, I’d say it is a place of hope, community, and discovery.

Hope….. for future businesses coming into Woodbury  
Community…. not just a place for the community to shop locally and small (thus supporting the areas’ artisans) but MADE. itself is truly a community of artists and artisans, connected by this quality place to work, sell products and services, and collaborate with one another in their efforts to thrive in their respective crafts
Discovery….. because not only will visitors find some really cool and unique hand crafted items, but they may also discover their aptitude for creating through one of our workshops, and connect with the creative arts community in the process

I’d like to think MADE. is essentially a small business eco-system, in place to support other small artisan businesses. Currently, our space features original artwork and hand crafted items from 50 of our tri-state artist and artisans, and we are steadily welcoming more! And that’s where we need your help, because we are rapidly outgrowing our space!
 

History

MADE. “Popped up” in late 2017, as a “holiday pop-up shop” with the intent to dissolve on February 15, 2018. However, as the community continued to show their support through shopping at MADE. and even spreading the word to friends and family outside of Woodbury, it became more than apparent that MADE. would make Woodbury, NJ its forever business home. 

In 9.5 months, we grew from our initial 20 artists (including myself) to 50 artists/artisans offering everything from artisan body care, jewelry, original artwork, home decor, woodwork, tea blends, and so much more. We have also been able to offer our local artisans a place to hosts crafting workshops for the crafting enthusiast and intimate artist talks and exhibits featuring our local artist and their works in our comfy "craft-mosphere."  

Where we are now

After assessing our growth and our mission, we realized that we needed to expand our headquarters so that we may fully and effectively live out our mission of becoming a sincere local artisan small business eco-system.

MADE. has found a gem of a space, located feet away from our current space on Broad St. (65 N. Broad St.) that we are working with the property owner to occupy.

In this new space, MADE. will be able to:

  • Welcome more local artisans into our retail space, with a cleaner retail design that offers the artists more opportunity to be hands-on in the design and creativity of the the store
  • Utilize our 2 new workshop rooms to offer simultaneous workshops and parties/meetings/etc without interrupting floor sales, and build relationships with several senior and special needs communities throughout South Jersey, offering them a wheelchair-accessible area with consistent and engaging classes to stimulate their senses. Our artists will also be able to schedule use of these rooms at their convenience, when they want to host their own workshops/events
  • Offer 2 additional workspace rooms, where artists will be able to use the spaces to take up residency to create their work and then sell their work on the sales floor
  • Host art exhibits in a separate gallery/event space
  • Host vendor/craft fairs in our large parking lot, attracting artisans for major holiday/seasonal events
  • Employ local residents (thus creating employment opportunities in the City of Woodbury), and offer volunteer hours to local high school students who are interested in the Arts and learning how to run a small business
  • Annnndddddd….. offer another phase of our artisan eco-system:  Include an ESPRESSO BAR that features locally roasted coffee beans, tea blends, and baked goods, all provided by your tri-state artisans!


Our Goal

Since  beginning our journey to expand, we have successfully obtained a commitment from one "angel investor" in the amount of $10,000, and we are genuinely hoping that our community can help us fulfill the additional $12,000 that it will take to occupy the space. Your contributions will provide us with working capital for advertising, promotion, and most importantly contracting our artists to contribute their touches to furnish the space.

Our goal is to raise the funds in the next 38 days, and with your support we will be able to have the keys to the property and start to move into the property---right after the holiday season!!

WITH YOUR HELP... we will be able to transform MADE. into the ultimate tri-state area destination, where locals and visitors alike know they can stop in to purchase 100% handcrafted goods produced exclusively by local artisans, grab an espresso, latte, or red eye with locally roasted beans, attend an event in a unique and stylish space, or take a workshop and learn from our local artists. You will be helping us not only to continue to stimulate our local and "shop small" economy in Woodbury, but also provide our local artisans a quality platform to make a living with their artistry and share it with the world.  And of course, for your donation, we have some really cool rewards! Some of our artisans are also featured in the rewards--check them out!

 

Risks & Challenges

When looking for a bigger and more efficient space on Broad Street, we came across few available commercial properties that had the appropriate attributes to suit our specific vision. We knew that we wanted to offer certain types of spaces/resources/services to both our customers and our artisans, and the property needed to be able to accommodate all of those individual factors. When we came across 65 N Broad St, we were first struck by the style/charm of the architecture (We later learned that it is actually a historic building, built in 1901 and built by Benjamin Franklin's nephew! The first senator of New Jersey also resided in this home!), and saw that it was in a very accessible location. We were able to meet and speak with the owner about our plans, tour the space, and everything began to fall into place... Currently, we are working with him as he is renovating the building specifically with MADE. and all of the business and artists needs in mind! Custom fit, just for us!

When deciding to relocate our business, our central focus has been keeping the business in the City of Woodbury; most specifically still on Broad St. If we are unable to raise the funds to occupy this space, we are very unsure when or if we will be able to find the space that suits our mission and thus we will not be able to fully live out our mission. Oh... and did we tell you that this space has FREE PARKING!!!?! That's a big deal!

Other Ways You Can Help

We are the first ones who can say that we understand that money is tight. However, you could still help us in these few FREE ways:

  • Posting our crowd funder on your FB Page once a week for 4 weeks, encouraging others to donate as much as possible. That's only 4x's, but even with that small act, the added exposure to your network may help us achieve our goal!
  • Sharing our crowd funder on your Instagram page once a week and putting the link to our crowd funder in your IG bio. This allows people from outside of your normal network, who live around the world see that you are in support of us, and they may want to help as well! GO TEAM!!!!
  • If you know of an angel investor who is looking to help a small business succeed (and receive a return on their investment, of course), please please please contact them and share our info. 

Sometimes the hardest part for small businesses and crowd funders is getting the word out, and boy would you be a TREMENDOUS help by doing these things!!!!

History
MADE. “Popped up” in late 2017, as a “holiday pop-up shop” with the intent to dissolve on February 15, 2018. However, as the community continued to show their support through shopping at MADE. and even spreading the word to friends and family outside of Woodbury, it became more than apparent that MADE. would make Woodbury, NJ its forever business home. In 9.5 months, we grew from our initial 20 artists (including myself) to 50 artists/artisans offering everything from artisan body care, jewelry, original artwork, home decor, woodwork, tea blends, and so much more. We have also been able to offer our local artisans a place to hosts crafting workshops for the crafting enthusiast and intimate artist talks and exhibits featuring our local artist and their works in our comfy "craft-mosphere."  
Where we are now

After assessing our growth and our mission, we realized that we needed to expand our headquarters so that we may fully and effectively live out our mission of becoming a sincere local artisan small business eco-system.MADE. has found a gem of a space, located feet away from our current space on Broad St. (65 N. Broad St.) that we are working with the property owner to occupy.
In this new space, MADE. will be able to:

Welcome more local artisans into our retail space, with a cleaner retail design that offers the artists more opportunity to be hands-on in the design and creativity of the the store
Utilize our 2 new workshop rooms to offer simultaneous workshops and parties/meetings/etc without interrupting floor sales, and build relationships with several senior and special needs communities throughout South Jersey, offering them a wheelchair-accessible area with consistent and engaging classes to stimulate their senses. Our artists will also be able to schedule use of these rooms at their convenience, when they want to host their own workshops/events
Offer 2 additional workspace rooms, where artists will be able to use the spaces to take up residency to create their work and then sell their work on the sales floor
Host art exhibits in a separate gallery/event space
Host vendor/craft fairs in our large parking lot, attracting artisans for major holiday/seasonal events
Employ local residents (thus creating employment opportunities in the City of Woodbury), and offer volunteer hours to local high school students who are interested in the Arts and learning how to run a small business
Annnndddddd….. offer another phase of our artisan eco-system:  Include an ESPRESSO BAR that features locally roasted coffee beans, tea blends, and baked goods, all provided by your tri-state artisans!


Our Goal
Since  beginning our journey to expand, we have successfully obtained a commitment from one "angel investor" in the amount of $10,000, and we are genuinely hoping that our community can help us fulfill the additional $12,000 that it will take to occupy the space. Your contributions will provide us with working capital for advertising, promotion, and most importantly contracting our artists to contribute their touches to furnish the space.Our goal is to raise the funds in the next 38 days, and with your support we will be able to have the keys to the property and start to move into the property---right after the holiday season!!
WITH YOUR HELP... we will be able to transform MADE. into the ultimate tri-state area destination, where locals and visitors alike know they can stop in to purchase 100% handcrafted goods produced exclusively by local artisans, grab an espresso, latte, or red eye with locally roasted beans, attend an event in a unique and stylish space, or take a workshop and learn from our local artists. You will be helping us not only to continue to stimulate our local and "shop small" economy in Woodbury, but also provide our local artisans a quality platform to make a living with their artistry and share it with the world.  And of course, for your donation, we have some really cool rewards! Some of our artisans are also featured in the rewards--check them out!
 
Risks & Challenges

When looking for a bigger and more efficient space on Broad Street, we came across few available commercial properties that had the appropriate attributes to suit our specific vision. We knew that we wanted to offer certain types of spaces/resources/services to both our customers and our artisans, and the property needed to be able to accommodate all of those individual factors. When we came across 65 N Broad St, we were first struck by the style/charm of the architecture (We later learned that it is actually a historic building, built in 1901 and built by Benjamin Franklin's nephew! The first senator of New Jersey also resided in this home!), and saw that it was in a very accessible location. We were able to meet and speak with the owner about our plans, tour the space, and everything began to fall into place... Currently, we are working with him as he is renovating the building specifically with MADE. and all of the business and artists needs in mind! Custom fit, just for us!
When deciding to relocate our business, our central focus has been keeping the business in the City of Woodbury; most specifically still on Broad St. If we are unable to raise the funds to occupy this space, we are very unsure when or if we will be able to find the space that suits our mission and thus we will not be able to fully live out our mission. Oh... and did we tell you that this space has FREE PARKING!!!?! That's a big deal!

Other Ways You Can Help
We are the first ones who can say that we understand that money is tight. However, you could still help us in these few FREE ways:

Posting our crowd funder on your FB Page once a week for 4 weeks, encouraging others to donate as much as possible. That's only 4x's, but even with that small act, the added exposure to your network may help us achieve our goal!
Sharing our crowd funder on your Instagram page once a week and putting the link to our crowd funder in your IG bio. This allows people from outside of your normal network, who live around the world see that you are in support of us, and they may want to help as well! GO TEAM!!!!
If you know of an angel investor who is looking to help a small business succeed (and receive a return on their investment, of course), please please please contact them and share our info. 

Sometimes the hardest part for small businesses and crowd funders is getting the word out, and boy would you be a TREMENDOUS help by doing these things!!!!

story:
Short Summary

“The most important shot in golf, is the next shot.”

-Ben Hogan

My name is David Klock, and two years ago I began dreaming of what it would look like to open an indoor golf simulator business in the Mechanicsburg area.   My desire was not only to open a successful business, but also have a place that would positively impact our community.  After a significant amount of time, energy, conversations, and prayer it is now time to make this dream and vision come true!

The quote by Ben Hogan was the inspiration for the name Next Shot Golf.  The quote is not only true about golf, but life as well.  Every day we wake up, there is a next shot/decision in life we must make.  For me the next step is to open Next Shot Golf.

Any donation given is appreciated more than you could ever imagine!  I am humbled to know you have spent time learning about this adventure.  Make sure you view which perks are involved as a small way to say THANK YOU for your donation!

 

How to Help!

The total startup cost is approximately $225,000.  Currently, we have over $200,000 toward the business.

I believe very strongly in the power of community and what we can do together.  It is with that mindset I want to partner with YOU in putting the final pieces of the puzzle in place.  I am seeking to raise $20,000 to help offset the cost incurred to open the business.  

The money given to this campaign will help specifically with providing an environment where people will experience community.  The money will be used to decorate, furnish, and finish the space we will be leasing at Windsor Park Shopping Center.  We will use the money to help make the space as safe as possible.  

Any additional money raised will allow us to add some extra features and help with other costs associated with the project (construction, marketing, website design, etc.).

 

Impact on the Community

Once open, Next Shot Golf will be a business involved in the community.  To advance this initiative, we are currently in conversation with a few organizations on how best to partner together.   We will provide an updated list of these partnerships as these conversations progress.  We look forward to utilizing our space and mindset of focusing on the "next shots" in life to make a difference! 

Added 10/27

We are excited to announce a partnership with Bridge of Hope!   We are offering the single moms in their program the opportunity to utilize the space for birthday parties for their children free of charge!  Bridge of Hope will also seek to use the space for some of their smaller functions.  Make sure you see the difference they are making in our community by visiting them at  https://harrisburg.bridgeofhopeinc.org/

Video update can be found at https://www.facebook.com/mynextshotgolf/videos/840351529838013

Added 11/10

We are excited to announce a partnership with Hero in the Fight!  We will be offering free golf lessons to those who are battling addiction to help them take their next shot in life.  Hero in the Fight is doing amazing work and we look forward to doing some other creative collaborative work for the community!  Make sure you check out their Facebook Page, like it, share it, and follow what they are doing!  https://www.facebook.com/groups/herointhefight/

Video update can be found at https://www.facebook.com/mynextshotgolf/videos/3489163974503545

 

 

The Simulators in Action at PGA Tour Show 2020

Below are two videos recorded at the PGA Tour Show held in January 2020.  These are the exact same systems we will be using!  You will be able to play on 100+ golf courses from around the world.  We will also have the multi-sport package on two of our simulators (in the large private room and in the semi-private room).

 

 

Location & Details

On October 15th, we signed a lease for a location at Windsor Park Shopping Center on Simpson Ferry Rd. in Mechanicsburg, PA.  It will be a nearly 4,200 square foot space where people will come to belong, believe, and become!  On the very same day we put a down payment on the four (4) golf simulators to be installed in late December.  Here is a list of what the space will look like (picture below).

-There will be one large private room (approx. 35' X 28') where those looking to have birthday parties, bachelor/bachelorette parties, corporate meetings, or any other type of social function will have a large space to entertain.  

-There will be one semi-private room (approx. 22' x 28')  where those looking for their own space can enjoy a nice layout.

-There will be two simulators next to each other for single groups/players or two groups looking to play together.

-There will be 5 televisions placed throughout the space - one at each simulator and one in a "common" area.

-We will be a Bring Your Own Beer (BYOB) and Bring Your Own Food (BYOF) establishment. 

-The large private room and semi-private rooms will have a double door connecting the two which can open 180 degrees allowing for full access to both spaces at one time.

-The simulators in the large private room and the semi-private room will include a multi-sport package for those who may want to try something different (see video above)

-We will offer a full service club repair (grips, shafts, loft/lie adjustments, etc.) - our "office" area will house these capabilities.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

It may seem like the wrong time to pursue a new business during these uncertain times, but I believe now is actually the perfect time to provide such a place for the community.  Golf provides a unique opportunity for people to be in relationship, and we want to provide a space in which this can happen.  

We understand the challenges COVID-19 brings to operating a small business and understand there is a risk in opening during this time.  However, know we will be implementing two things specifically to address the virus.

1) We will be applying Permasafe (www.permasafe.com) to all high contact areas which provides an antimicrobial protective coating.

2) We have designed the space with "social distancing" in mind, while also maintaining an inviting atmosphere to gather.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate at this time, would you please considering sharing this page and spreading the word?  If you live in the Mechanicsburg area, make sure to let people know about this exciting new business coming to their area, where everyone will have the opportunity to belong, believe and become! 

Make sure to use the share tools available!

story:
Background: 

Hi! I’m Jeanette Macias a self-taught brewer and co-owner of Seeking Kombucha & Seeking Ferments in Seattle, WA, along with my wife Lyz. We make kombucha & other fermented beverages with ingredients that have been locally sourced by Washington Farmers and other small businesses. We make Kombucha, Jun, Ginger Soda, Tumeric Soda, Kefir, Water Kefir, Kvass & Tepache!

For the past year we have been popping up around the city at local farmers markets and at some of your favorite farmers markets,  breweries & cafes! 

It has been such an unbelievable journey and increasingly high demand you all have sought after. We've had wonderful opportunities to collaborate with local businesses and farmers throughout Washington such as The Growler Guys, Chucks Hop Shop, Chubby Bunny Farms, Growing Washington, Hayton Farms, and many more.

As a minority (Mexican & Filipino) woman LGBTQ+ owned operation, it’s time to move on to bigger things and set up a permanent home, so that we can continue to give back to the community.

Our vision is to open a fermented beverage taphouse with over 30 different taps, where our amazing community can not only come to get their growler filled, but also stay and hang out because we want to have local farmers & small business pop ups with like minded visions. We also plan to host community classes to help our community grow together such as, " How to start your own Business", or classes that promote physical & mental growth. We believe in giving back to our amazing community that has helped us become who we are today. We have seen first hand the disparities and the mountains small minority business have to climb in order to get the resources they need, we want to change that. NO...WE WILL CHANGE THAT. We want to help people who want to start a business but just don't know how, by providing support, guidance, and the resources they need to survive and become successful! As we continue to grow we want to be sure to be able to provide the community the resources they need to grow and survive. This is a safe space for the community where you can come grab a drink or some food, ( we want to invite a food truck roundup) study, hangout, learn something, or just take a break.

The outpouring of support thus far has been surreal, and anticipation for a storefront is high as ever. We owe it to all of you to make this Kombucha bar dream come to life. It is overwhelming and scary, it’s a lot to take on, and we never thought we'd be opening a kombucha bar for the community in the middle of a pandemic, and mass movement for justice & peace– but here we are. We think that our previous life skills (Jeanette -Finance Director for an LGBTQ Non Profit & Lyz -Former Store Manager) we have what it takes to run this Kombucha bar and make this dream a reality.

The Tap House Details:

We have over 30+ different flavors of kombucha & Jun! So our goal is to have 30 different taps of Kombucha, Jun, Ginger Beer, Tumeric Soda, Water Kefir, Tepache & Cider. 

Not only will you be able to get your growler filled with any of these but also have the option to get a cocktail with ANY of our mixes!

Hungry? Well; we will be selling local small business pastries  & goodies including inviting local food trucks and have community food truck roundups!

What We Need:

Indiegogo funds will be spent on...

 Equipment: Kegerators, filtration system, kegs, refrigerated display case, under counter refrigeration, Keg Taps, Oven, Oven Hood, Fermenters...

 Renovations: service counter buildout, new seating area, electrical work for all equipment/lighting, security system updates, minor restroom upgrades, paint, fixtures, new signage, ensuring the space has accessibility 

All furniture (tables + chairs) and lighting

Labor + materials

If the goal of $50,000 is surpassed (in which case, thank you all so much!), the extra funds will go toward inventory and a start on rent/utilities as we spend some time renovating the space.

The Impact

We live in a world where we deal with racism and discrimination on a daily, so we want to help make the world a better place by offering a safe space, not only to hang out, but to also come to learn and grow. Society cannot grow as a whole if we are not willing to be the change we want to see in the world. This is our contribution with your help to not only to provide you with some scrumptious booch & food but to support the small businesses around us as well. We can't do this without all of you, and we are extremely grateful for all your support!

Risks & Challenges

Opening a kombucha bar for the very first time and without any experience is incredibly daunting, especially in a rapidly growing city like Seattle. However, we are so confident in the support from the Seeking Kombucha community, that I know that those people will be there for any guidance and support. We also come from a finance and upper management background which will greatly help us on this new venture we are so eagerly ready for.

Seeking Kombucha is here to stay. We are also fortunate to have friends throughout the community in a wide variety of skills that will help us with some of the renovations and marketing strategies to get up and running. Also a lot of it will also be done personally by us to save on labor and costs where ever  possible. Purchasing used equipment will also help us to stay within budget.

It's so much to take on, but this has been our dream and we are in it for the long run. We are committed to learning and growing to make this business successful. We also would love for this endeavor to include all of you, so we will constantly be sharing updates on Instagram (@SeekingKombucha), and asking for opinions, posting polls, etc…This is a community space so we want to be sure we get the community opinion on designs and space! And we know the result will be beautiful because it'll be a team effort.

We cannot wait to complete the vision and share this space with all of you!

Other Ways You Can Help

We do understand not everyone can contribute financially so we ask if you can share this with your family and friends!

We can only grow together so any help is much appreciated!

And that's all there is to it.

We also come from a finance and upper management background which will greatly help us on this new venture we are so eagerly ready for.
