story:
What We Need and What We Have

  • Need:  More Gear (poles, benches, fiberglass), web site management, final vessel pay off, 2021 ocean slip fee, marketing funds, patent fee
  • Have: back bay boat, ocean boat (80% paid), insurance, 2021 back bay slip fee, fishing gear, dive equipment, licenses, permits, inspections
  • This will be the fastest charter boat in Atlantic City and offer a Captain that dives and can SEE WHERE THE FISH ARE!  
  • All funds will go to funding our American dream.

The Impact

Fish-AC will provide a highly professional experience, be environmental stewards, practice conservation, always put fun and safety as the top priorities. 

We will re-define the dive and fishing experience in Atlantic City as the ONLY DIVE VESSEL in Atlantic County and the fastest fishing vessel in the Atlantic City Charter Fleet.

All donors will receive a steep discount or free charter and Fish AC swag!

Risks & Challenges

With over 17 years of charter experience, dive master license, 100 ton captain license, and 14 years fishing and diving the reefs and wrecks of Atlantic City this will be a charter that brings home unprecedented amounts of keeper fish and will never leave the dock in adverse conditions.

We will overcome weather delays and mechanical hang ups by responsible financial management and supplement the down times with outside captain and dive work.  

To minimize risk we will carry the maximum amount of insurance allowed and never setting unobtainable goals.  We will operate within our means and always be honest about the capabilities of our vessel and crew.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We are seeking to employ several captains, mates, and dive masters and recommendations an resumes can be sent to shaner@fish-ac.com
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
What We Need and What We Have


Need:  More Gear (poles, benches, fiberglass), web site management, final vessel pay off, 2021 ocean slip fee, marketing funds, patent fee

Have: back bay boat, ocean boat (80% paid), insurance, 2021 back bay slip fee, fishing gear, dive equipment, licenses, permits, inspections
This will be the fastest charter boat in Atlantic City and offer a Captain that dives and can SEE WHERE THE FISH ARE!  
All funds will go to funding our American dream.


The Impact
Fish-AC will provide a highly professional experience, be environmental stewards, practice conservation, always put fun and safety as the top priorities. 
We will re-define the dive and fishing experience in Atlantic City as the ONLY DIVE VESSEL in Atlantic County and the fastest fishing vessel in the Atlantic City Charter Fleet.
All donors will receive a steep discount or free charter and Fish AC swag!

Risks & Challenges
With over 17 years of charter experience, dive master license, 100 ton captain license, and 14 years fishing and diving the reefs and wrecks of Atlantic City this will be a charter that brings home unprecedented amounts of keeper fish and will never leave the dock in adverse conditions.
We will overcome weather delays and mechanical hang ups by responsible financial management and supplement the down times with outside captain and dive work.  
To minimize risk we will carry the maximum amount of insurance allowed and never setting unobtainable goals.  We will operate within our means and always be honest about the capabilities of our vessel and crew.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are seeking to employ several captains, mates, and dive masters and recommendations an resumes can be sent to shaner@fish-ac.com
Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
OUR STORY

Whether you call it kismet or divine intervention, some kind of magical force brought Mystic Dylan, Jessyica Johns, and Brieanne Kelly together. While each of us has had a different journey until now; we all had the shared vision of opening a store in Santa Clarita Valley. Read more about us below.

L-R Brieanne Kelly, Dylan Bauer, Jessyica Johns

Dylan Bauer

I always had an attraction to mysticism. At 13, I received my first tarot deck from my mother, and was entranced by their esoteric nature and history. I began to study the cards, and soon sought out other forms of divination: runes, tea-leaf reading, scrying boards, pendulums, palmistry, and throwing bones. I sharpened my craft by giving readings to family and friends and built on that foundation by attending classes in the Occult Arts in Los Angeles, New York, and New Orleans. My connection to mysticism and love for knowledge allowed me to study, explore, and dedicate myself to the art of Witchcraft, as well as Hoodoo, Root-work, and Shamanism. I am a practicing Witch and use the craft to assist me in both my personal and professional life.

Being born with Irish, German, and Native American blood, I attribute my spiritual gifts to my many ancestors who walk and work beside me, guiding me on my sacred journey. I’ve worked professionally for 10 years in both retail establishments and entertainment venues, and my varied background has allowed me to help others with phone and in-person sessions, parties, receptions, séances and other events. I consider psychic readings to be a conversation between the client and the tools. I am an oracle in the purest sense; I convey the information shown to me from the beyond to assist you in finding your path of least resistance. ​

Since childhood I’ve always know that Magic existed. I felt a strong connection to nature and knew that there were things amongst us that we couldn’t see with our eyes.  When I was 9 my mother took me into a local shop in Hollywood that changed my life. Not only did it confirm that Magic existed, but that it was also accessible to us. As I studied and delved deeper into my spiritual path, I frequented a lot of similar shops, but none truly resonated with me. As a professional witch and psychic, I’ve worked in numerous New Age, Occult and Witchcraft establishments. I have an understanding of what people look for in terms of product, aesthetic and quality. I have knowledge of the tools required for specific rituals and have friendships with vendors and other practitioners that will allow this shop to succeed. With my knowledge, practice, and connections I plan to make this shop more than just a retail space, but a community and portal to spiritual guidance.

Jessyica Johns

My wish to open a store stems from the deep want of community; a safe, welcoming place to share space with like-minded individuals and learn from them at the same time. I have been in a constant search for just this, and have come across plenty of wonderful shops, and have met amazing people, including very close individuals in my life, but nothing has endured or stayed constant. This is the true spark of my desire to open a shop! We can create this open, ever evolving safe space for others looking for the same sense of community! And my experience working with amazing companies and creators with III Crows Crossroads will allow me to meet to everyone’s needs. And I hope I can lead you to discover some of the wonderful brands and products out there, and some you didn’t even know existed!

Brieanne Kelly

When I was a teenager, I discovered a store in Los Angeles that changed my life. This store felt like the perfect fit for me; I felt like I belonged among the rows and rows of unique, quirky, and odd gifts! From Tiki glasses, esoterica, hard to find art books, and stickers, you name it. But most importantly, I discovered some of my favorite pop-surrealistic artists there. This store planted a seed in the back of mind to one day open a store of my own, and create a special space which I could pour my heart, soul, and creative passions into, and that was all welcoming for others. However, I didn’t water that seed for many, many years, and I took a few alternate professional paths to where I am now. I’ve worked in sales and marketing, retail, customer service, healthcare and the military (most recently where my path was cut short), and I realized, now, more than ever, was the right time to start a new journey. A la, The Olde World Emporium.

Everything happens for a reason, right? The past seven years I have been serving in the CA Air National Guard. However, I was diagnosed with Epilepsy over a year ago which is a disqualifying condition to stay in the service. When I found out I was being discharged, my gut immediately led me back to the thought of opening up my own shop. As of 30 June 2020, I was officially medically retired from service. I learned so much from my time in the military serving in different capacities, and I am eternally grateful for the friendships I forged in service and the experiences I had. I am proud of what I achieved and the skillsets I obtained (never thought I would have a Security+ certification!) and I hope to parlay these skills into our business.

Life is too short, and I need to follow my intuition and try this new journey. It’s important to me to try and create a legacy in my community, and to set an example for my daughter to never stop living her dreams. Regardless of the actual meaning of the song, there are two lines from Ozzy Osbourne’s “I Just Want You” which is my new motto to live by:

There are no impossible dreams

There are no unachievable goals

THE STORE

We're excited to call 23127 Lyons Avenue in Old Town Newhall our new home! We have found the perfect location; one that is conveniently located just a short drive from Los Angeles and the Valley, in addition to a minute’s walk from thriving Historic Downtown Newhall. Now we need your help in making our dream a reality! We envision a place where people can gather together, connect with their local and global Metaphysical/Mysticism community, and find unique, otherworldly goods to fill your home and your sacred spaces. Take a tour with us and imagine the possibilities.

Having a brick and mortar shop means that we can offer a much wider variety of products. We plan to stock a wide selection of handcrafted goods from across the globe, as well as local creatives including books, candles, tarot decks, art, altar supplies, crystals, home décor, and everything you need to create your own spells, rituals, and charms. In addition, we will be offering a variety of different spiritual services such as: tarot, bone throwing, tea leaves, and palmistry. Even better, we will be working on creating a safe space that will be warm and welcoming where you can relax, have refreshments, and be able to take your time browsing our selections steeped in rich history. The Olde World Emporium invites you to step into the past and shed some light on the present through the many spiritual mysteries that linger inside. More than just a store, The Olde World Emporium is the gateway to an adventure of both mind and spirit.

Can it get better? Yes! Working with many different creatives from around the world, we are pleased to offer curated classes, book signings, exclusive subscription boxes, and our patrons will be able to reserve our space for receptions, parties, and film production. What more can you ask for? How about poetry and open mic nights, new release events, seasonal celebrations. What about a rewards system that earns you credit for future purchases every time you buy something? Or are store credits what you seek? We will be offering all this and more!

On top of being a physical location, we will have a full online store that will allow shopping from the convenience of your home or office no matter where you are in the world. Every product we offer in-store will be available online. However, due to the current situation, we will be working diligently to offer unique classes, limited edition bundles, and one of a kind products online so you can feel like part of our community from the comfort of your own home.

WHY BACK US ON INDIEGOGO?

Well, we plan on being a company accessible to the world, not just our local market, so what better place than Indiegogo that gets visitors from around the globe. Plus, we also want to be a source of support for other diverse spiritual communities and practitioners. We pride ourselves on being friendly and knowledgeable in-store and online. We will always be here to answer any questions and point you in the right direction. Customer service will be our highest priority, and we will work hard every day to earn your business. Finally, not only is our goal to help create our small business, but to financially help other businesses by purchasing products from them or helping generate awareness of their products and talents. We proud to share our core values with you.

Our Core Values

Practicing with Integrity – We make conscious choices when planning, operating, creating classes, and researching product offerings with a genuine and authentic spirit. We aren’t here to sell snake oil; you can trust us for high quality products and ethical services which we use ourselves. We have hand-picked every item in our store from artisans, practitioners, and craftspeople, near and far, who align with our core values.

Customer Service – We hold ourselves accountable and to a high standard. The Olde World Emporium is our home away from home, and we will always treat you as a welcomed guest; everyone is honored and valued (online and in-person). Transparency, open and honest communication is a tenet we thrive by. We believe there is a person behind every transaction. If at any time, your experience is less than pleasurable, we will go above and beyond to make it right. We are here to listen.

Dedication to Community – This space is dedicated not only to our ancestors, but yours as well. We dedicate this space to those that follow the beat of a different drum. We acknowledge, accept, and welcome you regardless of race, gender, sex, creed, color, or faith. Throughout history, people have been persecuted for their differences; here we wish them to be celebrated. We do not adhere to any specific spiritual dogma, or practice. This space is intended to bring about community, while also embracing our differences. We do NOT tolerate Racism, Bigotry, Homophobia, Transphobia, or support any Political propaganda. Our mission is solely to elevate and educate the mind, body, and spirit

We are a Proud Woman owned/Veteran owned/ LGBTQ Business!

OUR GOAL

Small businesses around the world are having economic difficulties and need your support now more than ever. We are so thankful for the support of our community, friends, and family. Opening a store definitely takes a village...but that's the fun part! We will need funding to purchase inventory to fill the store, complete the buildout process, and create the perfect immersive space you’ll never forget and will keeping calling you back. By pledging your support, not only are you backing our small business, but you’re supporting artisans across the globe! Below is what your funds will be helping us achieve.

We are looking to raise $30,000 through Indiegogo and with your help we know we can reach this goal!

Our $30k Goal Will Fund:

  • Materials and labor for buildout and design
  • Complete two private reading spaces
  • Purchase the cornerstone pieces of furniture and custom pieces
  • Create a beautiful and welcoming indoor space with immaculate attention to detail
  • Help with our beginning inventory
  • Create an immersive library and apothecary to serve human connection

We plan (and are in the process) to do the labor we can to contribute to fixing up the space (such as painting the walls, installing new fixtures, changing outlets), but some will need to be outsourced to professionals.  If we exceed our goal of $30,000 (oh boy, that would be incredible!) we will use the extra funds for the first months of rent and utilities.

The decision to use Indiegogo to raise funds was made after having so many people reach out us and say that they wanted to help. We have chosen special rewards we feel will really be appreciated by the people who support us and our business; because we want you to feel you’re getting something great back in return for your generosity. No contribution is too small. We are sincerely grateful for you all! We can promise you, if we do reach our goal, there will be many more exciting events and projects to come.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Wow, 2020, Huh! This year has pressed the small business community to its limits. Not just in the U.S., but worldwide. This is our greatest challenge. COVID-19 has been an interesting feat thus far, but with persistence, we will learn to navigate the policies and procedures put in place by our local and state governments. We are encouraged by the strength of our community, and we believe that The Olde World Emporium can overcome.

We know the economy is not at its strongest, but we also feel people need escapes from everyday life and practice self-care, and our space will help provide that. Then there's always a risk in opening a brick and mortar store; especially with so many options for shopping online these days. But we believe that customers have a strong desire to connect with their community, touch handmade products from around the globe in person, participate in special curated classes (when safe), receive spiritual readings, and to learn and deepen their strengths in their crafts in-person. We are SO ready and welcome the challenges.

Additionally, another obvious risk is we will not generate revenue to continue to fund this project which will make it more difficult to open our doors to the public. However, with preliminary social media posts, the interest and responses we have received have all been overwhelmingly positive. With the positive reviews we know this business will be able to maintain its value and continue to serve the community for many years to come. With our combined experience in retail, management, and experience already owning small brands, we are confident we have what it takes to make our store and space successful.

Lastly, as with any project we expect it to be easy and on schedule. But there can be unforeseen circumstances that delay shipping such as printing errors, postal mishaps, etc. These events are outside of our control, but we will do our best to overcome any challenge as quickly as possible with as little impact to our pledges as possible. The Olde World Emporium is our legacy and we will do everything necessary to see it manifested and come to fruition.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, no worries!  But you can help spread the word about our campaign on your social media pages, or you can use the Indiegogo share tools.
